description:
Located in Pier 39, at first you think this place might be a tourist trap. However, after visiting, I don't think that's the case. I came for breakfast/brunch on a beautiful Saturday afternoon, right when they first opened for the day (around 9 am). My server was attentive and friendly while dealing with multiple customers throughout my visit.

I decided on the huevos rancheros (no beans) and loved it! The portion was large, every bite was tasty and the price was right. The eggs were perfectly cooked to over easy and nothing was over-salted (happens often with this dish). I highly recommend this meal to anyone. 

I had a 15 percent off coupon from the San Fran welcome center (food only), which was one of the reasons I stopped here and I'm so glad I did. Realistically, when the discount is only on food it took one to two dollars off of my meal, which isn't a big deal, but was enough to make me stop in and give this place a try. 

The bathrooms are unisex and leave a bit to be desired, minor detail. This place is large and can fit a good deal of people. It wasn't busy when I was there, but I could see how it would fill up quickly on a weekend night.
author: Emily D.

description:
My friend and I had dinner at the Wipeout Bar & Grill after a long day hanging out at the Pier. 

We went around 5 pm and the wait for two people was only 15-20 minutes. However, it only took 5-10 minutes for them to call us. We got a table outside by the boardwalk so that was very nice. (The only not-nice, but also uncontrollable part is that the pigeons were flying left and right). 

For food, we each order the fried seafood combo ($17.90ish each (w/o tax), which comes with a cod, 3 shrimps on a stick, and a lot of calamari. With fries, a small side of coleslaw and 3 types of sauce for each of the seafood. The Asian chicken sauce (if you know what I'm talking about) was for the calamari. The cocktail sauce was for the shrimps. The tar-tar sauce was for the cod. Both the calamari and the shrimps' batter (outside) were very light, which is amazing. So you can really taste the meat. The fish was okay, not mindblowing. The tartar sauce was tasteless and I think it did a disservice to my cod experience. The coleslaw and the fries were also tasteless. So the tasteless things on my plate took out 1 star from my review. Out of everything on the plate, the calamari was my favorite.

For the drink, I ordered the Shark Bite and my friend ordered "something California" (forgot the name). These are from the bottom left corner of the menu. The drinks were good. I couldn't really taste the alcohol or feel it. The drinks are huge though, but it's nice and cool and sweet, a good combination with the food. 

The service was great. They were attentive and came to check-in on us multiple times. We really enjoyed our time there.
author: Yuan Z.

description:
This review is for the TO GO wipeout van. There was a short line so we decided to check it out.

We ordered the chili cheese fries which was surprisingly larger than expected. It was fresh and hot! My man really enjoyed it, his tastebuds was loving it. 

I had the BBQ burger with a side of BBQ sauce. The bun was nice and soft, only thing was the inside of the burger kept slipping out every time I took a bite so I was looking like a hot mess with hella napkins around me lol. But it was pretty good, I killed the entire thing! 

Then our son had a slice of cheese pizza which he liked and ate for the most part. Nothing too fancy, just a regular piece of pizza. 

There was a lot of seating area, table and benches. Napkin holders on each table. A separate small area with utensils next to the TO GO van. There was a basket of crayons too but no coloring paper? I don't know, maybe for the kids to keep busy?
author: Yee W.

description: I really enjoyed the service. Our server was very attentive and helpful. He let us know he was going to take his break and introduced the server who was going to take over him while he was gone. The vibe there was amazing and the food tasted really good as well. Will definitely visit again on my next trip here.
author: Lily G.

description:
There is a full service restaurant and a to-go window on the side. The restaurant was completely packed, so we went to the to-go window where there was only one other group in line. The to-go side has a limited menu. I couldn't really tell what theme of food this place serves since the to-go side had typical options, such as fish and chips, pizza, and tacos. 

We ordered the three tacos for $15. They are served a la carte. The tacos were filled with meat and topped with sautéed peppers and salsa. This is a convenient option when you don't have time to sit and aren't looking for elaborate food.
author: Roxanne F.

description: They don't have a ton of options for vegetarians, but there was a few options I was able to choose from. I chose the vegetarian pizza which included cheese, onions, black olives, and green peppers. It was ok but nothing spectacular
author: Tawanna M.

description:
This is a solid casual, fast, affordable option when visiting Pier 39.  My usual order is a cup of the clam chowder and their ribs. Both are consistently good and good value for money.  Be careful with the chowder, it can come piping hot. I've also had the wipeout burger and it's good.  

This place gets really, really busy and service can be problematic at times. There are also typically a lot of tourists with kids coming here (not a romantic place at all) and there can be a rather long line for the restroom.  Including tax and tip, expect to pay about $30 to $40 per person.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Came to wipe out for breakfast 
. I tried their chiliqules. I was kinda nervous I noticed on Yelp no post it. But it was actually really good. I would defiantly come back here to try the lunch menu.
author: Crystal C.

description:
While in San Francisco, act like a tourist,
Even though I grew up in the bay area.
I have not been to San Francisco for 15 plus years, so I decided our day in port was going to be spent at the wharf.
I was hankering for a large bowl of clam chowder and The wipe out grill did not disappoint.
The Wipe out grill is located on pier 39.
This is a huge tourist trap and I had my reservations on how good the food would be.
I really was pleasantly surprised. The meal was delicious and the service was excellent.
author: Peter K.

description:
Nine of us came here for lunch on a random Saturday. It was fine. Over-priced, non-special food but it was certainly edible and it worked.

I ordered the carnitas street tacos - they were loaded with pork - not really carnitas, but definitely pork. The meat was pretty favor-less and on the dry side, but it was heated through... yep, that's the best thing that I can say about it. The tortillas were stale and tough, the cabbage and salsa was fine, the beans were oddly sweet and the rice was cooked well.

The service was pretty quick and everyone got what they ordered. The coolest part was that they were able to seat us all right away - a huge plus for a group that size.

I would certainly come here again for another non-extraordinary lunch.
author: Tammy S.

description: Absolutely fantastic location and and all good vibes from this restaurant. The weather was too good yesterday to waste your day inside. My fiancé and I went for some cruising all around SF and wanted to grab lunch someplace we can enjoy. We saw this place instantly before our next cruise and decided to come back here after we were done. We made it back in time before the crowd and waitlist began. I ordered the Fish tacos and my fiancé ordered a cheeseburger... the food was delicious and filling. Trust me if you're looking for a casual eat that is filling and delicious then this is your place!!!
author: Neloffer E.

description: Good, the spot is very convenient. Salad in some dish items is the most delicious I think.
author: Eugenie Y.

description:
I wanted clam chowder on the day the ship was docked in port in San Francisco, so I set out to find my next meal.
I let my nose lead me and it lead me to the Wipe out grill.
I ordered a beer and a bowl of chowder.
This my friends is the true breakfast of champions.
The soup was delicious and truly hit the spot on a cold day.
Service was great and the restaurant was very clean.
I definitely would give it a shot.
author: Debra K.

description: We were in a group of 8, looking for a place to grab a bite on the pier and this was the spot we ended up choosing. The decor is funky and cool, lots to look around at. Our server was.. How do I say this.. Rude. I'm guessing he was having a bad day and took it out on his clients- it happens. I can't say I had a pleasant experience, but the food was alright. I wanted something quick so I ordered a pizza and some fries, kept it simple. I'll give them some point's for the outdoor heaters, we sat inside but they felt great to walk by during a chilly afternoon.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
Yelped the location. We arrived at fisherman's wharf and were pretty hungry.  The host was really welcoming. Nice. I asked for a table by the window. They accommodated. Great view! I was surrounded by tables where they looked to be drinking some pretty drinks. I chose a nice tall beer.... but those drinks sure were tempting. 
Hubby and I got chips and salsa and sweet potato fries. For entree ordered a burrito and fish tacos. 
My hubby added some heat to the salsa. They were good chips! And the sweet potato fries came in a very large portion. I just wanted a taste, and I kept on eating and eating and eating. These are the not so sweet kind of sweet potato fries and I was okay with that. 
Fish tacos. The breading was perfect, very nice portion of fish. I had to break it up and eat half without the taco because it was so large. Yum! Two tacos were more then enough. 
Husband really liked his burrito. 
Our service was super nice. Erich maybe? Great service. Great experience. Great views. 
Thank you.
author: Asheley B.

description:
An American restaurant located in touristy pier 39. 
Their food was affordable, but I was not a big fan of the sourdough bread that the clam chowder was in. I was really craving clam chowder but it was a bit of a letdown. 

We came in on a Tuesday night for dinner and there was no wait! The service was good and the waitress was nice enough to let us split our bill 4 ways for 6 people which I appreciated! There are TVs around the restaurant to watch some sports. We were seated next to the kitchen so we could see the food waiting to get delivered and it kinda made us regret not trying the nachos starters because it looked like a huge dish! Overall, I think my group was satisfied with their orders
author: Katrine U.

description:
We stopped in on Sunday night for a bite to eat. No wait and fast service. We got coconut shrimp (see attached photo), the California burger, and another burger (sorry can't remember the name). All three meals received a thumbs up. If you're walking around the Piers and looking for a place to go, we'd recommend swinging by -- especially if there's a game on you'd like to watch! 


**if you grab coffee, cookies, or anything else from Biscotti next door the receipt comes with a Wipe-Out coupon!
author: Madison M.

description:
I found myself in SF playing tourist. By belly was growling so I hoped on Yelp, just like you did to search for the ultimate fish tacos. 
Despite the Wipeout Bar and Grill didn't score all that well on Yelp, we decided to eat here anyways. After clicking the photos and seeing the mountain of nachos and the succulently breaded and deep fried fish tacos, I knew this was the spot to feast upon.
Yelp photos are beyond helpful !!!!

We decided to sit outside to catch the warm rays from the sunshine and smell the salty air as we people watched in the heart of Pier 39.

The service was super stellar even though the house was packed with tourists. 
Our drinks were always topped off. The food came out in less than 15 mins. 

And these nachos..... well they were actually legit ! So were the fish tacos. Super tasty and loved the Baja sauce that accompanied them.
author: Stephanie A.

description: i always wanted to try the food here with my family and we finally did. I thot the place was a cute little spot. Loved the high tables and the staff was friendly. The food was really delicious, and we especilally loved the beer bucket lol. My kids loved the food as well
author: IslandGirl 3.

description: My husband and I were walking around Pier 39 and decided to try this place for lunch. Food was a bit pricier, but that was to be expected since it is SF and on Pier 39. Food was good, but nothing really to write home about and service was OK. I wish they had a bit more to offer for their seafood salads and rice bowls.
author: Valerie K.

description: Great experience. Fun atmosphere. Good food. Our waitress' name was Paloma - she was very friendly, personable and helpful. Would definitely come back.
author: Leilani W.

description:
This place had a fun and lively atmosphere. Great decorations and an overall great looking place. Prime location on pier 39. Also had a fun outdoor seating area, to sit back and have some some and drinks.

The food was subpar. Our table of 8 ordered a variety of dishes and they all were less than mediocre.

I would NOT recommend this place to anyone who is wanting great tasting food. It is an okay option though for families who need to please based on having a large variety on their menu (but again each dish tastes blah).

Wait staff was really friendly but seemed to be slow service, maybe understaffed?
author: Faldo R.

description: So ridiculously overpriced. The staff was super nice and the drinks were good, but the food was only mediocre to be worth around $20 a dish. I got a basket of fries for $6! I guess that's what we get for going to a touristy restaurant on the pier, but still.
author: Kate J.

description: Dropped in here after a whale tour. We were quickly seated even though the place was packed! The waitress let us know that she was new and didn't have everything down yet which I thought was nice. We ordered an appetizer and the waitress, while she was very sweet, was kinda pressing us to order entrees at the same time. I told her I didn't want the app and entrees to come out at the same time and she said they wouldn't, so we ordered everything at once. Well.... everything came out at once and the table was extremely crowded- which isn't too big of a deal since all the food was great. We had wipeout nachos with chicken as an app, Baja fish tacos as my entree, and both my sister and fiancé had coconut shrimp. The food really was delicious. It was an extremely busy day / time so I'm sure that's why everything came out fast.
author: Kimber B.

description: Beach/Surf atmosphere, small beer selection that does include Anchor Steam (of course), and super friendly attentive staff, that doesn't water down the mixed drinks.  They do have a full menu, but didn't eat anything as we already had.
author: Chris H.

description: Wipeout has the best grilled chicken tacos! Seriously the best!!! The kids menu isn't your run of the mill kraft Mac, it's real Mac! The salmon bowl with coconut rice was seriously amazeballs for a kids menu item! Service was awesome in the outdoor dining area and it was a perfect spot to people watch. Will definitely come back here.
author: Meesha S.

description:
Probably the worst in San Fransisco.
the starters took a long time and within a minute the main courses arrived.
Everything was fried without taste.
the only thing the waiter worried about was the tip.
author: T. B.

description:
This place in pier 39 has some great finger food and Mexican good as well. It's very affordable and always has a good crowd : well its on 39 after all. I've been here thrice already and always tried their chicken wings, nachos (which can server 4 ppl easily) and their fireball whiskey shots. 

Right next to Hard Rock Cafe, this one is a lot more affordable and the food is delicious. So wanting to grab a quick bite, it's a perfect place to check out. The service was fast and prompt too, and portions were big.
author: Saarthak C.

description: If you are wanting to watch a certain game, don't bother coming here. They can only put on 2 games at a time on the 10 tv's. Don't bother asking to change it for the game you want to watch either. Manager will not change it. Service is marginal at best. Food is ok.
author: Trey H.

description:
The customer service here leaves so much to be desired. We were treated rudely, repeatedly. I wish I had more words for this place but frankly I can't seem to find a way to say it respectfully.

Edit: after positing my review, I was contacted by the chief operating officer. He was gracious and it is appreciated. I changed my post from one star to four because it's obvious he cares about customers and that's really all we wanted (along with the good food).
author: Rod R.

description: Corona was good but that's about it. The food came out fast but wasn't good at all.  It's a touristy place but food could be better
author: George D.

description:
A good time at wipeout, Ashley is great! 
Thank you for a good time. They have an awesome selection of beers and breakfast 

Cesar
author: Fernando R.

description:
We were lucky enough be ushered in right away. Our server was good & accurate and our food was cooked exactly as ordered.
I highly recommend this place if you are down at Pier 39.
author: Lili L.

description:
The food is decent. The crane asada burrito is very oily. We got the nachos which showed up without the sour cream and guacamole and we were charged for it when we asked to get it. The pizza tasted like cafeteria pizza, it was so bad my 6 year old wouldn't even eat it. The service was pretty good though.

***update*** Hi Bob, we came in yesterday.
author: Christopher W.

description:
We came in on a Monday for lunch and the place was packed. Liked that atmosphere a lot for a casual lunch. The server was absolutely overwhelmed but seemed to be doing the best she could with a smile. Drinks came out right before our food and we saw them sitting up at the bar for a good 10 minutes. 
Food was good for bar and grill food. Fish tacos, burgers, salads and so on. 
I did find a live ant in my salad but just chopped it up to that stuff happens.
author: Kel C.

description: On a busy Sunday afternoon it were told for about a 25 min for a party of 3 who wanted seats outside or inside (whichever became available first). We were actually seated in about 5-8 mins which was great. We sat outside on a chilly sunny day. Our waitress was Janet who was super friendly and around if we needed anything. The calamari was nothing fancy. I ordered the fish & chips. The batter was great, but nothing much stood out either. I must say the only thing that did stand out was my bf's clam chowder in sourdough. It was delish! The restaurant is right on the pier and very busy at this time. They have a fire pit which has about 4-5 seats around it. Nice touch to it!
author: Rhea Z.

description:
This was a great place to eat right in the heart of Pier 39. If you like people watching, make sure to get a seat outside on their patio. They were definitely busy, but our party of four was instantly seated for dinner.

The pizza was delicious, and the bacon cheeseburger was yummy too. All of the portions were pretty big, so expect to either share, have leftovers, or take some home. What drew us to this restaurant was the extremely large food portions we saw as we were walking through the pier. We turned around to have dinner there after seeing how delicious everything looked. We were not disappointed!

We were not in a hurry and wanted to enjoy dinner... But just know that this restaurant typically stays busy. We weren't exactly waited on hand and foot, but we were okay with that, as we wanted a relaxing dinner. If you need something, make sure to ask your server right away. 

Also, this is the only restaurant bathrooms I have been in that allows both men and women in the same bathroom! I was a little surprised at first. Each stall is private, but boys and girls share the same bathroom--just be prepared.
author: Cindy W.

description: A surfing novelty restaurant/bar. Great location at pier 39. Food and drinks were yummy. The breakfast was surprisingly fantastic, with the best bacon I have ever had. The California Dreamin' was my favorite drink. We ate there several times, and it was always a good choice.
author: Jim C.

description:
Aww man! Why didn't I come to this place sooner! I've always passed by this restaurant while visiting Pier 39, never giving it any thought whatsoever! Come time for lunch during a busy weekend outing and this place was nominated as our new restaurant of the day. Wipeout Bar & Grill, why have you never caught my attention before? 

Wipeout, I see you've got a lot of surf food and beach snacks on your menu! Well I'll raise you a barnacle and a hungry stomach in exchange for your finest fried fish sandwich with chips. Throw in some chili for good measure and let me wash it down with your smoothest virgin ocean rum AKA water. 

Our chosen fare consisted of seafoods and meats! From Chorizo & Chicken pizza, Fish Fried Sandwich, to the Carne Asada Burritos, we definitely had a little land and sea action going on! We had an awesome waitress named Natasha and a patio table with great scenery and shade! Couldn't have asked for a better first time experience at Wipeout!

I love eating seafood and on this particular day, I was craving it! Wipeout had a charismatic and fun environment! Our main waitress Natasha and all the other waiters who helped us were super friendly and energetic! In all, I would definitely recommend this place for their great selection of seafoods and other menu items, even if it was only for a Clam Chowder with bread bowl. 

Surfs up!
author: Andy L.

description:
The boy friend and I wanted to try some fresh seafood and we decided to stop by at Wipeout Bar & Grill. It's located right at the entrance of Pier 39. We were craving for some fried fish and ordered the fish tacos and fish and chips. Both of our plates were huge and we didn't get a chance to finish it. The battered fish tasted juicy and yummy. The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the tortilla for the tacos. It was bit on the dry side so I ended up just eating the fish. This restaurant seems like the to-go place for tourist. Crowded inside and out. Overall, fun experience.

AS ALWAYS, NOM FOR LIFE!
author: Natasha N.

description: We came here because we were hungry after getting into the fisherman's wharf area. We liked the restaurant because of their dog friendly patio. The theme of the restaurant was your typical nautical flare, but done well. The prices where cheaper than I was expecting but still cost us 60 for an app, meals and drinks. Our dog was given a water bowl by the staff. The onion rings where done really well. My boyfriend wishes they toasted the bread for the clam chowder bread bowl. My caesar salad was like many other restaurants. I wish the chicken would have been warm though. Overall, this was a good stop.
author: Rebecca D.

description:
From the garlic fries to the heat lamps, it was a great experience! When I came here the weather was fairly chilly. Since there was no wait for outside we decided to take our seat there. One thing I really appreciated is that they had heating lamps on the outdoor seating. 

When it was time to order, we got garlic fries as a starter and I chose fish and chips as my entree. Once the fries came out, my aunt and I started eating them immediately. The garlic was definitely there and the parmesan complimented it nicely. Then minutes after, our food came. My fish and chips were very good. The batter was nice and light, and the fries were delicious. 

Overall, the food was great and the staff was amazing. I would definitely go here again and encourage others to come here.
author: Liv 1.

description: So good! The wait was only 15 minutes on a Saturday night, and we didn't even have to wait THAT long! The food came out pretty quickly and damn was it good! If you like fish tacos, give their fish burritos a try, hella delicious!!!
author: Natasha J.

description:
So a solid 4 stars for this escape from reality of San Fran. Took a party of 5 here this time. Been here many times, the food is always fast, hot and delicious.

This time aground we had 3 people who have never been here before and they had smoked salmon, American burger and fish sandwich. I had an American burger the GF had a salad. This is a great place to eat, if there's a wait it's very short. They have a massive amounts of seating space.
author: Jason Z.

description:
It's a decent place to grab your all american favorites - Hamburgers, salads, fish & chips (ok, that last one isn't american but you get my point). 
They've got the basic favorites on the menu and plenty of drink variety for anyone in the family. The kids can get soda while Mom has a blended cocktail and Dad gets a beer. You can pretty much make every member of the clan happy with the menu here.

As far as flavor ... well, the view is great and the prices are fair. The service is great too!
author: Shiela T.

description: Here for breakfast and I have to say I have never, ever returned a coffee at any breakfast establishment....ever!! Today, at Wipeout Bar and grill we did. It was so bad not all the sugar and creamer I. The world could've helped that coffee. The food was greasy AF but had an ok flavor. Safe to say it was our first and last time here.
author: Martha E.

description:
Looking for a place for a late lunch while walking around Pier 39, this looked like a fun place with a great atmosphere and had food everyone could eat, so we stopped in.

The verdict was very positive; the ladies enjoyed the soup and salmon salad and the pineapple chicken breast and pineapple burger were also tasty, and the margarita was also very good.

A server can always make the dining experience better, and Natasha couldn't have been better. She was prompt, took our order which included slight deletions or changes on some menu items, was very friendly and helpful and seemed to really enjoy her job.

We've eaten at a good number of Pier 39 restaurants while visiting San Francisco and we couldn't have asked for a better lunchtime experience.
author: Mitch P.

description:
*Tourist Approved.. 

I ordered the Garlic Pizza Bread for starters. It had a lot of crushed garlic. I wasn't expecting that. I like garlic, I just wasn't expecting that much of it and that much fresh garlic which is a plus. ***I'm from the East so fresh garlic isn't so free flying on our dishes. It's something I'm getting used to while being in California. The Garlic Pizza Bread is a great tasting starter. 

For my lunch I ordered the delicious Grilled Salmon Bowl. This was filled with fresh sautéed veggies and get this- coconut rice, not plain rice, not brown rice but COCONUT rice. Do you see my amazement? Well, it's because anyone could've put this dish on plain white rice and called it a day but no the creator of the menu put some brains behind it and used his/her culinary degree. Who says tourist places don't offer good food? I beg to differ. This dish also had teriyaki sauce which offered a great balance. 


** just a little note** this whole area has great shops with good prices, live music, boat tours, retro/classic arcade, Seals docked and talking :) and a bus ride away from China Town.
author: Carrie K.

description: Worst tacos ever.. stay away from the tourist areas!!!              Food was cold.......drinks were flavorless.........calamari was dry.......dont waste your money or time....
author: Lupita H.

description: Solid spot on Pier 39! Good prices, huge selection, quality service and great food. Visiting from out of town and this is def a great place. I would recommend
author: Ben M.

description: We were meeting up with friends who were bumming around Pier 39 for a gorgeous day. We needed a bit of the "hair of the dog" after a fun filled day at the Dickens Christmas Fest and we grabbed some lunch here. The sesame tuna bowl was light and refreshing, and the veggies in it were seasoned wonderfully and still had a great crunch. The tuna was perfectly seared with the tender inside. So many complex levels, so delicious. The jalapeño burger didn't have much heat, but the relish on it was fabulous. Great drinks, great atmosphere, would definitely go back.
author: Becky B.

description:
This is one of my go to places every time I visit pier 39. I absolutely love the seafood combo, fish and chips and salmon BLt sandwich.

This place has amazing ambience and there is indoor as well as outdoor seating available.

The drinks are pretty awesome with great service.
author: Amit S.

description:
Awesome place to grab a beer and some food. 

This is the only spot I eat at on the pier. Great fried foods, really laid back beach atmosphere (exactly what should be on the pier) and a reasonably good beer selection. The staff is always happy and friendly which is really nice to see. If there's any sporting events going on you can expect to catch them on one of the many TVs this place has. It's really the best way to end a day on the pier, and the only way I plan on ending mine.
author: Nick S.

description: Not impressed- waitress was awful - other gal had to help us more then our own. We are w our hands never given silverware or even a extra plate for our appetizer! Nothing came correct and drinks never filled - when I asked if she was new I was told no she's just that bad of a waitress
author: Karole R.

description: I had the cheese burger it was very delicious. the french fries and pizza were very good as well . overall I had a very good experience with my family and I were treated very well by our waiter RACHEL . I was also impressed on how fast our food was brought out.
author: Naif Bin A.

description:
This is where we usually come to eat at Pier 39 when we bring the girls. They just love these burgers and that is very surprising since they are very picky. My sister and I liked the fact that they use Harris Ranch meat. Any extra condiments you need you can ask them for it, that part I like not a big fan of mustard.

They have a pretty good option for the kids menu too, their little pizza wasn't too bad. We'll definitely continue coming here especially since this is the girl's spot to eat in San Francisco lol.
author: Graciela P.

description: Food was great and drinks was great!! I'll def go back again!!! Was pretty busy but we checked in online so we didn't have to wait as long
author: Andrea R.

description:
ok, USUALLY, I hate trying tourist trap restaurants, and being on Pier 39, the menu seemed enticing.. 

Beer / had decent options, but the one I wanted was just tapped, and warm, so stuck it out with Water... boo

Calamari Appetizer was mediocre, little "greasy" but decent portion size. Wipeout Nachos, were actually pretty good and well prepared.. Not a bean person, but this dish was tolerable with the cheeses, and added fixins.. 

Now the MAIN reason for 4 stars, was the Sesame Tuna Salad.. yes a damn salad.... OK? .. Large slice of AHI Tuna on top of COCONUT Rice, with some seared veggies.. Very nice portion size, and couldnt finish the entire dish.... Coconut Rice was badass.. no JOKE, with hints of cilantro n a few other items like garlic, etc,,, but damn, one of my all time favorite rice dishes... Stir Fried veggies are always great and healthy. Now the only downfall, was the AHI was a over cooked, "seared" but definitely wasn't rare in the middle, which I would have loved, but was edible enough to enjoy.. 

Yes, I would come back here with the family... Out and about on my own ? hmmm, that Rice though,,,, !!
author: Mike H.

description:
Stopped here during our one-day trip to the bay. It's a tourist restaurant on the famous Pier, right along the walk way as you walk in/out from the street. 

Service was great. We were seated outdoors, and our drink order was taken as soon as we sat down. I ordered a house margarita and my husband ordered a corona-rita. They tasted just as expected. 

**Fair warning - if you plan on eating outside, you'll be surrounded by brave, ruthless birds.**

Since my husband wasn't too hungry, he didn't order anything. I ordered chips and salsa as an appetizer, and Baja fish taco's for lunch. Their menu has a wide selection (taco's, pizza, burgers, sandwiches, salads, burrito's, bowls, and pasta) so it took a minute to decide what I wanted. 
My food was "just okay". I might be biased, since no one can compare to San Diego taco's, but I was hoping it would be better since we were at a Pier. The salsa for the chips was bland, but the chips were tasty.

The restrooms were gender neutral, and the sink was a long, metal sink, with multiple faucets (kind of Costco's bathrooms). I thought it was refreshing to see a mixed gender line, since most restroom rooms are mainly for the women's side.
author: Cat T.

description: This place was awesome. Staff is extremely friendly and food was great. Excellent service and great for families. This place is also serves Mexican food we ordered burritos (couldn't tell by the name). We also ordered the nacho appetizer which was a mountain high and delicious.
author: Abdo K.

description:
I was hanging out around Pier 39 with the family, and we were looking for a place to eat. We checked out the Hard Rock Cafe, but the wait was like ten hours, and the food was pricey. The Wipeout Grill was close, so we decided to check it out. It was a beautiful day in San Francisco, and it was summertime, so the Pier was packed with people. The wait time wasn't bad considering how many people there were. Atmosphere is fun and touristy. My daughter was taken aback by the bikini girl statue out front. 

The service was pretty good, and we didn't have to wait forever for our food. I had a plate with fried calamari and fried fish. The sweet cocktail sauce was ok, but the regular cocktail sauce was great. The coleslaw has  pineapple in it or something, but it wasn't anything to Yelp about. Wife got the clam chowder bread bowl, she was quite satisfied with it. The calamari tasted fresh--it was tender and just the right amount of chewy. I chowed down and grossed my kids out at the same time. Son enjoyed the chili dog. Other son enjoyed the quesadilla. 

Clearly there are better places for seafood around the area, but if you want some touristy fun on Pier 39, Wipeout will serve you well. I would go back there. It's a good place for families (it is really loud though, so babies might not like it).
author: Logan S.

description:
Ok. Just stopped by for a quick, late dinner. Most of the pier closes down early, so went with Wipeout, and their late close time. 

Decent (not epic) tap beer selection. Good quality, but variety is a little limited. Not a big issue, since quality seems to be their goal.

Sampled two IPAs before grabbing a pint. Guy behind the bar is on point. Mostly cleaning, but serving as necessary. 

Now... the real reason for 5 stars: Sesame Tuna Bowl.   Didn't expect much, based on some prior reviews. One bite, and that changed. Coconut rice, ginger, cilantro, and a decent chunk of perfectly seared tuna on top! Simply exceptional!!! If I had time, I would order another, right now. And again for breakfast! This simple tuna, rice, vegetable dinner is one of the best restaurant meals I have had in a very very long time. It's not massive. It's not bland. It's not over seasoned. It's just perfect!
author: Tim D.

description:
Typical touristy restaurant. Only tried the wings and chili. Both were just ok. Tasted like Wolf brand chili and Tyson frozen wings. The service was good, though.

Fyi: they charge a 5% healthcare fee.
author: Mark J.

description: Came to this place because of its outside seating and we wanted something quick on the pier. Worse mistake ever, the food was nasty, and the drinks had no alcohol what's so ever, so much syrup my stomach started hurting. The service is slow and not accommodating at all. I had the chicken tacos and my husband had the bar b que chicken pizza needless to say we will not be coming back.
author: Taniesha L.

description: I would say this is the best place to eat on the whole pier. The most seafood options available and great service and atmosphere for a family or even friends getting a drink.
author: Joshua D.

description:
The food was ok and the servers were ok. Nothing so great or so bad... just middle of the road one step above Denny's or IHOP.

Thank you for your response. Im not sure how to leave a comment on a comment, so hopefully you get this. I was there on Saturday morning, March 31st. We had the breakfast burger which was ok... the potatoes were cold and tasteless.  Unfortunately we were the first in line and I figured they would be fresh.  My wife got 8 little potatoes on her plate. My wife had a breakfast sandwich. She said it was just ok,... unfortunately it was nothing great. The hot drinks were good, but they weren't hot (temperature wise) like I expected. I just drank mine like a warm cup of coffee.
author: Aaron P.

description: The food is good here and they have a big selection of different food, the one thing I don't like here is the fact that they keep the music up loud so if you want to visit while eating it can be quit difficult. The next time we visit here I think we will try the patio which is usually quite busy but much quieter .
author: Cathy K.

description:
The colorful exterior, fun atmosphere, and obvious popularity of this place coaxed us into choosing Wipeout for dinner while visiting San Francisco and finding ourselves hungry while strolling around the area. 

The location is great and easy to find, and the restaurant is huge, offering lots of seating. There is a prominent island-theme to the restaurant that adds to the fun atmosphere here. When we arrived, there were quite a few parties waiting outside so we anticipated a wait, but were pleasantly surprised when the waitress took us right back to a large booth. The menus here are pretty large with lots of food choices, but I will note that the prices were high for what you get. This being our first day of vacation, we decided to splurge on a specialty drink for $12. The drink was just okay-not very large and didn't taste very blended or smooth with not a lot of alcohol or flavor-a bit disappointing. Our food was okay also, but definitely not worth the high price as it really was nothing special nor large portions. 

Our server was okay, but could have been more attentive and friendly. He didn't seem to want to be there. My husband and I both ordered water with our meals and we noticed our server was the only one that served water in small/child-sized water glasses instead of the large/normal water glass. This was a bit frustrating, as we needed a few refills and always had to wait for him to not only notice our empty glasses, but it also took a long time to get our glasses back with the refill.

One thing it took us a bit to realize here was that there are no separate male and female bathrooms-just one joint bathroom. There was a long line of women for the bathroom we assumed was women's and my husband wondered around the restaurant looking for another (men's) bathroom, but after not having any luck, we realized men had now joined the bathroom line. This was confusing and could have been more clearly marked/labeled. I'm not a fan of joint bathrooms to begin with, but especially with how crowded the bathroom was, I would prefer them to be bigger and separate.

Fun atmosphere, but I don't think we'd return because of the high prices and less than friendly service.
author: Sarah K.

description: This place was good but I've had better. It's very touristy with loud beachy music and decor. I believe they have a little shop to buy hats/t shirts near the exit. We came here because it's the only place we are aware of at pier 39 that doesn't put bacon in their clam chowder. It was a bit underwhelming though..the clam chowder wasn't anything special and the bread bowl wasn't fresh bread. Not a good bread:chowder ratio either. The fish and chips were standard. Cole slaw was good. The fried pickles were good but their "chipotle ranch" could pass as plain ol' ranch. One thing I did really enjoy was their chipotle hot sauce. This place was good but wasn't special enough to reel me back in next time I visit.
author: Jessica P.

description:
I'm pretty impressed by this place. I expected it to be this touristy overpriced low quality seafood.  I mean it definitely is touristy, but the food was pretty good. Yes, probably overpriced, but everything in SF is overpriced. 
It seems like this place gets busy, but my boyfriend and I were seated almost right away. I don't think we waited more than 10 minutes. Their service was pretty fast. 

Anyway, I got the order of two tacos with rice and beans. I got a grilled fish taco and a steak taco. The grilled fish taco put me in heaven. I'm not sure if I was just really hungry, but that was the best fish taco I've ever had, and that's comparing it to fish tacos in Ensenada. The steak was also pretty good, but the fish taco outperformed it so I didn't even care about the steak taco anymore. The beans were good, too. The rice, I wasn't too impressed with. It was probably the corn, but it tasted kinda sweet, which I didn't really enjoy that much.
I wish I had ordered a drink because they looked delicious. They have these large drinks that are blended and are served sort of tiki style. I believe you can also order a drink of your choice and they still serve it in the same type of glass. I overhead a table next to mine ordering a Sex on the Beach and was served in that huge glass. Not sure if they made that request, or that's just the way they do it there.

I wish I had also tried the fish and chips, too. They looked really appetizing, but I could only eat so much. The reason I also didn't order a drink is because I had to make an hour drive back to my hotel. I was in SF just to visit Alcatraz.! I was exhausted from Alcatraz, and was glad to get quick service at this super packed touristy area.
author: Melissa S.

description: My frist time visiting Pier 39 and I decided to come and give this place a try . I ordered the The wipe out Margarita 14oz. I must say it's pretty good
author: Rebeca P.

description: I landed here because I didn't want to go to In n Out Burger with my friend, but I also didn't want to pay the outrageous prices of most of the Pier 39 spots. They have a nice big list of fun, fruity cocktails, but I tried the raspberry iced tea. It was tasty, not too sweet, and was served with a paper straw! Not plastic - hooray!  I started with a side salad- it was fresh, crisp, and delicious with a yummy light vinaigrette.  My meal was the ahi tuna bowl. It was absolutely delicious, seasoned well with a teriyaki glaze. I only wish it'd been a bit more rare, but I didn't know to specify that. It was served on a bed of rice surrounded by steamed veggies. Absolutely wonderful. I sat at the bar and had quick, attentive service. This place seems to get very busy, but it's definitely worth the wait! I'd definitely return!
author: Kara V.

description: The grilled salmon bowl was really good! The nachos were just okay. Great customer service. Would definitely go back!
author: Kelsey Z.

description: Watered down drinks, high prices, but I wouldnt expect anything more at a touristy area :)
author: Christina N.

description: Wipeout restaurant was an outstanding disappointment to my family and I. We waited an hour just to get tacos that were really unappetizing. The salsa was orange and they were freezing cold. The soda we got was flat too. The waiter even told us the tacos looked bad. I wasted an hour of my life and I could've gotten something at better at the 7/11 across the way. We paid for our $5.00 soda and $7.00 quesadilla and we were done for the night. Hopefully it only happened to us.
author: Paige B.

description:
4/5 stars for great atmosphere, strong drinks, and good food. This time around we sat at the bar just for drinks, but when I've been in the past with my family we all really enjoyed our meals. The reason for not 5 stars is because the bartender seemed very busy working alone, so we had to wait a while for our check since when we first ordered he didn't close us out or ask if we wanted a tab. However he was very friendly and again, the drinks are STRONG! 
Margaritas are definitely recommended!
author: Emily M.

description: The fish and chips was supposed to be the best thing on the menu but I thought it was pretty mediocre. The service was excellent and ambiance was lively.
author: Vinayak P.

description:
The food was just average and the service was god awful.  The food was just your average fish and chips, the teriyaki bowl seemed like a frozen one they heated up, but the worst of all was the service.  The waiter was rude and seemed in a rush. I asked multiple times for condiments and he never brought them, we asked for the check multiple times and he didn't bring it until the 4th time, all while he was bringing other tables around ours their checks. One member of our party was drinking Sprite and she asked for a refill and he took the cup and came back and gave it too her, all he did was fill it with water, so now there was watered down sprite in her glass and she then had to go to the bar and ask them to refill it. 
Worst service of any restaurant I've ever eaten at in San Francisco. I Will eat anywhere but here in the future.
author: Martin A.

description: Me and my friend are visiting g the pair for her birthday and we're looking for a place to eat and let me tell you we were not disappointed! The service is fast and friendly. We got our food within 5-10 min of waiting. The vibe was mellow and the music was nice. Definitely portrayed the surf and turf vibe. Overall great experience.
author: Qiana C.

description:
Our go-to at Pier 39 is Chowders but since I can no longer eat fried or high fat foods and my husband wasn't in the mood for it, we decided to pay a visit to this place. 

We visited on a Thursday evening with a group of 5. Were seated as soon as my name was taken and the waitress took our drink order right away. Then brought the drinks before any time passed. It was busy and most tables were full but the service was speedy without feeling rushed.

Being a bariatric patient, I almost always ask for a kid's menu and she happily obliged, no questions asked. Not many restaurants allow an adult to order off the menu without a long explanation or some sort of proof that one is on a bariatric diet or even at all. I immediately noticed that their kid's menu offered a grilled teriyaki salmon, coconut rice and veggie dish. How perfect is that?! I was leary though, as I've never had salmon but said, "what the heck?! I'll try it". I was NOT disappointed! The portion of salmon was tiny but enough to fill me up after a bite of rice and the veggies. I took most of it to go. 

My husband and daughter both ordered the wipeout burger and upgraded to the blue cheese fries. They said it was all delicious and the patty was perfectly cooked to medium, just like they asked. 

My son (mr picky) ordered their Cali burger (avocado, bacon and jack cheese) and upgraded to onion rings. He's never ordered a burger like this before as he's a bbq bacon type, usually. I was pleasantly surprised to see him enjoy that burger though. He said the bacon was perfect and he loved it all. 

The burger and fry portions are huge! Definitely shareable for lighter eaters. Even my son, who cleans his plate (13 y/o), left food behind because he was so full. 

My niece ordered the clam chowder in a bread bowl. She's also picky and only usually likes the clam chowder bowls from a little stand in Old Sacramento but said this one was amazing. She never finishes her food but scraped this bowl clean! 

Our drinks were never empty and our food was served surprisingly quickly considering how busy it was. I thought for sure there would be a lengthy wait because but they definitely have an efficient and competent kitchen crew! We were in and out in about an hour. The most shocking item on the menu as far as price was my husband's beer; $10!! The prices aren't listed on the menu, which is pretty clever because he wouldn't have ordered it if he knew before hand but oh well, no biggie. Our bill was a few cents over $100 which I found to not be too unreasonable.

Will definitely return!
author: Susana Q.

description: Joel Natasha and Ashley are all outstanding bartenders. I was wildly blown away by their customer service, considering how busy they are bartending at the forefront of pier 39!!! Back for round 2! Thanks guys!
author: Jorge G.

description:
Convenient and reasonably priced spot on Pier 39! This review is specifically for their to-go counter which is located right next to the main restaurant. You can't miss it. There wasn't much of a line when I went, and after I ordered, my food was ready in about 5-10 minutes. Also there's plenty of tables around to sit at and eat your food. 

I got the fish and chips. It was about $10 and came with 3 strips of fried fish and fries. Pretty standard fish and chips- I only wish it came with tartar sauce which is maybe why I didn't enjoy it quite as much. And if you're thirsty and don't want to pay $3 for bottled water (the standard around here), they do provide cups of water for something like 25 cents. 

This is not a restaurant I would go out of my way for, but it's a nice option if you're exploring Pier 39 and want to grab a quick bite!
author: Linh N.

description:
Went here for a casual lunch and got the fish sandwich. It was a pretty standard fish sandwich but delicious nonetheless. The meal was filling and not terribly overpriced for the location. There is an obvious premium that comes with eating on the coast/bay, but my wallet didn't feel too burdened after dinning here. 

The service was good and our food came out in a timely manner. The whole restaurant has a SoCal surfer/beach theme which they even extended to the bathroom design. That's a lot of dedication. Fun and casual atmosphere with plenty of TVs showing various nature, beach, and standard programming. I had a good time and wouldn't mind going back.
author: Eric B.

description: OK this place was amazing.  Besides the cool atmosphere and completely reasonable pricing, the food was delish, and our waitress was outstanding.  My son was hungry and crabby from a long, cold day at the pier, he was crying and fussing.  Not only did she immediately get me a cup of milk for him that I was in desperate need of, when she took our order, she held him and let him put the order in on the tablet!!  He stopped crying, everyone could order and she could hear them, he was happy for the rest of the visit there, I was given a small break.  The fact that she did that shocked me, it was well above and beyond what she needed to do but was so effective and simple that I feel the need to recognize her here.  Jessica you are the most awesome server I have ever had and I hope life treats you well.
author: Tiffany B.

description:
Decided to try this restaurant when my family came to visit since American food is typically familiar to everyone's taste especially for kids. Came on a Friday afternoon and it was pretty busy but we got seated in no time. 

Service was mediocre. Our server didn't check up on us throughout the dining experience. Whenever we had a question, she didn't know the answer. It took a while to get waters refilled as well. 

One of the meals also had dirty celery sticks that came with the wings. Luckily one of the managers was there and immediately took the plate back with no question or hesitation. It was then taken off our bill. (Thank you for that!) 

Food was great! I ordered the chicken and chorizo pizza -- something new and typical American food. Crust tasted like it was made in-house, chorizo the perfect char, chicken nicely grilled. Not too much cheese, which is good for my taste. The chowder was also good. It had more potatoes and less of the soup consistency, if you're into that stuff. 

Beer and cocktail menu looked great along with their prices. They offer some Bay Area-brewed beers too!
author: Mara E.

description: Stopped by for a quick lunch as we toured the city. We didn't have to wait bc we had a larger group which was nice. It took some time to get the food and when it came my order was incorrect but it still tasted good. I ordered the onion rings and even my daughter liked them. It seems there was a lack of communication with the kitchen and the waiter though. But it was still good food and a clean place to eat. My only big complaint was the fact that the restrooms were so busy with ppl that were not customers and the actual paying customers were not able to go to the bathroom without a large wait! We paid a lot to eat there and not being able to use the restroom ticked me off.
author: Christina W.

description:
1. They brought out a totally different order (chicken sandwich). 
2. They ended up bringing just 1 of them. 
3. I had to wait literallly an hour for my actual food to come out after they kept messing it up a couple of times. 
I just dont understand how hard it is for someone to mess up an order of 4 chicken tacos. 
The food overall was 4/10. I would never go back there. :)
author: Arsine A.

description: First day in San Francisco and we found a great place down near pier 39 to eat some dinner. Very reasonable prices, great variety of foods for every one to select, quality selection of drinks. Atmosphere was great, positive vibes and great selection of chilled music, also we loved the colourful relaxed vibe of the restaurant. The welcoming atmosphere as soon as we arrived was great, the waiter/waitress named "Dolly" provided a great first impression, a very happy smiley face greated us with positive attitude to her job, gave us time to select what we wanted, always checked on table for extra drinks and to see if our food was hot and always ensured she checked on the table to see if we were all enjoying our meals. Coming from another country it was great to see someone do their job really and actually provide exceptional customer service and take pride on ensuring a great experience. Well done "Dolly" before we leave San Francisco we will be coming back to Wipe out bar and grill because of the first impression that was set.
author: Brett C.

description: I took my group of Mentally Challenged Adults. Told the Hostess we would have to do seperate checks. She checked w/the Manager & we were accommodating. The food was delicious! Asked each one if they liked it each told me Good. After paying each bill & leaving tips w/each bill. Leaving needed to ask the manager a question so that is why 4 stars. If I didn't think He would correct the situation I wouldn't have given 4. OH & one of my Clients said that was her Favorite Burger! LOL Great!
author: Sheryl L.

description: Great burger!  And great fish taco stuffed stuffed stuffed with fish. An awesome surfer ambiance and decor.  The service was friendly, starting with Dave at the door.  The restaurant was very busy, but we were constantly assured that we would be seated prompt which we were. #cannotwaittogoback
author: Felix S.

description: I like to go to this place whenever I go out to Pier 39 and I only come here to eat the taco salad. I've had many taco salads, but none seem to be able to top this one. After eating one, I am always full and I rarely become full that easily. Easy to find location, but you might have to wait a little bit for a seat inside. Great place to bond and spend time with friends and family. They never cease to be amaze me and I look forward to returning in the near future.
author: Merrilyn W.

description:
Had a terrible experience today. Not first timers. Tried to give this place some second chances. No.
I received the wrong food item and was not offered any kind of compensation or the option to speak to the manager. A manager did not automatically visit my table for the mistake. I finally spoke to a manager (sadly I missed his name) who was extremely rude. Finished his last sentence with me by turning his head mid sentence and walked away. Hell no.

And the food is overrated
author: Mai N.

description: Good service at bar. Only ordered drinks--skinny lemon drop (tasty), wheat tap beer (cold) and a root beer float (slow getting it--made in kitchen).
author: Jill M.

description:
Location is great, outside patio dining.
The BBQ chicken pizza is kind of sweet and the chicken was over cooked.
Clam chowder was ok.
author: Vivian L.

description: We just had a beer and a drink here waiting for brother-in-law and his woman to finish eating.  The service was good and of course the beer went down like a champ.
author: David S.

description: This place was really good! We went for a light lunch and enjoyed everything. We shared a sandwich with onion rings and chips and salsa. The salsa was amazing. My boyfriend got the appetizer of coconut shrimp and liked it. Price was $38 so not bad and they had seats right up on the window looking out to the ocean we were a couple tables away and still had a nice view. Our server was a little slow but we enjoyed our time.
author: Bryana W.

description:
The food was delicious, but I'm leaving this a low rating because the prices are so ridiculous! Why does it cost so much money to eat in SF?!?!?!?! If the prices were reasonable I would give Wipeout 4.5 stars, but the fact that you need to take out a small loan to eat in this city is horrible.
We ordered the fish and chips and coconut shrimp and chips; both were so tasty!! 
Definitely a good restaurant to check out if you're in the area, just be prepared to pay more than expected!
author: Ryan M.

description:
Came to San Francisco as a tourist and we got
Hungry after walking pier 39 so we stopped here to get dinner. The service was nice and fast. We got margaritas and they were delicious, but the food was not so delicious. I got the buffalo chicken pizza and my boyfriend got the Baja fish tacos. The pizza tasted like it's frozen and just popped in an oven. And the fish tacos was pretty good, but the beans and rice that went with them not so good! The rice had a weird taste and the black beans were sweet. Service and drinks were good, but the food was not so good.
author: Jenni M.

description: I have been here twice and was not incredibly impressed either time. The first time I learned what not to order. I was born and raised in a New Jersey beach town. We have decent seafood, but I expected much greater from a restaurant on the pier. I was mistaken. The calimari was terrible, rubbery and tasteless. I went for a pasta. Not bad, but not great either. My second time around I chose simpler options, and it was all decent, but still not as expected when visiting this location. Head upstairs to Eagle Cafe instead.
author: Brianna L.

description:
We stopped by Monday at about seven, and were seated immediately. The staff was incredibly polite, and fast with bringing out our drinks and food. It was kinda busy, so we were super surprised to be able to eat so quickly. The food was absolutely delicious, and cooked to perfection. We had their cod fish n chips, which were a little greasy but sooo worth whatever the calories were, and a salmon BLT. It never occurred to us to combine our favorite fish with our favorite sandwich, but it was delicious and we're glad we ordered it. The staff was also super quick to refill our drinks, which is great. 
The decor is funny, and very clever. From using surf boards as tables, to reusing Coors Light holders for condiments really reinforced the whole "day at the beach" feeling. The bathrooms were also great. Through a cute little beach tent, they have four unisex stalls (more like little rooms) which were very clean, and an area for everyone to wash their hands. 
The only thing that kinda sucked, (pun intended) is that they use paper straws instead of plastic straws. While this is way better for the environment, and I dig that, they do kinda get soggy after a little while of drinking and need to be replaced.
So while the price is a little more then we wanted to spend, it is 100% worth it, and next time we visit San Francisco we will return here!
author: Jeremy L.

description:
This place is located on the money spot. It will be one of the first restaraunts you'll see when you come to Pier 39.

The restaraunt started to get crowded after 6:00 PM. The wait wasn't too bad, only around 10 minutes. We requested to sit inside, but all the tables were taken. Instead of informing us that there were no more tables avalible inside, our hostess continued to chat to his peers and escorted outside. This defintely annoyed my dad.

We ordered the clam chowder and comboed it with a salad (you aren't allowed to choose other salads, you are only given the option of a house salad).We also ordered the bbq ribs because $11 for ribs sounded like a dream. The bread bowl was soggy and the clam chowder had barely to none clams! The cilantro-lime vinagrette was so sour, no one even touched the salad. And sadly, the dream was too good to be real. The ribs were small, barely had meat, and the bbq sauce tasted like pure honey.

The servers were very busy, so waiting for the bill took around 10 minutes. I wouldn't come here again. Pricey, mediocore food, and slow service, there wasn't much to love
author: Janette N.

description:
When you have a tourist trap area like Pier 39/Fisherman's Wharf in the most popular part of San Francisco, one might always assume that food & drink prices are absurdly inflated. Not to mention, some of these restaurants offer only mediocre quality food. Surprisingly, this isn't quite the case with "Wipeout Bar & Grill".

As far as getting to this restaurant (located in the heart of Pier 39), it is relatively easy to find as you will see giant wooden posts paired up with palm trees and surfboards, it almost looks like a place that should be in Malibu or Honolulu and not a cool climate like San Francisco. Forget about driving to this place; the parking garage is located a couple blocks away. My advice is to either walk, bike, take a cab, Muni bus, or trolley.

This is actually my second time dining here, however it is my first review on the place. I came here with my lady and our friend (who was celebrating her birthday over Labor Day weekend). We arrived around 5:30pm (on the afternoon of Sunday 9/4/16) and were told by the hostess it would be about a 35-minute wait. Unfortunately, this place does not provide the portable buzzers when your table is ready; nor do they text you. Not a big deal but staying near the restaurant hearing for someone to call your name can be challenging, especially since it is very loud inside.

And speaking of the inside, you will find a fairly large and spacious dining area complete with a very surf-inspired theme to it. Some of the tables are even carved out as surfboards. And for the serious surf enthusiasts, there is also a chalkboard that lists the daily surf reports as well as shark attack reports. One thing I didn't really care for were the bathrooms. A restaurant this busy only had 3 toilets (with private doors) that are used by men & women while the sink is located outside. That's a bit odd if you ask me. The outside has plenty of seating to dine as well as fire pits for those cold, foggy San Francisco days.

Fortunately the wait time was only 20 minutes and we are all seated around 5:50pm. Our hostess (whom I forgot her name) was very friendly and had an awesome personality. We all ordered drinks, I was craving an iced cold beer so I went with a 20 oz. size of the Ballast Point Sculpin IPA. To eat, I decided on their "Teriyaki Pineapple Chicken Sandwich" (for $12.95). This consisted of a grilled chicken breast, teriyaki sauce, grilled pineapple and jack cheese served on a toasted bun. As my side of choice, I went the healthier route and went with a side salad w/vinaigrette dressing.

As busy as this place was, all three of us got our meals out in less than 15 minutes; I find that to be quite impressive. Now onto the food.. I actually enjoyed every bite of my pineapple chicken sandwich. It was flavored very well and was a very generous portion that filled me up very well. My lady ordered their "Teriyaki Chicken Rice Bowl" and she loved her meal as well. However, our friend (who wasn't that hungry) only went with the "Coconut Fried Shrimp" (which was priced at $10.95) and was not satisfied how small the amount of food was that she got. My entree (that was only a mere $2.00 more) had way more overall food. So it really depends on what you order that determines if you get your moneys worth or not.

Overall, "Wipeout Bar & Grill" is a decent place that won't burn a hole in your pocket. They do serve breakfast, a huge variety of drinks (with a full bar & several beers on tap), and finally a decent dessert menu. And speaking of desserts, our friend (the birthday girl) had Happy Birthday sung to her and got complimentary chocolate lava cake with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. So all in all, its a solid 4-star dining experience, not the best place I've been to but far better than some of the other overpriced touristy restaurants in the area.
author: Donovan H.

description: So yummy... great service. Food was very tasty and was so big we could share. Our waiter was awesome and even split it for us. The drinks were very yummy and super fun spot. We came from Florida and really enjoyed the boardwalk a lot. Recommend coming whenever your near:)
author: Chantel Q.

description:
Probably the best fish and chips! Great crisp on the fish. Would have love a tiny bit more seasoning. Bustling place, bit we were seated next to the washroom which was not the best place to sit. 

Overall great vibe though.
author: Manasa K.

description: Wait staff was rude and food was horrible. I was with a party of 15 and everyone complained about the food! My burger patty was raw on the inside and when I sent it back to be cooked properly they returned with a burnt patty! Will never return again! Do not waste your time or money!
author: Irene V.

description:
This place was nice. It is at the beginning of the Pier 39. We got there at about 12pm on a Saturday and it was busy however we got seated quickly. The food was reasonable for being on the pier. Surprisingly not overpriced for a tourist area. I ordered the Teriyaki Burger it was about $13 and a 23oz alcoholic beverage for $11. Good portion of food. Definitely filling. 
Not 5 stars because they took a bit to take our order and didn't really come to the table much. But once we ordered the food was served quick. I would recommend trying this place.
 Also they validate for parking garage.
author: Alexis G.

description: Ordered the nachos, pizza bread, wipe out burger, and California burger. Everything was pretty meh. The wipeout burger had the best flavor but this joint was definitely not #2 spot worthy.
author: Jackie S.

description: We had a hard time finding a decent place to eat on the Wharf. Everything is so over-priced and badly rated. We tried Wipeout because it seemed to be cheapest, and had a large selection of food and drinks. It's pretty decent, but still over-priced. The ambiance is fun, and the service is ok. The short-haired hostess is really unfriendly and pushy. I saw her try to seat a guy then kind of yell at him when he seemed hesitant about the placement of his table. She exclaimed, "Here is your table, sir!" I gave this 4 stars because we did enjoy our overall experience and drinks.
author: Jessica M.

description: The grilled chicken burritto was good.  The reason I didn't rate it higher is because of the location.  If you sit outside be prepared to get a good dose of weed smoke constantly from the people who are walking by.  The birds will pay a visit and purch over you while you are eating.  You can imagine what could happen here.
author: J C.

description:
Absolutely fantastic location, food was scrumptious, beer was crafty! It is located in the center of Pier 39. But the thing that caught our attention the most and kept us there for hours was a fire pit with Adirondack chairs. 

perfect place for people watching and a light snack with a cold beer or a glass of wine this is a very nice place to stop and will revisit it for sure


Loved it!!
author: George W.

description: Had a great time. The nachos where so good and so where the drinks! Ashley was awesome and very helpful and attentive. And also Zach was a great help when we had any questions about the area. Thanks wipeout! We will be back
author: John T.

description:
Very basic fare, as far as American restaurants go. I had a chipotle chicken pasta that wasn't very flavorful. 
The waiter suggested a Mai Tai that I ended up ordering. I did not like it. It was extremely sweet, almost syrupy. I couldn't drink it. The waiter was very nice and didn't make me pay for it which I was very surprised about. 
I was disappointed in my lunch but I would go back and maybe order something different. 
My friend ordered the steak with the blue cheese and that was very good.
author: Charles B.

description: This was not great experience for for the amount of money I spent on a hamburger and appetizer. My calamari was burnt and our waiter Michael did not listen to us and had a very bad attitude. I expected a much better service. Brought us our check and never came back just like every other time we needed something we had to hunt him down.
author: Tamara D.

description: The fish tacos were really good; however, the rice and beans to go with it were super bland. The Pico de gallo was a very small portion to mix in with the beans and rice to flavor it up. Not worth 14$ maybe the rice and beans has to be made bland but our waiter Rachel wasn't very connective with us. It was busy I understand but just a quick stop to see how we were doing and a here you go with the bill. I get it I've been a waitress but connection with customers is important.
author: Celeste C.

description:
Over the many years I have patronized Wipeout, it has been a fun place to eat.

The place is usually busy enough I can have a conversation with customer when I sit at the bar. And there is a wide array of menu items to choose from. 

The service aspect of dining is paramount here. At least three waiters stopped by to check on me or say Hello.

Large groups do well here. But large can groups acutely acutely impact restaurant service.

The place is very clean. The tables, bar,  and floor are quickly cleaned up when vacant. Although Pier 39 is a hot tourist spot, so many young, employed locals that can't afford a real vacation dine all over San Francisco year 'round, as if they are on a vacation. Pier 39 should be on any locals list of places to meetup. 

When I'm in a hurry to eat, I use the walk-up window. I can eat my food at their outside tables, or order it as take-out.

During times when my personal agenda is clear, I get seated inside, near a window. I try to arrive just before the lunchtime rush.

Remember, you can get to Fisherman's Wharf by ferry from all over the Bay. The F Line Street Car has a stop here. Otherwise, time yourself and take advantage of the one hour free validated parking at the Pier 39 Parking Garage across the street.
author: The Adv G.

description:
I really liked this place! When I was at pier39 it was raining pretty hard so all restaurants were full and everybody was taking shelter.
I only had to wait for 10min before my table was ready. I got a very nice spot in the middle of the restaurant and the staff member was really interessed where i was from.

I orded a coke and got it quick! It tasted good this time. Sometimes the sodas in restaurants has such a bad taste!
I orded a burger with fish and it came pretty quick. It tasted good! The food on the other tables looked nice aswell.
So conclusion a very nice quick food restaurant at pier 39!
author: Fanny B.

description: The service was great and the waiter was very attentive.  The food was another thing.  It was cold and very dry.  I order the garlic fries and they were cold. I addressed the issue with the waiter and he promptly fixed it with some semi warm fries.  I had the fish tacos and the shells were hard as if they were old and made eating them very hard. I would think with the crowds that they are pulling the food management from the kitchen to the table would be better.
author: J. M. J.

description:
THE FOOD IS MODERATE

It's not bad but it's not good, it toes the line of mediocrity. The reason why I gave it two stars instead of three is because the price is so high. The average plate cost is 15$. I ordered the chicken penne and it was saucy but super runny. My other table mate orders the 17$ coconut shrimp and it was too greasy the shrimp were small and the batter had no coconut flakes.  

Our waitress was attentive and sweet. 

The atmosphere feels like a chucky cheese but the view is nice by a window. 

Will not return there are so many other beautiful authentic restaurants on the beautiful pier.
author: Mary L.

description:
Prices were low, and the food and drink was great. We sat at a table that looked like a surfboard. It was very cute but extremely small. Our plates were touching. The bar is very cute and have DELICIOUS food. They have an adorable surfer theme. A kids milk was 1.95. And they were extremely small. The food is priced very well and would definitely recommend this place to friends. Just in small groups. Just another note: the place is pretty loud.

Y'all have fun out there
~Kyle
author: Kyle M.

description: My wife and I have been to pier 39 a few times already and we're pleasantly surprised at how this restaurant was so many good things all in one. The service waitress, Navidad, was so attentive and consistently asking us if we needed anything or if we wanted our drinks topped off. Furthermore, I was impressed by their friendliness and cleanliness of their restaurant. The food was so very awesome as well as having been prepared so fast.  It really does say a lot when you got a great staff like the ones here. We will definitely be coming back to this place next time.
author: Who D.

description: Clam chowder bread bowl was absolutely terrible for the bread but the soup was good. The fish taco and carnita asada taco were cold and flavorless, and the beans that came with it were worse than canned beans. Would not recommend this place to anyone.
author: Phyllis L.

description:
First things first; it's Fisherman's Wharf. Are you a SF local? What the hell are you doing here? It's very crowded, very expensive, and lots of tourists really wandering around with paper maps, in circles, with little-to-no spacial or kinesthetic awareness. Your coffee will be knocked out of your hand by a clueless housewife from Nebraska. You'll be annoyed.

Met up with a friend who was in town for a conference nearby, and she only had an hour so we were limited to this neighborhood, as much as we were hoping to end up elsewhere. Walked into Wipeout primarily because it wasn't one of the most expensive places in the area... and it was... fine.

Food was good but not great. Setting was cute but not sexy. Waiter was helpful but not exceptional. Expensive for fish tacos, but not for Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Sean B.

description: We stopped here for a late dinner after a late sunset cruise. The food was really good and we were able to get in with no wait (all the other restaurants nearby had hour long waits). We got the fish and chips and grilled salmon bowl but all of the food looked good here and there were lots of options.
author: Christie A.

description: The food (we ordered the nachos and some adult beverages) was great and I would eat it again. The portion sizes were great and the prices were reasonable. I had to give this restaurant 3 stars though because our server was a little slow and did not keep our waters refilled. The bathrooms were also pretty gross and didn't look like anyone at the restaurant was taking time to care despite several workers hanging around and talking.
author: Jonna Leanne P.

description:
We finally made it to San Francisco to relax! And who has some of the greatest Margaritas around? Wipeout!
The vibe is great! Wooden posts and a Volkswagen bus window is an awesome look to the place! There is convenient outdoor seating-and enough for a large group! 

We sat outside, right up to the bar- Well,  yes,  I wanted that fancy MARGARITA! We were served by Jru... funny awesome guy. He checked up on us constantly, laughed at some of our jokes... service from Jru was great! When his shift ended, he came over and said bye... 
It was sad to see him go....that was the best service we had in San Francisco! 

The next night we came back, Jru was not there, so we got margaritas, chili cheese fries, and a 2 taco meal to share. The chili cheese fries were good,  I love red onions in mine, but they didn't have any. The tacos took a very long time to come out. First, they were wrong, so he took the plate away from us... then another 10 minutes went by before the bartender went to the back to get our correct 2 taco plate dinner... by that time, our chili cheese fries had settled, and with us being on our 2nd margarita... we said we didn't want the food anymore. They were polite, and understood.
We put our card in the glass, paid, & left. 

5 stars for Jru... that's the kind of service we like when we go anywhere! 
Thanks Jru!
author: Ursula O.

description: Great location with a great view! We chose to seat inside and we were up against the window with a view of Alcatraz. Had the carnitas tacos and my wife had the calamari. The garlic fries are awesome.
author: David J.

description: My husband and I ate here for dinner after a day exploring the bay. I had the carne asada burrito and he, the fish tacos. The food was great, highly recommend the fried pickle spears! The prices were on the lower end based on the other restaurants we looked at which was nice and seemed appropriate for the quality and quantity we got. Service was the only downside to the meal, we were not given silverware until much after we received our food and we struggled to get refills on our small glasses of water. Other than that, we enjoyed our dinner, especially with the bay side view and would probably return in the future.
author: Ivy M.

description:
Generic seafood chain restaurant on San Francisco's kitschy Fishermans Wharf delivers decent food, good service, and a family-friendly atmosphere. 

I'm a foodie. So, maybe it's unfair for me to review a place like this. I have no real complaints about the Wipeout Grille, but there's nothing local or special about it either. I could be in Galveston, Pensacola, or Virginia Beach and find a restaurant that would be indistinguishable from it except for the color scheme. The menu is long on choices and short on interest: burgers, nachos, pizza, tacos, generically Asian bowls, salads, sandwiches, and sea food all in one place. The margaritas are large and nicely priced. The beer is lowest common denominator. Our server, Jana, was attentive and helpful. The decor was predictably fishy. 

The bathrooms were oddly unisex (toilets are private, with a shared wash area). Not a big deal, but I saw women in the line the first time and had that flash of terror a man has when he accidentally walks in the ladies room.
