I think I wanted something more distinctly west coast than I found here. We wandered in cuz we were really hungry and tired and it was near the entrance to the wharf. Four stars because they do a good job at being this kind of place. It's just not for a foodie like me.
author: Loren B.

description:
Wipeout Bar & Grill is located on Pier 39 in San Francisco, CA. It is a cool place with outdoor seating on the pier which is great for people watching or you can sit indoors and look out over the harbor. They have life size figures of an attractive surfer dude and babe to have your picture taken with and other fun stuff. 

We had lunch there after a morning of walking. We started with their namesake lager & amber which were both okay. We shared a huge plate of some crazy good nachos. I could not finish my delicious "Beach Club" turkey, cheese, onion BLT on sour bread toast. The others really enjoyed their Mexican food.

 I did not expect such fresh food in this high volume setting.  I highly recommend the Wipeout Bar & Grill.
author: Rich C.

description:
This bar is at Pier 39, cool décor, stood a while till we were seated, and i don't know why because I saw a few empty tables.

Anywho, we got a great window table and we were able to see the big screen playing the 49ers game we wanted to see.  Our server, Renzo, was really nice and quick.

However, the food I wasn't really a fan of, sadly.  I only ordered the clam chowder which was super chunky, just the way I like it, but it didn't taste all that great.  The coffee was super watered down, and the calamari was not the best, especially for the price.  The lava cake, you can't go wrong with though, that was good!
author: Precious Ethel P.

description: The servers were very friendly and quick. The food was ok, nothing special, but it is a busy tourist location so was not expecting much.
author: Lisa S.

description:
Decided to come here and have breakfast before the start of Fleet week festivities.

We were greeted and asked where we would like to sit outside inside or buy a window, of course we said by the window inside. The staff was very accommodating him to make sure we were able to see the beautiful day that was outside and all the bay's beauty. We were quickly ask what we would like for drinks, the server was back immediately with our order of iced tea and a soda. At that point our server asked if we were ready to order, as we were so we placed our order and in less than 10 minutes our order was at the table. 

The food was excellent. The restrooms were very unique, but they were absolutely clean. The restaurant itself was well-maintained and clean. The staff was friendly, well groomed, and happy to be at work. We look forward to returning next year for San Francisco Fleet week.   So if you're in the area at the beginning of Pier 39, you must come here and either have breakfast lunch or dinner. We highly recommend it
author: Michael N.

description:
My boys and I had an awesome experience at the Wipe Out. 

The food was delicious, the service was awesome and Meagan made sure my son's Birthday was an experience to remember.
author: La Toya B.

description:
Wonderful waitress and best fried calamari I ever ate.
The smoky flavor of my wife's hamburger was sublime.
author: R L.

description:
Its good secind time here and satisfied again.. 
Its nice family restaurant in San Francisco i reccomend hitting up this joint.. its legit joint lol
author: Pedro O.

description: It was decent! The waitress (Janet) was not overly friendly but the beer I had was good, the coconut shrimp I would rate a 5/10 but my husband's teriyaki pineapple sandwich looked amazing and he said it was good. The weather was perfect on their outdoor patio.  Overall experience was 5/10.
author: Callie S.

description: The food was good, but not great. But what made our visit extraordinary was our amazing bartender/server, Ralph. He was very personable and accommodating, wanting to make out short vacation memorable. I would return to Wipeout again strictly because of him!
author: Travis W.

description: OHHH BOY!! I cannot even describe how happy I am with the food and service at Wipeout Bar & Grill!! My boyfriend and I decided to visit Pier 39 and we actually walked all the way from Chinatown to the Pier (IT WAS A LONG WALK, TOOK FOREVER). Needless to say, when I got to the pier, I WAS STARVING!! Although I wanted seafood and a bowl of clam chowder, I decided to visit Wipeout because it was near me and I really couldn't walk any further before I put some food in my belly. The inside of the restaurant is very nice and close to the water, the tables were a little messy though because there were soooo many people! The place was jam packed with people that my boyfriend and I actually had to wait for around 15-20 minutes, which isn't bad. I ordered a strawberry lemonade because I am a lemonade FANATIC! My boyfriend ordered a burger, I forgot the name of the burger but it has avocado on top, bacon, and cheese. I settled on the BBQ chicken pizza and we also ordered the fried calamari. I am sooo sad that I forgot to take a photo of the fried calamari because the plate was HUGE!!! I am a big big fan of fried calamari and when the waiter brought the plate out, I almost fainted, it was pure bliss. I devoured the fried calamari, it was soooo delicious and yummy! When our entrees were brought out, I was already super full because of the calamari hahaha. My boyfriend gobbled up the burger in about 3 seconds, it was VERY TASTY!! The avocado and bacon really made the burger stand out. The BBQ chicken pizza was also REALLY REALLY finger-licking good, I would order both plates again. Overall, you can tell based on my gigantic review that I had a very good time at Wipeout Bar & Grill, and that I will surely be back! I highly reccomend this place people
author: Lulu T.

description: Went here to watch the warriors game. They didn't have a pitcher that we could share so we got a bucket of Coronas. I shared a teriyaki bowl with my friend, but it wasn't spectacular. It tasted alright though. Portions are large so I'd recommend sharing.
author: Nathan C.

description: Great customer service, but the food wasn't the best. It's also a tight fit restaurant.
author: Alishee M.

description: Given the location and  clientele (massive numbers of tourists), Wipeout could certainly skimp on quality and service. We were pleasantly surprised at how tasty the food is and the great service. The manager stopped by to ask if the food was good and it was!  We had the chorizo chicken pizza. Great flavor and crust. We also had the club sandwich and sourdough chowder bowl. All good quality at a fair price. I'm glad we stumbled in and will recommend this restaurant to friends who come to visit San Francisco.
author: Elena and ivan A.

description: Short wait, great menu, tasty! We were pleasantly surprised with the quality of food and had a great view of the sea lions and passersby.
author: Jennifer L.

description: The food was very good and the seafood was fresh. The salmon sandwich was very delicious and not dry at all considering it was salmon and its usually dry when cooked.
author: Gabriela G.

description: We took our teenage boys here for dinner while on spring break. We thought it be nice for the boys to have some burgers. First, the waiter was so unprofessional, and disengaged. He was upset that he has two large parties and vocalized this to the hostess which we over heard since we were sat right next to the hostess. The food is bland and not worth the $200 we spent.
author: Elizabeth P.

description:
I had some relatives visiting and we were up in San Francisco at the Fisherman's Wharf. We started to get hungry and everywhere had a really long wait. So we decided to eat here since the wait wasn't too long and they had a bar so that was perfect.

This place isn't terrible, but it isn't outstanding either. The service was quite slow, even though they were pretty busy. However, we asked them for waters, but we didn't receive them til after out food came out, which also took a really long time. The server was not sympathetic, but it could have been because she was busy.

I ended up ordering a Corona-rita (Corona beer with a margarita) and a half salad half clam chowder. The Corona-rita was pretty good. I have had it before at other places and this one wasn't as sweet, which I liked. Most places put too much sweet and sour and its like drinking sweet tarts. Yuck! The salad on the side was pretty lame, literally nothing special about it. The clam chowder in the bread bowl was ok, just like the rest of the meal, nothing special and a little bland.

The rest of my family ended up ordering some pretty yummy looking things. Next time I will try the burgers or sandwiches.
author: Theo T.

description: Been here for 15 minutes and no one greeted our table, many servers around just talking to each other. We finally get some blonde girls attention. Instead of taking our order, she looked around like she had no idea what to do & went and got our server. He seemed too busy for us. Weird cuz our order was extremely simple.. anyways the food wasn't special. I wont be back
author: Cierra D.

description: First and last time eating here, my boys and I stopped to grab lunch but the food was greasy, fries were not crispy and my turkey burger tasteless all for almost $70... not worth the price!
author: Jaime C.

description:
First time dining in! Had lunch in the patio area! Super packed! Fast and friendly service! 
Fire pit was awesome as it's usually chilly in the city. And the pigeons were amusing to watch as they fight for food on the floor! Our server Karen was wonderful! I don't know  how many tables she was handling but she certainly took care of us! Even I we noticed the management was involved in taking care of people! It's a wonderful resturant. Menu: has salads sandwiches burgers pizza tacos! Great choices. Hubby had fish & chips & I had the teriyaki pineapple chicken sandwich.  It was smothered in teriyaki sauce which I would wasn't the case but maybe the the recipe!
In totally I would recommend this place! 
Thank you Karen!
author: Simi K.

description: I mean, it was ok, if you are desperate, but I don't think anyone should come here, if they are organized and know where to go, tbh
author: Ankur N.

description: The French toast here is amazing. It's super thick, not too tough but not too soft, and it was tasteful. Definitely recommend eating here.
author: Douglas D.

description:
After extensive research on where to watch the super bowl we ended up choosing this place over Players and going downtown. 
The bartenders working during the game were great!  
I am glad we chose to watch the game here. 
I will be coming back for sure on my next venture out to SF.
author: Autumn G.

description: I have to say food is great especially when you have such amazing server like Ralph. Positive, kind, very courteous. My order is perfect every time. Smiles, and makes sure customers are happy. Definitely makes me want to stop by knowing I will get best Customer service every time. Ask for Ralph. :)
author: Sabah A.

description:
Mmm, yeah ... this place was just okay. Fisherman's Wharf is super busy and filled with tourists. With so many places to choose from we decided to give this one a shot. The spot is fun and has the quintessential beach theme to it. Our server was very nice and attentive.

The food, however, was forgettable.

I ordered the salmon BLT that looked appetizing. Too bad there was barely any mayo on it, making the salmon taste drier than it already did. (Points for adding a nice portion of lettuce, so I could get some green in.) My husband did say he enjoyed his fish tacos.

The biggest disappointment came with our kids' order. The chicken tenders they got were so hard and over-cooked, I'm pretty sure the sea life wouldn't dare touch them. You could barely pull pieces of edible meat from each tender. Needless to say, our kids ended up eating our food.

Like others commenting, it took a while to get our food and for the waitress to come back with check. I will say the waitress (likely a grandmother) did an awesome job of splitting up our kids' single meal on two plates, and bringing out their food before ours.

Maybe this place had an off day. We won't be returning to find out. I guess I should've looked at all the three star reviews before picking this place.
author: Tanvier P.

description: We both thought the food was pretty good! We got a table right away, had great service from Gabby and had a view of the pier by the ferry boats-Great for people watching! Good bar food for sure! The chips and salsa were amazing!
author: Melissa H.

description:
Wipeout is exactly what you would expect it to be when you look at it. A very mediocre, touristy restaurant with very high prices and very average quality. 

I went to Pier 39 because I was with my wife who had never been to Sam Francisco. After walking around for almost an hour, we finally decided to eat here. 

The beer list is maybe the best thing here. My burger had very little in the way of flavor. My wife's calamari was very salty. The fries were just average. I guess it's what you should expect from the location.
author: Bryan A.

description: Food is great. To get a seat was chaos. Too may people and not a process to seat people.
author: Ellie G.

description:
We had the nachos and cheeseburger which was average... And the calamari Sucked big time!

Service was bad. The server's were very nice but the place is always packed and not enough help so everything took to long to get.
author: Cecily R.

description: The prices were better than most of the eating options.  The waitress was friendly,  but SLOW and not observant.  The food was OK,  nothing special.
author: Keri L.

description:
Did not dine inside the restaurant it was too packed so I ordered by the to go side :
Order the bbq pulled pork sandwich and customized my fries to chili cheese 
Did not expect the sandwich so big it's full of meat and it's so worth it for the price I did t even finished my meal I got full half way . . I recommend if you don't wanna wait and wanna grab a quick bite it's better to order to go!

I wanted the full experience but didn't wanna wait so long I'm so glad I came to San Francisco to experience different places to eat, I like the atmosphere my type of place to go to ; Laid back and chill
author: Nina S.

description: I got a burger-the food was good and a decent price for being in a touristy location. The food came  very quickly and service was friendly.
author: Allysia B.

description:
I had such a great time here! I went recently and split the Blue Cheese Fries and some wings with my family (I think the wings were also blue cheese? Can't remember, but they were delicious and actually drumettes, which were fantastic anyway.) I'm afraid I can't say what beers were had because I wasn't paying much attention since I was happy with my Angry Orchard, but my brother really favored his and it was Magnolia something, I'm sorry I'm not very helpful but the staff was knowledgable so just ask them, depending on what you like. 

Although it was not the warmest of San Francisco nights, we sat outside people watched - they have a great little fireplace that kept us warm as well as our drinks! The fries were absolutely fantastic, unlike anything I'd had before, and the combination of green onions, blue cheese, bacon, and the rest of the toppings made it so delicious, couldn't complain. I also want to give props to our waiter Brian, who first off has some really cool tattoos. My parents were deciding between two beers and he offered us the ability to sample them, which was unexpected and delightful, and they came out promptly and were excellent quality. Brian also heard us talking about how it was my father's birthday and brought him a brownie and frozen yogurt, which was quite sweet, so just total applause to him, we really liked him. We also ordered the fries on his recommendation, so thank you Brian. 

All in all, this place is a good place for people watching, drinks, food, and service without being ridiculously expensive or feeling too much like a tourist! The restaurant's theme was beachey and Californian without being raunchy, and had enjoyable music as well. I'd recommend!
author: Alina D.

description: Of all the times we've been to Pier 39 this was our first dinning experience here and we loved everything about this place. We had lunch here on Thanksgiving Day and despite the crowds our server was all over it. We were lucky to get four seats by the fireplace. We chose to order off the menu from there since it was a beautiful day on the wharf. The drinks were great and priced right. I had the Sex on the Baker Beach and a mango margarita. The nachos was a big hit. The clam chowder bread bowls are a must! While the inside is cool, the outside dinning area makes this place stand out among the others. It's close to the front and offers great views. No reservations needed. I highly recommend!
author: Gerald H.

description: I'm 100% satisfied with my visit here. The staff was quick to seat us, get our orders, and our food came in probably 10ish minutes. I ordered the Salmon BLT that came with a huge side of fries, both were hot and delicious. They actually have a public bathroom here, which is hard to find in this city! The bathroom was clean, lemony fresh, and the stalls were head to toe like their own little rooms. Only complaint is the paper straws and the restaurant is very open so it may get cold at night. Otherwise, I would definitely recommend this surfer-themed restaurant, I will for sure be coming back!
author: Logan L.

description:
Such a great place to eat!!! First off we are from out of town and have no idea what's around. When we walked and I searched up pics on yelp I confirmed of what already was to be true- this place will knock my socks off. 

We first ordered the garlic fries (made perfectly. Not too garlicky and just right!!) and then we got the Caesar salad which was a good salad for sure. The fries were like $8.95.... expensive but i dunno.... 

Then we got 2 salmon bowls (one for each of my friends) and I got the carne asada  Baja tacos which had skirt steak and a beautifully made dressing on top. We were sooooo full and enjoyed every last bit!!! 

Total came out to be $100.20 with one alcoholic drink called strawberry mango tequila 

Not bad? But yes it's pricey - worth it? I think so.. 

Our waitress's name was Iris. Super nice and sweet girl!!
author: Melissa M.

description: I would of liked the chance to give this place a higher rating but for my first visit we sat on our table for over 10 minutes and just watched as others getting service before us and we were seated before them thank you wipe out
author: Jorge C.

description: Food was ok...and the music was horrible,who in their right mind would play country music on a Bay Area,that's a no go!
author: Yanet D.

description: Pretty much what you expect at a tourist destination. Food is decent and not horribly overpriced. Service was very good.
author: Al J.

description: Place looks crowded but its really not there time for waiting for a table is not long maybe 15 mins at the most. Food was pretty good..wipeout nachos very good but i asked for no pico de gallo but the waitress must of forgot since the dont write down peoples order which i thought was weird. We had to keep telling her she missed two of our starter orders. The baby back ribs were good but definitely "baby backs" very small should have called them short ribs but flavor on point not a bar b que sauce but a teriyaki taste "sweet sour and a little spice" wipeout seafood plate very good and garlic fries good very "garlicky" not much parmesan great for garlic lovers. Free refills which is great considering the 3 dollar and something charge for a medium size cup. Yes i would go again and try something else wont hurt to try for a second time
author: Sasha J.

description:
I got there mid-afternoon on a Friday and although the place and pier were absolutely packed with summer visitors, I was a seated quickly.

I had one standing order because I had been walking all day and it was hot - bring me a glass of ice water (lots of ice) and keep it full.  They did an exceptional job of re-hydrating me.

I ordered the fish and chips and although I instructed them to ditch the coleslaw when I ordered, it came with the food. Not a big deal. The food was good and was a good value as so many other tourist spots are so overpriced. (Like the $9.50 hotdog just down the pier)

The food portions were good and the service was top notch. My waiter even filled my water bottle with ice water for me when I left.
author: Chris D.

description: Super fun atmosphere right on pier 39. Definitely a great place if you're a people watcher like me. My boyfriend and I had a few beers and split the hot wings as a small snack before dinner. The wings and ranch were delicious. Our server was ridiculously fast and extremely nice.
author: Jordan C.

description:
We went to the Fisherman's wharf on Christmas eve and were looking for places to eat as it was getting late and were hungry...Most of the places were closed and this place had some decent options...so we went in..they said it would be 45min wait...so we put down our name and were waiting...

After more than 45 mins we saw that several tables were empty and the waiters were just standing there...so I went to them and mentioned that we have been waiting for a table..the waiters spoke amongst themselves and told me they will go check...we kept waiting but few groups who cane after us got called..so I went up again and asked and the waitress again said she will check...finally after waiting for almost an hour we got a table and we sat there for about 15mins before our waiter showed up...very hungry we ordered appetizers and entrees together...

We saw the table behind us get some appetizers before us even though they came later and we didnt even get drinks 30 mins after ordering... We asked the waitress she said she would go back and check..we asked her to at least get our appetizers......after 10mins she came back with our appetizers and she said she was waiting to brink all the orders together...we ordered nachos which apparently had been sitting there so we asked her to get us new ones...
After all this experience..though my burger and my wife's pizza and my friend's entrees were OK we left disappointed since we had to wait almost 2 hrs to eat something though the tables..the food and everything was ready....One possible break this place could get was that it was Christmas eve where everything is closed and the staff was tired...

Anyway go here on a non-busy day and u will enjoy the food and drinks..dont expect stellar service though :)
author: Sivaram V.

description: Not impressed with the food.  Basically same thing you could get an a chili's Or Applebee's. Wish I had not listened to the yelp reviews. They failed me this time.  If your from out of town your best bet would be to eat outside at one of the small vendors and try the lobster roll or clam chowder. Skip this place
author: Mayra C.

description:
Good place!  Came here after an Alcatraz tour.  We ordered several items, and these were the star ratings given by the people eating the food:

-Fish tacos + beans and rice:  3.5
-Steak and shrimp w/ coconut rice: 4.5
($17.95 seems a bit expensive, but the shrimp were the 31/35 per pound size, aka big = prawns) and the steak pieces were tender and good.  The coconut rice actually had shredded coconut in it.
-Kids cheeseburger and fries meal:  5
(Fries are the kind that have a "batter" on them = good)
-Kids hamburger and fries : 4

Service was fast and friendly.  We came here at 2pm on a Saturday.  Done with meal before 3pm.
author: rugbarn d.

description: For my visit to California this place helped add so much value to my day. The food came out fast and was really good. The drinks were outstanding!!!
author: Joshua R.

description: Got seated right away with a great view. Extremely good food and good pricing for sf. Food came very fast, almost too fast. Seemed fresh but we had our food within 10 minutes. Good atmosphere and nice waiter. Food was amazingly good
author: Connor P.

description: food not so good. but waiter was a champ about it. and sat us near cool view. however would not come back again.
author: Hana D.

description: I have been to SF many times and have always wanted to eat here.. and finally I ate here this past wknd and the drinks were delicious! I had a chz burg with an egg on it and it was amazing! The fish burrito was excellent and their milkshakes are yummy! Can't wait to eat here again! Great service!
author: Marissa L.

description: Enjoyed the California Burger. However Pepsi isn't an alternative to Coke, Coke is good, Pepsi isn't.
author: Danny D.

description: Food is good but they charge for health and insurance of the employees plus you have leave tip so they don't raise the prices on the food. And the price went up anyways since last time I went. All they want is your money.
author: Duno N.

description: I understand it's just a burger place, but the garlic fries are amaZing! They have a cool thong sign that I don't care how old I get I'll love and always look for. Haven't been here in almost 8 years... Took a road trip just to visit.
author: Viola M.

description: This is the worst place I have ever been to eat I absolutely hated it and so did the rest of my family and friends they messed up our order at least 3 times for me my brother and two of my cousins all we asked for was tacos and they kept messing it up finally when we got our food it tasted terrible the worst part was the meat was raw I suggest that you never go to this restaurant I know I won't
author: Lida A.

description: Appetizers were ok. Food came out pretty quickly. Our server didn't check on us after giving us our food. When we were done he came over and asked how it was. My six ounce glass of water had been empty for about 25 minutes at this point and the tiny piece of fish in the fish taco was all breading, which he acknowledged. No change to the bill though... which took 15 minutes to get. It's been 15 minutes and he still hasn't taken it back... kinda wished we waited the extra time to be seated at a better restaurant.
author: Danielle F.

description: Went to the Wharf for my birthday, and found this place on accident. There drinks are great. I order the nachos couldnt finish it. Overall great experience.
author: Heidi W.

description: Pretty good burgers and fries but I wouldn't rave about it. We also got the Shark Bite drink! It was really tasty. Kind of expensive for a burger though. Good atmosphere and I can't complain about the food.
author: Skylar H.

description:
The vibe and service was great

The food however was not. My family had the Baja fish tacos where the fish was lacking in flavor. Too much fried for our taste. My mother had the fish sandwich with the same problem. My brother had the fish burrito with the same problem. We're Spanish and we like our food seasoned so the rice and beans that came along with all the meals was just bad. The carne asada tacos were decent.
Overall the food was not worth the price at all. Even with understanding San Francisco's inflated prices.
author: Andre V.

description: This was a fun place to have lunch. Extremely busy during lunch hour and they have all your standard Fisherman's Wharf favorites such as clam chowder in a bread bowl, but with the added benefit of some Mexican dishes. A little overpriced but that was expected since it's San Francisco. They have one large co-ed bathroom which I thought was oh so progressive; So if that makes you uncomfortable in your private parts, then use the facilities elsewhere.
author: Angela A.

description:
Attended the Spring Wine Pour at Pier 39 and was waiting for someone to join our party. Spotted this restaurant as it is one of the first ones you see at the entrance to the pier. Decided to grab a drink with a friend while waiting.

Was greeted (or not) by an un-smiling hostess. Asked if there was some room at the bar for 2. There wasn't, so we were seated on the patio where at least we could watch the passerby. We were handed our menus and didn't get approached for another 15 minutes. Finally placed our order for 2 drinks and the Bacon Blue Cheese Fries. Asked to close out immediately after as we were sort of on a time crunch. Food and drinks took literally forever to come out. And each time the person bringing whatever over seemed confused or lost. With both the drinks and fries, the server walked by us, looked around with a puzzled look on his/her face, and then finally set down whatever they had at our table. Drinks were extremely watered down, tasted as if they put a teaspoon of alcohol in it. The french fries, however, were very good, as I had never had fries with blue cheese and I LOVE blue cheese. Also, despite the fact that we asked for the bill immediately after ordering, that took another 15 minutes to get to us. And then another 15 to receive the copies to sign. We were also not checked on once. Overall, fries were good, drinks were watery, and service was just a no. Will most likely never come back.
author: Genevieve M.

description: David at the Bar is a hoot! Had some beers and the garlic pizza bread. Was tasty but only if you LIKE garlic! The Restroom set up is TOTALLY weird. Co-Ed sinks with private restrooms and you enter through a circus big top tent.
author: Amy W.

description: On Pier 39 on Fishermans Wharf in SAN Francisco. We had breakfast here several times during our recent SAN Fran vacation. Their specialty is sourdough pancakes and WOW are they good!! Great sourdough flavor and a very tender pancake. Hubby had scrambled eggs and their own brand of hot sauce- which he liked enough to bring a bottle home to Iowa! The view looks right out to the ocean and the atmosphere is fun and beachy.
author: Diane B.

description:
The items I ordered sounded better on paper. I started off with the coconut fried shrimp. Too much coconut and the dipping sauce wasn't all that. Then I continued with buffalo wings. They were saucy and juicy-- the best part of my meal for sure. I finished my meal off with the the chorizo & chicken pizza. Both the meats and the pizza itself was really dry

Service was good; waitress kept the refills coming and was patient with our indecisive ordering, lol.
author: Phi N.

description: Food was good, but the service was absolutely terrible. Server only came by to take out drink/food order, and after that he didn't stop by to check up on us once. A girl server kept coming by to refill drinks and such, and at the end she dropped the tab off so we are unsure as to whether the initial male server who said he was going to take care of us was our server, or she was. Maybe it was a miscommunication, but either way neither server was very pleasant or friendly. Too bad.
author: Vivian A.

description: Atmosphere was average. Food was great. I'm not a fan of fish tacos, but the ones I ordered from here were AMAZING! You have to try them. Additionally, the garlic fries are pretty good. Prices are not too bad (considering that it's in the heart of a tourist area). I would go back.
author: Elvis G.

description: She ordered the pineapple teriyaki chicken and I had the cod sandwich. My sandwich was great, her chicken was rubbery. We asked for new one and the new sandwich arrived and was very good. Despite that service was good, food was good.
author: John G.

description:
Decent food. Nothing too special. 
The basic calamari and chips, fish and chips combos. 
Order to go on the side and you can get a nice size order of calamari and chips for $7.50. Which is a good price in an area where a hotdog could run you $5.50 plus tax. 
The calamari rings could use a squeeze of lemon to add some tang to them. But they were just ok. 
If you choose to dine in, the price doubles on the menu. Which is why we decided to just grab to go, eat in the designated area for to go food and head off to see the rest of the pier.
author: Linda C.

description:
Located in Pier 39, Wipe out is a quite busy bar&grill place however lines moves fast. We had a late lunch before our sailing tour. Menus arrived as soon as we sat down and the waitress took the order within the following minutes.

We ordered a clam chowder soup in a sour dough bread bowl and a salmon salad. The soup is really nice, you feel the sour dough taste of the bread. We ate the whole bowl with the salad :) Salad lacks dressing, salmon was a small piece, a bit overcooked. Being busy, I assume they pre-cook and reheat that should be the reason why.

Bathrooms are unisex but super clean. Considering the crowd, it is a good job.

Tables by the window have pier view.
author: Ceren A.

description: Great atmosphere. Good food. Got seated quick, food was delivered in a timely manner. It was busy, but probably typical of the area. Had the fish and chips. Good fish, breading wasn't the best I ever had, but the meal was good. Service was good. Definitely a place to tryout when down at the Piers.
author: Scott M.

description: Awesome spot. Bartenders super friendly, portable phone chargers available. Great spot. Highly recommend.
author: Tina E.

description: Fast friendly service with an upbeat vibe ! Drinks were topped off and strong ! Always a plush.
author: Luis Z.

description: The place is packed with people and waiters are rushing in and out. They served us Hawaiian pizza, garlic pizza bread, fish and chips, though I think their garlic fries were the best. The restrooms were so confusing! I saw a male coming out of the restrooms and there were no signs, so I just awkwardly stood outside the door! The waiters were nice to us. I must admit though, this place is quite pricey for dishes that are not particularly spectacular or unique. Nonetheless, it's a great place to eat while touring!
author: Sharon H.

description: We often stop in here. Food is always good, staff is always friendly. Nice bay views, fun vibe. Love the teriyaki salmon. Fun for the family. Kid friendly.
author: Kristin R.

description:
Worst calamari I've had in a long time, overcooked yet soggy inside (probably frozen) and completely bland. Even their sauce was extremely bland. 

Most people seemed to order nachos, so guessing it was the better choice.
author: Jeremy J.

description: Date night at wipeout bar and grill, had a great night! Our server Mercedes was really fast and friendly. As a local I don't head down to the pier much but was in the neighborhood and we really enjoyed ourselves. The servers here seemed to really have fun and it was nice to see. Thank you Mercedes! Oh and the drinks were excellent! Bartender (with glasses) well done! I will definitely bring my family when they come to town. Thanks all!
author: C N M.

description: Best fish tacos i have ever eaten, served with a pic De gallo that is so delicious. My husband got the California burger And he was very satisfied as well. It also has great service Jamie is an awesome friendly waitress.
author: Betzybebb G.

description:
We were looking for a place to just hang out and drink after doing some sightseeing at Fisherman's Wharf. We decided to just check out the bars near Pier 39 and Wipeout had a pretty nice outdoor seating area so we decided to check it out. When we found out there was a wait to grab a table outside, we just went inside since there wasn't a wait. 

We checked in with the host and told him we didn't need menus since we just planned on drinking. Then out of nowhere the host (some older Filipino guy) just went on a rant about how he has to give us menus if we want a table. He basically said this is how it works, you either take the menus or you don't get a table. Alright man, we'll take the menus...relax. He was speaking in such a condescending tone, almost like we offended him by suggesting we didn't need menus. I have no clue what this guy's deal was but he seriously needs to just chill out because his confrontational attitude totally killed the vibe. 

When we sat down at the table with the food menus we didn't need, not a single server even approached the table within the first 5-10 minutes. We were fed up and just decided to walk to the outdoor area and grab a few stools at the bar. For such a crappy bar, the drinks were expensive and pretty weak too. What a terrible combination. 

The only bright spot in the whole time we were here were the amazing garlic fries. I'm a garlic lover and even I was impressed by the amount they put in there. There would just be glorious mounds of garlic and butter that I would scoop up with the fries. Seriously some of the best garlic fries I've ever had. 

Overall, I wouldn't recommend coming to Wipeout. The rude host was such a turn off, and our laziness to find another bar was the only reason we stayed. The garlic fries were good, but even that couldn't salvage the rest of the experience. There's gotta be better places out there at Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Mike M.

description: Fast service and good food. Our server kept our drinks filled and even tracked me down some Parmesan cheese.
author: Phil B.

description:
I wanted to like wipeout. I really did. The atmosphere seemed promising. We had a small group - 4 adults and two children. 
The surface of our table smelled like it had been wiped with a mildewed, food covered rag. 
The condiments (ketchup AND mustard) were totally rancid. Water glasses had food remnants on the rims. Silverware was still dirty as well.
Service was incredibly slow. My children were never served their own drinks (that we ordered!) and we sat for 10 minutes after receiving our food for an employee to walk by for us to ask for silverware. 
Overall this place was a complete and total letdown. I am bewildered that this establishment has passed any health code inspections at all.we most certainly will NOT be returning.
author: Renee B.

description: Was disappointed with the bad service.  First, right after I ordered I changed my mind because I wasn't all that hungry. So I ordered, he went to the computer to put it in, and right after that i stopped him and asked to change it to something that sounded better. In response he said "Well I already put it in but I guess I could go tell them to change it". I was so confused at his rude response because it is not like the food was already made, it was literally just put in. Second, after dinner I paid with a $20 and was expecting around $3 back. Everyone at my table paid with card and got their receipt back with their card but i didn't get my change back so I sat there waiting to see if it was coming. I sat for about 5 min watching him to see and every time he looked at us he looked confused as to why we were still sitting there. I could not believe he just took my change expecting it to be part of his tip. I have never experienced a waiter taking the money expecting it to be theirs. It was late and i was angry and I didn't want to be a rude customer, so i just took the money back i had set on the table for tip and left. The only reason they get 2 stars is because the teriyaki chicken was good.
author: Ashley R.

description: Very very poor service. The only person that asked us about anything was the manager I'm assuming. She took our order after we asked. Nobody bothered to ask if everything was ok, or even if we needed refills. But now that i got the check,  i think i understand! It must be self service! It says on the check that service is not included,  my bad.
author: Mandy N.

description: Favorite burgers!! Really great the grilled cheese was awesome. Great service. Recommend from me and my husband and daughter. My daughter is very picky so if she liked it we know it's good!!!
author: Stacy W.

description: This place is the bomb. Extensive menu with lots of options for gluten free eating. Great atmosphere and it is right on the pier. We both ordered taco salads which were more than enough food! I had the steak option and she had the chicken option, both were superb! Natasha, our waitress was very knowledgeable and helpful and very nice. We also tried a few "Sex on Baker's Beach" drinks which are tasty and go down a little too well! We could see the pier and sea lions from our seats but without the overwhelming fish smell that you can catch on your way to the pier. We were in San Fran for only a few days and were careful with our restaurant choices, if you're in the same boat we highly recommend making it here at least once!
author: Aj L.

description:
The place was really was busy due to the fact it's on the pier. Customer service was good, our server was able to make a special change for my meal which was 2 tacos 1 fish and 1 shrimp and rice and beans.
The Shrimp taco was pretty good, the fish however was a little under seasoned, but the sauce it came with made it taste a bit more tasty. The rice and beans had a certain taste I couldn't quite put my taste buds on.
The Raspberry Tea was absolutely DELICIOUS! I should've ordered one to go. 

The calamari was on the tasty side as well, my colleague ordered the calamari and fries, the other had Salmon with veggies. 
I must admit that the veggies were cooked to the appropriate texture and seasoned delectably well!.

I would consider going back, but definitely ordering something different.
author: Takara U.

description: So was at the bar enjoying some drinks and he most unprofessional manager came up to her associate in front of a whole crowded bar (it was fleet week) and reprimanded her associate over when to take a break on the Sales floor. I honestly felt so embarrassed and be littled and I was not even the one being reprimanded. She continued to raise her voice and down talk the employee as he was not valued. Honestly if there was some kind of issue with the associates it should have been handled behind closed doors and not in front of the public.  This is common courtesy and when you are building a team and running a business there are things you do behind the scenes and not to deteriorate the ambiance of your customers experience with your business. This was just down right an embarrassment and hopefully this manager Megan can learn how to treat her associates with humility and respect. She will get more from her team building a culture of respect and letting them feel like they can be treated as equals vs some shitty employees.
author: Daisy O.

description: Not bad for a quick bite to eat while exploring the pier. Very busy and fast pace. It's hard to get a waiters attention being that it's super busy inside.  Good food and pretty views if you sit by the windows.
author: Risa V.

description:
Didn't have lunch here as I was full from my lunch fail on the warf.  
Restaurant was crowded so the food must be good here. Sat at the bar and we were quickly served. There is a pretty vast menu for food and beverages.
Enjoyable stop for a quick drink :)
author: Nicole Y.

description:
Mediocre, at best. My nephew and I were in SF for a weekend & stopped here for lunch before touring Alcatraz. He ordered the cheeseburger (he wished we just went to In 'n Out down the road, instead). I ordered the pineapple teriyaki chicken sandwich. The teriyaki sauce was too sweet & not flavorful. The chicken was cooked well, but only flavored by the pineapple slice, which was probably the only tasty part of the meal. We both had the fries, which tasted like they came right out of an Ore Ida bag. Gross.service was friendly and pretty quick, for this New Yorker's patience!

Definitely take a longer walk through Pier 39, to find someplace else, or take a walk to In 'n Out (if you're burger-bound & have the time).
author: Cynthia C.

description:
By far the slowest service in Pier 39!

First of all, I went to the wrong area because I thought that's where they seat you. How beer, everyone that passed me ignored me for 10 minutes. When a couple waited behind me, a waitress escorted them to where they should wait... WTF?

Second of all, when we tried paying for the check, our waitress literally took more than 20 minutes to get to our table.

The food as mediocre too.

I got the chili cheese dog with French fries and jalapeños on top of my hot dog. The coleslaw was flavorless and disgusting.
author: Aj C.

description:
Terrible service. Overpriced. Food was brought out cold and I know I mentioned that the service was terrible. Let me just reiterate. ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE SERVICE! 

Water was not brought out while waiting for our food. Not to mention the server forgot two of our orders for my niece and nephew. Mac and cheese was brought out cold. If it was cold why bring it out? It's common sense. 

This place deserves no stars.
author: Kalien S.

description: Ate here with a few friends on a Saturday at peak dinner rush. Dispite almost every other restaurant​ having a hour or two long wait this place only had a 15 minute wait. We didn't even end up waiting 15 minutes, it was more like 5. There are not many vegan options here (the veggie burger has eggs in it), but I made due with an order of sweet potato fries and a house salad. I also order a sex on the beach which was incredibly good (get the big size!). The sweet potato fries were yummy and the salad was alright, nothing to write home about though. I do wish there were more substantial vegan options. One of my friends got the fish and chips and loved them. All in all, this was a pretty nice place to sit down, have a drink and chow down.
author: Natalie B.

description: Love to visit the city at Christmas time, we decided to grab a bite to eat and stopped at Wipeout Bar & Grill...  So nice to be able to sit out on the patio and people watch with the heaters and fire pit to keep us warm.  Travis was a great server making sure we were all taken care of though he seemed like the only server that night, running around like crazy but he did an awesome job.  Food and drinks came out as ordered and we all left there full with happy bellies...  we'll definetly be back.
author: Catherine I.

description:
Fun looking, beach-themed restaurant on pier 39 with great patio seating that's perfect for enjoying people watching and the weather on a beautiful day.

We had great service, but the food itself was mediocre, at best.  Not awful, but certainly not as good as other options.  


I had the bbq chicken salad, with salmon instead of chicken.  The lettuce wasn't the freshest, the salmon was a decent sized piece but tasteless and there was no bbq sauce or zing to be found.  You know when you're pouring tons of Ranch on a salad and it's still blah, that it's just not a great salad.  :/

My son ordered the ahi tuna bowl.  He said the fish was decent, but the rest he refused to eat.

We did order onion rings and those were pretty yummy.

If you decide to come, know that it's for the vibe and outdoor patio and not the great food.
author: Lucky S.

description: I am a SF local who was in charge of planning a day trip for my mom and brother when they came into town. During our tourist day I reluctantly took them to Pier 39 for an early lunch. We wound up at Wipeout for a Bloody Mary and bite to eat. Honestly I didn't think I would enjoy it but I was pleasantly mistaken. Our server was fantastic, it was clean, the bloodys were great and the food was good. I would suggest trying the Thai salad, it was really good.
author: Brooke P.

description: Spontaneous trip to SF on a Wednesday! It was kind of late, so not that busy. The food was pretty yummy. I had the teriyaki chicken and it came with coconut rice. Good service, attentive waiter... Only thing I was disappointed about was the beer. I thought they had longboard pero no they didn't. I had some lager beer that did not appeal to my liking. So... Other than that, I liked it!
author: Deniece B.

description:
I was visiting for the weekend, and my wife and I decided to stop here for a late dinner. We got seated promptly but that is where the service ended.  Once we were seated, it took about 7 mins before the waitress arrived to take our order.  My wife had to actually flag her down. And that was the last time we saw her until we had to flag her down again to get our check.  It was close to closing, but it wasn't that busy.  There was a larger group that showed up after us that was seated next to us that recieved drink refills and had all their requests answered.  We would of been happy if just once our waitress would have even looked at us.  I did not leave a tip, and i felt bad leaving without giving one, but her service didn't warrant one.

The food was good but not enough to go back.
author: Alex C.

description: Visiting San Fran with the family and decided to stop here for some lunch. I got the Chicken Teriyaki bowl and it was delicious! Definitely would recommend. The meat was tender and everything else was packed with flavor. My husband got the Wipeout burger and it was pretty tasty too. We were pleased!
author: Sarah X.

description:
Hubby and I are locals and I was craving a burger. It was a hot and sunny day in SF so we decided to take a walk to grab a bite in the neighborhood. We stopped by the hard rock first but didn't want to pay 20 dollars for most likely a mediocre burger so we walked into the Wipeout instead. There was a crowd but we got seated fairly quickly. My husband and I both ordered burgers which were pleasantly good! My husband really enjoyed his. I can't remember exactly what he ordered though. I ordered the teriyaki one which sounded good however I didn't like it as much but it's  just a personal preference but I would definitely like to try another flavor. 

They also have a 96 health score which is fantastic ! Overall, decent prices, good quality food, attentive and friendly service, and a fun ambiance. We will definitely be back !
author: Nancy T.

description: I was craving Fish and Chips while showing my friends some of the touristy sights in the city and decided to come here as we were already at the pier. This place is a surf themed restaurant near the entrance to the wharf. We all decided to eat in as we had a coupon from the Biscoff coffee shop directly across from this place that gave us 20% off our entire bill. We had a group of 6 and it was busy on that Tuesday afternoon, so we had to split our group into 2 and 4 so we could be seated right away. Our server was nice but only came around to take our orders, deliver our orders and drop off the check. They forgot to give us enough utensils for everyone at table and we were unable to flag anyone down to request the utensils before everyone finished their meals. The fish with fresh and perfectly crispy without being too oily or heavy. The dish came with a small side of coleslaw. Overall it was pretty good but nothing amazing and a little overpriced (It was about $17 for an order of fish (3 pieces) and chips without the discount). I definitely could've gotten better fish and chips for a better price somewhere else.
author: Evelyn L.

description:
Great atmosphere for lunch and drinks by the water!  Music is great the people are awesome the food was super fast and delicious!

Some of the best calamari I've ever had!

5 stars next time I'm in SF I will be back!!!
author: James C.

description: Stopped here for breakfast while being down here. Food was great, prices good for the area, but service was terrible. Didn't see the waiter after we ordered until we got the bill. Never was asked if we needed anything else, went the entire meal without being able to get any water. Also had to wait 15 minutes after we were done eating just to ask for the bill. This would be understandable if the restaurant was busy but it was nearly empty at 930 in the morning on a Friday.
author: Drew C.

description: We got sits immediately here. Went here before we left San Francisco to get some clam chowder and shrimp. The food was ok, the sevice was rather fast , and the server was polite. Nothing special to say...
author: Adriana S.

description: We had dinner and it was a good experience with good service.  Beers were a little pricey but what do you expect in San Francisco.  I had the BBQ chicken salad and it was pretty good.  My wife had the BBQ ribs sampler that has 6 ribs which was plenty for her meal.  The ribs were good though and regretted not ordering that for myself.
author: Bruce C.

description: Restaurant wasn't very clean although we did go late at night on a Saturday. Food was less than average. I got the wipe out fried seafood platter and the fish better wasn't cooked all the way through. Our waiter visited our table hardly 3 times within the hour that we were here. My drink was good! However, with all of the option San Francisco has to offer I would not recommend this place. And definitely not worth the price. Oh and they're super slow.
author: Allison C.

description:
Sub par service and even worse food. We wanted to find a kid friendly place for picky eaters who were needing a break from pizza. Atmosphere was pretty much what you'd expect with a kitschy surf vibe. Menu was limited, pizza, Mexican, salads apps and bar food. 
We got chips and salsa as an app and the chips were all broken crumbs, so much so that we thought it was a surprise when we found a single whole chip. The drinks took forever to arrive and we thought we may have been forgotten about. Our waitress spilt a beer on our 6 year old and while apologetic, all we received was a 20% off from the manager, who should have came by himself. Kids got a hot dog and chicken strips. Hot dog was as cheap as it gets, chicken strips were over cooked and leathery. I got chicken tacos and the husband got a hamburger. My tacos were flavorless and my husbands hamburger was like gas station food. 
I would not recommend this place to traveling families.
author: Heidi B.

description: It was a beautiful day in SF & the awesome lunch we had at Wipeout topped off our trip. Our server Luis Q recommended the CA burger and it was delicious. Will def be back next time we're in the city!!
author: Rae G.

description: My food was excellent the ahi bowl but my husbands fish and chips were flavorless and greasy
author: Events i.

description: I was on Pier 39 on the night of the 19th to watch the tree lighting ceremony. We had dinner at Wipeout where our server Ralph was charming and totally likable. I also chatted up the manager Megan who seemed to know a lot about horses. She was hilarious.
author: Patrick G.

description: The servers are very friendly and inviting. The food was enough to get you full but quite over priced.
author: Jessica W.

description: I was in town for a tour and was looking for something to eat. The place looked good at first so my family and I decided to go in. The lady at the front (I believe it's Kiki) seemed very rude and snobby. We then were seated and waited for someone to get our drinks, we were there for 20 minutes and no one ever bothered to stop by. A lady with two daughters  sitting next to us was complaining about how their orders were burnt and missing. That was the last straw and took our business to Chowder's which is much friendlier and cheaper compared to Wipeout.
author: JohnTS 2.

description: This is a dump not a very good place to eat I had gotten the fired combo and it was left unfinished. The service was great and the food came out super fast which is a bad things in my book.
author: Brent C.

description: My family and I stopped by to eat here a few days ago and was blown away by the service that we got. Chrissy was the one who helped us out and she was so nice! I never had to ask for refills, boxes, or anything. She was very attentive. That was our first time eating there and will definitely be coming back :)
author: Jess G.

description: I had the BBQ burger and my wife had the hamburger. Both were cooked exactly as ordered. The fries were seasoned well and the beer was cold. Our service was prompt and very attentive.
author: Petey C.

description: Terrible service and bad attitude from everyone. My boyfriend and I waited more than 20 minutes and nobody came to our table. We decided to leave and complained with the Manager and she didn't care at all, she had a bad attitude and didn't apologize. Very disappointed. I do not recommend this place at all.
author: Laura S.

description: I got the barbecue burger, medium with no fried onions. Best and juiciest burger Ive had hands down. The sauce is super good, and the bun is very good too. The fries that come with it are crisp and flavorful. Lastly, the employees are so respectful and kind, very polite waitress. 10/10 Wipeout is my main destination for Pier 39
author: AJ W.

description: We had a large group of 17 people and the server was great.  The atmosphere is cool, food and drinks were good.  Price is comparable to most restaurants in the Pier 39 area.  Might go back.
author: Angelique R.

description:
Stopped in for a quick drink and lunch while at the peir. The dining room was festive and made for a good atmosphere for lunch. The outside view from our table was great also. 

We had fried pickles and a pepperoni pizza. 
The dipping sauce for the fried pickles was amazing! I ended up doing my pizza slices in it as well!!

Good vibes overall. Worth stopping in.
author: Tyler A.

description:
The food portions are gigantic, you will not go hungry. They have indoor and outdoor seating, as well as child menus and crayons! Our first waitress was sweet but our second, wilfred, seemed very negative and frustrated with us for no apparent reason. We didn't require or request special accommodation or anything?! It made us feel uncomfortable so I took off a star for that. 

It was surprisingly clean for the location and the food came fast. The ingredients were fresh, it is NOT bad overpriced grease soaked tourist food. The food is actually good. Comparable if not better than the Hard Rock on the pier! 

The novelty of the theme is fun, too. Overall we enjoyed our meal. We had grilled chicken tacos, which they charged extra for the chicken, that made no sense.... we had the nachos, too. They were enough to feed 6 people.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Very meh. Kind of like the McDonald's of seafood. Came here in a group of 5 around 9p on a Monday. We were seated promptly and had a nice, attentive waitress. I got the grilled salmon teriyaki bowl. Nice flavors but the salmon didn't taste fresh and half the salmon was raw. My sister got the calamari and clam chowder. The calamari was definitely frozen and came out of a bag. The clam chowder was nothing special. 
Probably won't come back.
author: Sunia C.

description: This place is a tourist fly trap....  I got suckered into this place and realized how crappy it was after I ate there poor excuse for a burger....the only good part of the meal was the ketchup..     stay away from this place..
author: Jason T.

description: Pizza was great, although the salad was brown and bitter and so being on the side of the water seems pretty ridiculous. The waiter already knew we were going to complain and took him a while to get to our table after serving us food. The manager was unpleasant when I told her she seemed as though she already knew and didn't really care.
author: Esmeralda C.

description:
The food was very bland. We were there to celebrate a birthday and the waitress said she'd bring out a birthday dessert... we got charged for it. (And it was not very good) 
Servers were friendly
author: Missy J.

description:
I came here on a Thursday evening and it wasn't packed at all. There's inside and outside seating (don't worry, there's heaters up above). When you walk in, make a left towards the entrance where a hostess can help you!

I ordered the BBQ Pork and my friend ordered the Chili Cheese Dog (see below). It comes with fries and coleslaw. The portions are decent and plenty to feel full afterwards! I really liked the texture of the BBQ Pork - tenderrr. The BBQ flavor was really yummy - not spicy or anything like that either. My friend enjoyed the chili cheese dog as well =]

I also came here and went to the bar. The bartenders are super nice and their drinks are priced normally which kind of surprised me since this place is on Pier 39. I would definitely come back here again to hang out since it is pretty spacious to eat with a large group of friends! I also really appreciate how their menu thoroughly points out what is in each of the entrees and drinks they have!
author: Nicole C.

description: I had the wipeout combo and it was pretty good. Can't complain about anything other than wasn't enough cod! They are huge pieces of cod but I just loved it too much
author: Aaliyah D.

description: Our waiter was very rude and impatient, at first we were just going to keep it to ourselves but we were upset. So we decided to talk to the manager David Jones and he was very helpful, attentive, and very kind. I would only eat there again if we get someone that is just as kind as he was!!!
author: Jazmine H.

description: Drinks are well made. Food is average at best, not too much flavor in the blend of ingredients. Wife asked for a well done burger and she got a rare burger instead. Service is good though.
author: Josh M.

description: We went last weekend and are thankful for their management who knew how to accommodate my son's dairy allergy. Food was great. Highly recommend the nachos.
author: Kiran K.

description: Visited the place over the weekend. We were going on an Alcatraz tour and arrived earlier to grab breakfast. We came across this place and they had a decent amount of guest. You can sit indoor or outdoor we decided for indoor. The server was very nice since the beginning and checked up on us multiple times. The prices are great, it's clean and tasty food. The potatoes were amazing we even asked for an additional side ! I must say I highly recommend them. I ordered a burrito and it had  great taste and they were not stingy with what was inside the burrito. The atmosphere is great and it does note at the bottom of the menu about the 5% charge. It was also great to see the manager helping out the team saw her passing out food. Overall a great experience and would recommend this place.
author: Elva N.

description: The food the drinks and the service was very good lay back relax kind of a server atmosphere feeling great music great customer service great food we really enjoyed ourselves definitely try the cocktails they're delicious
author: R B.

description: Great food and service!! Food was freaky fast and very good!  We had a party of 16 and everything was perfect!  Highly recommend the shrimp and steak bowl
author: Dayne K.

description: Suprised by this restaurant- great food good service. The carne asada tacos were excellent. Our server was friendly and the bathrooms were spotless- this restaurant is managed very well!
author: Christopher M.

description: Steak and shrimp bowl was very tasty with nice variety of vegetables and good coconut rice. Also enjoyed a large 23oz cocktail, which was reasonably priced.
author: Alissa J.

description: Waitstaff made a mistake, and compensated us for the hassle, which was unexpected but generous. However, the remaining food we ordered was lukewarm garbage. The entire table masticated with much displeasure, ending up in a very disappointed group of friends with especially light wallets (way overpriced)
author: D P.

description: Speedy service great food and friendly servers. We had a great experience and plan to go back before we leave
author: Rhonda V.

description: The food here is uninspired and bland. It was not worth the cost. It had, like, no real flavor to it.
author: Jackson S.

description: We had a great family meal.  My son left raving about the burger and fries.  That's a huge accomplishment because he's very picky.  Prices are reasonable considering the area.  The staff was also very accommodating the next morning when I realized I left my credit card with the bill!
author: Marc M.

description: Great drinks. Very busy on Saturday at lunch but only had to wait 10 minutes. Excellent pizza
author: Tuesday S.

description:
I'll admit it...I love SF, including the touristy places. For some SF residents this is a sin, but I don't care. I like the energy, the happy visitors, and the fun. I'm all about the hole-in-the-wall establishments, but I also enjoy the lively options at Pier 39, including this place. 

We ordered from the takeout window and sat at a table designated for this purpose. Our two dogs were with us and it was so nice to sit outside. 

Food:
-Clam chowder: not our favorite, but not bad. There was a decent amount of clams, but I wouldn't get this again. A little salty too.
-Fish, chicken, and beef tacos: these were SO GOOD. The fish was perfectly crispy. The beef and chicken were tender and flavorful. 

Ambiance:
-Sitting under the awning protected us from the breeze and it was nice to be outside, but away from the foot traffic. 

Service:
-They are so quick and friendly here!
author: Susan G.

description: Good place to eat, kind of pricey but everything is on the wharf. It's not great but not horrible easy, just an average place
author: Josh S.

description:
After walking up and down San Fran looking for night life we ended up back at Pier 39 and since it was the closest to the entrance- it won. Overall, it was ok-ay. Lots of specialty drinks options and all the ones we ordered were great. We didnt get food just chips and salsa and wings. Wings were pretty tasty! Chip and salsa- was chips and salsa.

Def not a place to check out if your are in san fran there are far better options

My only thing is it closes so early! Party pooper
author: Yanja B.

description:
Mexico meets California meets a tourist trap. It was, somewhat to my surprise, a very good experience. We were greeted and seated quickly. The hostess was great, seating us right where we requested. Our waitress was timely and very friendly. Clean bathrooms and clean tables. 

Be warned, it is very touristy. We came here for an early lunch before the fleet week show. 

We ordered the cheese quesadilla with fries and a salmon rice bowl. Both were yummy. 

My favorite part was the beverages. We both had Coke Zeros with special flavoring a. Mine was cherry vanilla. Yes!
author: David S.

description: Today my two friends and I had a late lunch at Wipeout, one of our favorite places to eat when we come to SF. It gets pretty busy over the weekend but had one of the best experiences because of our server Mendoza! He was so kind and attentive! Definitely made this experience memorable! Didn't even wait long for our food after we ordered and the food was great especially the fried calamari!
author: Nadia V.

description: Decided to play tourist today in San Francisco, even though we live here we rarely make it down to Pier 39. My 5lb yorkie named Willie and I decided to walk all the way from market street to Pier 39 by the time we got here we are both slightly famished (yay SF hills!). We noticed that wipeout had outdoor seating (I have dined here previously and have always had a good meal however being with the pup changes things a bit) we decided to give it a go-I've definitely learned that dog friendly restaurants are either a hit or miss - Wipeout nailed it! Our server Kimberly greeted us with a warm welcome and brought out water for Willie! I had the bread bowl salad combo- because who doesn't get clam chowder at Fisherman's Wharf?! Willie had a kids burger which was prepared puppy friendly without even having to request it! We both enjoyed our lunch and will definitely be visiting again. Thank you Wipeout and your kind staff for making Willies day out great!
author: Hevanya G.

description: I probably will never order a fish sandwich or burger here ever again! Of course it's apart of the attraction and it's reasonably priced for the pier but my whole entire bun fell apart or crumbled. Although the fish inside was crispy and moist and my garlic fries were amazing the bun on my sandwich and my moms burger was done from the start. Her patty also had no flavor... good luck!!
author: Siosiana L.

description: Great place at Pier 39. Great people watching. Sat at the bar and our bartender was great! I ate everything I could. New England Clam Chowder was great! Cheese Garlic Focaccia Bread...even better. My Bleu Cheese Bacon Burger, can't move...food coma.
author: Diana E.

description: I was absolutely blown away by the customer service I received here. My server, Haley, really turned our horrible holiday in the bay area into a beautiful one. We flew in, decided to check out a few restaurants on the pier, and decided upon Wipeout. My husband and I were delighted to be greeted by such a bright and dazzling smile from Haley. Usually I have no idea what to order, I take so long to even decide what I want to eat. I also had just recovered from a previous hiccup, I asked a previous restaurant if there were any traces of nuts in my pasta, and to my dismay...there were. I swelled up like a balloon and I've been traumatized for months. I look up at our server, and ask, "What's the best thing on this menu?" Haley answers and gives me a very thorough run down, warnings, about things on the menu that might trigger an allergic reaction, without me even asking! I felt very well taken care of. Keep up the good work, Haley. More restaurants should immediately warn a customer of something might be an allergy trigger.
author: Paloma C.

description: This place was great from the atmosphere to the food. They have an outside area to eat, ordered their fish burrito it was okay but the fish and chips was fantastic. The service was great waitress was awesome. Food was out pretty fast. I'd highly recommend if your out at pier 39.
author: Alicia P.

description: We specifically wanted chowder and it was raining. We went in here because of the large options of food for our big group. Food was ok. Nothing to call home about. I had the tuna bowl. The fish was so so but the coconut rice was great. I wouldn't come here on purpose again
author: Phillip B.

description: The food was what you would expect but the service was exceptional! It started out a little rocky as no one noticed our table but once they realized their mistake they went above and beyond to ensure we were taken care of.
author: Shelby T.

description: Wipeout is amazing!! Great good and Always have amazing service!!! Especially Ray one of the servers. He's an outstanding server that knows how to be polite and very attentive. Will definitely come back and recommend this place. Everyone request ray!!!:)
author: Maddie T.

description: The foods that we order was really good. The place was clean and crowded. I wasn't happy about the restroom because they took out the lady's and men restroom. The restroom is now combined both male and females. I was lost didn't know where to go..... The waitress was a male that gave us the total amount of our foods that we orders and he gave us military discount but it didn't show my statement of my bank instead $109.00 rather then $113.00 on my bill. I got ripped off from the waiter.
author: R R.

description:
Definitely a tourist spot but rightfully so. If you're sitting outside you get to do lots of people watching and if you're inside you get a great view of the water and boats. So, you win either way. 

We got a coupon from the Pier 39 fun pack that we obtained at the welcome center. Oh and did I mention that the coupon book was free with my Yelp checkin?! How awesome is that? Well, we used the coupon that gives you free garlic pizza bread with an entree purchase. The garlic pizza was made with fresh minced garlic and was delicious. We also ordered some yummy 23 oz cocktails to go with our meal. I wasn't too hungry so I got a bowl of the clam chowder and shared a little of my fiancé's teriyaki burger. The clam chowder had lots of chunks of clam in it which I thought was awesome. I had some the day before at another restaurant and I swear it was all potato and no clam. The bowl was very filling and only $1 more than a cup. You can also upgrade to a bread bowl for $3 more. 

My fiancé's teriyaki burger was very good.  Lots of gooey cheese, yummy grilled pineapple and perfectly cooked chicken. Good stuff. 

Yes though some might call this a tourist trap, I would say they actually did a great job! Oh and did I mention that service was great too? Our waitress was always wearing a smile, attentive and even answered our touristy questions. Thumbs up!!
author: Mo M.

description: Walking around Pier 39 looking for some food. Menu had a little bit of everything, so we stopped. Food was okay, nothing spectacular. They have a large selection of Margaritas but were not making them for some reason. Service was terrible. Too many other play as to waste your time here.
author: Jim G.

description: Mostly based on the service alone. Really quick and very friendly. We only had the burgers which are really good. Hubby recommends the Hawaiian burger. Check this place out.
author: Kimberly K.

description:
We made a quick late lunch stop and we obviously wanted some seafood. We got seated right away and they took our order promptly (we were starving). I had the Grilled Salmon Bowl and mom had the Coconut Shrimp & Small Chowder.
While we waited we enjoyed the free wifi (must give your e-mail) and funky decor.
The dishes were delicious and by the end we were more than satisfied! I highly recomend this place if you don't want to overspend and are in a rush.
author: Marla M.

description:
Must visit..
Its an awesome place with fire place and we got it.. Fish tacos are amazing.. Coconut shrimp is having good taste..
author: Anvitha Jyothi M.

description:
Great place to grab a bite and it wasn't too crowded either. Their food options are bar and grill type of foods. I had the chicken teriyaki bowl and it was delicious. This plate was packed with flavor and their coconut rice was scrumptious! 

The place has a surfer/90s feel to it and the tunes are pumping!  A very chill place to hang out. They also have TVs so that you can watch the games. 

Service was pretty good too!
author: Nasha W.

description:
Stopped here tonight for a quick light meal. My wife and I each got a salad. She got a house salad with Chicken. I got the taco salad today with beef. We both had pieces of bone and/or cartilage in our salads. So gross! 

Kids each for a meal and they were not very happy with it either. We were hoping for better quality in such a high profile touristy area.
author: Chuck L.

description: Came here a few more times after my review. I still like the food, but I realized that the service can be a hit or miss. I had some really great servers who were nice and attentive, but there were mainly some that disappeared and didn't bother to be nice. Probably saw my last server twice. I will continue to stop by. Overall, 3 stars for service, 4.7-ish for food.
author: D C.

description: Wilfredo was our server and I highly recommend him. Very attentive and willing to help with general questions about the area despite how busy the restaurant was. Food was good too but the service (for our server at least) was top notch! They even have charging stations too. Just ask your server :)
author: Frankie C.

description:
Worst restaurant I've even been to. Overpriced tourist trap with horrible service. After we were seated, we were abandoned for 15 minutes before we flagged a waitress down for some water. Which then took another 5 minutes to appear. She rattled off some line about there being "confusion from a shift change" but considering she never bothered to return to our table after we ordered I highly doubt that story. 

It cost $9 for a Budweiser, and the burger, which I ordered as medium rare, could almost be called well-done. My girlfriend ordered the Salmon BLT, which she proceeded to get sick from that evening. 

After that wonderful food experience, we were ignored again until a completely different waiter came by who we begged to take our plates and give us our check. Honestly has to be the most all-around terrible restaurant experience I've had in my life. 

Also, don't sit outside or you'll get harassed by the aggressive pigeons on the pier.
author: Ali A.

description: Reasonable prices and great food. Our server was very attentive and had a great attitude. Overall wonderful experience. The tacos were so good! If you go to wipeout, make sure to ask for Roman.
author: Nancy G.

description:
Ok... We're to start ! 
December 26th 2015 (today) knowing it will be supper packed everywhere we decide to go to the Pier. 
Got to this place and we put our name on the waiting list... 30 min... Cool .. We waited ... Finally our name was called out. We got eats at the fire pit.. Okay... (I forgot to mention there was 7 of us with a baby) and only 4 chairs around... Okkkaaayyyyy??? Any ways we were willing to work with this... At this point we start to move to get our seats and the lady looks at me and said " oo I'm sorry you can't have any strollers outside" are you serious !!! We clearly told them ! And waited 40 minutes and did not even have enough chairs to sit on... Forget it!!! We left ! I'm a sf native and I will be sure to tell people to never come here ! I am beyond upset with this place !
author: Leslie R.

description: They have average food but their location is very desirable - they located right on the wharf in popular tourist area.  It's an easy walk from most of the touristy type hotels.  The staff was very nice.
author: Annie H.

description:
When I told one of my favorite people from work that my husband and I were headed to California for a multi-stop journey, he insisted that we go to Wipeout for margaritas and good pub food.  With such a strong recommendation, I bookmarked it on Yelp so we could fuel up before our trip to Alcatraz, since it was right near the pier we would be leaving from.

Overall, I enjoyed lunch and the surf-themed atmosphere.  I had a delicious steak Mexisalad,  and made sure we got a picture next to the statue of a surfer to show that we really went to Wipeout and had a good time.  This is certainly one of the better options at Fisherman's Wharf from what I could tell, and I would return if in that area.
author: Caroline B.

description: We love this place good drinks and great food. People are so nice and attentive here they make sure they take care of u !!! If u are a local or a tourist you must try this place it won't disappoint the wait time will be worth it!!!! Thank you Christina and Renzo great bartenders
author: Melgoza T.

description: I ordered a Hawaiian burger with no onions and for it to be cooked well done .when i got my food the burger had onions so i told the server he took it back they took out the onions gave it back to me i cut the burger in half and its cooked rear wow ! I canceled my order. Happy thanks giving to them to.
author: Saia F.

description: Yezz folkz another Kool vibe here...Garlic fries and a cold one on point...Coconut Shirmp and a Bacon Cheese Burger hit the spot. When at Pier 39 hang ten your thirst and hunger at WIPE OUT BAR & GRILL ya diigg!!
author: Jesse C.

description: Thanks to Meme and company for helping us recover from our own wipeout. Great drinks, such friendly service, respectful of disabled individuals, overall fun and positive vibe.
author: Faith C.

description:
Since Pier 39 is a huge tourist infested area, the wait for a table was about 30 minutes. That's totally understandable since it was a crowded day on the pier and we had a group of 10.
