Everybody ordered their food; we were all really excited to eat and extremely hungry. I ordered the California Burger (guacamole, bacon, and jack cheese), my friends ordered clam chowder, the Hawaiian burger, salmon BLT, a regular burger, and fish and chips. 

It all went wrong when every single person at the table got their food, but me. I obviously was pretty angry because well, everybody finished most of their food and my food STILL wasn't out. My friend asked the workers if my food was coming out yet, but they just said they would "check on it." After 5 minutes, my food still wasn't coming out while people who came in after me got their food first... ok?? My food was obviously forgotten and the workers were obviously ignoring our table. 5 minutes later, my food FINALLY came out after a 20 minute wait. Oh, and the waiter also forgot my friend's order of French fries, did he not write ANY of the orders down, or...????

My burger was mediocre, tasted like a burger. There was nothing special about it, even though the price for it was pretty expensive.

When the check came out, the waiter said he took my burger off the check. I felt bad for being angry, so I gave him a nice tip. But there was a problem with the check, and he ended up charging my friend's credit card twice... Which pretty much made me angry again because I gave him a good tip for being a lousy waiter. I didn't expect amazing service, but I expected at least decent service.
author: Julie N.

description:
I have never had to ask for water 5 times. Even McDonalds does better. 

I have never had to eat a plate that was handed to a stranger because the server was dyslexic and couldn't tell the difference between table 231 and table 213. 

I have never had to ask for a margarita to be remade because a pidgin took a crap into it. 

And for that lovely experience, the meal cost $90. 

Not going to return.
author: R S.

description: Went here with some friends at about 9:30pm last Friday night. This place was busy but not packed, and service was fast. We got some clam chowder (of course!) and some beers, and everything was out right away. A little overpriced, but that's to be expected at the pier. I'd love to try something else on the menu because everything looked good, but it's tough to pass up the chowder when you're only in SF for the night!
author: Jess M.

description:
I had the Wipeout Fried Combo- it was massive and superb! My friend had a Veggie burger which was bland though. Their fries are really good though! and I was told that their most ordered dishes include burgers and the Wipeout Fried Combo, and fish tacos. I'll definitely try a burger next time I go there :)

The service is pretty good, waiters/waitresses pretty nice and helpful!
author: Lara T.

description: Came in to get chili in a bread bowl and have a drink. We sat down and Lourdes was our waitress. She was extremely honest and patient with us. We ended up ordering a hamburger and teriyaki chicken sandwich over the bread bowl and have no regrets! Lourdes was fantastic! Made this experience for a couple of vacationers a memorable one!
author: Amanda S.

description: Super cheesy looks, super touristy, but omg the chili cheese fries were amazing! Try to get a window seat so you can see the sea lions!
author: Brittany B.

description: Went Sat night after spending evening strolling Pier 39, enjoying awesome weather! Ordered Veg Burger, BBQ Chicken Pizza, Coconut Shrimp& Chips, Grilled Salmon Bowl. We were very hungry and directly ordered these, skipping starters. The portions were good size. I couldbarely finish my burger ( after stuffing all the fries). Salmon was fresh n nicely grilled. Service was good and the lady was updating us on our order ETA and didnt take more than 15min to arrive.
author: Tara P.

description:
We ordered:
Hamburger w/ cheese
Chicken tenders
Grilled salmon and rice bowl
The food was mediocre.  The hamburger was ok. The salmon was good. The rice was mushy. It was one of the first places we saw on pier 39 and if you haven't eaten since breakfast and now it's 7:00 p.m., it'll do. We got seated in about 15 minutes. Once we got our food, it was difficult to get any service. We had to walk up to the waiter to get the bill. Lots of outdoor seating, of course, but make sure you're wearing a jacket in the evenings because it's really cold and there are no heat lamps. If there is another restaurant that you are considering, try that one instead.
author: Judy H.

description: Worse service at the bar I have ever received. Bar tender refused to leave his name. Description: short small blonde guy with brown ball necklace and matching bracelet was hands down the rudest, most unprofessional bar tender I have ever experienced from every place I traveled. Server# 1097 should track him down. To be in a place like pier 39 where tourist travel and locals still may go, you think a place as big as wipeout  would have s better staff at the bar. Sitting with trash and an empty drink and o didn't even get acknowleded until it was time to pay. Save your money and go upstairs to fog excellent service and well worth everything. Stay away form wipeout unless you love to shout out Everytime you need something.
author: Christopher B.

description:
It was a nice day to enjoy the SF weather so we decided to visit Pier 39. This place is packed so we decided to try it...we were seated outside dining. It was great except for the birds fly around and just crap anytime they want! 
we had garlic bread (good), fried calamari (ehhhh...it was a big squid ring and i'm not a fan of it), and fish & chips (it was good...we even substitute the regular fries to garlic fries) and of course we had root beer float! 
overall, it's an okay food.
author: CJ B.

description:
for an outdoor beach/surf-themed restaurant in a high-traffic touristy area, Wipeout is actually a reliable place for a meal. I don't think it's a destination but we were checking out Fisherman's Wharf before hitting up Alcatraz, and it was recommended by a coworker of my wife.

bucking the bar menu theme for once, I actually got a teriyaki chicken shame bowl. filling, tasty, and the grilled pineapple was a great touch.

service was friendly and the prices were surprisingly fair. I guess as a cynical New Yorker, I was not expecting that. also, if you save your receipt you get a discount at the coffee place across the walkway - of course, I threw out my receipt before realizing this.
author: Mike B.

description: It's a nice place if you are going to eat inside. The food it's good. I would give 4 star if the staff was more friendly and well trained, but they aren't.
author: Kleiton S.

description: Happened to find ourselves on Pier 39 and decided to grab dinner here. Crowded and Touristy, but we tried it anyhow. The service was good and I ordered the Skirt Steak. It had great flavor but was also the toughest piece of meat I've had in a long time, like trying to eat my flip flop tough. Wifey had the Teriyaki Chicken Bowl that was very good. The Garlic Fries were good. Not a bad place, but doubtful we'll be back.
author: Karl S.

description:
Family of 5 from Los Angeles:
 This is our 3rd time here and every time it's been absolutely amazing.  The food is great and the service is just right, my son says the pizza here is the best in the world!! Trust me he knows his pizza's! Anyway we highly recommend wipeout grill to everyone, make sure you ask to have "Angel" as your server, he really goes the extra mile. 
GO DODGERS!
author: Hector H.

description: We were here on a Sunday night. Food is reasonably priced for being on a budget I got the tacos. Server was a bit slow getting to take our order. After that, he was attentive and fast. I'd come here again. Food came out fast.
author: Laura K.

description: My teenage girls wanted to try a local place and were attracted to the theme. The atmosphere was fun, the view amazing, the burgers were TRULY cooked to order perfectly, and the calamari was tender and not over breaded.... coconut shrimp was amazing too and the fries were perfect! Service was friendly and efficient... refilling drinks regularly too. Definitely worth a visit!! Francisco and David were fun! Wish we lived closer so we could come back soon!!!!
author: Sandra L.

description:
I had an interesting experience here. Good vibes and a fun time down at the pier. Total cost of our food was 55$ for an app and 2 entrees. Waitress was nice and the beer was good. Overall I recommend it to anyone who loves beachy tones.
4/5
author: Michael N.

description: In Pier 39, this is one of the busier restaurant around. since I came here alone, I got a seat right away at the bar. Decent seafood with great portions and fair prices. I sat at the bar and was served promptly and was even able to get a coaster charger to charge up my phone. Food came promptly and my water was refilled regularly. If you go to the visitor's center on the second level at pier 39, you can get a 15% off coupon for this place.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
Great place to eat and relax!! The food is good, drinks are even better! 
I'm mainly writing this review for Josh, our server. 
He was so awesome, attentive & went the extra mile to help my grandmother! We brought my grandma here, to get out & go sight seeing. Unfortunately she can only eat non chunky soup. So we ordered her clam chowder & asked if it was possible to get the more creamy part of the soup. 
He made it happen! He drained some of the chunks out & mashed some potatoes in. 
Thank you for making our experience, especially my grandmas, so great!
author: Jenay L T.

description: Convenient location. However when we went, our server could really use customer service training. We ordered drinks and she asked for ID, so my friend and I were trying to take our ID's out and she exclaimed, oh just her, pointing to my friend. I mean REALLY? Do you really have to embarass me and on my freakin birthday too?? To be honest, I almost lost my appetite. She could've just go on with it but she kept saying "Just her."
author: Sophia L.

description: I had been here before while visiting Pier 39, it touristy and expensive for what you get. With that in mind today it was just right, I was in the area (I'm not an SF native) and I didn't want to pay for parking... I knew they validated and the lot was across the street. Even at 8:30 on Thursday the ambiance was good, lots of people but not crowded. There was no wait but I sat in the bar anyway since it was just me. I got a Stella and some fish and chips, everything was cooked right and tasty. All in all, I was in and out in 30 mins, and the service was great and food was good. Giving them 4 stars for overall experience, food alone would be 3 stars.
author: James M.

description:
Worst service ever! Ordered a BBQ Pulled Pork  sandwich and  asked the cashier to upgrade the fries in my meal to chill cheese fries...  

Not only did I have to wait for 20 min in a "To-Go" window, I had to ask my fries (which came as regular fries). 

Waited and  over-payed for a below average tasting food...
author: Adrián C.

description: Horrible service. If I could give no stars I would. They forgot my food after asking them over and over. My salmon boy finally came when my party was done eating. The served blamed each other. The manager apologized and gave me my salmon for free but then immediately after another server angrily came and told us she was handed our table. As a San Francisco native... I am appalled at this service because if I got this kind of service how are tourists getting treated. Never coming back here again.
author: Maggie G.

description: This is the second time I have visited the restaurant. We had a group of 13 and the service could not have been better. Their menu varies from seafood, to pizza and more traditional American options. Their fish tacos are among the best I have had. The margaritas are excellent. And their outdoor seating is wonderful on a warm San Francisco day if you don't mind the passing crowds.
author: Tim S.

description: Great place to get a real size burger and fries and watch the Warriors game. I wish I got my server's name. He was awesome and very attentive. Got me anything I asked; refills, water, napkins, toothpicks, change, and more food. Seating was very prompt. You can see the bay though the Windows. My boyfriend loved the experience and we will definitely be back to eat again. I love all the signs posted at the Resturant. The staff is very honest and friendly. It's all about location and thus Resturant is in the best spot.
author: Anh V.

description: Wait was not bad... not a bad seat In The house - tasty down to the dessert! Apple tart yum yum
author: Carla T.

description: Wipe Out San Francisco  pier 39. The best bar/restaurant  to visit while visiting. While there request  Jay the best bartender. Absolutely  the best . Not to mention the management.  Dave the General manager. And the floor manager  Kiki. Totally  the best crew . Recently  they have added a new crew at the bar Brooks and a gorgeous  lady named Sam. I visit from  Sacramento  at  least twice a year just to visit what I consider  long time friends.
author: Johnny M.

description:
This place is perfect for a late night dinner. That's exactly what we did on a Sunday night. The patio is heated for chilly nights, the decor is pleasant. The prices are very good for the portion sizes. I got the fish burrito and ended up taking half of it home. My friends got ribs (delicious) and coconut shrimp. We also ordered chicken nachos. They came out burnt the first time but the manager dropped new ones off and took it off our bill. 
Over all we were satisfied with our food.
author: Amelia L.

description:
Wipeout Bar and Grill is always packed so it was time for us to give it a try.  Even though the place was packed we were seated right away back in the back by the windows.  Our waitress was very nice and friendly and the service was fast and good!

I had the Fish and Chips w/fries and coleslaw and hubby had Wipeout Fried Combo - Fried Fish, Calamari and Coconut Shrimp w/fries and coleslaw.  The food was very fresh, good and hot!  The fish was big, golden fried and crunchy!  The fries were fresh and hot and the coleslaw was good with a little bit of crunch, not mushy.

We had a very good experience and will definitely be back on our next trip to San Francisco!
author: Vikki J.

description: Cold beers with some friends, awesome location, great service, and decent food. What else do you need from a bar?
author: Brian E.

description: Ordered from the to-go area. Definitely waited more than 10 minutes for my calamari and chips platter. The calamari was mediocre. Seasoning was alright. There was a lot of breading around the squid, but the squid was not scare. There was a hefty bite of squid in each piece and they did not go easy on the fries. Overall a decent amount of food for the price you pay (~$7) at a tourist location.
author: Courtney D.

description:
Wow. I think the only reason I gave this place a star was because of its prime location on Pier 39. The service was friendly but extremely slow. I mean, I waited so long for her to take my payment that I contemplated walking up. 

First things first, the food. I got fish tacos. I'm in San Francisco on the water. What better place to eat fish? The menu said fresh Alaskan cod. The waitress said they're great so I get them. It comes deep fried in these awkward oblong shapes. I don't do fried fish. Fresh does not equal fried. Specify that in the menu. Also this shit looked like it came straight out of a freezer bag and dumped into a deep fryer. To me it was inedible. I didn't eat it. I tried my rice and beans-- I bit down onto what was raw crunchy rice mixed in with cooked. Can you imagine eating this? It was actually painful. I pushed my plate away and tried my daughters food. A teriyaki chicken bowl with rice and veggies. To my surprise her kids meal was better than mine, and a great portion so it was enough for us to share and be satisfied. If you're in pier 39 and looking for a place to grab a bite, keep walking. Or stop in for a drink on their patio cause that looked fun and it overlooks the water.
author: Darin T.

description:
This review has nothing to do with the food. We did not eat there except chips and salsa. This review is for the service, prices and atmosphere. 
My boyfriend and I are here from Austin, Texas. We have been In San Francisco for 4 days and this is by far the best service we got. Especially at Pier 39. 
This is one of the few places on the Pier that has more than just seafood to offer (I looked at the menu) and the music has songs everyone can enjoy. It's a good mix. 

We sat at the bar just for drinks. Jay was the bartender and he was amazing. Legit. Friendly. Attentive. Talkative. All around awesome. If your sitting at the bar you want Jay to be your bartender and if your Jay's boss reading this you want to give him the best schedule possible because guests will not be disappointed. 

Like I said. Can't say anything on the food since we didn't eat but I wish we didn't wait till our last day of the trip to try this place. 

Thanks again Jay!
author: Amanda R.

description: Seemes like a decent place from the outside. Decor simiar to a Wahoos. Don't get anything fried, like the fish and chips.  Mostly breading and the fish inside was more chewy than flakey. A bit disappointing. Will probably try another place on the Pier next time.
author: Charlie Y.

description: Worst experience ever. Took us 30 minutes to get our drinks, when our food got there it was extremely disappointing. When we asked the bartender about our drinks (because our waiter couldn't be found), he talked to the manager who just gave us a 10% on our drinks, and after that our waiter wouldn't even look at our table. Service was terrible, food was mediocre, everything was over priced.
author: Ricky P.

description:
Located at the Pier 39 tourist trap...we met up with a couple of people we met on the ship....a cool little place to grab a drink and people watch.  The prices were fair for the location.

Server/Bartender was great...... 

I would stop again.
author: Sharon N.

description: Nothing too amazing about this place. Just your typical overpriced, decent at best eatery. A tourist trap to get you to spend top dollar on mediocre food. I wouldn't highly suggest or recommend this place.
author: Marcus A.

description: The name says it all, needs to be wiped out off the pier, disappointed in food, only thing that made it bearable was our server angel he made sure our drinks were full an checked on us frequently while bouncing around his tables, not worth the $102.00 I spent
author: William A.

description: You know this place is just like every other frozen french frie burger joint.. The food is is ok its like that second class version of In and out. Its better than a chain. Dont bring the family seating is better in side .. Out side the birds will pooh on you.. And the fire pit is actually a place to sit for guest like a table... Not for waiting...
author: Seaera T.

description: My family and I came up to SF for the day on Saturday to enjoy Memorial Day weekend. We had two small children with us and my mother so we wanted a place that accommodated everyone. We chose wipeout. While we had to wait like 30 minutes for a table (it was real busy and our kids were hungry) the service was fantastic. The hosts were friendly and attentive. The server seemed unbothered by how busy she was and the manager (Megan?) even came by and said hi. She helped us with directions and even recommended some fun things to do with our kids next time we are up. All in all we had a nice experience and will definitely be back.  Only thing I would recommend is maybe putting the prices on the beer menu. We were a little surprised by how much the beers cost. But I mean it is pier 39 after all.
author: Christine E.

description:
Considering where this restaurant is located, I didn't have high expectations for it at all. I feel restaurants located in prime tourist locations don't appeal to the actual "foodies", but the out-of-towners instead. They don't need to. Their business is built on location vs. food quality and this restaurant is no exception to that. 

It's true what they say about the service. You almost have to stand on top of your table to get anyone to notice/help you. I ordered their fish and chips, but sub'd the "chips" for their garlic fries instead. I'd give it a 3 out of 5. The fish was a little on the bland side and the fries could've used more garlic. Their onion rings, however! Those were awesome and would likely be the reason why I'd ever want to dine here again.
author: Lainey C.

description: I did not expect to have as good of a time as I did. It was great. The food was good, not bad not amazing, but the service was flawless. Nora was incredibly nice, fully entertaining and we kind of wished she would've been sitting at our table instead of serving us because she had so many wonderful tips for our stay in San Francisco.
author: Joe S.

description:
Great place great staff & great food 
The location is perfect right in the heart of everything

I had the bacon cheeseburger and a cocktail called a Shark Bite a definite must 

Great place all around
author: Brad S.

description: Ordered wings and a blue vodka drink. Long wait. Good service. Good food overall but not to 'die' for.
author: Jaz M.

description:
My best friend and I decided on Wipe Out to start my birthday celebration Food was ok...definitely nothing special. My friend got an appetizer, and I got the Teriyaki Chicken Bowl...chicken was cold, the whole dish seemed like it was a TV dinner that was reheated. Definitely will not order again.... We were mostly interested in the drinks and we were very happy with them. Service was EXTREMELY slow, our waitress gave us time to think about what we wanted but we really didn't need the full 35 minutes it took her to come back... also she admitted she forgot about us....we were also overcharged for some random "salsa" charge...and she seemed annoyed when I brought up that we had no salsa.....and that i did not want to pay for it.

The next thing we found super strange was the bathroom situation!!! its a unisex bathroom with a super awkward layout...there were paper towels and water all over the counters/floor and guys and girls waiting in line together was very strange and my friend and I felt super uncomfortable along with the other woman standing next to me who was fixing her makeup.. So overall, do not expect exceptional seafood or service, just enjoy the drinks! I got the Corona-Rita and loved it!
author: R B.

description: My friends and I had a great experience at this restaurant. The drinks were great and the food was amazing, and had an amazing time talking with Zach. It's great to see a manager so engaged with his customers and to see he takes real pride in making sure people are happy and enjoying their time while at his restaurant. He deserves a raise!
author: Fillionaire H.

description: Good burgers and beer selection ! Seems like a low key place good for families and kids.
author: Shannon B.

description:
The food was very good. 
Try the cheesy bread appetizer. Awesome!
Service was good as well. 
Not crazy spending like so many places near the piers. 
Sat outside, enjoyed a beer and watching folks walk by. 
Cool facility.
author: Ed B.

description: I was not impressed over priced and food was less then amazing.  I asked the waiter if clam chowder was fresh and home made ... all I know is is was bland not very creamy and thick I think I put like 1/4 cup of hot sauce in it to make it bearable to eat.  Definitely could tell the Clamato was frozen if you are on a pier please sell fresh sea food ... not impressed
author: Nora D.

description:
Just had lunch there.. the teriyaki chicken bowl was awesome!!  So good. 
Also very good service too.  
The bathroom is unique.. coed sink area with locking private coed stalls.
author: Anna R.

description: Waited 25 mins at the "wipe out to go" for my burger. Drank my soda in that time and they refused to give me a refill citing they'd "be in trouble" and refused.
author: Deanna D.

description: Came here yesterday with my boyfriend and two of our friends and we were pretty pleased ! (: It was a Saturday at Pier 39 during lunch hour which is a very busy time, place, AND day ! We were told it would take 25 minutes to get seated and we were actually sat within about 15 minutes or so which was very nice. The customer service was very friendly and fast for being such a busy time and place ! (: The food was GREAT ! I ordered the Baja Fish Tacos, my boyfriend ordered the Hot Wings with Fries, and our friends got the Chicken Teriyaki Sandwich w/ Pineapple and the BBQ Burger with Jalapeño and we were all VERY pleased with our meals ! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who plans on visiting this area ! (:
author: Nyomi M.

description: If you ever come on the weekends make sure to ask to sit in Raquel's section . She is an AWESOME waitress. She's always making sure everything is okay and that you've got everything you need. Had a great attitude and it seemed like she really enjoyed working here. OUTSTANDING experience and I will definitely come back again. Thank you so much Raquel!
author: Mark A.

description: Awesome service from Wilfredo. Clam chowder and Baja fish tacos were great. Definitely will be back the next time we are at Pier 39. See what I did there... :)
author: Tim N.

description:
My family and I ended up going to Wipeout Bar and Grill on June 16th, around 1:30-2:00 pm or so. We would have done the to-Go option right next door, however there was no place for our party of 6 to sit outdoors.

Me: Chili Bowl with Cheese and Onions on the Side + water
Guest 1: Cheeseburger + soda
Guest 2: Hamburger + soda
Guest 3: Chili Cheese Fries + soda
Guest 4: Chili Bowl no sides + water
Guest 5: Calamari & Fries + water

Total: 100 some odd bucks (GEEZ!)

The chili bowls were okay, nothing special but better than diner chili in my opinion. I would order it again if I was craving it. Guest 4 didn't enjoy it so much, and only ended up eating the bread bowl. Guest 1 said the cheeseburger was fine, not bad. Guest 2 said the same thing. Guest 3 didn't think there was enough cheese on the fries. All who ate fries thought that they were too oily, and leeched a puddle of oil on the plate. And guest 5 thought his calamari wasn't very good, rubbery with a bouncy ball like texture. I later found out that this person also got food poisoning from the calamari. That sucks.

SERVICE IS VERY POOR. You will have to hunt someone down for anything. It took me a good 20 minutes to get one person to tell our waiter that we needed a refill.

Breakdown:

Service: 1/5
Food: 2/5
Cost: 2/5
Overall Value of Visit: 2/5

if I go again then it'll be the to-go option. Chili bowl only. Then again, this is not as bad as the Italian option near the end of the pier. With touristy SF, pick your battles.

Italian review here: http://www.yelp.com/biz/luigis-pizzeria-san-francisco-2?hrid=48RxlcCQawq49Lm_x_Vmyg&utm_campaign=www_review_share_popup&utm_medium=copy_link&utm_source=(direct)

Note: All photos were taken mid-dining experience. I forgot to take pictures because I was so hungry! :)
author: Nik B.

description: The worst service ever. Monday night, place wasn't busy at all and we literally waited 15 minutes before we left due  to sucky servers. The host was too busy watching the warrior game before informing anyone that we needed service. The waiter grabbed plates and refills for another party before asking to take down our drinks. Love the pier but this restaurant does not deserve to be in a great location like that.
author: Dianna M.

description: The California Burger, medium-rear was fulfilling; I was actually impressed, I thought it'd be a basic tasting burger but it was pretty good.
author: Stacy O.

description: Located at the entrance of Pier 39 in front of Boudin.  The food was good and the ambiance was pretty laid-back.  We went on a Saturday so it was pretty busy.  Although the food was good, it wasn't anything out of the ordinary.  The service was good.
author: Cris H.

description: I had lunch at Wipeout Bar and Grill and I had fantastic service! My waitress Gabby was very hospitable. She kindly came to my table and introduced herself and took my order. I ordered the Salmon BLT with garlic fries and it was delicious! Thank you Gabby for the great service and great food!
author: Katherine R.

description:
I was in SF on vacation and happened to walk by this place. The atmosphere is great. 

I had the coconut shrimp and chips. MUST GET!! They are amazing! Full of flavor and the dipping sauce they are paired with is perfection! 

My boyfriend had the fish and chips they were also very good! They have a great selection of beers. They serve large portions of food! 

They also have a part in the restaurant for all TO GO orders. 

SERVICE: I wish there was a 10 star rating! Our server ANGEL was just fabulous!! He was very attentive and friendly! He has a great sense of humor made my boyfriend and I laugh every time he came to check up on us. Which I LOVED! :-)
author: Lizbeth C.

description: It has good food  kinda pricey but I guess all the Pier 39 places are.
author: Annie Z.

description:
The food here is pretty good here, the menu is large with something for everyone on it. The weekends here are crazy & the place is jam packed sometimes which can make getting seated, ordering & waiting a huge pain.

The servers are always friendly & knowledgeable, and happy to substitute items, but the food can come out pretty slow at times, so beware if you're coming here when you're starving to death!
author: Denise F.

description:
Ordered 2 Carne Asada and 1 fish taco...was not the traditional way I was expecting, but they were ok.  

The seating was way faster than the 20 minute wait time given; the atmosphere was great and had a pretty good view.  Our server seemed less than enthusiastic, but was nice lol.
author: N B.

description: Completely lied about gluten free menu my girlfriend had a terrible reaction to her allergy. Good for drinks and nothing else
author: Ryan B.

description: Excellent nachos...enough for 2. Children's menu salmon was delish according to our 12 year old. The California burger was great as well. Very cute decor. Service was slow but very kind and accommodating. Drinks were very expensive.
author: Carrie J.

description:
Late-Post : Hello Yelpers, today's stop was at "The Wipeout" located on Pier 39 in the heart of San Francisco. As we entered the establishment were seated right away and offered menus. There Menu consists of Burgers, Salads, Pasta and down to Fish and Chips which included a little of seafood given thats its along the pier. I had ordered the Fish Chips as well we ordered an appetizer of calamari to start off with. It didn't take long for us to receive the appetizer which was a plus but for our drinks it took them awhile as we didn't get what we had asked. There calamari was a very tasty, batter was crunchy and served hot. When I had received my main entre, it was served in large portion. 3 Pieces of fishes and a large portion of fries at the bottom including cole slaw on the side to balance your palette. And so simple meal turned out to very good. I can't say much about the drink being served off.. given that there food was very good.. So again .. Wipeout is a nich place to eat while out at the pier 39... off to the next stop....


Next.. Be ready.. I could be YELPING!!!
author: The-Reviewer T.

description:
We went here to watch the Syracuse game. Its a nice place and the service is really friendly however there were some small issues. 

The Nachos were good, the Taquitos were good, the fish and chips were good but the burger wasn't that good and the turkey club wasn't that good either. The waiter didn't make the order right and we had to remove items from the turkey club before eating it. 

Other than that its a good place and I would definitely go again but maybe try something different on the menu.

The price is a little more than expected for the food we got. It came to $108.00 for 4 people for 2 turkey clubs, nachos, A hamburger, fish and chips, 1 corona and 3 ice teas.
author: Jesse P.

description: This place is highly recommended.  Not only is it cheaper than surrounding restaurants, not only does it have neat outdoor seating, not only was the service great and we were a party of six that was seated inside of a minute in the middle of the day.  But the food was a cut above as well.  I recommend the pulled pork bbq sandwich.  One of the best I've ever had!    Don't be fooled be the surf theme.  This is excellent dining
author: Jason G.

description:
Best service ever.  Wyatt  knows exactly what we want! 
 Best waiter ever. You will have a great time at pier 39 eating at wipeout
author: roxana g.

description:
We had to find a place to get a validation for Pier 39 Garage. So we happen to go to this place because this place is the first place that you see when you enter the Pier 39. You need to spend $15 in order to get a validation. So we ordered Clam Chowder with bread bowl and Garlic Pizza Bread which was perfectly $15. 

Their service was so so because they have a lot people working but it is really hard to call someone for help. JUST A FRIENDLY REMINDER, when the waitresses sat you close to the windows or close to the bathroom, don't sit there. IT STINKS! 

Also, the worst and the funniest thing is that when the check was given and put the cash, the waitress asked if I needed change when the change was over $5. I don't think I would give $5 tip for eating $15. So I hope they don't do that... People leave the full cash, if they want to give the change as a tip. But if a customer waits on a table to get a change that means they want the change! OK?
author: Alice C.

description: The Waterfront Pier 39 is beautiful with tons of options for lunch...we chose the Wipeout Bar and Grill.... nice place has indoor and outdoor seating , we chose outdoor as the afternoon was very pleasant.  Service is good beer is cold.... We went with the garlic fries appetizer and I must say it was simply fantastic. Would certainly do them again great little twist on a standard plate of french fries. Portions are large staff is very friendly.....absolutely a good bang for your buck. Great little spot for a quick bite to eat.
author: David B.

description: The drinks are tasty but overpriced. The veggie burger was strange. The fries are great! Service was great from everyone who wasn't my server...?
author: Lindsay A.

description:
RIPPED OFF      RIPPED OFF.
           WARNING! WARNING! WARNING
Horrible customer service, there's a Latina skinny girl super bitter and unhappy with her jod she's so rude an stupid asking me for my receipt after I just paid in front of her. I said I throw it away trash, she said well go look for it I need it. WTF! She needed proof for my VALIDATION who is this stupid or disrespectful she knows who I'm talking about.  IF YOU'RE NOT HAPPY WORKING THERE WELL QUIT. 
I saw her explaining to her manager  with details who knows what lia did she said. Both were laughing with about the incident. 

1 horrible service
2 food disgusting
3 food very expensive nothing unique or good everything is so greasy.
4 BEER IS OKAY
5 45 minutes for just cooking simple frozen food WTF 
WARNING! WARNING! WARNING! WARNING! 
NOT RECOMMENDED AT ALL FOR NOBODY SUCKS EVERYTHING SUCKS HERE.
author: Denish G.

description: Husband and I liked it.  I got the clam chowder and he got fish and chips.  Very yummy, way too much food.  The beer was good and wait staff friendly.  Only minor problem was we were seated for quit awhile before we were waited on, but the waitress apologized and was on top of everything after that.
author: Amber B.

description:
Great location on Pier 39 and if you are lucky enough you can score a table outside and partake in some great people watching. 

This place is usually pretty busy and has lots of servers running around checking on people in a fast manner.  Our server was friendly but you could tell she was very rushed so the service felt a little rushed too.

They make a great mai tai in a large glass that is about $12 which is really pricey (especially when you spill it like I did right when I got it and get charged for another one). UGH!  

The fish tacos were pretty good.  We asked them to split it but we got one large plate and had to ask for another plate to split the meal.  They were crunchy and pretty good but the rushed service only warrants 3 stars from me.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Stay far away. Food was really bad. Really bad. Four of us ate here - four of us did not like or finish our meals. Cold soggy fries, Cold pizza. Fish N Chips cold and tough. I'm not trying to be a jerk but save your money.
author: Captain G.

description: One of my usual spot whenever I visit Pier 39. This place crowded as usual, but the wait time is less than 10 minute maximum. Large space for group dining, has a outside patio if you want people to see you eat, well-put-  feels like I'm a tourist though I'm not actually one. Staffs are friendly, whatever you ask for something they actually give u enough portion instead of other places that are cheap to give you just a little enough so you'll stay quite. Food were good, I love their drinks so refreshing. This place is not to expense and a place where you can chill with your family, friends or anyone you like to bring, it's a causal layout restaurant.
author: Hye L.

description:
I love the ambiance. This is a great place to go if you're looking for a good burger and fries without having to pay too much in its famous, touristy Pier 39 location. 

I got the chicken sandwich which was cooked with teriyaki sauce and included a slice of pineapple (in addition to onions, tomatoes, and lettuce on the side of the plate) with fries. It was a unique blend of flavors that I wasn't expecting, so I probably wouldn't recommend it or try it again, but it wasn't bad. The drinks here are good though, and the location is very convenient.
author: Bianca G.

description: Food was delicious! Service was great! Waitress didn't even need to write our 6 orders down. Awesome!
author: Chrisropher C.

description: Great service and nice patio station. We sat down for a tea and lava cake desert. Nice experience over the bay. Food was good: calamari and fish chips. Not fancy bites, but they were delicious. If you like outside sitting, then definitely check this place out.
author: Julia S.

description: Pricy but really nice staff. Got seated right away and food came quick. Very family friendly place.
author: Bernice H.

description:
I came here for lunch after a whale watching tour. 
1 star for good service; 1 star for the ok food; and 1 star for the touristy food. The service was great. But if you want to get a drink the size is 16 oz! I just wanted to have a little taste of one of their sodas but when they brought my soda out it was huge! The food was ok it wasn't horrible but not great.
author: Tatum M.

description:
Service was friendly and fast 

Restaurant was clean and tidy 

I had the Chili dog and it was disgusting ! The only thing decent was the Nathan's Hot dog . Didn't use chili but some version you find at a gas station and cheese was fake and gross

My kid had Mac and Cheese and it was largely disappointing , guys use Kraft or Annie's vs making your own crap

The Turkey club wife had was great- full of flavor and meat 

I would save your money and stay away
author: Gerald A.

description: Yummy fast service. My favorite lunch spot with the kids at Pier 39. Nice staff and good selection of food for everyone. Orly thing that would be nice would be the option of fruit instead of fries as a side, but we'll live :)
author: E F.

description:
For a tourist trap, this place was actually okay. Nachos to share for our appetiser, which were fairly well loaded. I had the chipotle pasta, which was nice and spicy. I'd have it again. 

The waitress spilled some of the food from one of our parties' burgers (bacon and crispy onions) and she came back with more bacon. The burger itself was quite dry. 

As its a tourist trap, the bill was pretty expensive (they charge $9 for a glass of Bud Light!!) so maybe lay off the beer unless you want a huge bill!
author: Lynne K.

description:
This is a typical American restaurant, but the draw is the location at Pier 39.  I prefer to eat at little kitschy, local spots, and this place isn't like that at all.  It feels like an American chain, but it's ok. 

It's one of the first places you'll see on the left, as you enter the busy part of Pier 39.  Keep walking and you'll find some higher quality food at Pier 39, but if you're not super adventurous with your palate, Wipeout will work for you.  The menu is large, and there's pretty much something there for everyone.
author: Tara J.

description:
what i ordered... fried calamari, fish and chips

THE WORST fried calamari to date even if it was fresh off the fryer................. hard, day old bread tasting batter and the squid was a bit fishy and rubbbbbbbbbbbbbbbery.

Beer battered fish was good and flaky but was so bland......... it was the first time i had to use salt on one.  
fries was typical and thin

ambiance... good (lot's of monitors showing the local sports and the outside seating is excellent for watching tourist)
service... good (host's were smily and waiter's as well though they're a bit short on follow ups (but it was busy during my visit))
cost.... $+ (fair)
author: Gors P.

description:
OK... First off... Food was good and service was pretty good ( although very bad about personal space) but
My friend and I got extremely sick after we ate there... Stomach cramps...sharp pains in body... Nausea ...throwing up and diarrhea. Made the rest of are trip not as enjoyable. Food poisoning ? Idk but def not right . we ordered wipe out burger and chicken pasta. Do just be careful
Also food was expensive . 4 people came to 120.00.
author: Randi F.

description: This place had a cute atmosphere and staff were friendly. The food was ok nothing really stood out for us but it was good enough. Good location and good for families
author: Cindy S.

description: What a great place!! Went to the aquarium and on the back of the ticket stub was a 15% discount to 3 restaurants Wipeout Bar & Grill being 1 of them. Took a chance and it wasn't the bit disappointing by far!! Great staff and AMAZING!! FOOD.
author: Anna F.

description: This tourist area restaurant is very family friendly. There is a wide variety of food styles and choices on the menu. We tried some of their local drafts as well as dinner. Although our lagers we're good, they were more like IPA's. My steak and shrimp bowl was excellent. My husband's fish and chips was good, but we've had better. Service was fast and the place was very clean.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Came to Pier 39 on a beautiful sunny day. My boyfriend and I first walked by this place and were intrigued by the way it looked. I loved that 6-pack beer carriers were the holders for condiments! So creative! So there's a to-go window and an actual restaurant seating area, as well as a bar. There is inside and outside seating. Follow the signs if you want to reserve your seat at the restaurant! We finally saw the host and they said it would be 5 minutes for 2 people. We preferred outside seating. Right next to the hostess area are knick knacks for tourists, such as magnets, heats, shirts, etc. We then got seated right away and looked at the menu. The tables outside are picnic like tables that are pretty sturdy and clean from what I saw for our table.

Now, we both really wanted fish and chips and we know for a fact you can get it better somewhere else, such as the stands at Fisherman Wharf, but those go for about the same price as everywhere else at the pier due to the high amount of tourists that come through! 

Our waiter was really nice and prompt as we were both ready to order right away. I ordered a tall Anchor IPA and Fish and Chips($13). My boyfriend ordered the Wipeout Combo that included fish, calamari and coconut shrimp($15.95) and fries (or "chips," lol). Our food came out quick and crispy! My boyfriend and I really liked our food. If you're into Malt Vinegar for your fish, you have to ask the waiter because they don't leave it in the condiment container at your table. Our total came out to around $45, a little pricey, but understandable because we were at the Pier. I really liked our server because she wasn't rushing us out as I was still finishing my beer, super chill! I wish I could remember her name! Anyways, I plan to come back if it's another sunny day.
author: Veronica A.

description:
I was really disappointed with how terrible the service was. The server was awfully rude to me. Considering he only showed up to take our order and bring the check, it's impressive really that he even had time to be rude. Even when they brought the wrong side item for one of the kids, he didn't check on why we only had three out of four plates for more than half our meal. He also never came to get my credit card for the check. Over 20 minutes after he dropped off the check (with three restless kids and our to-go containers all packed), I had to literally stop another server to get them to take my money. Not even standing at the register was enough to get anyone's attention. I guess I should have walked out, but I'm not that kind of person. All in all, there's so many places around that, even if you're starving, there's plenty of better options. 

TL;DR don't waste your time.
author: Melissa S.

description: Okay, so I have a couple of extreme allergies and am terrified of eating at restaurants because of them. As I ordered my food at this place that promised GLUTEN FREE options, I was still hesitant- I have gone into anaphylaxis because of my wheat allergy in spite of the dishes being advertised as GF. For whatever reason, I was being served by the manager instead of a standard waitperson, and she (was her name Megan?) noticed that all of the items we were ordering were GF. How do I know? Because I didn't realize that the items I had ordered were not automatically gluten free, but gluten free BY REQUEST. Her observant ability to detect my needs and prompt me by asking "I noticed all of your order items are from our gluten free options, would you like me to make everything GF?" could have saved my life. More than likely, I would have gone back to her three minutes later and made sure I had mentioned my allergy, but that isn't the point. If that isn't 5 star service, I don't know what is!
author: Heather C.

description: I was a bit nervous at first. The To Go order line is a cute vw van facade. I placed the order because their price was half of that of their neighbors. It was hot and fresh very quickly! Fried to a perfect golden brown, flaky and tender. A great deal!
author: Cass B.

description: We were seated right away on a busy Friday night. We ordered the nachos---a huge portion and they were great! We also ordered a personal pizza, fish tacos, and steak tacos. All were great! The place was clean, staff was friendly, service was quick, and I believe a manager was walking around also double checking on us which was nice to see. I would definitely come back again!
author: Tori D.

description: Wipeout (aka Bay Scum). I don't usually write reviews but my horrible experience here has led me to write my first one. I'm convinced the cooks wiped their balls on the food. I wouldn't even feed my dog this food. It sucks that this was my first eating experience in San Fran. Better luck next time!
author: Nick W.

description:
40 minutes after we ordered still waiting for our food while watching other people eating their food oh yeah I forgot to mention that they came way after us. 
Finally when I got our waiter attention to ask him how much longer he had the clueless look on his face. 
He went to check than came back with 8 more minutes. 
What I think is that he forgot to put the order on all together. 
Guess what 10 minutes later still no food so we did the only thing that we could do is walk out which the waiter saw us doing explained to him why we are doing it and still had the same stupid look on. No apology. 
Bottom line he didn't care. 
Should have a zero star option
author: RIMA A.

description: OVERALL AMAZING! The waiter we first had was okay. You could tell he was kind of new so we weren't too hard on him. Then, after a while, the manager took care of us and he was the most friendly, upbeat guy I've ever met. He really takes the time to get to know his customers and make you feel so comfortable. I had my dog with me and he even took the time to suggest what would even be good for him. lol. He was very informative and helpful. My whole family came to love him by the end of our meal. The food was amazing! I ordered the Chipotle Chicken Penne, best pasta I've ever had. I would recommend this to everyone for any occasion. Bring your dog! But if you do, you'll have to sit outside.
author: Tiffany G.

description: Great outdoor seating but it does fill up fast.   Got the fish sandwich and it was delicious.  Their Margaritas come blended or on the rocks.  Great assortment of drinks.  Definitely would recommend to anyone looking to eat on pier 39
author: Chelsea P.

description:
We were walking around Pier 39 and just happened to walk into this place. 

It's pretty cool on the theme all beach stuff, surfers full wipeout hangout. Which makes sense because of the location. 

I got the fish and chips. They were beer battered with a side of fries and pineapple slaw. The fish that came on the meal were def fresh (obviously) but they were actually huge fillets. 

It's a fun place to hangout at the bars nice and it's a great open layout that's right there on the pier with an open deck. 

Only downside to it was it is extremely packed. The server we started off with wasn't there after she took our orders so managers and other people would come if we needed something but it was a huge issue just trying to get someone over there. We were there for over and hour and only received one refill.
author: James B.

description:
First time trying. Last time going. The food was decent. There are no complains coming from the food. However, there are plenty of complains on the waiter. The one star I'm leaving is for the horrible customer service my family and I received. We were a family of 10 and four of us wanted our own checks. Our waiter, Wilfredo, complained vocally by his constant irritated sighs. It's not something new that we've all done in a restaurant. Whenever there's been a group of us, we've always had separate checks and it has never been an issue. We told him on more than two occasions that there was going to be separate accounts so why he sounded irritated was unexplainable to us. Another complaint we had of his service is he then did not ask us for refills nor how our food tasted. He was happily attending consistently the two tables by us, so it seemed as if he was ignoring us. We had to ask him over to our table and ask for refills, which then he snidely remarked that one of our drinks was not a free refill. We knew this already before asking him for a refill but the tone he used was inappropriate. Then when we received our checks, we used our 15% off coupon from the aquarium and he got more irritated and told us he could only allow 1 for the entire table--it says nothing on the coupon that there is a limit per table. We had all gone to the Aquarium, so we each had our separate coupon. He later came back and gave us the 15% off, but it seemed as if a coworker or supervisor had to direct him how to do it.
It seems as if this server was new, and if he isn't I would like the manager to at least consider retraining him. My family and I aren't from San Francisco and had little time in our hands. We somewhat regret not asking for the manager when we were there, but we had little time to enjoy our time in the Bay and we also didn't want it to ruin our evening. This occurred about 10 hours ago and we've all had time to calm down and think back on the experience. We all still agree the service was horrible and will more than likely not return.
Again, food was great, but the service (at least from one individual) needs improvement.
author: Andrea A.

description: I had a very bad experience here, after long tired day me and my wife went there to had lunch as it was already busy we waited for 40min to get our turn and we got seated. To take order they took 25 mins and after taking order they took literally 45 mins just for pizza and burrito. Service is too bad and food is not up to mark as pizza and burrito both were cold when they got from kitchen. We returned back the dishes and they again took 30mins to make new and those were too very bad in taste. Never going again.
author: Murali K.

description:
This place is alright. My girlfriend and I sat at the bar. She ordered the taco salad and I ordered the fried fish sandwich. We ordered beer and a piña colada as well. 

The beer was cold. The piña colada was good. The service was pretty good. If you want to drink go here. 

The food was average at best. The fish was greaser than I would expect. The taco salad had too much cabbage. An option of onion rings instead of fries would be nice. Fresh avocado would be great. No sour cream on the salad? Weird. 

There was a roach. The manager was alerted. He said he would take care of it.
author: Chris F.

description: One of my favorite spots 2 eat at Pier 39. The food was delicious and highly recommend ordering the tacos.
author: Michael N.

description: Great burgers!!!  Seriously!  And I'm not that big a burger eater!!  Waitress was awesome, location can't be beat and restaurnt was fantastic!  Happy happy customer!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
You cannot control how crowded it gets at Pier 39, so our wait time was 15 minutes. 
We did not whine when it took our server half an hour to get to us since we were a large party of eight and it was during lunch.

However, the food was absolutely bland and flavorless! The beer battered fish had great texture and consistency, but lacked FLAVOR.

The cook forgot to give me marinara sauce for my calamari, and when I asked the server for sauce, he returned twenty minutes later with hot pizza sauce! 
Our drinks were not refilled on a timely basis and our server looked uninterested in helping us. 

Do yourself a favor and don't eat here. 

BTW: You'll get charged an extra fee to pay for the employees healthcare.
author: Gigi M.

description:
Tourist trap experienced by a local. I would give it minus 5 if I could. Went with a tourist friend and noticed that they don't tell you about any extra charges for substitues
Salad for fries because of allergies (shellfish in same fryer) if drinks are refill or not. When you order a drink they get you the largest size not regular and don't tell you that. Once you get the check when you mention it to the waiter he was extremely rude to my friend, said "I dont know where you are from but thats how it is here in San Francisco restaurants"  which is when I stepped in and said I was a local and they should have mentioned all the extra charges on my bill. He said he was sorry and he was going to fix it but instead just charged my check dropped it off running and left. When I mentiond it to the lady at the front desk she was somewhat polite said they were sorry and that in SF they charge for drinks( refills) everywhere and substitute for salad instead of fries. This is just bad, I feel bad for all other amazing restaurants in the city that are not like that at all. Our city maybe expensive but not as unreasonable as they made it sound. I love food and can't stand places that don't value customer and the citys love.
author: T B.

description:
Friendly service.  Bartender needs lessons!

Best thing about this place was the outdoor seating and people watching while munching on good eats.

Free WiFi. Interesting yet fun decor.  Great location on pier 39.
author: Hope M.

description:
AVOID AVOID AVOID.... We have attempted this place multiple times and always get the same result. I cant say anything about the food since we are never able to order any.  My husband and I always prefer to sit a the bar top, our number one reasoning is because the service is usually much faster and friendly.  Unfortunately that has NEVER been the case.
I figured the first time we were there, the bartenders may have been new or just having an off day.....but when the send time we were there and the bar top was empty and we were treated the same way I know not to give it a third try.  We were ignored for 10-15 minutes while the bartenders were closing out checks (must have been busy before we got there) so I was a little more understanding that we may have to wait. But then when I saw them throwing straws at each other, laughing and goofing around, instead of either clearing off the several dirty plates or at least greeting us we got up and left. 
when there are SO MANY GREAT places in the city, don't bother wasting your time here!!!!
author: Marie S.

description: Me and my friends got a table for 9, service was very good, thanks luis! Food was unreal we got a mix of pasta, pizza and burgers! The burgers were so good and very good price for portion given! Will definitely be back!
author: Laureen G.

description:
This is a really cute place. The customer service here is stellar. On a busy day, my party of 8 was seated within 10 minutes. Our waiter was great and super attentive.

Unfortunately, the food wasn't all that great. I sampled a bit of everything we ordered. The cheesy bread appetizer (that currently comes free with check-in) was good, as was the coconut shrimp plate and clam chowder. All good, not anything to rave about.

The Hawaii 5-0 pizza has a doughy crust and really basic ingredients. My son liked it but the doughy crust just wasn't my thing. I ordered the fish & chips and did not finish the fish because it was terribly bland. The waiter was great at comping us for these issues. I love how he was quick to make the situation right.

I got a free birthday dessert of a lava cake and ice cream! That was awesome!

Oh...and the bathroom is unisex. It was odd at first but really no bit deal since each bathroom stall is very private.

Overall I would say that the food is not the best but is reasonably priced based on the location and the plate size. They also have a good variety especially for those who aren't that into seafood. 

3 stars because the food is not the best but they are still a solid restaurant.
author: Cristina P.

description:
Hey all.

I usually don't review bars and grill type places as I find they all generally offer the standard bar type foods and environment. 

But I had a change in heart and decided to review Wipeout on Pier 39 Fisherman's Wharf. Place was lively and colorful. Right in the heart of the Pier 39 shopping area. 

We decided to sit at the outside section especially if you are into people watching. The service was great and fast. 

I ordered the Fish and Chips which included an amble serving of Alaskan Cod lightly battered in beer. My rating was 8 our of 10. The fries are great if you into them.

Also ordered was the Hawaiian Burger, which was good but the underwhelmed bun was overwhelmed by the sauce resulting in a soggy affair. 

Cheers.
author: George L.

description: I have been here twice and both times the food, staff and facility were on point! This will def be the place I always come back to! :)
author: Tricia B.

description:
I loved the margaritas here , hella good tasty and delicious. 
I had a veggie burger too, it was really good. 
I'll be back again and again.
The bathrooms are unique an different. 
I dig it
author: Luke S.

description:
Awesome location and atmosphere. Nailed the vibe I was looking for on the Pier.

Food was good, what I was expecting for price. Everything tastes great.

Server was friendly and always smiling. He was rather busy, and felt like he was stretched out to much, but he nailed it for what he could do.
author: Matt L.

description: Walked past this place and Pier 39 and knew I had to stop in to eat. I am a sucker for "surf" and "beach" themed eateries. Lucky for me, this one did not disappoint! Started off with a Mai Tai, which was just what I needed on my search for a tropical blended drink. For an entree, I ordered the Salmon BLT. The salmon was cooked perfectly and the sandwich was pretty good! Granted, this wasn't some 5 star seafood restaurant, but I was definitely impressed. And, our server was a pretty awesome dude. I can't think of his name, but he was very nice and made it a point to make conversation with us. He asked us where we were from and kept purposely saying "Illinois" wrong. It was pretty hilarious, you should've been there. I would totally return.
author: Heather J.

description:
This food was decent enough, nothing spectacular. But it's definitely a fun place to hang out, right on Pier 39 with a divey feel. Had the CHICKEN TERIYAKI SANDWICH, which wasn't as tasty as I hoped, since it had a pineapple, but it was alright. COCONUT SHRIMP was better, crunchy on the outside, chewy on the inside. I would suggest not ordering any fun cocktails because it didn't taste like any real fruit was used in mine, very artificial flavor. 

I hate to give this place such a bland review :(
The atmosphere really redeemed it though!
author: Sarah D.

description: This place is amazing.  Our group of four from Roseville CA. Often visit San Francisco and when we do, Wipe Out bar and grill is a mandatory stop. The food is great along with the service. The bar is terrific.  I highly recommend this place for food and drink.
author: Johnny M.

description: Worst experience of my life. Super unprofessional. As soon as we sat down, our waitress disappeared so the manager came to take down our order. We had two different waiters bring us our drinks and food. No one came by and asked us how we were doing. We asked for our check and every item was on one check when we wanted separate checks. I went up to one of the waitresses to see if she can split it for us and she just walked away. I stopped one of the waiters to see if he can split it for us, he took back the check and asked another waiter to come see us. He told us to mark the items we ordered separately. He took back the check and came back with separate checks. We waited forever to get service, to get our food, to get our checks and we were ignored. None of the waiters/waitresses wanted to help us. The manager herself was no where to be found. The overall experience was horrible. Would not recommended.
author: Richard C.

description: great, quick breakfast and a friendly staff. come here if you have a hangover and need that remedy!
author: Matthew M.

description: Awful experience all around here. We went to the "Wipeout To Go" and the pizza we ordered was awful tasting and was not fresh. The customer service was very hard to understand and wrote our order down wrong a few times. We then asked if we could get the chicken tacos without the chipotle sauce on the top and they said they couldn't do that. All in all there are better restaurants all around the pier that are actually worth your money.  Also, the prices are outrageous ( $6/slice of pepperoni pizza & $5 for a small street taco)
author: Deven K.

description:
I came here twice during my stay in the Bay Area, both times to get a drink only at 
the bar. I can only comment on that and not the food. 

Sure, Wipeout Bar is located in a very high traffic tourist area of the city (Pier 39), but it's fun to go there and people watch. Both times I went I went early evening (maybe 5pm) and was able to find a seat right away at the bar. I ordered a Blue Moon on tap both times. Small is about $7, large about $10 (before tip). You can't go wrong with this order, so I was satisfied with my drink and had a decent time people watching. 

First time I came in the bartender was really happy and appeared to really enjoy her job -- or at least she was really good at faking it. Second time I came in the bartender was nice enough, but he seemed like he just wanted to go home. They honestly didn't change my opinion of the the place, just wish the second person was more happy. 

I would come back here again for drinks when I'm in the area. Not sure if I'd have food here, but drinks was good for me and excellent people watching.

Cheers!
author: Michelle M.

description: We always have a great time at Wipeout, but Brian H. made it especially great this time! Brian was very attentive, smiled and was positive the whole time, and was really knowledgeable about the menu as he was easily able to answer all of our questions. We have all been in the service industry at some point or another and Brian H. is what great service looks like! Thank you Brian and thank you wipeout for another great time!
author: Melanie S.

description: They seemed really busy but they were still able to help us out on a timely manner. However, my food was cold when it arrived to our table but they apologized and gave me new warm food. Food was okay. Drinks were a little better than ok. & service was okay. We were hungry and it looked good but overall it was OKAY.
author: Itayetzi M.

description:
I can not remember our server's name but he is the oldest of the bunch, a very nice latino waiter.  Very pleasant, caring, was on top of whether we needed anything.  Removed our dirty plates right away.  Changed my order without giving me an attitude.  Great Service overall!

Gracias.

What a relief to see that not all servers in San Francisco are rude, unprofessional, and uncaring.  We had a Horrible experience at Mango's!!!!
author: Vivian D.

description: There breakfast food is delicious. My wife and I are out here for Vacation and checked this place out and man i wish i was here for another day to have their breakfast again!
author: Anthony V.

description: Not bad... Chowder is "ok" just basing this on the fact that I'm from New England and we def have the best chowder ever... Atmosphere pretty hip.. Very kid friendly
author: Medgy R.

description:
Visiting from PHX, husband got Fish Taco's, waiter said rice and beans sucked lol so my husband substituted sweet potato fries and he said they were great along with the tacos! Clam chowder bread bowl is pretty good but if you are coming for the chowder I'd go
To Scoma's down the street!!!
author: Lysa A.

description: Tasty food, cold beer, good ambiance, in the best city in the world. Nuff said!
author: Stephen D.

description:
Located just inside the shopping area of Pier 39.  A very relaxed surfer-themed restaurant to get American style burgers and fries.  Sit inside or outside.  They have a really nice bonfire area near the front entrance if you are lucky enough to get a seat there on a chilly Fall evening. The hostesses were especially nice and accommodating.  
A little pricey (but what isn't in San Francisco?) at $20, before tip, for the California burger, FF and a soft drink ($3.50 alone!).
author: Leah M.

description: Beautiful place really nice decore will recommended the food really good and the bear
author: Elad B.

description: Brian was our server and he was excellent. He made our experience here amazing. His recommendations with the clam chowder and drinks were spot on!! I will definitely return here on my next visit.
author: Michael W.

description: My visit there started off fine. As it went on though it just got worse. I had to wait 40 minutes for my food and to top it off it was cold. Then I had to ask twice within 20 minutes just to get my water refilled. The food was decent apart from it being cold but I would never go again.
author: Alyssa C.

description: Fast service, great food! We had the shrimp and steak bowl, fried shrimp, calamari and fish, and the fish and chips combo. It was all delicious! Not mention great location. Loved it!
author: Diana E.

description: Came in here yesterday with my friend and our kids. We ordered the chicken wings and calamari for appetizers and it was good. I ordered the chicken penne pasta, it was also good but nothing about the dish stood out. If ordering the kids meal, keep in mind it does not come with a drink, that is extra. Our waitress, Lourdes was very nice and attentive. I hope she still works there when we come back
author: Bee L.

description: 5 stars and all for our server Reuben!  I am born and raised here, so going out to eat at a tourist destination is not my everyday cup of tea.  But it can be fun to hit up the pier every now and then.  Food quality was not bad actually, but the server experience is usually the next up that makes or breaks a dining experience.  Thank you Reuben for the recommendations and the service with a smile! :)
author: Tea Lyves ..

description:
French fries tasted rotten,  corona $7,  service was a bit slow.  I had California burger,  it was OK. 
Will I come back?  I'll think twice about it, I'll try something else next time.
author: Ivan G.

description: The food was pretty good. Nice restaurant and menu that is family friendly. Unfortunately, our service was so bad it ruined the experience for us.  Note the restaurant was not busy as it was 4:00. Took a long time for our waitress to come to greet us and when she came, she actually first greeted a table that was seated several minutes after us and took their order first. She finally came to take our order and mumbled an apology for taking so long. When we finally got our food she never ever came back to check on us until we had nearly finished. Then the bus boy came and started to aggressively grab our plates while we were still eating and we had to tell him to stop. Note that the other tables around us were served and long gone while we were still waiting for our check. We had to ask 3 times for our bill. On the third time, she nodded her head at us and then proceeded to take the order of two other tables. Then she sent over someone else to bring us our bill. He said, "your waitress said you wanted the check???" and then just tried to walk away.  We habitually leave 25 to 30 percent for gratuity and more at this time of year for good service. For the first time in my memory, we left 15 percent.  Won't be coming back to this place. Good service is such an important part to a restaurant experience.
author: Mia H.

description: Was pleasantly surprised.It was best fish and chips I ever had.Wait to be seated on tuesday afternoon was 10 minutes.Service was efficient also.Price was not too expensive also.Paper between plate and food started coming apart but likely due to amount of vinegar I used.Good experience
author: Mike C.

description:
Horrendous. Ordered the steak nachos that never came. Ordered a beer and was brought the wrong one. Neither of which was acknowledged.
Ordered the fish sandwich thinking SF being right on the bay the fish would be fresh. WRONG. I would've been better off eating a fish sandwich at a fast food place in middle America and the tartar sauce was like mayonnaise. Seriously mayonnaise. I wanted to throw up.  The wait staff is awful - our waiter clearly clueless but even the other waiters were very rude and acted like you were in their way when we were walking in/out of the restaurant. Very dirty restaurant also, the bathrooms are unisex, the restaurant itself gets mopped probably once a week, and even the silverware/cups they give you are the cheap dingy kind from the 80s. Like you literally cannot see through the clear cup that's supposed to contain water because the clear cup has turned white over all the years of use. Do not eat here.
author: Lani L.

description: This restaurant is absolutely horrible. The waiter didn't even bother to check what we want to drink after 15 minutes. I will give it 0 rating if the option is available. I will never visit this restaurant ever again.
author: Bill Y.

description: My family and I visited this restaurant a few years ago and the food was pretty bad. The calamari is probably the worst in the existence of the human race, and everything else was pretty mediocre as well. Yesterday, we visited the restaurant during lunch time, and it wasn't very busy. We got sat down by a waiter, and then waited 15 MINUTES for a waiter to come by and take our order. We called out for 15 MINUTES, with waiters blatantly ignoring us after we had made eye contact with them. We noticed this was happening with a lot of other tables as well. The waiters were extremely rude and unprofessional. We walked out, as we tried to call and talk to the waiters with no response. I would give them a 0 stars if I could
author: Chris C.

description:
I am giving them 5 stars not just for the food but for excellent care.  Only half of our group had a chance to enjoy the very delicious food because unbeknownst to us my two year old niece had the stomach flu.  Which she informed the whole restaurant of via what I would liken to the Niagara Falls of Vomit.  While my brother took the baby to clean her up, I helped my sister-in-law to clean her up.  The staff were wonderful and did everything they could to help us with kindness and compassion and many, many towels.  Luckily we did get to enjoy some of their food at home before we each fell like dominoes to the wrath of a tiny virus.

I suggest the fish and chips, it pairs well with Pedialyte and Tylenol.
author: Jessika L.

description: Had salmon salad and fish tacos.  Good enough.  Now the garlic Fry's on the other hand rates about an 8 out of 5. Real garlic and not mushy.  :)
author: Scott D.

description: Wipeout was a pleasant surprise.  Breakfast was served very quickly.  I had the steak and eggs.  The steak was very juicy.  Our kids loved the pancakes.  My wife was very satisfied with the French toast.  Our server was polite and attentive.  The location on Pier 39 was very convenient.  The price for breakfast was great considering the location.
author: Andre R.

description: Omg my hubby and I came for Breakfast the food is amazing and our server Juana was soooooo sweet....ask for her when you come!!!!
author: Kaleo G.

description:
After a day of playing tourists in the big city, we went to the biggest tourist trap that San Fran has to offer:  Pier 39.  You've got the lounging sea lions, Alcatraz as your photo backdrop, souvenir shops galore, and of course, over-priced restaurants serving mediocre food.  The one we finally decided on was Wipeout, mainly because they were cheaper than their upstairs neighbor Eagle Rock Cafe (which has the better Yelp rating).  

The place, inside and out, was packed.  The vibe is casual, loud, and fun...something you might find on the Santa Cruz beach boardwalk.  Surprisingly, they sat us inside right away.  Not much of a view of the marina, but they had giant TV's all around the place.  So it's actually a good place to catch a game.  Their menu consisted of specialty pizzas, 1/2 pound Angus burgers, tacos and burritos, salads, the usual bar appetizers (chicken wings, nachos, calamari), clam chowder, and some seafood items.  They also offer 23 oz fruitty, blended drinks ($10.95), that appropriately get served with an umbrella of fruit.  I likey!

We started off with some perfectly fried and seasoned onion rings that were lightly battered in panko, no heavy flour batter.  I thought the seafood platter ($15.95) would be a great choice consisting of calamari, coconut shrimp, a thick piece of cod, and fries.  The shrimp and fish were ok but I didn't like the calamari at all.  It had a thick batter and pretty much tasted like it came from a frozen bag.  Luckily I ordered a cup of clam chowder ($4.95) as an afterthought (we are in San Francisco ya know!) that was filled with clams and had a nice consisitency and mild flavor.  That chowder and the onion rings saved me from a disappointing meal.  Our table also had a burger that looked amazing, a fish sandwich that was tasty, and a big carne asada burrito, which unexpectedly had lots of tender and flavorful diced up meat.  

Service was very good.  Our server was friendly, helpful with the menu, and prompt.  Our food and drinks came in a timely manner.  For the place being chaotically busy, I honestly didn't expect that great of service.  The one thing I didn't like was that they charged $0.75 for a side (tiny plastic cup) of pico de gallo!  Seriously?  Our server should have mentioned the extra charge when we asked for it.  Aside from that, Wipeout was an above-standard choice for a casual SF touristy meal.

**oh, side note:  one unisex bathroom with 4 stalls inside the restaurant only.  a long line, and a little awkward, but clean and convenient.
author: Carol P.

description: This place is amazing! And the service was great! BRANDON D WAS SUPER NICE AND QUICK! Best service we got in town! San Francisco will see us again and we surely will see Brandon again!  Thank you!!!!
author: Ayda R.

description: Food wasn't bad. Service was horrible. Waitress could have cared less about our table. Had to keep flagging her down to ask for refills. She was not friendly at all. Two stars is probably too kind, but food was ok.
author: John P.

description: I really wasn't expecting much based on the location and look of the place and found myself pleasantly surprised. The place was packed but we were able to get seating right away. They have a pretty extensive menu. My niece loved her carnitas burrito - it was huge! And since I'm doing low-carb, they replaced the rice in my Shrimp & Steak Bowl with double veggies. The food was delicious but a bit overpriced. (Location, location, location.) Service was excellent though and I was happy we ate here. On another note, I loved their bathrooms! They have a common area for men & women to wash their hands and individual unisex bathrooms -- this makes the line equal! Yay!
author: Linda J.

description:
Let's see: a restaurant on pier 39... Indoor & outdoor seating, flocks of not only birds but people everywhere... Nonetheless!--

5/5: we were immediately greeted by the hostess, who told us our waiting time would be five to ten minutes. Turned out to be only two minutes, and we were called up to our table.

5/5: food was amazing. I posted up pictures already; the only thing that I thought that needed a bit of work would be the chicken penne. But this place is a grill, so I don't really know why I would choose pasta here (but I did). Their burger, says my brother, was amazing. Their taco, says my sister's boyfriend, was delicious (the best, apparently, was steak). I tried the pulled pork taco- it was pretty good. We also had the nachos as our appetizer- pretty good, and my younger sister had a fish and sticks meal (she really liked it as well).

5/5: service, I will have to say, was amazing. The waitress came back with our food within ten, fifteen minutes, and was very friendly and kind to us all. She refilled our drinks constantly and checked up on us every once in a while. The manager, whose name I believe is Chris, also visited our table as well- it was pretty cool. He was extremely friendly and welcoming to us, and I thought that this made the meal even better.

All in all, I loved it! I'll come back to this place when I come back to the pier. :)
author: Shirlee L.

description:
