Well....certainly nothing to write home about.  I ordered the fish tacos and one would think that you can't go wrong with eating fish at Pier 39.  I was wrong.  The fish tacos were bland and disappointing.  I definitely won't be returning. 

As for the service, it was ok.  It took the server a while to take our orders.  But her attitude was pleasant.
author: Ingrid H.

description:
I've been to Pier 39 a bunch but this is the first time I've ever eaten here... What made the whole experience so good was our waiter. The guy (Brandon) was chill, down to earth, told us what he liked and didn't like, he took time to explain the different plates, and never left our waters empty. By far one of the best waiters I've ever had. 

I ended up loving my dish, it was the Wipeout Fried Combo. Ton of food and it tasted great. I'd definitely come here again.
author: Steve W.

description: Went to dinner with some friends tonight. Food was amazing, drinks hella good, and our server Wyatt was bomb!!
author: Brenda B.

description:
We had the Chicken Chipotle Penne and the Clam Chowder in Bread and it really was good. The Chipotle maybe a bit too spicy but all in all very delicious.
Would really prefer that place.
author: Andreas R.

description:
Outdoor seating at its best.  We come here every time we visit San Fran-total tourist trap but a good one!  People watch while you drink your specialty drink or beer and hope you don't get pooped on by the birds. LOL  We started in the sun and as time went by the tarp shade came out little by little-just like magic till the patio was totally shaded.  We ordered our drinks- a tall beer and a Mai Tai.  Nothing better than being on vacation with a frosty beer glass with ice cold beer to drink.  Sigh.  

The BF and I thought we would share two dishes so we ordered the BBQ burger with crispy onions and the chicken sandwich with pineapple and teriyaki.  The burger was much better than the chicken as I can remember feeling like I was on a commercial eating it when the bbq sauce dripped from the burger.  Charred to perfection.  The chicken sandwich was really messy and the bun a little soggy from the teriyaki but not too bad.  My daughter ordered the mac n cheese with fries.  The mac was straight out of the old fashioned Kraft box...it always amazes me that they would serve that at restaurants and charge the prices they do for it.  Anyways, she was fine....just like good 'ol mac and cheese from home I guess. haha

The atmosphere is exactly what you expect being in California.  Totally chill, good food and drink, great customer service and enjoying the fab Cali weather!  The décor is a beachy-surfer theme with cute little signs that make you laugh.  Get your pic with the surfer dude statue in the front for giggles.  Even if I lived in San Fran I would still visit Wipeout on occasion.  Sigh....I wish I was still there.
author: Carissa C.

description: Good food good service ... Strawberry Margarita and Chilaquiles were good ... They need good Mexican salsa tapatio would've worked lol
author: Esmeralda L.

description:
Parking validation if under 2 hours - pretty sweet and I dig the unisex-style restroom because it's something I have never seen or been to plus they do have a baby changing station that is relatively clean.  They do have at least one restaurant personnel in the restroom facility at all times to ensure cleanliness and to assure patrons that it is a boys' and girls' bathroom, haha.   

The wait time wasn't that long for a Saturday night.  I think we waited for about 10 minutes?  The hostess was nice and our server at first was also nice however, during the middle of our meal, there was a server exchange due to her lunch so what I heard from the group was that the replacement server was rude and plain out sucks.  Fortunately for her, I wasn't present or else I would have said something.  

I knew I wanted clam chowder because I'm in San Francisco and it's a mandatory soup to order especially at the pier and I did but I refrained from ordering it in a sourdough bread bowl because I did not want to consume over 800 calories and over 70g of carbs, not to mention over 25g of fat in a soup - SOUP!!!  Plus I was spending money left and right that weekend so my soup costs just $4.99.  I can spend lavishly on myself when it comes to food but I have a finance conscience, however.  

What I really wanted to order was the taco salad which looked fresh and ginormous but I didn't want to spend $12.95 on a salad.  I can be cheap but this is where I regret not ordering that because I really wanted it *sad face*  At least I made up for it at Chocolate Heaven afterwards.  I devoured 3 chocolate covered Oreo's in less than 2 minutes.  

My sister and her friend ordered the Wipeout Fried Combo ($15.99) and it's a fried fish, fried calamari, and coconut shrimp platter.  It looked rather appetizing but I didn't want to try it because I don't know about them but I hate it when people want to try my food or share.  "Get your own, dude".  They also ordered The Jalapeno Burger ($12.50).  The burger was brought out cut in half already per their request and it looked deliciously medium rare but if it was my burger, I'd order it rare.  

Kevin ordered a pizza and added his own toppings.  If I recall correctly, he opted for bacon, chicken, and pineapple.  He raved about it but I personally didn't care for it (had it as leftovers the following day).  It was on the dry side.  Meh.  

I left before we paid because the kiddo started to act up.  Instead of allowing him to be loud, cry, or scream... I took him out for a walk (Chocolate Heaven) and to listen to the live music that was right in front of Hard Rock Cafe.  I didn't return to the group but when I came back in to wait a bit, the hostess remembered me and validated my parking ticket.  

The food is ok and the service can definitely improve (the server).
author: Tram N.

description: My girlfriend and I were coming from Los Angeles and this was our first stop on fisherman's wharf, we were starving so we decided to try the clam chowder from here. The only clam chowder I had ever tried was from soup plantation and this blew it out the water. My girlfriend had never tried clam chowder before and she agreed that it was really good. The bread was soft and was perfect for dipping. We also tried the hot wings which were good. For two starving people wanting to try clam chowder, Wipeout did it's job.
author: Miguel R.

description: Service was fast and friendly. Food was pretty good. Had the fish tacos and carne asada tacos. The beans and rice... Delish. Only problem were the weak drinks
author: Lucretia P.

description: Everyone's food was great. Ordered a few different tacos, nothing special about tortilla salsa has no flavor just deep fried fish with a tortilla nothing bad but defiantly nothing even good. When I told the waitress she agreed smiled and walked away  cool atmosphere giving it a two star because I was really looking forward to it would have been better off buying a hotdog on the streets. 5 star if I would have ordered anything anyone else ordered at my table  not leaving satisfied
author: Bianca W.

description:
We went to this restaurant thinking the theme would be fun because of the name "wipe out", we thought it had something to do with the show. It had nothing to do with the show but everything to do with the "Corona time" thats what they meant by wipe out. Also, it has a surfing theme. 
Our waiter was very nice. I checked in at yelp and got free breadsticks but they were all out, so he said for me to choose something else. I did, and it was more expensive then the breadsticks so they only charged us the difference. That is perfectly fine with us. 
The restaurant was clean, not packed at all.  The only bad part was my food was bland. I had the fish tacos. My son had the carnitas burrito, now that was very tasty. They cook them fajita style. If I ever come back that's what I'll b eating.
author: Terry M.

description: We love this place great food great drinks good service highly recommend this restaurant when at pier 39. Shark bit is a must try on the drink menu for the 21 and over.
author: Luis S.

description:
Fun place. The atmosphere was really cool. Good music. Staff was great and service was good. Food came out pretty quick, despite how busy it was. 

Food only so so though. I've had much better coconut shrimp and pineapple burgers elsewhere. Not horrible. But not fantastic.
author: Jessee L.

description:
WOW...I wish I could give 6 Stars! The OUTRAGEOUS Onion Rings are just Heavenly sitting alongside my Jalapeno Burger....YOWZA.... Outstanding Job! and I washed it all down with a SPIKED Arnold Palmer....the wife had her usual OFF THE LIP Lemondrop and the TACO Salad...Love this place. The servers are SO Friendly and know the answer to every question and are happy to suggest something different. That along with the AMAZING FOOD AND DRINKS is why we keep coming back time after time. People visit us from all over the country and we send them here every time and they all "Praise" my suggestion!!
Keep it going Please....Hats Off to Wipeout Bar & Grill         BRAVO !!  :-)
author: Carl G.

description: This place was kind of weird. The prices were good, which was nice considering everything else on Pier 39 is extremely expensive for my taste. The food tasted fine, not fantastic but not terrible either. However, the waiting staff seemed pretty disorganized, in terms of where people were going to be seated, what we had ordered, etc. Also, and this is the weird part, one of the staff came outside with a spray bottle and sprayed the pigeons with water to get them away. The outside area was pretty busy while we were there and she was lucky she didn't spray anyone or anyone's food. So maybe eat inside?
author: Jared G.

description: Shrimp and stake bowl was extremely salty. Pizza tasted like just bread, couldn't taste sauce or cheese. Waiter would not change the bowl for us.
author: Laurie W.

description: Awesome food, great service one thing I did not like about his place was the bathroom situation; this unisex bathrooms are not right, they need to change that.
author: Arbi G.

description: Was seated by an unwelcoming 16 year old. Didn't even greet us, just sat us at a table that had pink glass stains on it. We sat there for about ten minutes without even being greeted by a server. We were tired of waiting so we just walked out. We wouldn't have minded if it was busy, but there open tables everywhere and servers standing and talking! Just a place run by dumb teens.
author: Dana T.

description: Service was great. Had the carne asada burrito and it was terrific. Not a long wait despite it being very busy during lunch.
author: Trey W.

description:
Pros: 
It's in a popular area and outside bar service.

Cons: 
The price, service and the price.

Food Experience:
The food was just average nothing to go crazy about. The service was nice but not great to where I would rave about and the prices were just too pricey for what I was given. We got the Ribs entree since I checked in and I got a deal to get Pizza Sliders and we all got beers which were pricey too. Then my friend wanted onion rings which were okay. 

Conclusion:
I wouldn't recommend it here. It's just not special enough for my liking.
author: Irving B.

description: Everytime I come to Frisco I eat here. Food is great. Not too pricey.  Drinks are a little strong which is a bang for your buck. I always sit outside on the patio. Adds to the environment. Waiters and waitress are friendly and very attentive.
author: Jose R.

description:
The food here is pretty good. We didn't have to wait long. They provided coloring in for our 3 kids to keep them occupied. 
We did however come at an extremely busy lunch rush. The ordered came correct, however having kids who decided they want something different did confuse the kitchen, that was quickly fixed. 
The poor server was unhappy that other servers were steeling his food. Van did a great job and really went above and beyond. Nice guy!
Will come back.
author: J K.

description: Food was perfect!! Big sizes and amazing flavors! Such a fun environment. Our wait or was so nice and did a great job with recommendations! Would come back again and again!
author: Candice K.

description: We stopped here late on a saturday night for dinner. Knowing that pier 39 is not the best place to go for food, we were just hoping to find a half decent sandwich. There was a 20 minute wait, not too bad. We ordered some nachos which were really pretty good. My fiance ordered a turkey club and I ordered calm chowder. Both were alright, nothing exciting but not bad. The service was good. The place is kitchy but that can be fun sometimes. I was a little bit bothered by the open coed bathroom.....
author: Melissa J.

description: This was an ok breakfast spot my chilaquiles was 3 star, the server never checked on us so rating that a 2 star is generous and the location is a definite 4 star so there you have it 3 star!
author: Kurt S.

description:
Seated quick but some of our chairs were missing. 
I had the nachos, the beans had a weird sweet flavor, and so did my gf's veggie burger. The waitress never came to see how we were doing. All 6 of us left at least half our meals at the table when we left.  Kind of a bummer to drop 40 on a check and not even eat the whole meal.
author: Brock M.

description:
When:  July 4, 2011 HAPPY FOURTH OF JULY!!!!
Location:  Pier 39 in San Francisco!
Company: My boyfriend, celebrating our first 4th of July together!
Crowd: Patriotic people!
Decor: Very Beachy!
Service: Emminsck was alright!
Love: Food and Alcohol and of course the company!
Hate: Took the waitress a long time to bring out my boyfriend's honey mustard he requested and our bill. 
Total: $43.73 for 2

Side note: 

Chicken Nachos: DELICIOUS!!! They charged us extra for Jalapenos I requested, which we didn't know about until we got our bill..

Onion RIngs.. YUM!!

23 Oz mix drink was alright..
author: Darlene M.

description: Nice environment.  Had the fried fish burger. It looked like it was going to taste amazing- i was so excited to eat it. Unfortunately it had absolutely NO TASTE! Now if your a restaurant on the on fisherman's wharf i expect you to have good quality seafood! The waiter didn't bring me any silverware for awhile so my food got a little cold. I just expected better tasting food here or tast at all
author: Jessica B.

description: With many visits to pier 39, I finally decided to try the Wipeout Bar & Grill. I must say I was pleasantly surprised, the food was delicious, service was great, and I see a lot of families. With so much to select, from their menu, I still went with my old standard, hamburger and fries. Everything was delicious what more can I say give it a try. Located at the entrance of pier 39. Easy access from the pier 39 garage, or public transit. Just as a side note if you want the great food and you decide you want it to  go, they have a fast service window, which I thought was pretty neat.
author: Dave L.

description:
Plainly I loved this place . Great food and they kept our drinks full :)
We had a combo plate . Pineapple coleslaw was on point ! 
Chicken taquitos were really good as well ! 
Great atmosphere, but they didn't have the As game :/
author: Marissa P.

description: Love it here, the staff is friendly!! The margaritas  are bomb!! The food is a little greasy, but will come back because of the customer service.
author: Xuan C.

description: We enjoyed our pier 39 dining experience here. We ordered fish and chips, clam chowder in a bread bowl, wipeout burger, and the wipeout combo (calamari, fish, and coconut shrimp w/ fries). The food was basically what you would expect for a chain restaurant. The service was prompt and polite. If you want a reliable burger or fish and chips and you're on pier 39, this is a good choice. But if you're on pier 39 and you want an authentic, freshly caught, San Francisco experience, you'd probably be happier with one of the local joints like Alioto's.
author: Shannon J.

description: Probably one of the best places we ate while visiting SF.  I had the bbq pizza which was delicious.  My companions had the burgers which were much larger than a "hip" joint we had stopped at in town earlier.  Large portions, great service, view is amazing, I'll come back every time.
author: Josh D.

description: Terrible customer service. They took way too long to take our order, and never checked on us. As we asked for our check she lifted up her finger without saying a word, I thought that was quite rude. If I could give this review without any stars, I would.
author: Donna E.

description: We ate here last night - wish we had not.   One of our three orders was placed wrong  - asked for the salad with tuna and received the tuna bowl. They did offer to put the correct request in but it would take time. I decided to keep the  tuna bowl  - the tuna was over cooked and very dry.  The fish tacos were terrible - shells were dry and crusty on edges.  Pork sandwich was okay. Over priced for the quality. $70 dinner with one adult beverage and Water's for others.   Another thing is when arriving with my Seeing Eye Guide dog  was told no dogs allowed but would check with the manager who said it was  okay.  Staff need ADA training.
author: Janette N.

description: I hate this place they messed up my order and the pizza was horrible, awful,and discussing. I'm never going there again!!!!!!
author: Jennifer F.

description: I didn't care for this place at all. I got the fish tacos and they were mediocre for the price. Their food is highly overpriced, especially for the taste of it. The only good thing about Wipeout was their fries. Their burrito was mediocre as well. I wouldn't recommend spending your money on it.
author: Adri M.

description: Awsome place to hang out and gets some great food and service. For it bein a busy day the service was great ..
author: Alex S.

description: Nice place at the Pier 39 entrance. Good burgers with a lot of fries, extensive soda list for the kids delight.
author: Judith F.

description: Employees very suck Especially the bar girl her attitude is so rude and definitely not clean at all i saw her sucking the straw to taste the beer then but back in the cup then Served it to them!!!!!
author: Mashael N.

description: Best breakfast we have had in San Francisco. Everything was fresh, the service was spot on...fast and friendly. Definitely recommend giving it a try. We were a little nervous to try, because it's such a tourist spot, but happy we did!
author: Sarah N.

description: I don't recommend this place!! Horrible! Hamburgers on the menu very, very DRY and tasteless!!  Nasty! Had to ask for thousands island to doctor- it -up. Fish and chips more batter than fish, coleslaw dry and tasteless!! Yuk! Burrito not what you would expect.. not good at all. Recommend doing your homework and Yelp to find a good restaurant in the area! We came here thinking it could not be that bad.. Wrong choice. Total regret! Wasted meal and money!
author: Alexsia E.

description:
Love the fact that offer a check in free, great comeback! For Christmas feeling. I love the shark with the Christmas decorations and always a good thing for younger children too. 

Okay so after we had our experience of eating there, I'm sad to say that while Herbert is a good waiter every other way to there is an apt. The cleaning staff flat which means the bussers were very good as well but I had certain server come up to my table not give me the correct discount after I specifically asked in showed him the discount I should have gotten he he gave us a tude wonder what the spell on my table he did not help clean it up my hand up having to clean up all by myself. When the very end I had a huge mountain of paper towels that were wet and soggy on my table he walked by asked you need anything else and left without even asking for trying to grab the Foggy Mountain off table table table napkins. End result Herbert was great, Busters great the rest of the stuff I will not be coming back for even if the food was good and it was
author: Giulia B.

description: The only place I know of where you can order fish tacos AND chowder in a bread bowl, while sipping an icy cold beer on the patio and poking fun at the tourist stereotypes milling around. The kids menu runs $7. Their west coast beer selection is respectable. We always end up bringing out-of-towners here because it has something for everyone, including burgers, veggie burger, teriyaki bowls, and pizza, and the food is not terrible. FYI: the restrooms are unisex and there is just one line (so stop looking for the other bathroom).
author: Cassandra J.

description:
There are so many food choices on Pier 39. What brought us to Wipeout Bar and Grill was the burritos. I got the carnitas burrito. It about killed me it was so good. Paired with Big Wave Golden Ale, the burrito was perfect. Wipeout is a beachy themed place so if you're not a native Californian and assume California is just one big beach, you can get in the mood here. Throw on the Beach Boys album and it would be perfect.

I liked Wipeout because the food was spectacular. Plus, we didn't have to wait very long to be seated. Would I go again? For that burrito, yes.
author: Sharece B.

description: I went here for dinner last night with my boyfriend. It was really great atmosphere (I'm from out of town) and we sat outside by the fire. Amazing service by our waiter and food was good, I had calamari appetizer and the pulled pork sandwich. Coleslaw needed to be a LOT colder and calamari was fresh n crunchy but lacked flavor (I'm picky about my calamari) my sandwich was bomb and I believe my BF liked his jalapeño burger. I'd be down to come again when we visit.
author: O S.

description:
Great food at a great value. Hopefully you have the pleasure of having Brandon D. as your waiter!! Great service as well as a great personality!

I got the Caesar salad and grilled teriyaki and pineapple sandwich. 5 stars all around
author: Courtney M.

description: Predictable menu, service and experience. For a canned experience, it was a pleasant surprise to run into a fellow Illinoisian at the restaurant.
author: Cherine F.

description: The over all experience is terrible. We were seated quickly and drink orders taken quickly. Server was friendly. We ordered food and food took over 30 minutes to get but only 5 of the 6 meals were ready  after 10 minutes the server came to ask how all was, we inform her of the missing meal. She checked on it but after another 10 minutes and said a chicken sandwich will be ready in 2 minutes. Finally got it and it was cold. The fish and fries were tasteless and greasy.
author: Teresa V.

description: Thick. Black. Hair. In. Food. Doesn't seem like a clean place to eat. Also they weren't very kind when I reported the hair. I definitely won't be going here again.
author: Dana K.

description: Service is poor we where sitting for a long time before we got our drinks and our food watching the waiters and waitresses run around lost with our food for twenty mins ...... However food was good if it's first time there order their signature burger can't go wrong and their Thai noodle salad DELISH
author: Melissa S.

description:
The food here was amazing!!!  Seriously, some of the best clam chowder I've ever tasted.  My friend and I each got a bowl and then split the fish and chips combo with calamari, coconut shrimp.  The portion was HUGE!  At first I thought it was a mistake and we somehow got double, but it was not.  It was definitely more than enough food.   The clam chowder came out super fast!   I was impressed by how quickly we were able to get in and out.  The only thing food-related I didn't really like was the coconut shrimp, it tasted like sunscreen to me.  My friend liked it though. 
Our server seemed annoyed with us the whole time, and while she wasn't rude, she definitely wasn't friendly or engaging.  At the end of the meal when we were paying I asked if they validate parking and she said "if you parked across the street we do" as she was walking away. Cool.  Thanks.   I had originally rated this experience higher, but thanks to that little ending piece, it changed it completely for me.   At first I thought yeah I wanna come back again for this amazing food, but this service really put a question mark on that for me
author: Karsyn M.

description:
Wipeout has been awesome. The atmosphere is nice. The service was great. We had Josh, he was so awesome. Very informative and helping. My group came from LA on a visit and he gave us some tips on touring the city as well as their menu.

The food was delicious. I had the chicken tenders, and my sister had the carne asada tacos. We loved our food. The coronarita was a very tastey drink:) 

I recommend this place. It's close to all the cool shops too!
author: Ness G.

description:
The Wipeout Bar and Girl like many restaurants on Pier 39 has a good outdoor seating , that is perfect for people watching when eating the food. 

One of the best things that they offer is the many different options for soda drinks. You can mix and match pretty much anything. 

Their nachos are very good, the half order was enough for 4 people as an appetizer. 

I had the Hawaiian burger, it was ok. The meat is really good but the flavors were a bit flat and the pineapple slice was a bit too thin. The fries though are the real deal. Everyone else quite enjoyed their burgers (one vegetarian, one with blue cheese and one California with guacamole)
author: Tamara S.

description: Breakfast was really good here! The French toast is on the famous sourdough sand Francisco bread & the bloody Mary's are made very tasty! We had the view that looks out onto the bay. But service was really slow & the wait time was longer than most places especially since it was not busy.
author: Briana G.

description: This place was good on peir 39......if you spent your day walking around alcatraz this place will do the job and hit the spot!
author: Sammy A.

description: My wife and I stopped at Fishermen's Wharf a little before lunch. First, it was $17 to park (ouch!). The first restaurant we saw on the Wharf was Wipeout Cafe. Looked good from outside. Good view of Alcatraz from window until  bread truck pulled up and blocked our view. Not sure about lunch, but bacon tasted like it was from the microwave and the scrambled eggs tasted like cardboard. I will say the pancakes were very good, but i had to unwrap individual butters becasue they did not have whipped butter.  Server acted like she did not want to be there. Bad experience!
author: Monty M.

description: The bar drinks are the best. I got a pina colada with extra shot of patron they made it perfect its pricey but worth it
author: Becks M.

description: So terrible! We went there starving and left hungrier. First complaint our waitress was kinda terrible after we ordered our drinks we she tried to take our menus so I had to let her know we were still ordering more. After we order appetizers she tried to take our menus again ...just tell us to go at this point... Second our appetizers came out and the chili cheese fries were amazing but the nachos were terrible I might as well have ordered from Tacobell cause at least the cheese would have been better. After being disappointed with the appetizers we decided just to get the check. Third was that I had stopped one of the workers to ask what was her favorite appetizer. Her answer to me was "I don't know". How do you not know..don't you work there??? Maybe they just had new people but will never go back and definitely will never recommend
author: Alexandria R.

description: I came here with my family while we were visiting Pier 39 and we had a great experience! There were 3 adults and 2 children in our party and even though it was a busy Sunday, we were seated within about 15 minutes. Our server was very friendly and attentive, and she took our drink orders right away. We started with nachos to share and they were huge! My only complaint was that the cheese wasn't all the way melted on some parts but they were still yummy. The entree portions were also very generous. I ordered the California burger (which comes with guacamole and bacon) medium rare and they cooked it perfectly. The fries were pretty average but nothing to complain about. The prices for everything were very reasonable and we all left very full and happy. Also an added bonus for families with little ones, they have a stroller parking area where we were able to leave our stroller while we ate, and their bathrooms have changing tables which was also great when you have a little one in diapers!
author: Julia O.

description:
Went there to the dreaded Pier 39 that every local says they hate, especially my friend who took us there but immediately as we got sat our server shar took great care of us. 
The window seating was breathtaking, being able to see the boats go by while you eat! What more can you ask for! We asked shar what was good and he recommended that huge platter of a little bit of everything and I was not disappointed. I'll definitely be coming back!
author: Sam S.

description: I stopped by here to have a late lunch with my family. We got 15% off our meal for going to the aquarium before hand. My family enjoyed their meals. In all we ordered a bacon and blue cheese fries, wipeout combo plate, baja tacos, and a kids pizza for my son. Everything was good except for my soggy fish tacos. Server happily took my plate off of the bill.
author: Rupert D.

description: Great spot. Sat at the bar and Sam and AnJru made my experience unforgettable. They provided excellent service as well as engaging conversation. Will definitely return
author: Mibo A.

description: Way too noisy. ......couldn't hear across the table..a bit pricy for lunch. ...but it is San Francisco
author: Perry F.

description:
My family and I ended up at the wharf (were most tourist end) we liked the look of Wipeout and decided to give it a try. There was no wait but surprisingly it was a little busy. We got sat by the window and was happy with the view and the fun atmosphere  in the restaurant. The menu is very big and had a lot of great choices and also a full bar and plenty of beers on draft! ASHLEY was our waitress and we really liked her!! we couldn't make up our mind with the food so she suggested that we tried some of her favorite things. We tried the shrimp/steak bowl, fried combo, and the California burger(with guacamole and bacon) Which all was great!!! also she insisted on us trying the wipeout beer lagers, Which of course we did and they we really good too!!
Above all we have a great experience with the food and service. Thank you Ashley and Wipeout
author: Orlando P.

description: Decent food - stopped at there to go section. The gnarly garlic fries were delicious! Definitely worth a stop in. Unfortunately, the BBQ pork sandwiches come with very little BBQ to them, and the sauce is a very generic ketchup-type style. Drinks are very expensive, especially considering McDonald's is just down the street with $1 large drinks. Still... Garlic fries are amazing!
author: Kari C.

description:
It took ten minutes for our server to even come and take a drink order.

Food came out quickly but my order of two tacos came out wrong twice. 

The California Burger and the Wipeout Burger were both very dry. We asked for medium but the came out well. The wipeout burger had no sauce what so ever.

The tacos themselves deserves a 4/5. The crane Asada was really moist and had a grey sauce on it. The fish tacos also had great flavor but instead of plopping a huge chunk of fried fish on there it would have been better to break the fish up. 

I will give them another chance but will only be ordering tacos.
author: Brandy H.

description: Attempted to eat at this restaurant. We were seated outside and a bird pooped on our table and my sister!! We moved to another table and watched a bus boy wipe down the table with bird feces and continue to clean other tables with the same towel! I brought this up with management, who informed me that these were new employees who hadn't been properly trained. I wouldn't think it takes a training program to teach what should be common sense-- do NOT clean surfaces with bird feces!! Needless to say we did not eat food there, and were offered nothing for this inconvenience. NOTHING AT ALL!!! Very gross, skip this restaurant!!
author: Lauren J.

description: I had the tuna bowl and my husband had the steak and shrimp bowl. Both were excellent and loaded with flavor. We traded halfway through so we could also enjoy each others dishes. We ordered the garlic fries as an appetizer and they were not as buttery as those from the ballpark, but still okay. We probably would not get them next time, but will definately be going back again.
author: Deborah P.

description:
Yeah this place was ehhh. Just came back from the 49er game tonight and that was fun but my experience at this place for food and service sucked. I didn't like the quick rush they were showing us and telling us. I mean you should never rush your customers to leave. We paid and made business to this place and its not cool. 

First off, the food wasn't good at all. I'm sorry but the spicy wings were like plastic fake tasting, the potatoes were ok, egg rolls were bad, etc. idk, it wasn't nice. I do like their prices here though! It's super cheap to sit and have a little something. Overall, I didn't like the service. Especially the manager I'm assuming? He even said for us to leave because they need the table....??? Uhmmm no. Not happening. 

Never coming back
author: Allister D.

description: Staff was on point, checked on us regularly. The food was decent, had a platter of seafood appetizers (shrimp, calamari, fish) but it wasn't great...especially for the price. The atmosphere is pretty cool, sat right next to a fire pit. Drinks were made well. I would go back, mostly for the drinks and atmosphere
author: Mike C.

description: Our waitress was Ashley and she was amazing always checked to see if we needed anything and was great at just socializing with us and made us feel welcome. The food was absolutely amazing!! It was mine and my boyfriend's first time on pier 39 and our best time was at Wipeout Bar and Grill!
author: Christina K.

description:
We went the Sunday before the 4th of July. It was super busy and my party of 3 was sat quickly but the table service was horrible. Our waitress took forever to take our order, had to come back and double check what we ordered because she didn't write it down and then forgot my husbands Arnold Palmer all together. 
We also noticed that we were not the only ones always looking for her.
author: Satyn L.

description: Perfect place for kids. The food was fast and delicious. I got the chicken teriyaki bowl and loved it. It's located in a fun area close to the carousel. Our server Wyatt was especially friendly and helpful. Definitely a great place
author: Bekah B.

description: First time coming here. Ordered a California Burger and a Cod Burrito. Burger didn't have flavor for  $14 bucks I rather go to McDonalds. Burrito was plain sad boring :( service was good though server was nice and helpful.
author: Francisco H.

description:
Came here with my family for lunch after visiting the aquarium. I didn't have high expectations at all, but the food was much worse than I thought it would be. 

The milkshakes were pretty good, but everything else was pretty bland. I ordered a taco salad with no meat--I got a tostada salad with no flavor and some steam vegetables thrown on top. I don't understand WHY they did that. My salad was cold, the veggies were hot and absolutely DID NOT go with my salad. 

I would never come back here again.
author: Coco C.

description: Grabbed a quick app here with some homemade onion rings and a beer. Pretty good wouldn't mind stopping back by to explore more of the menu.
author: Randy J.

description: Food was very average bar food but the drinks were great. Carnitas were over cooked and lacked seasoning and the salmon sandwich was soggy.
author: Steven S.

description: Great food and reasonable price! I had the grilled fish burrito on a plate. It was delicious! The sweet potato and garlic fries were to die for! Our waitress was very accommodating!
author: Sue A.

description: Good place to eat near Pier 39 area!! Their menu is more pub like but the food is fresh and delicious. The service was great!! They have outdoor (which has fire pits) and indoor sitting with a nice view of the bay!! I tried the Veg burger with Onion rings and enjoyed it throughly!!
author: Shivani K.

description: So, this was my worst meal in San Francisco. There are no words to describe this place except "gross." My fiancee and I had just gotten off the boat from Alcatraz and we needed lunch. We started hunting around Pier 39 and settled on Wipeout because we did not want seafood again and were craving Mexican food, so this was as close as we could get to what we wanted on Pier 39. Plus, there were a lot of people here and that is usually a good sign. The entrance is super confusing as there are two and we came in behind the hostess stand. The first thing said to me was, "You need to come around and get in line, there's a line." Because of the warm welcome, I honestly felt like leaving right then and there. So, we finally get to the hostess stand and are told that we would have a 5-10 minute wait, but then the hostesses get into an argument with one telling us to wait while the other telling her she has a table for us. After the exchange between those two, we are seated at the window with a bay view, which was awesome. My fiancee and I ordered chips and salsa, nothing amazing or bad about those. Both of us ordered chicken burritos. My burrito was watery. The chicken inside was bad quality, a lot of fat and a lot of gristle. I just stopped eating mine because I was so grossed out by it, I didn't want to get sick. It also lacked a lot of flavor, it was pretty tasteless. The server was friendly, which was a plus. If at Pier 39, try Fog Harbor or Boudin.
author: Caroleigh N.

description: The food and service was good.  Outside seating was pleasant.  Good comes out fast and the menu was diverse enough.  The food was good.  I got the Wipeout Burger which was awesome.
author: MIke H.

description: Visiting SF for the weekend, we decided to go to Pier 39 to check out some restaurants we missed on our last trip. My boyfriend really wanted fish tacos, we saw Wipeout had a selection of decent food options, and decided to try it out. Big mistake! The place looked like an outdated beach themed applebees. It was beyond packed, LOUD, kids running around, waiters giving tables the wrong food, just chaotic to say the least. Nothing on the menu looked appetizing, right then and there we should have left! I ordered carnitas tacos and the people we were with ordered fish n chips. My food was disgusting, the rice tasted like fish and the tacos were all fat and had no taste. I couldn't even eat it. They were nice enough to take the meal off our bill but in the end didn't accommodate us. Wouldn't return. There are way better seafood joints in that area, unfortunately we chose the wrong one.
author: Savannah K.

description: This place was delicious! It is hard for me to find healthy places to eat sometimes and this place had a veggie burger! It was amazing! Best veggie burger I've ever had! Would go again.
author: Natalie B.

description: My sister has come to this place faithfully for 5 years and told me how great it is so I finally joined her for lunch on a trip to SF from Sacramento. I wasn't disappointed. The carnitas burrito was filling and delicious. The drinks were amazing. The margarita I had was a good strong drink. I had 2 and boy were they strong. We had one problem. My 6 year old nephew did not get his kids pizza until we were all done eating. We let David the manager know and he was quick to make things right for us. He was very upset about the situation and genuinely concerned about the delay. He handled the situation so well and was a great representative of the business making sure that we will definitely return as loyal customers. Thank you again. Cindy Lorrayne Margo and Ishuwa.
author: Lorrayne G.

description: I was there for a business lunch so we sat inside next to the window so we had a great view. The food was great (coconut shrimp and chips but substituted salad which was delicious-not your boring iceberg house salad, it was leafy greens with jicama and cherry tomatoes) and the service was prompt. They have a nice fairly spacious outdoor seating area that faces onto Pier 39 if you want to people watch.
author: Shauna C.

description: Great service was here on martin luther king day  place was packed and did no wait. We had our food within 10 min of ordering was amazed
author: Paola T.

description: I know this is a tourist place BUT, tiny pice of salmon that was burnt and a ton of lettuce for $17.00.  Worst meal I've ever had, anywhere!!!! I was starving when I left. So disappointed.
author: Mary M.

description: Best breakfast on waterfront and you wouldn't expect it but was awesome.The food was fresh and delicious while sitting outside on Pier 39 with a lack of birds dive bombing you.The wait staff was so kind and personable while the drinks were kind and personable. Don't miss this place while in the area.
author: Troy N.

description: Would not let my kids in during a busy time because my friends were at the bar .  Had to walk through a crowd m to go to the front of the place to wind up standing at the bar with my kids like i said we would .  I am so mad . ! Totally un respectable . Waiting for a table and they turned me away because i had kids in a kid friendly area !!!!
author: Dana F.

description: Favorite spot on Pier 39. The burgers are superb. Service is quick. Never have to wait long for anything. Definately recommend to anyone that visits pier 39.
author: James S.

description:
Much like other locals, I went in with low expectations and to no surprise it was awful. We went in with 3 kids under the age of 5, and the hostess sat us at a high top.... Noo common sense seriously. 

Then we got sat at a 4 person booth. It took 15 minutes to be approached-- enough time to look over the menu and have all 3 children decide what they want plus us two adults. By the time we got a server she got our drinks, appetizers and food ordered. Appetizers came out before drinks did. Garlic Fries and Chips & Salsa. Bland but edible. I ordered a California burger, and the guacamole was seriously the most disgusting pre packaged guac i've ever had. I wiped all of it off 4 bites into the burger. My husband had the wipeout plate, fried shrimp and calamari which was soggy and undercooked. My daughter got chicken strips, burnt. And the kids mac n cheese didn't receive a complaint from my nieces. 

The entire time we were there, our server checked on us 3 times. It took 20 minutes to even get our check done. I had to ask another server for a to go box (that my 3 year old insisted upon). My husband and I both worked in the service industry for many years, we know how to handle triple seating and campers-- it sucks but you deal with it the best you can! You're in a prime location, just because you know you're still going to have customers, doesn't mean you can't give better service to every guest. I won't go back, i could get better food from the hot dog stand around the corner. But to each their own.
author: Heather N.

description: Seriously do not give this place your money. Awful service and a horrible bartender with a very bad attitude. I wish I could give this place no stars. Even the manager chris is a crook. Ordered three drink and no of them contained an alcohol(as they should have) complained and the manager treated us like we were crazy. Told me his bartender on duty was his best. 10 minutes later the couple next to us complained about their drinks as well. But wait, if he's the best surly he would not mess up 5 drinks in a row right? Did not offer to take the drinks off the tab, did not offer a little more alcohol for said drinks. Horrible place, horrible service.
author: Joey P.

description: We had eaten here a couple times before and it was great good food an service.  We also had came by lastnite for a nitecap by the fire and it was really a nice quiet relaxing time..  Thank you
author: Frances T.

description: Good fish dishes, but pretty bad on the kids menu. Boring hot dog, and a rare kids cheeseburger. I enjoy rare/medium rare, but I'm an adult. My young kid didn't like his very rare burger. I didn't think I had to specify "well done" off the kids menu, wasn't even asked.
author: Abel L.

description: Wonderful service and friendly servers. Although the fish & chips could have been crispier, they are definitely recommended! Will definitely be returning in the future.
author: Shane G.

description:
We were starving and wanted a quick bite to eat, but not fast food - so we ended up here. Cool, chill spot. Casual - lots of TVs that had college football on. 

I got the Hawaiian Burger... and they are VERY generous with that teriyaki sauce. It was one of those drip all over your hands and plate and face burgers. LOVED IT. 

The service was mediocre... but then again I didn't expect it to be since its mostly high school/college students making minimum wage. Slow... but friendly. 

Def worth checking out if you're at the wharf and dont want to throw down hella bank for a fancy schmancy place, but dont want fast food either.
author: Leanna S.

description: Came here for breakfast and it was not bad. The portion size was generous and the food was decent, for the price you're paying. The staff was mildly attentive - not constantly checking on you but we couldn't find the guy for a few minutes at a time. When I've asked for my eggs to be well done at other places, I've never had to explain what that is but the waiter here gave me a weird look and asked if I meant scrambled. Not the same thing and I was too embarrassed to explain so I just ordered it sunny side up.
author: Terri C.

description: Probably the coolest place on the pier. I came because a friend told me about this place. I got a drink-martini, my wife got a shark something or other. We ordered a late lunch/early dinner-salmon and burger. Everything was good. The service was better. I couldn't remember the name of the server-mayber Danny/David/Darryl? It was a decent stop in after a day of SF walking.
author: Anthony R.

description:
In this day and age you expect tourists places to gouge you on price and give you one french fry, well this is NOT that type of place. I order the fish n chip (beer battered with AnchorSteam) paid $13.95 and it was big enough for 2 people to share. In fact there was so much fish AND batter that I got through one fillet and 2 bite of the other and gave the rest to my boyfriend. The beer their used pair perfectly with the fish and definitely gave it a kick.

Our server was excellent and the scenery is great. Cannot go wrong with Wipeout Bar and Grill we will defintely be going back next time we are there.
author: Caitlin C.

description:
My family celebrated Easter early, so when it was actually Easter Day, I decided to spend it with my brother, his girlfriend, & their daughter. It was a bit on the sunny side (at least in the morning), so we wanted to do something. We decided to go to Pier 39! 

Couldn't really decide where we should eat. Picked a couple places & just went with the one with the shortest wait..considering that it was a Sunday, Easter, & a tourist spot all day every day. The winning restaurant = Wipeout Bar & Grill.

While I thought I'd have a good day (I mean..it was Easter!), the moment I went to up to the hostesses, I was automatically in a bad mood. I originally went up to the hostesses to inquire about the wait time for 4 people. They kind of just stared at me for a while, which made me feel uncomfortable. One woman asked, "Do you have a preference?" First of all, preference for what?! When I didn't answer right away, she looked at me like I was stupid, which I did NOT appreciate!! I think that's what ticked me off. She still didn't clarify her question, but I had figured out what she was asking me. But already from that point, I just didn't want to deal with her anymore. I almost wanted to tell my brother to let's go somewhere else, but I knew everyone was hungry. 

They told me about 20-30 minutes wait time, so my brother, his girlfriend, & their daughter wandered around the area a bit. I decided to stay behind just in case we were called. They called my name (which they got wrong btw. I'm pretty sure 'Jessica' is a pretty common name) & I told them that I had to get the rest of my party. They were very IMPATIENT & quick to grab someone else. Like seriously?! They kept pushing me to hurry up basically & that was NOT okay. 

After getting horrible hostess service, I was hoping that the rest of the experience would make up for it. Our waitress was really nice, which is why I gave 2 stars instead of 1 star. As for the food, that was alright. Here's what we ordered...

Teriyaki Pineapple Chicken Sandwich ($12.50) - I'm cutting down on my red meat, so I decided to get chicken instead. It was okay. The bun was way too small for the chicken..or the chicken was too big for the sandwich. The teriyaki & pineapple was good, but definitely made the sandwich messy to eat. Towards the end, I ended up using my fork & knife to eat it. It was just okay though. It also came with crispy fries, which were good. I probably wouldn't order it again.

The Hawaiian Burger ($11.95) - My brother got this. He was craving a burger, & was satisfied. Also came with crispy fries.

Fish & Chips ($13.95) - My brother's girlfriend got this. She liked it..oh, my niece did too. 

Overall, I'm not a fan of my experience at Wipeout Bar & Grill. From the beginning, my experience started to go downhill. If I'm back at Pier 39, I would rather take my services elsewhere.
author: Jessica A.

description:
The quality of food here is not healthy IMHO. 
I feel much regret going here because the food was so very....VERY SALTY and not that appetizing......as I write this...I feel sick to my stomach. 

The Clam Chowder was nothing close to what you get on Fisherman's Wharf...which would have satisfied me for dinner alone. It was too salty again and tasted like canned soup. and did not taste freshly made. 

And make sure that if you want Calamari....for $9.95....you get only Calamari. 

They ended up ordering us the Calamari "Entree" which we did not specify as what we wanted...so they charged us the $14.95. The fries I suppose was $5 but those too were not great at all. 

Lastly,...their Fried Fish Sandwich....lets just say there was more bread than fish. And it tasted no different from what I have eaten at the run of the mill fast food joint.  

Overall....It was a big disappointment for both me and my boyfriend that we do not ever plan to come here again.

The staff was courteous and we appreciated that. Just not the food. Sorry...but Wipeout at Pier 39 was a definite Wipeout of our hard-earned money!  

Oh btw....Keep in mind. Restaurants in San Francisco charge for the food, tax....and charge an extra ordinance fee to you. 

That just about put the icing on the cake that did not agree with us....a definite "No way Jose!" for us if we were to wonder where to go and eat again in SF.
author: D. N.

description: The drink portions are huge but there's barely any alcohol in them
author: Jennifer L.

description:
So I normally don't write yelp reviews cause I feel like it's a waste of time...BUTTTTTT the  good and the service was just AMAZING, that I have to write a review for this place. Starting off with the food review, my boyfriend and I ordered the coconut shrimp, it was on point! The outside was crispy and the flavor of coconut wasn't overwhelming at all! It was perfect! And then for the entrées I had the chicken pasta and OMG!
Soooooo good!!! I wish the sauce was a little thicker but other then that It was mouthwatering! My boyfriend got the wipeout burger cause that's what our server recommended, my boyfriend lovessss burgers and he said it was good, and that's saying something! Okay I know this review is getting really long, but what made this experience so enjoyable was our server David with the sweetest smile and wasn't rushing us at all! He gave us great recommendation, and we will definitely ask for him! Overall 5 BIG STARS for this place!!
author: Lucretia C.

description: ok so, food was great, drinks were strong, atmosphere was nice, waitress (Natasha) was nice but really screwed things up lol. I'm learning that I can't judge a business so harshly based on one person that works there. So here's the rundown... It was myself, my boyfriend and another couple. So we ordered drinks and she checked our ID pretty standard. Received our drinks and they were good, big, and cheap! We asked for some suggestions and they all sounded good. we told her he has a nut allergy and she said he would be fine. She suggested a Carne Asada burrito for my bf so he went with that. When all of our food came his was the last to arrive. When he cut open the burrito and started eating it I realized it was carnitas and not the Carne Asada he orders. She apologized and took the plate back. She brought him the correct meal and a complimentary drink which was appreciated. On the low I told her it was his Bday and said they will take care of him. We were done eating and they brought out his bday surprise and sang. My boyfriend asked me if I thought there were no nuts in the brownie so I called her over to check. She took the spoon and cut the brownie open! I thought she was going to eat some lol! She runs to the kitchen and run back to the table, "DO I NEED TO CALL AN AMBULANCE?!" So that clearly means NUTS! I told her no as he didn't eat it yet. She came back apologize once again for another mix up and brought yet another drink. So although she brought out the wrong burrito and almost killed my boyfriend it was good nonetheless. Lmao by the end of dinner he was so drunk he didn't remember!
author: Haleigh S.

description: Management here is a complete joke. I've never met such rude, uneducated, sexist, racist people before in my life. People: think twice about coming here and giving people like this your money. You also won't be missing out. Food is disgusting. Service is incredibly slow. It took almost half an hour just to get the check, and nobody was there!!
author: Jane H.

description: I was there last week and ordered the sampler, it was sooo good. Good service n good food.  Everyone was pretty friendly. The bathrooms are unisex and a lil on the tight side other than that everything was great! The drinks are good there too.
author: Alex R.

description: Good food even better service! Don't remember the bartenders name but it was lunch time on Thursday 2/25 and we were at the patio bar. He was a lot of fun! Will be back!
author: Stacey R.

description: Their GARLIC FRIES? BOMB DOT COM.
author: Laine C.

description: Nice central location. Good menu selection. Good drink selection. Nice bay views at seating. Fun atmosphere. Nice staff.
author: Cherie S.

description:
Came here for the first time since it was my best friend's Birthday (Saturday), it was pretty crowded but the wait was only 15 minutes. When it was our turn to get seated they sat us down outside between a couple and a family, it sucked because I could hear in both sides of the conversation.

Anywho, lets talk about food. So, since it was my friend's Birthday the manager (I believe?) talked her into getting a beer, we didn't really pay much attention to what the name the beer was but he had told us it was from Hawaii, something Kona(?), it was alright it actually reminded us of a more fizzier Corona if that makes any sense, a glass of that was $8!!! 

I ordered the grilled chicken burrito, it wasn't all that great. It had bean, grilled chicken, and that's pretty much all I can remember (not memorable what so ever), it also came with some chips but no salsa! FAIL.

My friend had gotten "The Beach Club", which looked pretty good! It had 5 rolls of turkey, between sourdough bread, onion, tomatoes, lettuce... Additional avocado for $1 and a side of friends ($10.95), not bad for a sandwich especially for a spot like this.

The thing that really rubbed me the wrong way was that when the couple that was sitting next to us left, some random guy with a glass of red wine just walked up and sat next to us and kept staring at me when I was eating! It was really rude so I turned to him & asked him what he was looking at and his response was "You have such a beautiful face and such a nice body", I was like "WTF?!", he wouldn't leave me alone!!! My friend & I started telling him off but he just sat there smiling at me and looking at me as though I was a piece of carcass and he was a hungry vulture! Finally he got the point and walked off & our waiter finally returned & I had told him what happened, he told us that he'll make sure that guy doesn't sit there & as he left to go back to the kitchen the creeper came back & kept complimenting me! That was my last straw! My friend & I kept yelling at him & he finally left. UGH!!!!

Another thing that confused me was that they had given my girlfriend a Birthday dessert (usually restaurants give small ones for free) but I was charged $6 for that! If I knew it was $6, I wouldn't have even told him it was her Birthday since we were already getting irritated with this place!

Overall, our bill came out to almost $50. We paid for my burrito, her sandwich, a beer and her Birthday dessert that we never even ordered. This place gets a 2 star. Decent food, decent price, weirdos, and sad that we had to pay for a dessert we didn't order. Never coming back.
author: Phoebe T.

description: One of the quickest and cheapest fast food at Fisherman's Wharf. Its also prpbably the only one around that serves pizza by the slice. The taste varies and if it were consistent, I would have given it 5 stars. On weekends, there is not much seating around unless you want to dine in and then you have to wait. The service is quick and love the onion rings and Margherita slice.
author: Zaki S.

description: The atmosphere inside is really fun! However the food is pretty average. I probably won't come here again ):
author: Hannah P.

description:
I'd call it a diamond-in-the-rough but it's literally on Pier 39 so I can't really say that.
However, you might walk past this place a hundred times and comment on how cool their little beachy walk-up bar is or how clever their Wipeout To Go truck looks plastered on the side of their building but if you've never walked in, you're truly missing out on my Pier 39 budget-friendly favorite.

Pier 39 has really stepped its collective game up and I've noticed an up-scale new wave of restaurants has matched their pricey shops so it's refreshing that a place like Wipeout still makes the cut! It seems they've earned their keep with friendly service, pretty good food and outside eating accommodations.

Is this the place to get world-class oysters in a half shell or that "fresh" ahi tuna tar tar that sounds so elegant when you order it? No. But if you're in the mood for some tropically-inspired comfort food, you've got nothing to lose. They pretty much had me at Anchor Steam beer-battered fish 'n chips but I decided to get a turkey burger -___- (it was awesome though). Luckily I have an awesome girlfriend who got the fish 'n chips and after one bite, I was hooked.

I can't speak on the rest of the menu, but the coconut shrimp were some of the best I've had that weren't in Hawaii and the turkey burger would definitely be something I'd order again if I hadn't known what their fish 'n chips tasted like. Great seasonings, everything cooked/fried to golden perfection, friendly staff and we got to enjoy it all outside on their plentiful seating area. 

What else do you want? You're in San Francisco, enjoy your day, just stop here at some point.
author: Michael S.

description: Surf themed joint right as you start strolling down the pier.  Bartenders are always in a good mood (possibly from the constant beach themed music playing) and the service has been good on the couple times I've stopped there. If your on the pier and looking for a drink, some nice background music and people watching - this is the place.  Take a seat at the bar and enjoy the show.
author: J L.

description:
Mediocre place with bad food. We went there for dinner and ordered calamari and chips and some pasta. The staff was friendly, however the food was was awful; pasta was under seasoned and the sauce was watery... it almost seemed like microwaved pasta. The meat in the sauce was dry and tasteless... obviously frozen.  My dish, calamari and chips, was not better but at least eatable. Calamari was a little chewy and seemed fried in old oil. The fries were OK... 

I wanted to try the place just for the location... but i will not return and i will not advice anyone to go there.
author: Ashish N.

description: good food but pretty expensive. I had the coconut shrimp, my boyfriend had a burger, very good but not worth the price. We also had some clam chowder. he had a beer and I had a super tasty sex on the beach. for the two of us our bill was over 80 bucks not including tip. typical bar food should not be this pricey.
author: Arianna L.

description:
Came here because the menu looked good and looked like it there was a variety for the 6 of us. I ordered the chorizo and chicken pizza. The meat on the pizza was dry and nasty. The kids ordered chicken tenders and we had to ask 3 different people for ranch dipping sauce. We first asked Alexa who has no personality and doesn't smile once. Joyce was our first waitress. Thanks to Jesus we received the ranch dipping sauce. When we first say down and ordered we asked for 2 checks since we both had plastic only. When the bill came it was in 2 checks. We sent it back and requested for 2 bills.  We noticed that there was a 18% gratuity added on to it.  The manager came over and asked if everything is ok.  We asked why there was tip already included it. His response was that if there was more than 6 people tip is included. Well that means if it is 7 or more tip is included. We had 6 people. Most places advertise that if have a group of XX or more then tip would be added on. There was nothing indicating this.  Don't get me wrong, I don't mind paying 18% tip, but the service would have to be great, not bad.  The manager was nice but Alexa makes it so we will never return there.

P.s. inspect your water before you drink it.  My friends husband found a seed in it when he was done and no there was no lemon in the water.
author: Teresa G.

description: The food was great. I had the clam chowder in a bread bowl and pepperoni pizza with black olives and obviously a soda. The food would probably be the only reason why I'd ever come back, but next time I would ask for take out because customer service was horrible. My family of ten and I went the Aquarium of the Bay so we all got the 15% off discount in our ticket. Our waiter was named Wilfredo. Before we even ordered our food, we had mentioned to him that we were going to have separate checks. When so, he signed as if he was annoyed. We only mentioned it once. I'm a cashier at a restaurant as well and I understand people have bad days, but it's still no excuse for you to rub it off on your customers especially if they don't deserve it. Anyways we finally got our food and like I said, I was extremely happy with my food! Not once did he come to our table to ask if our food was good or if we needed refills. Nothing, but he had no problem asking the tables next to us. When we were done and got our checks, we were each gonna use our ticket for 15% off of each check, and again he didn't hesitate to groan. We all got our checks back and only 2 of the checks were taken off 15% when it clearly said on our ticket..anyways I would definitely appreciate it if you retrain him for customer service because even if you have to fake it, you do it. All of us left a bad tip because honestly he did not deserve anything higher.
author: Karoline C.

description: The hubby and I were looking for someplace to eat after the Alcatraz night tour and stumbled upon this place. We ordered the garlic pizza bread and one of the burritos. The food and service were quite good. Prices were a little high, but that tends to be the trend in The city.
author: Robin W.

description:
The one thing that attracted me the most about this spot that it was the first spot upon my arrival on Pier 39 that had a patio area to eat. Then it was the people, the people that this place attracts. How it was decorated, what they offered opened to people who are casually dress and could afford a tasty meal.

So after we walked along the Pier, we headed back out to this spot to have lunch. We were a bit confused on where the entrance was. There was a separate windows to place order to go. Then another door to the patio from the inside. The actual door for us to get seated was located at the very front.

Not surprisingly, it was incredibly busy. I asked the hostess how long is the wait. She responded, "10-15 minutes." "Oh okay. Party for two (2) please." "Sure." They started to call out names one after the other. So if you weren't around when they called it, you missed your chance at a table. They went through it quick. As if they didn't have patience. So instead of us waiting for 10-15 minutes, we only stood there for a few minutes. =]

It was a beautiful day; the weather was perfect. It was noisy but very relaxing. Our server was Breaker. He greeted us with a smile (plus!) and helped us right away. Gave us the right amount of time to pick out our entree selection and served us our drinks and food at a fair timely matter.

I ordered the Grilled Salmon Salad (no dressing) and the Boyfriend ordered the WipeOut Fried Combo. When the my salad came out I was disappointed on the size of the salmon. However, the taste of the salmon was juicy and perfect. It is the best salmon I tasted at a bar & grill by far. I tried some of the boyfriend's dish and it was definitely delish.

The service was excellent, the dish is good so I definitely would recommend this spot to others again. I wish there wasn't as much pigeons there. I felt like my food was going to get pooped on. Hehee.
author: Cathy N.

description:
A couple of us were on Fisherman's wharf hungry and ready to sit. I have not personally been to Pier 39 before so everything was new to me. We decided to get fish & chips since we were so close to the waters. We decided to come to Wipeout Bar and Grill. I had the Wipeout Fried Combo ($15.95). It included A LOT of calamari, one or two pieces of fried fish and two skewers of coconut shrimp. The taste was pretty much standard as compared to other fish & chip places, but it was a tad oily for me. The sauces that came with the meal were delicious- I like the sweet sauce. This place isn't a place I'd crave to go, but it satisfied my stomach since I was hungry. The staff was really friendly and the service was pretty fast. It's convenient and there's inside & outside seating. I think it's a family-friendly place, but I wouldn't come here on a date or anything.. just a casual hang-out kind of place.

Final verdict? I may want to try somewhere else, but if I can't find anything else better, I'd come back.
author: Eri K.

description:
Came here for lunch after taking my daughter to the aquarium right next door. It was PACKED, but they still got us sat in a pretty timely manner. Our waitress was very sweet, but a little slow--understandable considering how busy it was. I ate the Salmon BLT, which was about what I was expecting it to be. It was good, the bacon was perfectly crisp, but it could have used a little more sauce. I found it to be just a little bit dry. I would still order it again. The manager came by to check on us about halfway through our meal--nice to know that the supervisors are doing a good job of making sure things run smoothly. 

Also: I noticed on my daughter's menu there was something about a discount on tickets for the aquarium. Good to know if you're looking for somewhere to eat BEFORE you go in there :)
author: Meagan E.

description: Everything was perfect, we enjoyed our lunch here.. Burgers were amazing!  My son also enjoyed his cheese pizza, it was pretty big for a personal pizza but he wasn't complaining.
author: Wendy G.

description:
Our little family of 4 decided to have a "family fun day" summer got away from us. So San Francisco here we come. We first went to the California Academy of Science (review to come), and worked up an appetite and decide to head down to Fisherman's Wharf, luckily we found parking across from Pier 39 and proceeded across the skywalk. After checking out a few places, we decided to eat here (daughter HAD to have chicken tenders). 
The wait wasn't to bad for a Saturday at 2:00pm, maybe 20 minutes top. My wife ordered the same as our "princess", which were 4 or 5 strips of REALLY juicy, crispy chicken. They did say that the fries were so-so, and I don't think either one touched their coleslaw - too bad, I liked it just fine. Our son had the chili cheese dog which he devoured within a few minutes (as like any other 17 yr. old would). The only issue he had with eating outside here, was that the birds were freaking him out, LOL!. 
I had the Sesame Seared Tuna bowl, which at $17-18, I thought was a little expensive for lunch. Then our waitress, Gabby, brought it out and that question left me as soon as I tried the wasabi aioli topped, ginger smothered, ahi tuna. It was all resting on top of stir-fried veggies and coconut rice. This dish was GREAT!!! The freshly cut tuna was perfectly cooked to just above rare, and the crust wasn't overpowering. I'm not a veggie/rice person, but they were well seasoned and the rice was just right. If I could have (without embarrassing my family), I would have licked my plate clean :)

Kudos to the chefs, cooks, and wait staff, you ALL made our day by making us feel at home :)

P.S. Don't forget to have your parking validated before you leave. It saved us almost $20.00!
author: David E.

description: Fun place to eat, drink and watch some tv! It's sort of a touristy type of place but I enjoy going in here when I visit Fisherman's Wharf. I've always had great food and service and I love that their bathrooms are actually clean!!! Great place to unwind and take a break from all the walking and shopping.
author: Dusty N.

description:
I've been here a few times and it's always a fun place to stop.  The staff is great!  We usually stop for beer and appetizers and they are always good.  

My husband and I just stopped by this past Saturday and had the coconut shrimp - they actually were not that great but okay.  

Again, it's a fun place to stop with lots of energy and friendly staff.  Nice outside seating and fire pits in the heart of Pier 39.
author: Annette P.

description: Total tourist trap. The calamari was the only thing was ordered and it was a complete miss.
author: monica s.

description:
I was just here during business travel. I had the Steak and Shrimp Bowl, which was far better than I could have expected. I definitely recommend this to anyone who comes, as long as they like the flavor of coconut (which was very apparent in the rice).

Having just flown in from a snow storm in the northeast, it was a welcome experience to sit at the outside bar and enjoy my San Francisco beer with my food. The bar tender was very friendly and we held a little conversation, which is always welcome when I am 2000 miles from everyone I know. 

The service was very good, the food was excellent, the beer was cold, and I could sit at an outside bar and soak up the warmth; what else could someone want? 

Location, food quality, service, and overall experience make this a fantastic place to visit on the wharf!
author: Christopher L.

description: The garlic fries were great. I tried the veggie pizza, and it was very ordinary. Overall the food was decent. But service was good.
author: Arjun K.

description:
Was in the area, liked the look of Wipeout so we went. 
Ordered their Wipeout Burger, it was great! 
Margaritas were exceptional quality as well. 
Would definitely go back.
author: Alton J.

description:
Just got some calamari and fries to go before I headed to my Alcatraz tour. 

The food was good, but nothing out of the ordinary. Would prolly try another place next time.
author: Dominique F.

description: We came here a few times during our trip to SF to grab a drink. We sat in the outside patio near the fire pit. The crowd watching is great here. The staff is low-key and friendly. The Mai Tai's they serve are tasty and strong and do the intended trick of taking the edge off. YUM!
author: Loren M.

description: Long wait on basketball finals night. Finally seated outside and random person sitting at our table who was not happy to move. Same person decided to stand in front of us blocking the tv with the final 10 min of the game on. Hubby politely asked him to move, he dos for a moment and returned. Hubby asked again, this time less polite. Same scenario.  Hubby stands in front of him and random guy gets rude.  Calls cops. Turns out, random guy works there. Needs to be fired for how he treats paying patrons. Meal comp'd  after hubby asked to leave by cops.  Food good and our server was great but wow!!  They need to rethink who they hire
author: Leslie P.

description:
Starting this review after sitting here for 17 minutes. No one has approached me. I was seated right away, so I assume it is not busy. 

Ok. 23 minutes and waitress (I know politically correct "server") ask if I want something. Really. 

No I just thought I would sit here and watch everyone else eat. But I was polite. 

I ordered a drink and she says "do you want to eat"????? Where are these people trained. 

Timing. Clam crowder and drink. 4 minutes. Starting to recover. Clam chowder is actually good. I think they are connected to the place above here. Looks and tastes the same 

Recovering. Had the teriyaki salmon bowl. And was tasty. 

Come if you like but not great service.
author: Joe T.

description:
Everytime, I've visited Pier 39-- I've passed by this place-- and thought, hmmm, "i wonder if this place is good; there's always a lot of people and it looked like a lively crowd.  

So last night, I made an executive decision for the family and went there for dinner! I'm glad that I've passed up on this place before.  The servings were small.  I ordered the appetizer plate for my meal, it was barely enough to feed me or even share!  What got me the most is the fact that their signature item was their breadbowls-- and yet they ran out of the bread!  Rather than offering an alternative to make up for it, the wait staff seemed to have this, "OH WELL, too bad" attitude to them.  

It seemed to take forever for our drinks to be refilled. We found out later that their soda machine went flat and they had to change it out.  Isn't that something your staff is supposed to be checking on regularly?  Seems like poor planning on the food order for the weekend. 

The wait staff wasn't the friendliest. I completely understand that it is Thanksgiving weekend and you probably had better things to do than to work, but come on--- that's the whole deal with food service!
author: Michelle P.

description: Not incredible but not too bad either. Service is prompt and friendly - food is ok. Nothing to write home about.
author: Naresh R.

description:
I went to San Francisco 2 weeks ago, after wondering around Pier 39 we started to get hungry. We looked at the menu out on the pier and I was attracted to the sweet and sour calamari. Sadly, that option was unavailable but I still opted for regular calamari. It was still good and appetizing, my bff was into it. 

Great waiter service, the guy we had kept coming by to check up on us and see if we were ok or how our food was. Oooh I love there watermelon splasher drink, it tasted so good but sucks you cannot get any refills on those. Anyway it taste like pop rocks which was amazing :)

So I got the taco salad and it was pretty amazing. I've had different types of taco salad and from all of it I kind of prefer this one. Most taco salads have beans at the bottom this didn't. Although would love to have a bit more greens and sour cream in it but it was still great.
author: Rose S.

description: I came to San Francisco for the super bowl and while waiting on friends to arrive I stopped in to have a beer and some lunch. Really enjoyed the quick service and the great fish and chips. The next day my friends and I went in again and were welcomed by first name from the day before, which really made in feel good. I highly recommend this place!
author: Tom W.

description: My partner and I stopped over to see what all the fuss was about.  The place is busy but the staff is friendly. The margaritas are fantastic ( I recommend  the patron margarita 23 oz. you'll feel no pain). The fried calamity  was edible at best. I've had better in worst places. however the fish and chips made up for it. Reminded me of the greasy type I used to eat when I lived  in UK. This is not heathy so don't try it if you're watching your cholesterol. My partner liked the shrimp and steak bowl. To me the coconut rice was good but the stake was a cheap cut with too much fat.. He didn't let me try the shrimp so we'll take his word for it that it was good..  I skipped Hard Rock Cafe cause it is too commercial n the menu is bland.. This one is not too far behind it now..
author: Martin W.

description: Ewe. we got an order of onion rings and fried calamari (both lacked flavor and were mostly breading), clam chowder in a bread bowl (was alright), and a seared tuna bowl (the tuna was dry and bland. The only thing that was good was the broccoli) and a soda. The bill was $50...not worth the "meh" service and def. not worth the food
author: Lauri P.

description:
This place is so cool to just hang out and get away from the rest of the city. Lucky me, found a cool bar to watch the Giants game and drink a couple of beers though, there was no happy hour. Loved how the game was displayed on a large screen which divided the restaurant into a bar and the other half was the seating area. Loved how this place has an outside seating area since they're located in the pier. 

Their decor is so different and unique, def fits the name of being a wipeout bar! The bathrooms were even super cool! It was almost like being in a beach-y scene. 

Anywho, the Blue Moons were super, super good and large in portion. I only had 2 of 'em to get me feeling a little tipsy. Wow. I just ordered appetizers, popcorn shrimp, fish n chips, wasn't anything special.

What I want to applaud is the excellent customer service. David was really funny and took great care of us even though I was just there to chill and watch the game, he didn't ever forget about me and if I needed anything. He was super funny too! So if you're lucky, ask David to be your waiter!
author: Christine F.

description: This is my favorite place to go when I'm in San Francisco. Their food is amazing, and their service is great! The workers are all nice and we always feel well taken care of.
