author: Pita S.

description:
This is an interesting bathroom...

First of all it's behind a circus tent looking thing, maybe they are going for a cabana look, but it looks like a circus tent

Instead of a men's room and a women's room, there's five doors and a coed washing area..very strange. In each of the doors is a toilet with terrible toilet paper. 

The coed wash area, has enough sinks, but only two paper towel machines.

Still, for the unique factor alone, I had to give 3 stars.
author: Bathroom Critic W.

description: This is one Place you don't want to Miss while at Pier 39. Its conveniently  Located by the Front as you make your way in to Pier 39 ( NOT TO BE MISSED). They Have good Selection of Food. My Friend from another country said..Im not a Seafood Lover...I said..No Problem...they Have Pizza Galore...To My Amazed .He Finished 2 Whole Pizza !!! Side of Sweet Potatoes too.(.Make it 2 sides!! ) I'm Not a Burger Eater..but Try their California Burger...Its a Must !!! My Once a year Burger is Worthy at this Place.. while you enjoy the View of Golden Gate or simply Watching People Wonder around...SERVICE !!! Yes...Juana Our Server...Came to each of her Table not once but 3 rounds!!! She Treats Her Customers with Smile...I Highly Recommend this Bar and Grill ...
author: Donovan L.

description:
Great fish tacos.  We stopped here because they had mac&cheese for our son and we were hungry (and they validated parking). We enjoyed the decor, music, and drinks and our son was happy!. Would recommend!!!  

JRU was our waiter and he was awesome!  Very accommodating when the mango splasher drink was no longer available so he brought the raspberry which was the other drink I considered.  He brought out our son's meal early as well.  Overall, good service, good food and good music/decor!
author: Nicole P.

description: We sat at our table for 20 minutes before anyone waited on us. When our food came it was cold, never was offered refills. And when it came to getting our bill, that was another 20 minutes. And to top that the birds are above you and pooped right next to where my daughter was sitting.
author: John M.

description: Been here before. Food was good. Came back ordered steak taco salad. Sucked! Ive never had a sweet taco salad. Plus it was 15$ -_- officially over this place. Leaving most of my food. Overpriced for quality offered.
author: Lyssa R.

description: Terrible food! Completely tasteless except for the 2 cups of garlic dumped on. Also bad service, twice different waiters came to our table with food & drinks that were not ours. Awful.
author: Rachel G.

description:
I never go to the wharf area unless I
I have family and friends in town. Given that I had both in town, we came and walked around the pier, went sightseeing and stopped in for dinner on Saturday. Honestly at this point we were exhausted and just looking for a quick bite before heading home. We came in and had the most amazing time here!! Wyatt was our server. He was hilarious, quick, and really made our experience. My grandma had a blast with him. He made her feel like she was in her 20's again. She is still speaking about how much fun she had and didn't even speak on the food. We all shared food which worked out great as all portions were large and sharable. We had the combo with fish, calamari, and coconut shrimp. The sauce that came with it was really good. We also had the burritos--good but really spicy with the sauce on top. I would definitely recommend this place for a fast and fun dining experience. Thanks Wyatt! Thanks Wipeout!
author: Kat S.

description: Went to visit and order fish and chips. The  waiter was not very tentative to us. I have notice the previous manager who was there about a year ago. He always greeted us and gave us great and fast service. I feel like since he left, the service has been very down and quality of food as well. This was my 2nd time coming in the last two months. I use to recommend this place but not any more. I hope the direction of operations contact me about this bad quality of service.
author: Michael B.

description:
The Bay Area has been having some odd weather this Summer, but visiting Wipe Out Bar & Grill restaurant at Pier 39 SF on a Saturday afternoon made the trip worth while. My rating is really 3.5-stars, but I'll round up.

WHEN: Saturday 7/16/11, 3pm-ish

WHERE: Pier 39 SF, ground level to the left, to the left. One of the 1st large restaurants upon walking into the Pier 39 area. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iaKZgEBfD4Ak4OR2vNKFrg?select=AXmgUpz3tlJyLZombPS7BQ

LAYOUT: Very casual seafood/burger spot. Spacious seating for ppl of all shapes & sizes. Kid friendly, handicap friendly, & senior citizen friendly. Armless chairs & all table seating; no booths. Indoor & outdoor seating.

CUST SVC: GREAT friendly & helpful staff! From host/hostess, to our Waiter-Willy, to food server, to the next employee directing you to their uni-sex bathroom area or the host/hostess stand. I've been here now 2 times, & both times have been great cust service. Keep up the excellent work team ^_^

VISIT: My cousin recently had a birthday & wanted to eat @ a seafood spot in Pier 39. It was a pretty crowded Saturday afternoon @ Pier 39. After viewing a few restaurants, pricing, spaciousness, & wait time, we opted for Wipe Out Bar & Grill. Wait time for party of 3 (me, sis, & cousin) about 15-20min...got seated in 10min dinning inside ^_^

EATS: Overall, all our eats were quite enjoyable! Fresh & hot. Drinks were pretty damn good too.

$10 Giant 23oz Alcoholic Drinks (Tasty Wave, Pina Colada, & Shark Bite) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iaKZgEBfD4Ak4OR2vNKFrg?select=hor38iAPUHLP4jSBu7bvCw
Great recommendation by our Waiter-Willy! Cousin & myself are light weight I guess, or we didn't enough in the morning 'cuz 1/2 through our drink my sis said we both looked buzzed. They were still good though.

$9.50 Glazed Pork Ribs (apps) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iaKZgEBfD4Ak4OR2vNKFrg?select=9nMc-1EQIXBzIdLV3HOSxw
Not bad. Sauce made your finger tips worth sucking on. Had some bite; not fall off the bone...some ppl prefer that, but no biggie w/ me. Meat cooked just fine.

$4.25 Cup of New England Clam Chowder http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iaKZgEBfD4Ak4OR2vNKFrg?select=muBhVQPG7vwOvpxQVi9K4Q
Also good & worth my recommendation. Stayed hot to the last scoop. Hot, creamy, & fulfilling.

$15.95 Wipeout Fried Combo (fish, shrimp, & calamari) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iaKZgEBfD4Ak4OR2vNKFrg?select=zfrBx4zUYLNAZ7b7-3vRUg
My cousin enjoyed this. Portion size plenty, hot, & fresh...she couldn't finish it actually.

$9.95 Bread "Chili" Bowl & Salad Combo http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iaKZgEBfD4Ak4OR2vNKFrg?select=F4RIg0EYkU73NecZgG7sRw
Sis went this route, but there was plenty more she wanted to try so she'll be back. Salad was over dressed w/ dressing, but chili bread bowl was pretty good.

$11.95 BBQ Chicken Pizza http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iaKZgEBfD4Ak4OR2vNKFrg?select=68oDljVQ3fVVVmeVqKDiUw
Yeah, I got pizza. I had a seafood item last time & was pleased so thought to try other. Glad I did. Really enjoyed the chicken on this pizza, more bbq sauce on pizza than I expected, but I'm not complaining ;-) No take home here, I finished everything!

FINAL TAB: So party of 3 we spent $94.84 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iaKZgEBfD4Ak4OR2vNKFrg?select=oBD_yGxYcMtlhkyvKg753g My cousin was happy having her birthday late-lunch here w/ sis & I. Of course this place will always be a considerate line up for me when visiting Pier 39...now I've recruited 2 more fans for 'em. Think I got my eye out on their burgers in my next visit *tee-hee*.
author: Mary J.

description: Terrible service and disrespectful. I waited for a server for 20 mins, then politely let a waitress know no one has come to our table yet. An hour later no one has even asked us if we would like water. I approached a waitress about this and said I feel very ignored and she said," oh would you like a menu". No apology or explanation for why everyone else in the restaurant has been served but us.  After expressing what a terrible experience this was for us she said "oh, ok".  Will never go again.
author: Yassmina M.

description: Came here with my boyfriend to grab a quick appetizer and some beers. The food was good, but the service was slow since it was packed which is understandable. Our waiter was really nice.
author: Tanya R.

description:
If you like a nice fire on a beautiful San Francisco evening with wait staff that makes sure you always have a drink...this is the place.

I never tried the food though...
author: Bill W.

description:
Came in starving. 

Food- the garlic fries were amazing!! Lots of garlic and done perfectly!! Absolutely loved them :) the entrees however were just ok. BBQ chicken pizza the chicken was definitely over cooked and flavor just ok. Carne asada burrito - no salsa with chips kinda a bummer. Burrito itself just ok. 

Drinks- wipeout margaritas were awesome :)

Service- on it! Filled my water after it was out really really quick. Super friendly

Atmosphere- don't particularly recommend kids but can. Noisy but very sportsbar feel for sure.

Side note - long wait for bathroom on weekends
author: Jennie G.

description: food was disgusting pls don't come here. poor quality with high expenses. abort. The turkey meat was deli school meat. The bacon was impossible to bite into. The cheese... o god. The food was flavorless. My friends food was dry or too messy to even eat. The french fries literally had no potato it was just crusty. I am not a picky person but this was sad.
author: K P.

description: Place is awesome food is good and big portions atmosphere is just like it should be for being at the bay... Great beer selection witch is always important to me... Def bring other people here when I come back ... Service was good didn't bug us just did her job
author: Justin G.

description: Very good bar food with a fun and youthful Surf ambiance. Fun and touristy. Good for kids.
author: Andrea K.

description: Love the outside atmosphere. Steak nachos were so delicious!!!! Drinks were great as well. Must visit !
author: Nikki G.

description: Had Dinner last night, food was good but service was great!!! Our server Josh recommend a new beer which we loved :) ! We'll be back for some Wipeout Lager!!
author: Matt T.

description: Had a great experience here. When I come to Pier 39 I usually do hard rock cafe or bubba gumps, but we decided to try out something new this time and were pleasantly surprised. Beautiful view, great burgers and margaritas... but what made this a Wow experience was our waitress. I believe her name was Kallie. She took all 6 of our orders by memory and knew a little something about everything on the menu. With people like that on their staff, this place has got to be doing something right besides just the food and location! We shall return~
author: Jonathan H.

description: Touristy ambiance and food was just okay when it finally arrived after watching other tables who arrived after us with larger parties get their food long before us. If I had read the Yelp reviews prior to patronizing this establishment I would have passed on it.
author: Andrea O.

description: Convenient. nachos and Hawaiian Burger and garlic fries coulda been better prolly wont go back
author: Serena G.

description: Terrible service. Dirty tables.  Awful food. Nasty door greeter. Just say no. And head to bubba Gump, fog harbor or boudin!
author: K K.

description:
There's nothing amazing about their food, or their menu. They definitely tried. I saw the effort when they put mango baby back ribs in their appetizer section, and decided to give it a try. Meh. Gave them another try when I came back a second time, this time for chili cheese fries... Ok I didn't specifically go there for chili cheese fries, but that (for some weird reason) was the most appealing to me at that time. Nope. Couldn't even finish a 1/4 of it.

My goodness, is there anything good about this place? Why did I give it three stars if I claimed to not have liked anything that I've tried so far? One thing and one thing only: garlic pizza bread. Whenever I went (the numerous two visits) I always had the opportunity to get this item for free thru mobile check-in or printed coupons. Either way, even if it wasn't free, I would still like them. And that, fellow yelpers, is the sole reason why I give this place three stars.
author: Christine C.

description: Bad service. Worst tasting food in San Francisco. We ordered some cheese burgers too and my kids left all of it too. Me n my wife will never eat here again we spend an average of 15 dollars per plate and it was disgusting
author: Luis G.

description:
I am giving it a 2* only because the service was good. Food was $$$ and meat in my burrito was hard to find...mostly rice and beans. Restaurant has a UNISEX bathroom which was weird. My daughter had to go so I got to follow her in their. About 90% female and a very strange experience. Just didn't feel comfortable letting a 9 yr old go in herself. 

They did validate our parking which saved $9. Good service, overpriced food and the USex bathroom add up to not a return visit for us.
author: Mike C.

description: I would agree with 3 stars-- one plate had to be sent back, and the first cup of coffee because it was too bitter to drink. The manager and staff took It off the bill and the staff was friendly but not too attentive. Good breakfast menu with am libations. Breakfast food was ok.
author: Carla-Marie S.

description: Josh, was amazing. Table for 9. Handled our group well. Even our kids were all happy as he kept them entertained. We will be back.
author: Jorge Z.

description: This review is long overdued but here we go. Don't get anything other than clam chowder. My friends and I had dinner here when we hung out in SF but it wasn't impressive. My friends ordered the appetizer sampler and they thought it was alright. We all shared an order of the garlic fries that everyone recommended, but it wasn't impressive. I ordered the Hawaiian pizza, and sure I should have ordered something else but they could have at least cooked the pizza properly, it looked and tasted undercooked, I couldn't even finish it. My other friend ordered a clam chowder and that was the only thing we all agreed was good. The service was good but the food was disappointing, especially for its price.
author: Vivian M.

description: got a couple drinks here and a deep fried platter of fish .. calamari.. etc your normal deep fried mixin of fixins.   drink didnt seem to have any alcohol in it (what else is new) but its in a cool location with alot of cool scenery inside the restaurant
author: Greg Z.

description:
Came here this weekend with my cousin who was in California from Kansas. So we took here to Pier 39, obviously, tourist central in San Francisco. When we were hungry for breakfast we were trying to find a place with simple (but good) food for a decent price, and we found that at Wipeout.

Pros:
- They had switched to lunch as we were being seated and they so very kindly let us still order off of the breakfast menu! (It was only 11am)
- Great and fast service! Michael was our waiter, he was awesome!
- Indoor and Outdoor seating
- Prices did not fit in with the Pier 39 ripoff theme, which was obviously fantastic.
- Sourdough French Toast (3.5/4 stars) 4 pieces of inch thick and perfectly sweetened sourdough, it was delectable!
- Carnitas Breakfast Burrito (3.5 stars) Yummy!

Cons:
- The pieces of bacon that were served with our French Toast combo were obviously not cooked to order. Thin, measly, and soggy bacon kind of sucked. 

Outside seating has a few heaters which is nice in the often foggy and chilly city. The inside has huge windows facing out towards the bay where you can people watch and see the boat tours. 

All in all we enjoyed our breakfast and left very satisfied, I will definitely be back one time when I am in the area.
author: Caitlin M.

description:
What an awesome place! At first the wait was 25 mins for a table. Two kids, all morning walking around Alcatraz... just wanted a place to sit & get some decent food. So we waited - only 10 mins, then got a good table, live music just down the pier. Seemed like we were off to a good start. Ordered some fruit splasher drinks for the kids and some calamari. Within minutes, our 6 year old knocked his drink over onto our 8 year old and like genies in a bottle two bussers & the manager were at our table cleaning up & getting our little one a new drink. Crisis averted!
Calamari came & it was super fresh & crispy. Ordered the chicken tacos - they were incredible! Tons of chicken perfectly seasoned, tasty salsa & amazing jalapeño sour cream. 
Super service from everyone especially our server Lisa. Really attentive, but never lingered for too long. 
Very impressed. Would absolutely recommend & come again!
author: Tamara S.

description: I am here as we speak im so beyond unsatisfactory of their service! I ordered my food the same time my sister did I got my food 15 minutes later && my sister was still waiting for her food 15 min later I asked them did they even start cooking it yet and they would ignored me started yelling at each other and than a guy that works there says I will have   .  Done in 1 minute at the point I wanted my money back and than they offered us just a soda && it took 10 more minutes til she recieved her food that came w 10 shrimp and a basket full of fries very dissapointed I will never come here again overall it took 25 min with no one else in line I wish I can rate it negative 0 NEVER AGAIN NOT WORTH THE WAIT OR MONEY!!!!
author: Ariela K.

description:
Sometimes, despite my best intentions, I sometimes wind up at Pier-39 and once there,  you gotta eat somewhere, right? My boyfriend LOVES-(I mean won't shut up) about Wipeout Bar & Grill. So, whenever we find ourselves nearby, I humor him and stop by for lunch. He always gets the same-the seared Ahi sandwich with fries, which seems enormous and is always a win for him.

I rotate what I get-there is not a huge amount of vegetarian items for me-they have a "veg head" pizza which is no better or worse than a frozen Elio's, I guess. Their veggie burger is decent-the fries are "trans fat" free so sometimes I will indulge-even though who I am kidding, they're still not great for me.
Heads up though, they will do some of their items such as the burritos and taco salad vegetarian style if you ask.

In my opinion, it's not great food-it's okay sometimes bordering on good. Expensive-ish considering the blandness of it, but cheap-ish if you consider the other options on the Pier.
Typically friendly service and the food tends to arrive ultra fast. 
To placate the BF, I find myself here a few times a year. It's not my first choice, but it will do.
author: Jennifer N.

description: Came in here because it's the only place on the warf I could find that had more than just sea food and I'm glad I did. The food is delicious and my server Natasha was awesome, very knowledgeable about the menu, good with recommendations and very friendly.
author: Tiffany T.

description: After a long morning my family and our friends decided to fuel up on lunch at this establishment. We noticed that a few tables outside were open so we decided to grab one seeing that we had two strollers (one baby sleeping in one). As the sign indicates you must see hostess in order to sit outside. I walked up to the counter to tell her we would be sitting at the outside table. She took one look at me and our party outside and said "no. You cant have strollers outside only inside". I was surprised since outside was much more spacious than inside. When I explained that we preferred outside since my baby was sleeping she continued to give me attitude and say we HAD to move inside. Since our group was starving we caved. Let me tell you inside was extremely tight. They continued to get on our case because our strollers were in the way yet they were the ones who told us to move inside "where the strollers belong". Never have I seen such attitude in a staff. I understand that this location must be stressful but it's not okay to take it out on the customers. Everyones food was okay though I enjoyed my French fries which lets be honest you can't screw up. I would avoid the nachos here. My husband and I agreed that they tasted sweet which is not how nachos should taste. If you have kids/babies/strollers avoid this place. They find you in the way of the other drunk diners.
author: Bri R.

description:
Sit your self! So we sat our selves, we were then casually being offered the bar instead. Odd, behavior,  however, after explaining the broken English manager there what "Sit your self" means, oh then it was "Jes okay we serve ju here!"  

Anyway shame on me for taking the Tourist Bait.
author: IrvnSandra F.

description: Decent food, pretty poor staff.  The hostess must of had a cold or something because she kept coughing and sneezing into her hands and did nothing to wash them or sanitize them. It was pretty disgusting to watch. The waitress could rarely be found... Our wait for everything; drinks, food, refills... was excruciating long.  And while she was at the table with us it was easy to tell her mind was on other matters.
author: David M.

description:
Please do not get trapped here. Tourists - I'm talking to you!

I ushered our group of 5 in here after a frustrating battle of where to go for brunch and I regretted it the minute they sat us down. 

We ordered the salad off the Special menu - it was simply steak pieces with lettuce and fired onions. When we asked them to change it to a regular salad - I was glad to see that at least they added tomatoes, and carrot shreds. But seriously?!? the special was crappier than something off the regular menu?? 

Their burritos and tacos are all things that can be found anywhere else. However, I've tasted better off a hot plate in the middle of Hollywood. 

The only good thing was our seating by the window where we could people watch. Unfortunately they seemed like they were all eating better food than we were, so that plus was negated.
author: Nahid D.

description: All I had was a bread bowl of clam chowder and it was amazing nothing like I had before it was so fresh tasting and creamy i would recommend you try it.
author: Tim R.

description: Went to this place for the first time and had the best waitress..her name is Callie and she was super nice and on point on everything. Gave us her opinion and everything..best first time ever....need more people like her around
author: Monique S.

description:
I really wanted to eat here because I thought the outside looked cool and "surfery". So I went in there for a few of my friends and ordered a burger. The meal was good however, our server was kind of rude to us.

After our food she came with our cheque, we decided we wanted to pay separate so we asked her could we split the bill. Her reply to us was "only if you want to wait".

I thought that was pretty rude. As I have worked in the food industry before as a server, I understand if she is busy, or if she is having a bad day.. However I saw her being super nice to other tables and I guess that's because, from looking at us, she knew she wasn't going to get a high tip from us as we are students. I don't think I would go back there again.

The food was good though. Pretty filling.
author: Emily I.

description: Food was pretty terrible. Sent the calamari back. The atmosphere is nice. Drinks are stiff. Typical tourist trap diner.
author: Boris G.

description: A Pier 39 must! Indoor or outdoor seating, great food and better drinks. The prices are low to average for the area. The number one reason to visit however is the staff. In a city where the staff of eating establishments tend to be haughty and pretentious this place is priceless, from the hostess to the servers and busboys, everyone is nice! Imagine that! Be sure to ask for Brandon if you want to feel like you're the best thing that's happened to him all day.
author: Sandra Y.

description:
It had been nearly 24 hours since I'd eaten, so Wipeout could have served me a plate of sea lion nostrils and I would have thanked them for it.  As it is, Wipeout is merely adequate, but I liked my server.

The place has a very Jimmy Buffett/Margaritaville quality to it, which would usually cause me to start throwing condiments.  But thankfully, I heard not a single Buffett tune, so the surf motif gets a pass this time.  There is a fire pit outside, which looked like it would be a cool place to eat.  As I was dining alone, though, I stood no chance of dislodging the baby boomers crowded around the flame.  No matter.  I pulled up a picnic table.

I started with a garlic pizza bread appetizer.  I was starving, so I needed something quickly.  The bread part of it was pretty good - light on the inside, crunchy on the outside.  But the sauce wasn't very saucy.  It seemed coagulated and dry.  The cheese was okay.  Still, I finished the plate.

I ordered the barbecue burger with garlic fries.  For burger that contains fried onions, pepper jack cheese and bbq sauce, it essentially had no flavor at all.  But most of the food I've had in SF has been exceedingly bland, so maybe that's par for the course.  Thumbs down, Wipeout.

The garlic fries were actually pretty good.  My server initially brought my plate with regular fries, but quickly returned with a basket of the garlic version I'd ordered.

By no means should you make Wipeout Bar & Grill a go-to dinner destination.  But if you're looking for some decent appetizers and a good atmosphere for a few drinks, it may hit the spot.
author: Ben B.

description: This place is great! The energy of the staff is amazing and make your experience so much fun!  Food is excellent and the outside fire pit is the best!  We didn't want to leave!  Also, the wait staff is so accommodating and will make drinks any way you want! Great place!
author: Nancy W.

description: Came here after receiving horrible service and blatant disregard from the manager at Luigi 's in Pier 39. Wipeout has great service. Fast kitchen. Tasty food. (Sidenote: Someone who isn't our server literally just walked by checking in on us). This should have been our first and only choice. Great place to try, whether you are a tourist or local, like myself.
author: Chondra K.

description: Great spot for a quick food stop. The fish tacos are good and they have excellent garlic fries. If you're looking for a quiet, relaxing spot to eat this is not the place to go. It is very loud and very busy.
author: Ashley Q.

description:
Came in and was seated immediately.  The food was great. I had the clam chowder in the bread bowl and house salad. Dressing was awesome.

The service was amazing.. all the staff was busy and helping each other. Would recommend!
author: Nilsa M.

description:
Good prices for the location.
Excellent service, our waiter was excited, friendly and super prompt.
Food was not gourmet but you get really nice portions and it still tastes pretty good.
author: Landon E.

description: We ate lunch here after our tour of Alcatraz!! My husband & I split the Teriaki pineapple chicken breast sandwich. It was served already cut in half and half the fries & pickle! Service was great and sandwiches too! Highly recommend
author: Susan H.

description:
Average food... Average/poor service... Nice view = 2 stars

Update: I increased the review from 2 stars to 3 stars because of the prompt response and apology from the manager after reading this review. The original review would have been 3 stars based solely on the food and atmosphere. I was impressed by a manager so in touch with Yelp and willing to reach out and talk to us about what happened to try to improve their service.
author: Todd C.

description: Wipeout is sort of a tradition for us. Every year on Christmas Day we go to pier 39 to see all the wonderful decorations and have pier food aka over indulge. We live in Marin and were sad to see our Greenbrae location close, low and behold our favorite manager Kiki is now working at the San Francisco location. It was so great to have our Christmas Day tradition and to see a familiar face. The patio is always crazy busy but the area inside is decorated with lively colors and a fun vibe. The huge pomegranate margarita is yummy!! And of course they have my favorite coconut shrimp.  My 7 year loves their kids burgers and fries, decent size too. Every time we gotta to the city to act as a tourist we will be sure to hit up this place.
author: Crystal V.

description: This place is amazing it's right on pier 39  and you could sit outdoors and watch everyone walking on the pier or sit inside and they've got lots of great variety of foods my favorite is the fish sandwich and they also have good customer service here so if you haven't been here yet Id recommend this place
author: Johnson Y.

description: Let's just say we had more than one waitress within our sitting. "You choose where you work." Leave the BS at home, don't share with your party that your having a bad day. Especially when you know that your party of 10 is traveling to your establishment to enjoy their Labor Day weekend with. Overall chowder was delicious but the service ehhh, you catch my drift.
author: Ariel C.

description: After deliberating over nearly a dozen restaurants, I settled on Wipeout. I sat outside and had a good view for people watching. I ordered the shrimp and steak bowl with coconut rice but at first I was brought the wrong meal and then there was an extra long wait (how hard is it to mess up when its just an order for one?). It started getting cold outside and I was uncomfortable. Finally the $17 meal arrived, it was a huge portion but...terribly salty. I was so disappointed after all that. But, from the looks of it, lots of better meal choices were on the tables around me so maybe I just didnt order the right thing here.
author: Jenn K.

description:
I have to say... I didnt expect to like this place since its in tourist hell. It was actually pretty good. 

If you can score the fire pit, you are lucky. It is a great place to people watch and get warm.

I wasnt thrilled with my food, but I ordered something I dont usually go for...so I blame myself. My husband got fish and chips and loved his.

The bartenders are all friendly (and drop dead beautiful!) and make great drinks. The little gift shop is cute too.

Dont let the unique unisex bathrooms freak you out, as they are CLEAN and private inside. 

All in all, I would say this little tourist trap is awesome and a great place for you to bring your out of town guests.
author: Blume S.

description: I visit often as I am a SF Local but I always avoid the weekends as I prefer the great service of during the week late night service when not many people are out. I will admit I have had to deal with pretty crappy servers in the past but for the most part they are good. I wish there was a second location somewhere closer to my home, like let's say oh the Mission. :)
author: G R.

description:
Was there for a breakfast at 9am probably the first group there that day! Since we had a tour of Alcatraz schedule for 11 am we decided to give this place a try since it seemed as if it was the only restaurant  open on a Monday. I had the bbq shrimp omelet to which I bragged about the whole day to my friends back in Los Angeles. 

our server was awesome she was very friendly and attentive! Perhaps it was because we had gone so early. 

Overall great place!
author: erick P.

description: Lisa was our server at Wipeout today. We are visiting from San Diego for a college graduation and I had a craving for garlic fries, and voila! Wipeout showed up on Yelp. Great food, great drink prices. Lisa was super funny and accommodating and fast. Although you're extremely busy she was awesome. Definitely got a tip and made the trip start off right. Thanks Lisa!!!
author: Madison S.

description: We love this place, primarily to have cocktails and sit by the fire pit and people watch at Fishermans Wharf.   We've eaten here before and it's a 3-star sort of solid meal but the vibe brings us back.  Highly recommend!
author: Rick R.

description: We couldn't decide where to eat so we came here because there was a little of everything.  The onion rings were undercooked, the steak I ordered had good flavor but was so tough I couldn't eat it, the burrito was laying in a puddle of grease.  This was my most disappointed in my birthday dinner!
author: Beni C.

description: Service fast and friendly, calamari nothing special-deep fried frozen.  Chicken Teri's bowl. DELICIOUS!!
author: Connie S.

description: Loved it. Got the fish and chips and they were priced right. In fact cheaper than other places close by. The staff was great and service was quick.
author: Manoj N.

description: I know this is a very touristy but good and tasty.  I especially liked the fish tacos and sweet potato fries.
author: Al B.

description: Food was pretty damn good - I got one carnitas and two carne asada tacos per our server's suggestion and WOW was he right! Wasn't really expecting much from a place on the pier as they're usually kitchy with only mediocre food, but this place for sure surpassed expectations! And to top it off, our server Brandon D, was freaking epic. Not only were his suggestions spot on, but he was super attentive and helpful with everything.  Food AND server make me want to come back!
author: Amy N.

description: Only giving this one star because the although the food was good, everything came out randomly and one thing at a time. Very unorganized and by the time everyone got their food, things were cold and inedible. Recommend eating at a taco stand outside of this area.
author: Sara M.

description:
We ate here on our last night. 

We got a window seat by the water and the service was great! I loved the clam chowder bread bowl!!!! YUMMY YUMMY! 

I ordered a mahi bowl which consisted of mahi, avocado sauce, coconut rice ( which meant plain white rice) and cucumbers.....YUCK! I was so dissapointed and couldn't even finish it. I am sure the bread bowl didn't help. Lol. It lacked any flavor. I think soy sauce would have done the trick but for 15 dollars it's not worth it. 

I liked the atmosphere and location so its worth a try!

Update since my last post..... The manager emailed me regarding my review and wanted to know ways to make things better. I thought that was awesome!!! For that I am changing my rating from 4 to 5 stars because that says a lot about management wanting to maintain their image and really caring about thier customers concerns!
author: theresa B.

description: Ate at this place twice. Once my friends & I came we decided to try it out. Food was great. Drinks were good too. I am a sea food lover so I had the fish and chips which was tasty. Friends had the burgers which they liked. Came back here a 2nd time with other friends. Might as well since service was good and food was too. Again excellent experience. I personally like how the menu has lots of options to choose from (food wise). If you don't like sea food then have the pizza or burger.
author: Meg O.

description:
As previously mentioned by others, the food was pricey and it was okay, but not special. We were seated promptly and it took a little while for our waiter to take our order, but after that the drinks and food came reasonably quick. I was not asked how I wanted my burger cooked, like at other restaurants. When it came in a plastic red basket with fries (trying to be like a food shack on the beach), it was huge and a little dry. The fries reminded me of McDonald's.
My son didn't think there was enough chicken in the chicken teriyaki rice bowl he got (he was able to substitute chicken for salmon from the kids menu, which is reasonably priced). 

It was nice enough and what we needed.
author: Lisa T.

description: Great meal on pier 39. Selection was good for family. Family of four with appetizer $80. Food was very good, fish and chips, clam chowder bread bowl, and cheese burger were all excellent, service was quick and people were friendly. I would definitely eat here again,
author: J C.

description: Let me just start off by saying getting good service in San Francisco is VERY hard to come by. My friends and I were so impressed by Roger, he is awesome! He was so nice and very helpful with ordering. Our drinks were brought out to us super fast and our food didn't follow very far behind. I highly recommend the pina colada, it's delicious. Thank again Roger!
author: Mel R.

description: Just left this place. Good food, but the staff: Josh, Paul and David were phenomonal!!!! Thanks sooo very much and Josh deserves a raise
author: Jen M.

description: Food is just okay. If you want a bread bowl of chowder, head to another spot. The atmosphere here is great though and the service is fantastic.
author: Robert G.

description: Coconut shrimp is yummy, salmon BLT was ehhh ok, chicken tenders for my son were good. Adult beverages were good but my blueberry drink was super sweet which I'm not into very much but I drank it. View was awesome and they have tv's for those who want to watch sports or anything else. We might try it again but try other places first.
author: Tony S.

description: Came back to Pier 39 recently with my new son to show him the sights and sounds and sea lions. Decided to stop by Wipeout as I remembered how good it was last time I was here with my daughter. I felt compelled to write this second review as it is rare for me to go back to a place and receive the same 5 star experience again. The wipeout burger here has started me on a blue cheese burger kick. It was so good that I had to share it with my son and I was fortunate to have this burger be his first time ever having a burger. He loved it. Like romantically. Jru was our server again, and I remembered him from last time, and just as last time he was fast, quick, and speedy with the service, refills, and answers to any questions. He is still great with the kids as he made my infant son giggle like crazy. He also didn't mind that my son was making a full on mess on the ground, which I always feel terrible about, unfortunately he is 8 months old and still working on his dining skills. The birds didn't mind the smorgasbord as we were outside on the patio and they cleaned up the mess tout de suite. Once again, I can not recommend a better place to anyone at Pier 39 for outstanding food and service.
author: Michael B.

description:
The California burger, which has bacon guacamole reminds me of something I'd find while strolling along the diners near Santa Cruz, that is the diners that existed before all the night clubs and posh wine bars that replaced them along the warf.

I've been here a few times after work to grab a bite and couple drinks, though it should be noted that while it has a full bar this place is super family friendly. The band that plays every now and again inside will often have to compete with children playing on the floor near the "stage" area.

I imagine parents really like this place.
author: Michael H.

description:
The location was great and the restaurant is placed at the beginning of the Pier, so easy to find. 
We took 2 hamburgers, they were good and peculiar. I liked the fries and service was really good, the waitress was lovely and nice. Prices were a bit high but in the average of the Bay Area.
author: Rossella T.

description: This is my first time coming here & I am very impressed with the food & service. The drinks are very reasonably priced & the food was delicious. The outdoor patio is very spacious & there are heat lamps to make it more comfortable. It is located very close to the entrance of Pier 39 so we are currently enjoying the live music which is great. Jesus was our server & truly made this a very enjoyable experience. We will definitely be coming back soon!
author: Jasmine R.

description: The food was great! The drinks were great! But Lisa was amazing! We are coming back to SF in two weeks and will be making another trip to Wipeout thanks to Lisa.
author: John B.

description: Went there w my three girlfriends had some drinks and the California burger! Great service the lady Juana was very helpful! Loved the atmosphere and the food was delicious!
author: Amber A.

description: I brought my son to San Francisco for the very first time. He hasn't tried the Clam Chowder, so I thought Pier 39's the best place to get it from. I surveyed all the other restaurants there and Wipeout just stood out because of their eclectic menu. Their Clam Chowder was good. Lots of clam meat in it, served hot at the right temperature. We had their Calamari, Garlic Fries and several entrees. My son loved the pineapples in his Chicken Teriyaki bowl. I ordered the Surf and Turf. The steak was cooked weird. I told them to make it "medium," but it turned out a combination of three kinds. The left part of the steak was a bit medium rare, red juice dripping out from it. The middle part was medium, pinkish brown. The right part of the steak was medium well, totally brown with a bit of charred surface. It was uneven. It came with veggies and coconut rice. The shrimp skewers were great. I was not a fan of the coconut rice, though. It tasted a bit sweet for me. I didn't like sweet stuff in my gourmet food. The calamari was good. The garlic fries, too, but I just think they over-did the garlic too much. Overall, it was okay. I'd come back. Service was attentive even though they were packed.
author: Sonnia K.

description: Food is better than posted. This may not be the greatest but there is a variety to choose from. The server Brandon was excellent. He didn't write our order out and it came out perfect. Service is great. Ask for Kaepernick look alike and you'll get Brandon. Excellent service.
author: Steve P.

description:
The food is average grill food that will fill you up but wouldn't force you to remember how good it is. Great location, I was sitting outside in the sun but the birds flying around the food drove me to go inside. 

The chicken sandwich is what I tried. It was a good sandwich given that I was hungry when I went into the restaurant . However, I see myself trying other places next time I visit this area.
author: Sami A.

description:
This place is super incredibly awesome, I stop by with my little dog and have a very good service thanks guys keep it up ;-) 
Ps very very dog friendly!!
author: Gabriel M.

description:
Who doesn't love theme restaurants with deep friers? (Apart from Michelle Obama who hates the fats). If you fancy on a high calorie meals from a can or box with a goofy name served by an art student that only Sallie Mae sees a future in, this here is the mess hall for you!

Onion rings cleverly wedged between meat patties for your offspring. Frilly pink drinks in plastic big gulp cups for you and the miss. TV screens playing 90s surf films for whatever demographic that is. 

When you go take a tinkle or re-apply your Wet'N Wild cakeface foundation you will notice that the restrooms are co-ed! What the heck? What's next? Gender equality? Its kinda radical and stuff. 

This place is ideal for kids and for parents wanting to simulate having your kids live at home well into their 20s. If you are lucky you can catch one of Pier 39's pan flute player. The outdoor seating feels just like a picnic table with all the ergonomic sophistication of a picnic table and all the conversation privacy of a picnic table in a dense city but one where gratuity is expected. Truly the best of both worlds, and one that is rife with a missing-foot pigeon infestation.
author: Gunner M.

description: I ordered the Salmon BLT with pesto mayo and it was absolutely delicious. Great taste, fresh, the combination is Salmon and pesto mayo were great.  We also ordered the fried cod fish sandwich, and it was good but not as good as the salmon.  Prices are reasonable compared to other restaurants in the area. Fun place to visit!
author: Patty R.

description: Came in on a busy Saturday and were seated right away.  Our waiter was awesome,  kept our drinks full and got our food out to us right away.  We ordered the calamari, and I would not recommend it here,  we actually ended up sending it back. We did the chili dog plates for lunch and they were awesome,  the chili was spicy and flavorful   All in all, I doubt I would eat here again, the great service is the only reason I give It 3 stars instead of 2.
author: Erika K.

description: Not my first time here but I did have the best service from my waiter David. He held me and my girl down with the A1 service. Definitely coming back. Great service = great food
author: Nick O.

description: Nice Busy Restaurant and shop on the start of Pier 39. Great Surf atmosphere, lots of TV's, tables fabricated from Boards....attentive wait staff, good menu, prompt service...fastest Bus Boy I ever saw....Nice Bar and Beer List....would go back!
author: Ray W.

description: The atmosphere, service, view and food here are awesome. I brought a few friends here who are from out of town and they had a great time as well. We had Grace as our server and she was amazing! Also made sure to check in on us and make sure we were taken care of. Very friendly gal and made our experience here that much better. Will def be back and bring my friends! We shared some fish tacos, coconut shrimp and garlic fries. All were excellent.
author: James H.

description: Absolutely disgusting. The worst fish tacos  I have ever had. I would rather eat mcdonalds
author: Matt C.

description:
The appetizer sampler was delicious and the clam chowder was good. My nephew didn't like his Mexican food but what do you expect from a from a place that does not specialize in Mexican grub

Word of wisdom do not order ethnic food from a typical American restaraunt because 9 out of the 10 times you will be let down
author: J P.

description: Great food, nice outdoor seating perfect for people watching, strong margaritas, and nice service. Angel was very helpful!
author: Renee G.

description: I was in San Francisco on Saturday to show a friend of mine around the city.  He suggested Pier 39 cause he had never seen it before.  The entrance to Hard Rock was right there and thats what we picked.  A young man sat us at an outdoor table, then disappeared.  It was like the Hard Rock had forgotten about us.  We started to get pretty angry, eventually leaving (of course they didn't notice us then either).  We moseyed to WipeOut and were sat.  Our waitress Ashley was wonderful and catered to our every need!  Hard Rock's waitstaff pales in comparison to the excellent service at this otherwise unknown restaurant.  Thank you again Ashley for making our trip pleasant.  Now my friend is in love with the wharf area, and I imagine we'll be back next time he's in town.
author: John C.

description:
Had a great afternoon watching a college football game and drinking delicious "California Dreams" created by the awesome bartender Michael. 

Grab a seat at the bar or outdoor patio, order some nachos and one of their signature 23 oz cocktails (!!!) and you won't be sorry!!
author: Nic S.

description: They won't accommodate a party of 11, or make a reservation unless you use yelp, but then it's only for up to 6 people,  they need to get it together
author: Angie G.

description: Paul, Brandon and Luis made our experience a memorable one. Our food was excellent but our service was impeccable!!! These guys are an attribute to your business.
author: Cory T.

description: Nice place to go to enjoy pier 39. The food is okay, the service is okay, the Bloody Mary's are DELICIOUS!!! Bottom line, this is a great spot to sit and people watch, not the best place to go for top notch food.
author: Shannon H.

description: Really good! Prices reasonable for the area. Staff was good, waiter actually shorted my buddy a $20 in change but was prompt in fixing it. Overall a good experience, but not worthy of a perfect 5 stars!
author: Nick B.

description:
Tourist Spot!! DUH, it's on the pier but you pay tourist prices...

We had drinks... large ones with a LOT of alcohol in them.  No complaints there of course!! Didn't eat but food looked good.  It's on the end of the pier so I am sure it is always going to be busy.  

We ponied up at the bar and was served by a fun outgoing bartender who quickly took our order and made us some tall margaritas!!! YUM!
author: Mike H.

description: Horrible. Gave us flak for wanting to sit at the bar rather than having a server. Finally the bartender took our drink orders, but then never talked to us again until we decided to just pay and leave rather than put up with that kind of service.
author: Erik D.

description: Feelin' the clam chowder. Fish was okay. Enjoy sitting outside along the water. Cool spot for quick & inexpensive pier experience.
author: Joseph S.

description:
I went here Easter Sunday with my father and best friend who were both visiting from out of town. We opted to park in the Pier 39th garage as we planned on doing a little walking around the piers after lunch. 

We were seated right away inside (too windy for me outside!) and had a nice window seat with a view of the bay, after ordering we enjoyed our soda and laughed until our Chips and Salsa arrived, Taking into consideration that this isn't a Latin restaurant, the salsa was fairly good.

Our food came out promptly even though they were fairly busy for lunch. 

My dad had the Tuna Ginger Salad, the Tuna was decent, a little tough in my opinion, but had good flavor. 

My friend had the BBQ Burger, she said it was good, but nothing to write home about. 

I had the Fish and Chips, I was disappointed. The fish was pretty dry and had very little flavor in the batter. I poured on the lemon and vinegar just to spice it up.

Our server was fantastic! Polite. Attentive. Informative. Friendly. 

Over all it was an A-OK lunch. I wouldn't dine here regularly, but it's a fun place to take visitors if they are at the Wharf.

They validate parking for the Pier 39 Garage.
author: Meghan L.

description: We came here for dinner on one of the first nights we spent in San Francisco during our honeymoon. We sat near a huge window in the back and had a gorgeous view of the bay at sunset. We even got to watch a thunderstorm roll in. Much more fun to watch than walk back to the apartment in, by the way. It's touristy and full of kids, but it's on the Wharf, so what do you expect? We went during the playoffs and they had the Giants game playing on the big screen near the bar. Our server was friendly and attentive, but not to the point of being annoying. I had fish tacos and thought they were super delicious. The Baja sauce was yummy and the margarita I got was HUGE. For the location, I thought the prices were very reasonable. It was actually the least expensive place we went to eat during our entire trip.
author: Melanie K.

description: I ate the Baja chicken tacos yesterday and I've been sick ever since. The service wasn't very good either. They gave us a small water cup and did not ask us for a refill throughout the meal.
author: Alexandra E.

description:
Boyfriend started craving for Fish and Chips... 

We went to this place after our little Alcatraz Night Tour Date..... 

We were seated right away....we requested to be seated outside.. I like how there are heat lamps everywhere....

The food was EH. The fish was bland and had outrageous batter. 
The fries was well fried and skinny..which i love.

The Server...was HIGH. seriously. we were seated and our food came..but our utensils came last. We had to request for utensils. Sweetheart, how am i going to eat my coleslaw without a fork. 

And when we asked for it.... She was like "oh, okay"... not even.. "oh im so sorry"....
i swear she must have had a sniff of something. she was red and kind of loopy.

Don't be fooled by the hype.....people are eating here because it's the first one they see at the wharf.... But really food isn't all that...
author: Monica H.

description: So my friends and I came here on a Tuesday night and let me just say, our service was AMAZING! We walked in and right away we got seated. Sadly though, we were seated next to the bathroom. Our food came out at a reasonable time and tasted fantastic! Our waiter, Brandon, was the one of the best waiters I've ever had before. He was very nice and was a great guy to talk too! Our experience was a very good one and we plan on coming back to Wipeout soon.
author: Anais S.

description:
Tried this place about a year ago.

I was expecting this place to be bad. But it was actually pretty good, considering that it was in Pier 39, and the last place you'd expect yourself to be eating at a burger place. Rather than going down to fishermans wharf to get a clam chowder. 

My boyfriend and I both ordered the "Wipe Out Burger" without bleu cheese.
the "Outrageous Onion Rings" and some "Sweet Potato Fries"

Service was okay, it wasn't that busy but our server did come around often to refill our drinks and check on us which I liked. Over all, I'd eat here again.
author: Kiyana D.

description: So many choices on Pier 39 and ended up at a surfing theme bar called Wipeout. I really liked the indoor/outdoor bar. It was a little cold out, so we sat inside. We were greeted by the bartender Michael and he really took care of us. I was jet lagged coming from Germany and all I wanted was a good local beer and some fish and chips. Michael went through the draft beer list and explained all the types you offered. Everything was delicious! We were never rushed and he answered all our touristy type questions. Thanks Wipeout and Michael for making day #1 in SF a blast!
author: Kirsten S.

description: Brought the kids here today to get pizza, chicken strips with fries and sodas. The part I went to was the wipe out to go. It's connected to the restaurant and where u order looks like a VW van. The prices and food was good, but service was so SLOW. Items like that don't take long to cook but we waited 25-30 minutes for the food! Other people were complaining too. Too bad, not worth the wait!
author: Kel F.

description: I had a jalapeño burger at while out, it was very well put together. The waitress I had (Lisa) was superior in her duties. She wore a helmet which at first was interesting, I later learned that she was special needs which is something that I whole heartedly support. More and more I see places in San Francisco which support their continued dedication to special needs employees- I appreciate and support their support and continues dedication to those in need of a place to work when they have no other options.
author: Matthew H.

description: Brandon is the man!  best server in town!  hands down.   The Ahi tuna was on point.  great environment!  fun place, good food, great service.
author: Joe J.

description: Only had the opportunity to sit at their bar and order a couple beers. Alright service (the staff was a bit on the chatty side amongst themselves). Closed out the tab and was out. Food looked standard. Nothing spectacular. Great location on the pier though.
author: Kelly G.

description: Rude bartender. I know he was busy. Shouldn't take 10 minutes to get a hello. Not worth a $10 beer.
author: Emma P.

description:
Perfect little indoor/outdoor bar in the heart of Pier 39! This place is awesome for a quick drink or bite to eat while your in the area being a tourist, shopping etc. If you have a big party meeting you they won't seat you until everyone is there but I guess that's understandable. The service was friendly, they kept coming back to check on us. They let us charge our phone using a nearby plug which was nice because I've been to some places that won't allow that due to "reliablility purposes". 

"4/5" only because I didn't try the food.
author: Robyn S.

description: Good drinks, good food, and excellent service by the manager, Christopher!! He was super friendly, came by several times to check on us, and offered to substitute anything we didn't like. It's nice to be appreciated and it makes me want to come back to places like this where great service is offered!
author: Angie E.

description:
Great Location. Patio. Coed Bathroom. Nice Server.

But...

We ordered a kids hamburger and kids pizza and two 23 Oz margaritas. Right now (next morning) my 8 yr old son is on the couch wallowing of food poisoning and still vomiting since last night. He threw up after we returned from the Fisherman's Wharf Pier 39. Hamburger and nasty all over the place. Not cool.

Secondly, the pomegranate margaritas were weak sauce. The glass is filled to the brim with ice so it was more like 10 Oz & watered down. And at $11 each. Total disappointment.

Will not return or recommend.
author: William C.

description: Our server Josh was amazing! Probably the greatest experience I have had with customer service ever. I have never felt so welcomed and comfortable at a restaurant. Kudos to wipeout for having servers like Josh!
author: Miguel B.

description: Our server was really attentive so this review isn't on her and the food was OK so it's not about the food either. It's about the jerks that greet you and seat you at the front. One specific lady who was calling every Asian person waiting for a table "Chinese". The place had a lot of traffic. Mostly to get to the restroom which isn't too far away from the  hostess booth, so after I gave them my name I stood in front of the booth for a little while hoping for the crowd to move along so I can relocate somewhere not so in the way. I can hear everything they say. I ignore the cussing. Then I hear the dude host ask the chick about who's next and she looks at the Asian family in front of us and says " those Chinese people" so the dude laughs and the other young girl there kinda giggles. I'm like why was that funny, but OK maybe I missed something. Then I hear them call my name and this chick goes "this Chinese girl right here". With a sort of  annoyance in her voice. I hear the dude laughing again so I turn and reply yeah I heard you say my name and the young chick's eyes get big and they all start fidgeting. Then dude turns on his super fake charm as if trying to make up for his ignorance and brings us to our table. You know that feeling you get when someone is trying to kiss @$$ to the max? He was trying so hard it was almost awkward. Anyway I asked our really nice waitress if I can speak to the manager but my husband and my teen child just asked me to stay calm and not let them ruin our time together. So I eventually built a bridge and got over it. I just got reminded because I read this news article about Bo Brice being called a "white boy". Then I got all heated again and remembered I never did a Yelp review. Anyway I'm not Chinese. And if I was, I don't see anything funny about that. I have no clue why that hostess made that comment the way she did.She was just ignorant. She doesn't belong in a fine establishment like this.
author: A F.

description: Went for Breakfast and sat at the outside Bar. Our Bartender/Server was Brooks. Dude was Awesome!!! Had a double Absolute Bloody Mary and the Huevos Rancheros. The sweet Salsa was amazing and the huevos ranheros were good A.F. the messier the better. So it was worth stopping by Pier 39 for breakfast at Wipe Out. Thanks Brooks!!
author: Kevin E.

description:
Speding two weeks in San Francisco with my family, we found this bar and grill during one of our walks.

Appealed by the music and the great atmosphere we came in. It was just SUPER! The waitresses with their huge (and beautiful) smile welcomed us after a few seconds!

We were starving so we decided to order one burger and two salads (thai style and chicken!) One word to describ these items: TASTY! I'm kinda picky when it comes to burgers but I was really enjoying every bite of my blue cheese burger! 

According to my brother and mother, their salad was also great and tasty, served in huge plate. Funny fact, the chicken salad was served in a plate made of one huge "taco chip plate". 

If you pass by Pier 39, I strongly recommand you to stop by and eat untill you're full! You won't regret it!
author: Miranda M.

description: Last night my friends n i were looking for something  to eat.  We could decide we decided try this restaurant on pier 39. Customer service was good! Fast service and food was good.  The wipeout margarita A+.  Outside sitting is available but wait is too long.
author: Yanni L.

description:
It was ok here.
This is my second time eating here. I usually like to eat outside on sunny days and luckily today was gorgeous outside! Anyways, there was a 10-15 min wait which wasn't that bad. The waitress checked on us continuously. The food was very fulfilling. I definitely like the calamari because it was very crispy. The clam chowder was delicious! Overall, I would definitely be coming back if I ever visit again!
author: Melissa A.

description: ....my son and I were about to head into the Hard Rock Cafe when we realized that it was only 10:45 am ....15 mins before it would open so we wandered a few steps and found wipeout with quite a few people sitting in the outdoor part of the restaurant.... We decided to go here instead.  I ordered the kids pancakes that comes with an egg and sausage for my son and I ordered the nachos with steak.   I took a bite of the pancakes and it was actually really good....chewy and fluffy and tasty.  My nachos were also pretty good ....I was able to eat maybe one-eighth of the plate because they gave u so much....well that satisfied my craving for nachos!
author: Ji Won K.

description: Service was amazing. Our waitress was very attentive and helpful. She even gave us extra clam chowder when it was already overfilling the bread bowl. My caesar salad was delish as well. The ambiance is nice and pulls you away from the business of the pier for a while and the decor is very cute and beach themed.
author: Jenelle G.

description:
My review is only for the drinks! After a nice little walk on the pier we stopped in and was assisted at the front right away. We got a nice open table for 2 and down to the drinks we went. 

She ordered a wipeout margarita and definitely enjoyed it. I ended up ordering a Giant 23 oz Shark Bite which at the time sounded manly enough to me: Cruzan raspberry rum, and piña colada mix, with a strawberry wave. When the drink came out it was an big hourglass shaped glass with a cherry, pineapple piece, and a nice fruity blend to it. At this point the man card had been left at the door. However, I did not let it phase me as I took a few sips and it was actually very good. Okay who am I kidding I positioned the glass closer to her as I took a few sips when no one was watching, it was still very good. I had to protect my manhood. As soon as it was close to being finished she said she will finish the rest I ordered a vodka pineapple "in a regular glass." The waitress was having a kick with it and brought the drink and left a piece of pineapple on it for me. 

So I really don't have an issue as I should've just read it clearly or there should've been a visual depiction of how the drink would look. It's okay because it was nice area to sit, the atmosphere was seemed very friendly, and a great view. I would def come again for drinks(man drinks) and I'll have to try their food as well!
author: Kobe N.

description:
Against my instincts, my kids convinced me to eat lunch at Wipeout after a long morning of sightseeing.  Having eaten on Pier 39 before and living among a ton of chain and theme restaurants, I had my doubts.  Surprisingly though, the food was really good and the service was quick.  I had a California burger that included bacon, and guacamole.  It reminded me of similar burgers I've had in San Diego.  It was tasty and perfectly cooked.  My kids had pizzas which were very good as well.  Also,  they had a vibrant bar scene and Anchor Steam on tap.  Very good.  

The downside-pretty expensive,  especially for a "casual" lunch.  Actually, it was more expensive than my far superior dinner at an Italian restaurant in North Beach.   Also, they really try to rush you through at lunchtime. Neither is a surprise on Pier 39 or Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Chris O.

description: Great drinks. Service was phenomenal. The staff was friendly and made me feel like I was welcome. The food was actually good. I would definitely go here again.
author: Harold G.

description:
Yes I know it is one of the most touristy places in S.F. but still this place serves one of the best fish and chips in the city.  

Be smart and don't order stuff like pasta,salad  or pizza here, places like this you should strictly stick to dive food  regulars.
Come here with a group of friends on a cold day and sit in their patio by one of their fire pits to drink some brews and make fun of the tourists lol.
author: Manny R.

description: Go here. Get served by Josh. The most awesome purveyor of Sharkinator IPA I have ever met.
author: Carl S.

description: Such an awesome atmosphere with great vibes! Phenomenal customer service , the employees treat you with the utmost respect and make sure you are taken care of . I had the sizzling shrimp & steak bowl . My first Time trying coconut rice and it was sooooooo delicious !!!! Can't go wrong with any of the food here , everything I tried was good . I also tasted the nachos and burrito
author: Pia M.

description: I've been here for the second time and this place is just awesome. The bonfire, the grilled chicken, BBQ pizza, Garlic bread and cold breeze outside makes restaurant a great place to spend time with friends and family. They have a street parking. Worth a try!
author: Pratik J.

description: Great casual place. Fish tacos and margaritas hit the spot after several hours of touring the city.
author: Angela C.

description: Our experience at Wipeout was beyond extraordinary. We were so warmly welcomed by our server Brandon who took our experience to new levels. He was extremely friendly and knew just how to make our meal the best we've had in ages. Ask for this guy if you know what's good for you!
author: Courtney P.

description: I love this place! My favorite is the fish sandwhich and garlic fries. The service is excellent,  would defenitly recommend it and try the fish sandwhich and garlic fries :)
author: Bernadette E.

description: Yes it's touristy, and tacky. But the service was good and all the food we had was decent.
author: Mike L.

description:
My first time here the food was delicious.
Branden the server was super friendly and helpful definitely coming back here oh and I forgot to mention we were 15 ppl.
author: Lizeth V.

description: We had a great time at Wipeout! Our server Brandon was awesome! He made sure they got my food right, NO BROCCOLI!!!!!
author: Rachel S.

description:
Came summer of '09. Worst tourist trap restaurant I've EVER been to, and well, I'm a sucker for tourist traps (I love them...most times). Part of me wants to say 'don't recommend it', but...it's just such a cute place. That's why we were suckered into going there. Has a cute surfer dude "wipeout" atmosphere, but the food was not up to par for a place that should dazzle its tourists.  I had the terryiaki pineapple chicken sandwich and the sauce basically disintegrated the roll.  I also thought it was WAY overpriced (hence, a true "wipeout") BUT if that's your thing, and you're not so picky, and you don't mind eating the run-of-the-mill bar/grill type food, you should go and try it. Fun atmosphere (albeit touristy), good for kids, sit outside if you can and enjoy that Bay Breeze!

My husband and I are also...light-walleted so to speak (that's what studenting and teachering does!), so that does have an effect on my review.  The staff was really polite to us, and we didn't wait 100 million years for our food.

Honestly, folks, SF has WAY better restaurants. Just get the heck away from Fisherman's Wharf! OR go there once and call it a day. I don't think there'd be any BETTER restaurants in the area (I mean, I guess it's not as bad touristy as Hard Rock Cafe, holy god!).

I'm not opposed to going back, just to give it another chance! I probably will. The next time we go, we'll have real jobs and more $$ and I'll just get something other than a sandwich! :)
author: Jen S.

description:
Summer of love.

Myon & Shane 54 version: http://youtu.be/YzcKZOp_0iA

Wipeout version: Homemade brown rice, black beans, oatmeal, jalapenos, dried plums and seasonal grilled vegetables patty. It's their Summer Of Love burger.

One will make your feet dance. One will make your taste buds dance.

You'll love them both.

And if you get Robert as your server you'll love him too.

Good vibes. Good food. Good service. Lots to love.
author: Jason B.

description: Burgers are pretty good... Service isn't.. My waiter lost his tip because he's been gone for 10 minutes.
author: sousan a.

description:
Live a couple blocks away wanted to check it out. Heard it was a cheap eats.  

The food was cheap but you really didn't get much. Got a burger. No meat. Think Burger King Kids Meal

My Girlfriend go the tacos. Her first bit into the second one she saw a long black hair( neither of us have black hair) the "chef" did

I told the girl at the take out counter.  She looked at itt and said, " oh, ok" that was it. 

Needless to say never coming back again
author: Jay L.

description: We picked this place because it was first in line of places to eat.  We were tired and the patio was very inviting.  We got seated inside and our waitress was great.  She was very helpful with the menu.  I couldn't decide and her recommendation was good.  We got the turkey burger and carnitas burrito.  It was pretty empty for a Monday night but after a long day the food was very good.  I would come here again.  They have good drinks also.
author: Miranda B.

description:
I usually try to avoid the over priced and hyped up tourist traps - opting for where the locals go.  However, we were in a pinch and didn't feel like hunting for another place to eat.

What a surprise!  The place looks like the stereotypical tourist trap restaurant - something like you'd find at Disneyland - however, the food was great and the portions appropriate for the price.  I had the fish and chips - it was really fresh and moist.
author: Scott G.

description: Came here on Wednesday with my boyfriend at around 5 or 6pm. It wasn't busy & we were seated right away, which we were happy about. We were starving, & after about five minutes, knew what we wanted to order. However, we waited about 15-20 minutes without any service. Not a single server came to take our drinks or order, & we waited so long because we thought maybe our server was busy & would come to apologize soon, never happened. There were servers just standing around & talking, not a single one thought to come over to our table. We became very impatient & my boyfriend went to ask the hostess where our server was, she apologized & took our order. We were never rude, keep in mind we were starving & we totally could have been. A manager I'm assuming (since she wasn't in the uniform like everyone else) came & apologized also & brought us our food. A server came maybe twice after asking if we needed anything but that was it, she was nice but busy with her other tables. The food was delicious, but the service was awful. It was our first time there & we're unsure if we would come back.
author: Iris V.

description: On Choir Spring Tour from Sacramento and been hungry and looking forward to Wipeout all car ride long, we walked in with a group of 9 high schoolers and lucked out with the best server Brandon D. He was energetic and took our needs above and beyond our orders, he was is so far the highlight of our tour! Thanks Brandon!
author: Kayla H.

description: This place is one of my favorite places to eat at Fisherman's Wharf. They are located right on Pier 39. The vibe is beachy, casual and fun! Excellent service...fast, friendly, and efficient. The food was good and not overly priced, considering their prime location at the biggest tourist trap in San Francisco. I would definitely come here again next time I'm in town, if only for their awesome oreo milk shake!
author: Jay B.

description: Maybe it's because I ordered tacos but this restaurant was a joke. I could've made better fish tacos. There was no spice and the tacos were flavorless. The garlic pizza bread was good for a snack, but honestly a kid at home could've put cheese on bread with some sauce and cook it up. This was such a disappointment. A glass of coke was 4 dollars as well. I know it's pier 39 but really. You would be better checking out pier 23 and paying a little more for quality seafood done right.
author: Miguel F.

description:
Very rarely my family and I go to San Francisco and eat there, however I have to say that this time we were so satisfied with the service that for sure we will be going back. 

Customer service was great and the food was delicious.. For sure more than what I was expecting.
author: Olga P.

description: Definitely a place to visit! Our server josh was excellent taking care of us and very friendly. The food was great and a nice selection and variety of foods and beverages. All around a fantastic place to eat along pier 39.
author: Dan R.

description: The service was great and so was the food. While on vacation in San Francisco we ate there twice.
author: Daine A.

description:
Wipeout Bar and Grill is one of the restaurants on the list of places that gets you a 2 hour free-parking validation (after 6 pm) at the parking structure across the street ($8/hr after 2 hours or without validation). This was the primary reason we walked out of Boudin across the walkway, and walked into this mess. After that grave error, what did we expect? 

After the hostess seated us, we were forgotten about for about 15 minutes. We almost stood up to leave, at which point our super-nice server appeared and graciously apologized and took our order. 

We got the chips and salsa, veg head pizza and fish & chips. Our food arrived in under 7 minutes - record time for pizza. I know, very fishy. There's no way a trendy bar and grill at Pier 39 is nuking food... right? Wrong. 

To be fair, chips were standard, as was the salsa. They gave us an extra serving of salsa, which was nice. 

But the pizza was just sad. Undercooked, bland and completely sub-standard. It didn't even seem like it had been salted, let alone other spices, that's much too ambitious. Where were the tomatoes I was promised on the menu? The cheese on the pizza was oddly melted and appeared hotter than the yet-not-cooked pizza dough (you know what that means). 

Now, I like pizza. Even crap pizza. But this just didn't make the cut, not even good enough to be pizza-you-can-chow-down-after-a-few-drinks. 

Fish & chips were served with nearly stale fries and dry coleslaw. According to my boyfriend, it was like eating a donut-wrapped-fish. Sounds icky. 

The extra star was for service, our server was amazingly sweet and very calm even with the misfortune of having a number of tables with camera-toting throngs of visitors screaming at her in various languages. Kudos for maintaining her cool. Food-wise, Wipeout was .... yeah, you guessed it, a massive wipeout.
author: Meg P.

description:
very bland but I cannot say I was surprised! I never go there for food! Fish and chips was really tasteless... almost like eating cardboard! (and no... I have not yet eaten cardboard so it is merely a speculative comment ;-)

some of the other bar dishes such as the spicy wings was ok. but this place is really more about the ambiance and pier 39 than the food itself.
author: Far G.

description: Great place, fun and happenin! Friendly staff and super efficient. The bonus, they have my beer.
author: Christina D.

description: The food was pretty good. My friends and I had a great time. Our waitress was amazing. If you can get in Lisa's area, I recommend it. She was so much fun. I laughed so hard it hurt.
author: Wilson W.

description:
This place is located on Pier 39, so anytime I'm being touristy in SF I hit it up. I went back this time because the last time I was there I had fantastic fried shark bites there. To my great dismay this time they told me that they had taken them off the menu. Something about it not being good for the environment to eat an animal at the top of the food chain. Bah! My answer to that is that I am at the top of the food chain. Oh well. 

Instead we got calamari and garlic fries, and a couple of margaritas. Great calamari, and the garlic fries are definitely very garlicy (though not as good as Gott's down at the ferry building). The margaritas were awesome. 

There's a great outdoor seating area where you can get it some good people watching. If it's a little chilly, aim for the big chairs around the firebit. 

I think this is a great place to stop if you're checking out the Pier 39 area. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in the area.
author: Cassandra F.

description:
Love their clam chowder!

Their service is decent. Our waiter had very good memory. He got all our orders correct without writing it down and brought out our food fairly quickly too.

I like the decor. It's very summery. Our table was in a shape of a surf board. Great place to hang out with friends and watch the game then walk the pier after.

Downside, it can get pretty crowded. We had a party of 9 and it was a 20min wait. So not toooo bad.
author: Jean T.

description: Thank you Josh for your awesome service and bringing us ice cold Sharkinators. I love Sharkinators. /Mike
author: Mikael S.

description: Okay so I originally made a complaint to Yelp, they contacted me, and one guy said I could get a refund and someone would be calling me. I expressed my dissatisfaction about how horrible the food was, greasy and more. So the guy calls me and tells me they do not give refunds or anything to people that complain to Yelp.So what a ONE WAY BUNCH OF CROOKS. They DO not CARE AT ALL ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMERS CONCERNS OR THEIR LOUSY FOOD.
author: Diane B.

description: We love going to Wipeout anytime we go to Pier 39! The food is always great and the service is excellent! I have a gluten allergy and the staff is always so helpful and knowledgeable about it. The manager always comes over to discuss my options with me. It's one of the easiest places for me to go out to eat with my family. Their bar is fully stocked and they make a great cocktail! Highly reccomended!
author: Anna P.

description: When visiting San Francisco I recommend this place on the pier 39 big variety of food great atmosphere and great service definitely would go back again
author: Ed B.

description:
When it comes to good eats with Kids at Fisherman's Wharf, the options are limited. Kids are picky, and many don't like seafood, and most often you just want to get them something to eat to shut them up.  

So where do you dine with the kids at the Wharf without breaking the bank with overpriced mediocre food? Hard Rock Cafe...Johnny Rockets for a quick burger?  You can support these national chains for American food if you like.

Or, you can support a local Bay Area joint with a warm beach-y, California surf-town feel.  

Wipeout Grill is a great place for families.
