The atmosphere is reminiscent of beach-side dining options along the California coast with both outdoor patio seating on a warm day, or plentiful indoor seating either with a bay-side view or bar seating with TVs playing your favorite ball game, while enjoying a drink off of their extensive beer, wine, margarita and Specialty drinks menu.  

Comfortable enough for large parties, you don't have to worry about making a big mess since they welcome families of all shapes and sizes.  

I dined here for a quick bite to eat awhile back after wanting sit-down service, but nothing too fancy.  We were quickly seated by the window and our server was efficient and friendly.

I ordered the The Hawaiian Burger - I love cooked pineapples! Burger was topped with a  grilled pineapple, teriyaki glaze and melted jack cheese, served on a toasted bun. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iaKZgEBfD4Ak4OR2vNKFrg?select=xYSsntNQEH-2SNVmbYkfiw

Burger was cooked to my request...Medium Well and the bun was nicely toasted and warm as described.  I'm not so much into a cold bun when eating a hot burger, and Wipe Out Grill did my burger nicely.  

We also ordered the Wipe Out Fried Combo - A combination of fried fish, calamari and coconut shrimp, served with a tangy sweet and sour sauce and side of cole slaw.  
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iaKZgEBfD4Ak4OR2vNKFrg?select=zJe_KOxH_YgW9m8d3GP4IA

Batter seemed nice and crispy at first, but became soggy quite quickly.  But for the most part, portion size was decent. 

Prices are competitive for the rest of the Wharf area...with my burger being $10.95 and the Combo platter at $15.95. It's the price you way for choosing to dine at the Wharf.  

Yes, you can get better deals elsewhere, but this place is great with families who don't have a lot of time, but would like a decent sit-down service restaurant with fun beach-y California atmosphere and extensive food and drink menu.
author: Cass J.

description: My go to spot on the pier for a burger and a beer.   Burger was hot and beer was cold.  Stopped by for breakfast and was not disappointed.  Simple breakfast burrito and mimosa's.  Burrito was hot and, you guessed it, mimosa was cold.  Service has always been good here for me.
author: Robert J.

description: Great high energy place with plenty of flat screens for sports at Pier 39!  It looks a little cheesy from the outside, but the food is great and the drinks are outstanding as well.  Nice bit of atmosphere for a family including the opportunity to eat at a surfboard-shaped table.  This was my chosen location to get the requisite sourdough clam chowder bread bowl before leaving town.
author: David B.

description:
I never go to Fisherman's Warf unless coerced by one of the kids in my life.  Too many tourists.  Well, we ended up at Wipeout the other night, and I was pleasantly surprised.   The portions were gigantic, and the portions from the kids menu  were almost as big as the adult menu's.  I wouldn't go here for date night, but definitely to watch a game on one of their many flat screens, or to feed some kids.  We all went home with leftovers.

We ordered: fish, chips, and coconut prawns.  Everyone was happy with their meal. 

Tip: Order to share AND get parking validated - we saved $7 (2 hours of free parking).
author: Rayna A.

description:
Nice place for it to be a themed bar on the Pier. The staff was very welcoming and attentive. I had the Grilled Fish Burrito and my boyfriend had the Wipeout Burger and Gnarly Fries. The fries were too salty for my liking, but he seemed to enjoy them. My burrito was really good and it's huge! I had to take it to go. 
The decor of the restaurant is cute. I like the mural that is paitned on the walls. We had an overall good experience. We would come back
author: Sharlena S.

description:
Trapped?

If you find yourself overwhelmed with the hustle and bustle of good ol' Peir 39, stop on by for a cold one.  Nothing special here.  Colod beer and a giant pile of nachos might just get you through the crowds.
author: Eric L.

description: I stopped by for a quick beer and a few cocktails for my friends at the bar and overall the staff was inattentive the drinks were mediocre and the pricing was avaerage. To me, its nothing special its what you would expect from a bar inside a restuarant. If youre into more touristy places id reccomend another restaurant.
author: Adrian P.

description: Outstanding service without a doubt!!! Mike made our experience in San Francisco memorable. Come to Pier 39 Wipeout to have a memorable time!! We can't wait to come out to Frisco again and experience the shoreline, pier, and "Wipeout" vibe!!! Thanks Mike!!!
author: Laura P.

description: Warm friendly service and delicious, generous portions of quality food. It is in a great location, and was great. Definitely would recommend.
author: Ben C.

description: One star for service. Piece of advice, make sure you have your ID out before you order a drink otherwise the rude waiter by name of Mendra might walk away for 10 mins before coming back to take your actual drink order.
author: Kari K.

description: The service was so terrible that it outweighed the fact that the food was decent. Waited for an awkward amount of time at the table before anyone greeted us. Asked for ranch twice and never received any. Seemed like we were an inconvenience to the waiter.
author: Heather B.

description: Some how three girls with a chili dog, a burger, a BBQ chicken pizza with no drinks ended up up with a hefty bill of $46. We were like what? Then figured eh must be because we're in a tourist zone. The food was okay. I had the chili dog with french fries. The french fries are your average and reheated skinny fries. The hotdog was eh, and so was the chili. Nothing spectacular.
author: Jess W.

description:
Was looking for a place that can accommodate 4 kids and 3 adults for lunch. The menu looked decent so we gave it a try. They had huge booths....we were all able to fit comfortable in one. The restaurant is pretty pricey compare to the quality of food you get. The burritos were $11 or more and contained very little meat. The rice was also very sweet and looked like rice in a jambalaya. The kid's mac and cheese kids meal was at least $6 and consisted of Kraft's Mac and Cheese. 

Nothing was memorable here. Kids were hungry so it served its purpose. Will probably not voluntarily eat here again.
author: Lisa T.

description: Great choices on the menu. Had the Hawaiian Burger and the pineapple plus the teriyaki glaze added the right sweetness.fries were hot and plentiful . My food was brought out quickly. All in all awesome service
author: Alfonsina S.

description:
Terrible experience.  Very expensive, tasteless food.  Our waiter forgot to place our food order then made-up some lame story why it was taking so long.  Really!!!
There are a lot of choices in that area.  This should not be one of them.
author: Gregory P.

description:
We stopped here before a Blue & Gold Fleet bay cruise (what MIL wanted to do for her b-day). I got the Wipeout Fried Combo (Fish, Coconut Shrimp, and Calamari) and the g/f got the clam chowder in bread bowl.

Very mixed performance with the fried fish being the best of the lot. The beer batter was cooked perfectly and the flesh nice and moist. The coconut shrimp (3 on one skewer)  had the coconut coating burned, but the shrimp itself was not overdone. The spicy dipping sauce was tasty and I used that with the other items as well. 

The calamari were virtually inedible: chewy and rubbery. I love calamari and was excited to see how much they gave in this mixed plate, but only ate 2-3 pieces.

The clam chowder was good with plentiful and not-overcooked bits of clam. 

A bit on the pricey side for what you get, but this is Tourist Central here and saw it was better value than the Eagle Cafe where we grabbed a quick drink later.
author: Andrew C.

description: Came in here to wait out the rain. The food was decent - pretty typical bar food. My husband had the nachos, which were very good, and I had the tacos, which were only okay. But the service was outstanding. We had a very friendly waitress who checked on us often (but we never felt rushed or anything), and was quick to bring anything we asked for. We would definitely go back again.
author: Ariel K.

description: THEIR PIZZA "SLICE" is LITERALLY HALF THE PIZZA!!! It's crazyyyy. Only $4.50 for cheese and $4.95 for others. Such big portions! Service at take out line was slow! Fish and chips were aight.
author: april w.

description: Food was gross, and the beer was watered down. Like literally watered down, it was ridiculous. Prices were too high.
author: Jeff B.

description: Sophia and I got nachos and one of their wipeout margaritas. Overall the restaurant was not exceptional compared to other grills I have been too, but as a tourist trap I did not expect a five start restaurant! On a side note, the waiter was very engaging and prompt!
author: Michael J.

description: Well the fish tacos we had were good, I didn't care too much for the rice. The service was good. The table we sat in was a little hard to get into. The bathrooms are coed style so I was surprised to see women washing their hands when I walked in, the toilets have full doors so there is plenty of privacy though.
author: Adam T.

description: Decent food for a decent price on the pier. If I am just casually at the pier then I'll go here. It's a very casual laid back place. Usually get the nachos or a sandwich. Great place for kids and the environment is fun and friendly.
author: Crystal D.

description: Not bad at all. Probably the best teriyaki bowl I've ever had (steak and shrimp bowl over coconut rice). Awesome people watching if you sit outside. Super touristy and noisy though.  Margarita was yummy. Would totally come here again.
author: Jenn G.

description: First time Boston couple in town and one of our stops was at Wipeout Bar..this was a few months ago and the bar was absolutely packed! We had jumped around to a lot bars on the Pier and Wharf. We had finally found our bar for the next three days. We sit at the bars when we go out and love talking to the bartenders. We came upon Michael and love him! He was so personal and accommodating, he made us come back. The restaurant was packed and he seemed to have been serving drinks to the wait staff as well. All I can say is wow! He's the fastest bartender I've seen in a long time. He seems to have the multiple-task to take care of the guest and staff. Kudos to Wipeout finding this guy! We will be back next year!
author: Tev H.

description:
Alexa is the best waitress you could possibly get.  Ask for her specifically if you want to have a good time.

Also get a Shark Bite - that will make your day epic.
author: Emma H.

description: Only had beers and clam chowder... And it was great! Fun atmosphere. View of pier shops and fun people watching.
author: Mandy C.

description: Ate here for breakfast. Standard fare and reasonably priced for its tourist location. Great decor and vibe. Good for people watching. Friendly and efficient service.
author: Nina F.

description: Service was great and the waitress was super friendly! The chicken nachos were to die for! The Baja Tacos are okay, need a little more flavor but overall, I enjoyed it. :)
author: Mickey D.

description: This place is touristy, food was pretty good, service was adequate, nothing too bad nothing to rave about,
author: Jim D.

description: I disliked eating here, the utensils were not properly cleaned, the tab was somewhat high, the staff is somewhat hard to access. Too busy for the amount of people working.
author: Jose Manuel C.

description: This place is pretty cool! The staff was way fun, it is super busy (stuck in the middle of a tourist trap), and the food is pretty good. The tables are very close to each other so if you don't like your bubble invaded then this (and well fisherman's wharf in general) isn't the place for you. We didn't mind at all because we met some awesome people, had great conversations and a great time. If you are looking for great seafood, then this is NOT the place. However, I would come here again if ever in the area, not necessarily for the food but definitely would for the good time and staff.
author: Alyse A.

description: Located on Pier 39 in San Fran. Touristy, yes, but they had a fun, clean, & inviting outdoor dining area (much different from the blah inside of the restaurant!). I was craving seafood, but much of what they had to offer was fried fried and more fried items. Not my bag, unless I'm having really good fish and chips, which I'm pretty sure theirs wasn't. Fun, big drinks that belong on a tropical island but it was delicious so no complaints here! I had a marg. When it came to dinner, I took the advice of the server: Grilled Salmon Bowl. A really nice piece of salmon, grilled and atop of fresh sauteed vegetables & rice. The teriyaki sauce was a good touch & the rice had fresh coconut mixed in which was surprisingly wonderful. It was an extremely tummy-pleasing meal, but would go somewhere else next time.
author: Sammy S.

description: I'm a tourist from Milwaukee. Loved the overall environment and outdoor patio. Coconut shrimp was delicious but I was really in the mood for calamari and I felt it was way too breaded. I could barely taste seafood, just fried breading.
author: Kelsey C.

description: We specifically chose this location because of their pledge to serve sustainable seafood. The server was very friendly, the food was very good, and the atmosphere was laid back. We also had a great interaction with the manager and appreciate his help on applying our discount to our bill. I would highly recommend this location to visitors of Pier 39!
author: Joanna P.

description: Rude,rushed, lied about the bar and what they had and I did take a picture of there bathroom and that should speak volumes about there kitchen. The stuff were extremely rude and it was the type of place where you could tell in the employees eyes that they just didn't want to be there. At one point, one of the waitress sat down at a unbussed table and was putting napkins in the depressor. That was actually kind of comical. Non the less, I shouldn't have wasted my time, next time or just go to Hardrock Cafe. Gosh, that place was nasty, LOOK AT THE BATHROOM picture I took.
author: Grant S.

description:
Disgusting...waste of money..... Daughter ordered the "GIANT" firecracker shrimp cocktail...poor lil shrimps looked like they were weeping....they just lay there flaccid in a bowl of lettuce :(.

Fries...cold.

Pizza...partially cooked.

Expensive and regretted the second we found all the other amazing choices available on the pier.

YUCK.
author: Christine M.

description:
San Francisco can be tropical if you know where to look. 

On Saturday we joined the tourists in sunny North Beach, taking in the sights at Pier 39. Wipeout had a 15-minute wait for the first available seating, which suited us just fine. We noticed the sweat shirts and hoodies in the gift shop, which probably sell well in the summertime. This day the sun was out and the air was calm, making them excess cargo. 

We were seated on the patio, a fenced-off area right on the Pier thoroughfare. To get into the mood we ordered a couple of mai tais, while we waited for our chicken teriyaki bowl and BBQ burger. The teriyaki bowl had coconut steamed rice, which tasted delicious, and the burger came with thinly cut onion rings in addition to the usual french fries. All of this for $53 + tip, of which about $22 was in the mai tais. 

The mai tais were served in a hurricane glass, about 24 oz. each, and we had to regain our sea legs after we stood up again. No sharks were sighted, although a herd of young harbor seals was gaining ground on the docks below.
author: David D.

description:
Good food, especially for a tourist trap place on pier 39.  Have never been disappointed.  Friendly staff, reasonably quick service, and good food.

A convenient place to stop and get a bite while your are chugging around the pier.
author: Chris K.

description:
Okay...been travelling a few days and i really just need a good margarita....not the standard bottled cuervo mix and crappy tequila...."you are in the right place...i can make you a great margarita" says Kalie, the bartender. Sure enough, great margarita !!!!!!!!!!

So i decide to try a salad...now its hard to screw up a salad (though it happens often). No bagged lettuce here !!!!! Fresh lettuce, good salad, good bar service, good experience ..... I have only ever handed a 5 star to 3 other places/people....so if u go to Wipeout Bar & Grill on the pier, definitely give my girl Kalie or my homeboy Chuck
 a shout
author: Jessica C.

description: If you want a table, apparently you have to walk around to the other side of this place, opposite of the VW bug takeout stand. The wait was around 15 minutes, which made sense since it was fairly crowded there (decent sports bar where they were showing all NFL games on a projector and at tv's around the bar). They should have some sort of intercom outside that tells you your table is ready though, if you were not directly outside the front entrance, you'd never hear them call for you. The garlic fries weren't too, well, "garlic-y" and the jalapeno burger I had a good amount of spice, aside from the bottom bun being too wet and falling apart by the time I got it. The server took care of us perfectly, and even came back several times to make sure we were taken care of, even with a lot of tables, which was appreciated. Just be mindful the bathroom is set up unisex, and the main handwashing area is just one big sink outside the bathrooms, if you're weirded out by not having designated male and female bathrooms.
author: Dan M.

description: Food was decent, I've had better burgers. However, we didn't know who our server was. Nobody came out to introduce themselves except for the person covering her break. Cristina our "server" did not stop by our table once. Bad service, didn't get any refills on our drinks and one our plates was taken away before we were done.
author: Angelica M.

description: Went in yesterday since we got to the Pier starved! Conveniently located near the entrance of Pier 39. Wait wasn't too bad compared to other places. Food was pretty good along with the portion size. The only downside to this place is that its extremely busy so hard to get your servers attention and it takes a while for your food to come out. Our server was okay - nothing great. But the manager (Christopher?) Was Very nice and stopped to chat with us and check on how we were doing- I appreciated that since I didn't see our server much.  Overall I would probably stop here again as the clam chowder was pretty yummy-I would just try again during a less busy time...
author: Nicole O.

description: Good food. I really enjoyed the coconut shrimp appetizer. Just regular food.. nothing spectacular. I would recommend for a quick bite.
author: Renee W.

description: This place was great!! After a long walk our family was hungry. They sat us right away and the staff was quick and efficient!  Food was fantastic and not overly priced like you would expect at other tourist locations. I had the bbq chicken salad and it was delicious.
author: R C.

description: After wandering around for ages looking for somewhere for a late breakfast/early lunch, we stumbled across Wipeout. From the outside, I didn't expect much but it definitely exceeded my expectations. The menu offers a wide variety of things to please everyone. We all had a milkshake which was pretty good to start with however they took a long time to come. I ordered the chicken burrito which was surprisingly very good. It was huge and came with corn chips as well which was a nice bonus. Unfortunately, the service wasn't up to much. Our waiter was pleasant but seemed interested elsewhere. The service was slow even at a quiet time. It was a chilled atmosphere and is good for lunch but is a serious tourist trap with its connecting gift shop. If you need a casual spot for a quick lunch on Fishermen's Wharf this is the spot.
author: Louise F.

description:
I could give it 4 stars because its pricey, but you're paying for the location, so that's just how it is. 

My husband and I went on a busy Saturday night. We had our little dog with us and we sat outside with her. Lisa was our waitress and it was her second day. She was great!! Very friendly and had a great personality. We really liked her. 

The coconut shrimp (appetizer) was delicious!! The dipping sauce that comes with it is a spicy sweet sauce.. I don't remember what they called it... but it was really good!! 

I had the Hawiian burger and it was good, not super filling, so it was good I had the shrimp first. Fries were good too! My husband had the fish & chips and really liked it also! I'm not a big fish eater, but I had some of the breading from his fish it was so flakey and yummy! I would definitely eat there again if we ever go to San Francisco again! 

Oh, and the atmosphere of the place was great, a lot of fun!
author: Janessa J.

description: Alcohol beverages have no alcohol. ..order shots or a beer.  Customer service was crap.  But hey the fries were good.  Not coming back for sure.
author: Sam J.

description:
Customer service sucks BIG TIME!!! 

After walking for a long time around Pier 39, my friend decided to have a beer. She sat down by the bar and the bartender checked her ID. First thing I noticed is that the bartender seemed like he doesn't believe that her ID is real. He kinda give her "the look" and then he asked her brother and I if we wanted to have some drink as well, but we said no. 

While my friend work on her beer, I decided to buy some hot chocolate right across from this restaurant. When I came back to check on my friend, she said she's done with her beer and ready to go home. The bartender checked up on her and asked her if she had finished her beer and my friend said yes. Again, he didn't seem convinced that she finished her beer. He asked her again if she had finished her beer or if she transferred her beer to my coffee cup!!! She said, "no, I finished my beer." 

I confirmed to the bartender that my coffee cup contains hot chocolate and he just said, "Okay" with an asshole attitude. I got the same reaction with the two hostess, they just said, "Okay" like it was nothing. I was furious! What the fuck is the bartender's problem? He was a racist son of a bitch!
author: Eileen A.

description: I had a burger and a beer at the terrace. The burger was quite good but I think the price could've been lower given the quality.
author: Santi M.

description: Came here at 730 on a Wednesday & were seated right away. Had the calamari for appetizer.. Loaded with batter. For dinner we had the fish tacos & pesto pizza! The pizza was fantastic!! however, the tacos, I only took one bite out of! Waitress wasn't too attentive. The cucumber Moscow mule was pretty good! Too many restaurants in sf to return here
author: Stephanie M.

description: If you are at Pier 39 looking for a place to eat, I would recommend elsewhere. This place was ok. I was really craving some fish and chips but was very disappointed. I'm sure I could've found better elsewhere. They do have a decent beer selection and if you are looking for large drinks, they do serve good margaritas.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Took relatives from Massachusetts to the wharf area to hang for the day. When it came time for lunch, chowder was decided on and Wipeout was right there. Place was pretty packed but we got lucky with a table outside. Staff was scarce because the place was full so our order took a while. We 5 thought our meals were a fine reasonably portioned moderately priced lunch. They were especially pleased with the clam chowder in bread bowls. Awesome on a chilly, windy pier day. Would recommend this over a lot of places in the area.
author: Melissa J.

description: The food was really good. The wife and I had the wipeout combo. The coleslaw was ok, but I don't like pineapple coleslaw. Everything else was amazing. Service was good and the food came out fast. Prices were reasonable and overall a good value.
author: Brad K.

description: If you are around the area, see if you can grab the fire-pit seats as there is nothing better then a Kahlua and coffee next to the fire on a cold day.
author: Heather D.

description:
Ordered two tacos, one fish (Crispy Baja Fish) and one chicken (Grilled Chicken) tacos. The salsa sauce was really nice and a bit spicy. I like the fried fish a lot and it went well with the sauce.

The chicken taco was nice and spicy. 

Both tacos is nice. I like the fish tacos a bit more than the chicken taco.
author: Rainbow C.

description: Ugh. Went here with my husband and 2 kids for lunch. We ate outside and it was very clean and our server was very nice (hence the 2 stars). Unfortunately our food was soooooo bland! The kids meals were ok (pizza and a burger) but kids will eat anything. My husband got the fish and chips and i got the fried combo plate which includes calimari, coconut shrimp and fish.  The breaded fish had no flavor whatsoever and the tartar sauce was extremely bland. Then the bill comes and they add 4% to every check for some reason I didn't even get (nothing to do with saving marine life or anything like that. Our bill was $60!!!! For 2 entrees, 2 kids meals, 1 beer and bland food?? Never again.
author: Kathy S.

description: The only, and I mean only, reason we ate here was because they served fish &chips and had a full bar. The start was rough as the first server we had only got one drink order right and confused a question for a review. The food was ok, but just ok; yhe fish was bland as was the coleslaw,  while the teriyaki bowl was good. The volume level of the music makes it imposible to hold a conversation, and forces you to yell at the person sitting opposite of you. This is not a place I would choose to visit again.
author: Jordan G.

description:
I live in San Francisco so I rarely go to the Pier 39 but when I do I LOVE eating here! It's definately the best restaurant at Pier 39 for burgers, beer, seafood, you name it! They have such a great variety on their menu and the prices are pretty good compared to most restaurants in that tourist area.
Their staff are the nicest people and even if there's a waiter that's not your assigned one, they gladly help you out if you need anything. They're really attentive of their customers and constantly check in to make sure you're doing good.
Oh and the manager is AWESOME he really devotes himself to the job. I constantly see him going around the tables making sure the customers are satisfied, motivates the cooks to make the food quicker, and he's vwry charismatic and energetic.
author: Lilia R.

description: In true tourist fashion, we ate here our first night in SF (2 adults, 2 kids).  We waited about 10 minutes to be seated inside where it was warmer.  Service was pretty good although once the mumbling waiter delivered our food he never checked on us.  We ate the BBQ burger, a plain burger, extra fries (what?  that's all the kid wanted) and the seared tuna salad.  The salad was huge, fresh ad delicious; the tuna was perfectly cooked, i.e. not overcooked in the slightest.  The BBQ burger was ordered medium rare and the waiter gave us a heads up that it would be bloody in the middle -- that was welcome news, and that's how it was cooked, too.  Total tab about $80 with tax and tip (we all drank water).
author: Susie C.

description: We were seated quickly despite the fact that the poor greeter was dealing with an irate (irrational) customer. She stayed composed and professional. Our waiter (eh) was not personable but we met Manny, our busser. He took our order and checked on us a couple of times to make sure we were being taken care of. Wonderful service. We'd come back just to see Manny.
author: Kat S.

description: The food is delicious and the drinks are great. Their pomegranate margarita was very good. Good place to stop at Fishermans Wharf. The customer service is great. Very happy customer!  :-)
author: Roxana M.

description:
- Chips & Salsa
- Fish and Chips
- Spiked Corona
- Garlic Fries
- Fish Tacos

Ever go out with another friend only because your best friend wasn't around or available to go? Say for instance your brother was supposed to go with you surfing, but then he cancels. You still want to go so your mom offers to go with you instead. Nothing against mom, but it's just not as fun if you'd gone with your brother, right?

That's how I feel about Wipeout. I like this place. I really do. I love the food. Their drinks are great (Shark Bite and the Mojito are some of my favorites). I love the beach vibe. But it always reminds me of it's better counterpart - Fred's (it's in Huntington Beach). 

I guess being reminded of some place I hold higher isn't a bad consolation. There really isn't another place in SF that I could get a similar vibe. Cheers to you, Wipeout.
author: Vincent B.

description: Staff are great, food is amazing. Atmosphere is great. I love how it's by the sea and how it's all decked out with surf.
author: Vanessa J.

description:
My friends and I went to Pier 33 to look around and decided to go to Wipeout for lunch. We had the chicken and pineapple burger, this chicken penne pasta and the fried calamari, fried shrimp and fried fish sampler. The pineapple burger was pretty good but it was messy. I really liked the penne - it had the right flavoring with the right amount of spice. The calamari here is not the same as the calamari I had at the Fisherman's Wharf. These were like mini calamari fingers. They were tasty finger food for sure but nothing to praise about. The place is pretty big for the area. 

What I did not like was their bathrooms. The bathrooms were individual stalls with a full door but guys and girls can go in. They fashioned it so it would look like port-o-potties. Awkwardddd. 

I might want to go back there with a larger group of friends. Seems like a fun place to drink beer and eat. 

~ happy eatings!
author: Rosa C.

description:
No complaints here.  Decent service.  Food was just ok.

PS - The Nachos are huge!
author: Mike S.

description:
As part of any first time visit to SFO, you had to make the obligatory visit to Fisherman's Wharf.  We bought a "GoCard" which allowed us many discounts at restaurants around the city.  Before our tour of the Bay by boat, we decided to stop in to Wipeout.  

With most touristy places, you stop into cheesy themed restaurants with fairly decent food and not so great service.  With that said, we ordered two entrees to share:  a grilled salmon sandwich and the coconut shrimp.  There was nothing spectacular about the food but, our server was especially nice considering that she immediately clocked me and my bf as tourists.  

The food came out fairly quickly but, there was nothing exceptional about the flavor or presentation.  With the 20% discount, we paid about $25 for the two entrees, two sodas and tip.  Worth a stop if you are looking for a restaurant in the Wharf with a view of the Bay and friendly service.
author: Mark M.

description: MY experience here was a great one. Me and my son ate literally everything on our plates. The view from our seat was awesome and the staff was nice. I was nervous b/c of the reviews but my trip there was better than expected!!!!!
author: Jenn D.

description: Burger was great! But the fish tacos did not settle right. Not sure what was up with the batter or the fish but it had to spit it out when I took a bite. Service was not bad we were checked on a few times. All in all it was an alright spot.
author: Danny A.

description: Unlike a lot of folks on here I had a great experience. Sat at the bar and was served immediately.  Drinks were great....ordered some appetizers. Those came out very fast and let me tell you.... you get a lot of food for your money. Bar tender constantly checked up on us and overall a great place to hang out, have drinks, and eat!
author: Larry B.

description: I didn't expect much and was pleasantly surprised. Even though I was there during the lunch rush, I was seated within 5 minutes. Waiter took our order promptly and  and food was pretty good. I had the chicken nachos and my husband had the wipeout burger. We would visit again.
author: Joanne R.

description:
Really enjoyable drinks.

Lower key atmosphere. 

good for casual time w/ friends. not so much date atmosphere

$9.95 Bread "Chili" Bowl & Salad Combo  Salad was decent  but chili bread bowl was pretty good
author: mr v t.

description: My boyfriend and I had a great time here! The waiters were great and so was the food.  I would definitely go back again :)
author: Molly M.

description: We shared the fried comb. It was delicious. Not too greasy. My son loved the sweet chili sauce for the coconut shrimp. The calamari was good and the fried fish was perfect. So yummy. Great for sharing.
author: Karen W.

description: Stopped in for a quick lunchtime app. It took FOREVER. I wouldn't say our server was rude but he certainly wasn't friendly or attentive. The food was decent. Again we just had apps, chips and salsa and shrimp. The tables were literally on top of each other, AND birds... EVERYWHERE if you eat outside. Lots of options in the wharf, not sure this is your best one.
author: Jude W.

description: The restaurant is typical American food but had a little of everything. Burritos, tacos, pizza, seafood, hamburgers, chicken, etc. Place was packed on a monday night. Staff was busy but still came around to check on us. My girl ordered a pepperoni pizza since she is picky. It tasted good, nothing special but not bad! Was hoping it wouldn't taste like cardboard and thank goodness it didn't. They have several different pizza's on the menu. (Hawaiian, bbq, etc). I ordered fish n chips hoping the dish would be pretty good considering we are on Pier 39 in the bay. Fish n chips didn't disappoint but again I have had better fish n chips elsewhere. Try this place at your own risk. I wouldn't come back but this is a good place to come with the family for fair prices and decent food.
author: Zach W.

description: Food was good, service even better. Nothing outstanding really, but the prices are bit inflated for what you get. Feels like a typical tourist trap at Pier 39.
author: Igor P.

description: HORRIBLE SERVICE!!! Just got out of there 10 minutes ago. We ordered an appetizer and the waitress (who's name we didn't even get) was set to come back to take the rest of our order. We waited 15 minutes and she never  came back. We could see her laughing with fellow coworkers. Finally another waitress came and asked if they took our order yet. I told her not yet because we were waiting for our waitress to come back. She said "oh ok" and just walked away. We waited another five minutes, eating dry tasteless calamari without a drink. We got fed up asked for the check and left. Never again.
author: Haner A.

description:
I love having lunch here whenever I'm close to Pier 39.

It has a very diverse menu. Perfect if you're not in the mood for seafood. I love the atmosphere here too. Don't come here expecting fine dining or good service and you might like it too.
author: Yoni D.

description: Ok seriously you get what you deserve eating in tourist-landia. Terrible food terrible bloody Mary's. (I mean terrible and they have nothing to fix them with). Good location. It's like being surprised that the food is bad in Disney!
author: Jobi H.

description: Food is ok. Calamari was not tasty but I recommend the fish and chips and coconut shrimp.
author: Rania R.

description: It's a simple restaurant with simple drinks on Pier 39.  It seems to be more of a chain than any other place we've visited since being in San Francisco, but hey, we're in a heavy tourist area.
author: Jenny G.

description: I came here to watch football playoffs. Screens have terrible resolution, fish and chips were tasteless, not horrible, just, well....nothing. Really cute waitress kept me well fortified with beer, the one saving grace of this place. Another example of a restaurant/bar that makes money off the location, so why bother with quality?
author: Douglas T.

description: No different than a chilis, tgi f or any other chain. Nothing special. Averages food and prices. Is inly go back if everything else was closed.
author: Rich G.

description: Went here for breakfast.   Big portions, love the wedge potatoes.  Had the Heuvos Rancheros and it was delicious.  But nothing too fancy about this place.  Service was good.  Food was good.
author: Salma S.

description: Subpar food, like "fancy" diner food with a "tropical" twist.  Was nothing to write home about.  Ridiculously overpriced for what it is.  Also, our waitress decided to bring back our change without our change.. It was a small amount and I don't care save for the principle of being so presumptuous that I would leave that for her with the crappy service we received.  Who does that!?!
author: Meia C.

description:
We come for the skirt steak. You used to be able to catch us here more often, but the service kind of sucks. I get that it's a very casual place, but come on. Tonight, it looked like they pulled homeless people off the streets to serve. Waiters and waitresses always seem like they'd rather not be there. Our waiter tonight barely made eye contact with us and was only a little cheerful when he handed us our check (in hopes of a nice tip perhaps, but we always tip well unless you really messed up big time). 

Like I said, we come for the steak. It comes with coconut rice and veggies and a little salad. I had one of their burgers, which was ok at best. The "toasted" buns were hard and stale-like. The calamari is good. All the appetizers are pretty good and the portions are large, so make sure you have people to share with. 

We'll continue to come once in a while when Bubba's is full of tourists and we need a break from Fog Harbor.
author: Jeanette P.

description: Came here for lunch. Food was great and service was sufficient. Not a fancy place but great for what it is. Fun atmosphere outside with a fire pit. Overall good for a touristy spot.
author: Katie F.

description: I ordered the scampi and fries. Fries were ok but seemed refried. The scampi did not taste nice. Service was good though. My girlfriend ate the garlic olive chicken sandwich which was dry and tasteless. We don't think we'd eat here again.
author: Courtney G.

description: This is for the to go window. Ridiculous service. Made us wait 20 minutes for FRIES only! Meanwhile they served tacos and burgers to people who came after us. About 5 people. The girl Sammie only brought us our damn fries after I complained. The fries were bad. Tasted like they were microwaved. I went to Ben and jerrys to forget this experience. Threw away fries.
author: A M.

description: Oh Boy!  Great food.  Very trippy bathroom.  The servers dress like surfer-bums, which is a nice touch.  Our server, Allen, made my grandma's day(it was her birthday).  He is HILARIOUS!  Thanks, Bro.  I will be back for more fish tacos soon.  Better than Scoma's!
author: Matt M.

description:
Overcrowded restaurant. The food was disgusting. I paid $10.95 for some tacos w/ rice and beans, but they were the worse I have ever eaten. The main ingredient in the tacos was the lettuce (75% of the tacos, with some creamy sauce). The pork was disgusting too, the rice overcooked, and the beans were probably canned beans. The lemonade costs $3.50 by the way. The food was not worth the price I paid. Did I say it is a "ripoff"?

Fisherman's Wharf is of course a tourist trap. My recommendation is to make your own sandwiches or dine out somewhere else.
author: JM C.

description: Great staff! Fast service and amazing food. My boyfriend and I walked around for a while before running into this gem. We had a nice seat with a view of the ocean. Our waitress was very warm and welcoming. The food was delicious and my boyfriend loved his long island iced tea. Definitely looking to go back!
author: Courtney M.

description: Portions are large,  food is decent or better, and prices are fair.  Overall, pretty good for a tourist trap!
author: Jj J.

description:
Fun ambience, food was good with good prices, and the service was great.
The seafood chowder was thick, rich, and filling. The nachos were pretty good and I was surprised how much I liked Lisa's suggestion to add steak instead of chicken.
author: Angela J.

description: The service was super good, everyone was friendly and attentive. I really loved my server Luis ! Not only was he good at his job but super hot with a beautiful smile and a big butt. Gave him my number, hope he calls !
author: Jeannette A.

description: My favorite dishes at the Wipeout Grill are actually their salads. The best one is the Thai Style Salad. I also enjoy the sampler they have as an appetizer. Service is great. They have a large projector screen. I also like their outside seating. Wipeout to go is great too. They just added a bunch of good draft beers. Definitely a fan!
author: Michelle W.

description:
Came in here after an Alcatraz Tour. We were SO hungry!
could be why the food tasted so good. We got chips and salsa to start. 
The salsa was okay, chips were good. The server was friendly, but he barely spoke to us.My boyfriend got the BBQ burger he devoured it! I got a turkey burger. 
It might have been the best turkey burger I've ever had! The bun was delicious! so soft and flavorable! 

The atmosphere was nice, very casual. We sat next to a window which was nice. 

I would come back! :)
author: Yessenia O.

description:
This was a very casual restaurant with outside seating. The server was extremely nice and attentive. Ended up trying the wipe out burger, which came with a side of fries. The burger included blue cheese and bacon. I thought the cheese gave it an interesting flavor. However, the burger was a tight bit dry (was medium done) and the fries were just okay for me.

Upon recommendation, ordered the Buffalo pizza. It basically tasted like buffalo wings on top of a pizza. I wasn't too thrilled or excited about it, had to ask for a side of ranch.

I would order their margaritas.. it was pretty tasty!!
author: Nhung T.

description: Forgot at the bar while waiting for a table outside. Lady got our order wrong. Had to get my own cutlery to eat with and we are still waiting for our two waters... Not coming back
author: Jaco V.

description: Nothing to write home about, had the fried combo, almost too much breading, but definitely not too oily. Got one of our order's wrong. Wouldn't come back
author: Adam C.

description: I thought this would be one of those touristy places with so do service. It just goes to show your server makes all the difference in your experience.  Not only did she make a great food recommendation she made me feel welcome (I was traveling by myself on business). She even made a recommendation in another bar where I could watch a 49ers game.  If you come here you have to try the blackened magi bowl with avocado tomatillo sauce! Fabulous!
author: Melissa R.

description: Second time visiting this place. And while food isn't bad it also isn't out of this world . But ok to grab a quick bite . Had the BBQ chicken pizza which was pretty good. All the other food our group had was ok. A bit overpriced for what your getting.
author: Deisy L.

description: A ok! My friend dragged me here for her bday lol! I ended up just getting a salad since I'm not really a burger type girl. The waiter was very cute though hehe! The service was really good I have to say and poor staff had to deal with a bunch of obnoxious tourist dodger fans which some were so bad they had to be kicked out. It's located on pier 39 so it's your touristy place. So I would take someone if they were visiting and not really culinary adventurous.
author: Nadia N.

description: This was my first (and likely only) stop at Wipeout Bar & Grill on Pier 39.  The menu definitely caters tourists looking for a quick bite and beverage, and there's something offered for just about any palate...from burgers to Asian.  I was tempted by the Steak teriyaki bowl served over coconut rice.  Though the steak strips were tasty and tender, they were literally floating in wet and soggy rice slurry.  This offering should not have left the kitchen, and I'm not tempted to return for another try.
author: Louis H.

description: Salmon filet, all day. Service hit or miss. Ask for Domíníc.
author: O. Reli-yah S.

description: If I could give zero stars I would. Absolutely horrible service,  food was cold when it came out. Asked to speak to a manager he was very rude. Reached across the table over plates and spit when he spoke into one of our plates. The burgers are dry and over cooked. Servers all have their hair down swinging all over the place. DO NOT EAT HERE
author: Mary G.

description:
Only for the tacos: THE STEAK TACO was better than at most authentic Mexican restaurants. I swear. I am not lying. Just have the steak taco & don't order anything else & you will be in heaven!!!!!!!

Oh yeah and the cool pick up window, so you can skip going inside, is an extra bonus!
author: Barbara D.

description:
We came up to the Wipe Out in on this past Saturday (9/1/12). The food was great as usual. Luke waited on us and the service was excellent. Me and my family want to thank Luke, the waiter, David, the general manager, and Bob, Simco VP, for going out of their way to make our evening out at Fisherman's Wharf the best ever. And especially thank you for the gift card. It's not every restaurant management team that will do this for it customers. You have earned a lifelong patron. Whenever we are at the wharf we will certainly stop by for a bite or drink. Keep up the good work.

Robert L.
author: Robert L.

description:
I like it :) I like chain restaurants, idk why. Visiting the pier at night, our last night in SF, we looked for a place to have our last dinner on our trip.

I wanted authentic Clam Chowder in a bread bowl, a pier classic. But my boyfriend is vegetarian, and a lot of the seafood restaurants didn't have anything for him.We finally settles on this place, near the front of Pier 39, non-threatening and silly looking, with my bread bowl on the menu!

We had the cheese fries to yelp's suggestions, AWESOME. My boyfriend had a veggie burger, he loved it! I had the... breadbowl of chowder! duh! it was great! and I'm a chowder lover, so I know chowder. yummmmmmmm.

The waiter was super nice, and we got to sit inside and watch the sunset on the pier ! There's an outside seating area too, with a fire pit. At some point a homeless person came in and just sat at a table. They didn't do anything about it, and eventually the person just left. 

Overall, I really liked it, I thought it was cute and the food wasn't disappointing :)
author: Nicole M.

description: Frozen food and bad service with an over priced ticket.  Skip the food and just have a drink.
author: David W.

description: Before I get to the food I just wanna talk about the service. The place was hustling and bustling like I always saw and our party of 4 was seated almost instantaneously. The guy taking our orders didn't write a single thing down and didn't make a single mistake. (Huge props to him since I saw him help another 2 tables before running back). On to the food. Fish and Chips were completely average compared to others, but the price tag on it was insane ($15.50) compared to everywhere else on the pier ($6.50 - $8.50) the fish was a few pieces overly caked in batter and didn't taste very great at all. Tried my girlfriends calamari and  it was unbearably rubbery and didn't have much flavor. The worst part was the coleslaw. I have yet to have coleslaw that horrible. It tasted so sour and was so dry I wanted to puke. To top it off I ended up puking not too much later. The TL;DR. Service is great. Experience is pretty cool. Food is pretty subpar.
author: Jason B.

description:
My buddy and I were out at about 10 at night looking for a place to have some beers on the Famous Fisherman's Wharf.  We saw Wipeout at the entance to Poer 39 and each got a big beer.  The beer was good and it was a beautiful night out.  The bartender was pleasant and we had some good conversation.

The menu looked okay, but it seemed like a typical chain restaurant and there weren't enough TVs around.

I couldn't see paying $8.50 plus tip for a beer so we headed back to the Sheraton with a six pack of Stella Artois from 7-11 and watched some TV.

I could see going with a family for a sit down lunch but I have been to the Bubba Gump's on Fisherman's Wharf and I liked it a lot better for a chain like restaurant.
author: Jason K.

description:
Every blue moon, I love go to to Pier 39 and hang out like a tourist on the weekends!

When my husband and I got there, we were starving and the closest non-seafood place we found was Wipeout! (I love Seafood, he doesn't)

I like this place because there is outside and inside seating!
They have a huge screen to watch games on (Go SF GIANTS) and they have huge windows where you can see the Rocket Boat and other Bay Cruise boats leave.

The food is basic and average! Nothing great but not awful!
The service could improve because our waitress was soooo slow.
Took her forever to take our order, check on us and bring us our bill!

This is a great place to just hang out! I really enjoyed my experience minus the slow waitress!
author: Stephanie M.

description: love coming here and just relaxing..not a fan of Pier 39, but this place is a must stop, hang out by the fire pit and have a fee drinks
author: Larry K.

description: Great breakfast. Sit outside if weather permits. If they are busy you will  need to wait a while at the bar. Hard to get the Bartender's attention. Tried to overcharge for a drink but the manager corrected for me
author: Steve H.

description: We got a table for two straight away. I had the shrimp and steak stir fry with rice. Absolutely delicious! After a few weeks travelling around the US it was brilliant to find healthy good food. My friend had fish and chips and thoroughly enjoyed hers. The fish wasn't greasy at all and the batter was perfect. Service was excellent. If we were staying in San Francisco longer this would be our regular!
author: Juliette O.

description: Fish and chips are amazing! Clam chowder was also so yummy but apparently "the whole pier ran out of bread bowls" as told to me by our sever but I did see someone outside eating a bread bowl, it wasn't a big deal but I didn't appreciate a lie from the get go. Our server was mediocre, not to friendly, seemed preoccupied. The thing that absolutely grossed me out to the max is the condiments on the table....they looked bacteria infested for sure!
author: Adelle K.

description:
I was expecting to be disappointed based on reviews, but it wasn't bad at all. 

Keep in mind it's a tourist area and a casual sit down restaurant with a tropical theme. Plenty of lunch options $9-12 and also a bunch of $15-20 options if you're looking for dinner.  The place reminded me a bit of Islands but with a bigger menu. 

I had a 2 taco plate that was $11. The fish and steak were very moist and they came with a jalepeno cream sauce that was pretty tasty!

The place was mostly empty at lunch time, but other days I've seen it pretty full around the same time. The service was fine. I normally wouldn't have sit down for lunch on a weekday just so I don't have to tip, but I'm glad I stopped in.
author: Karl I.

description:
They had 23 oz beers for $8.50.  I guess my friends and I are cheap because we all thought that was too much and my friend ended up keeping the glass even though he wasn't supposed to.  In retrospect, it is Pier 39 and rents are very high, so what can you expect, prices are going to be high because of the location.  

We had to ask for silverware twice.  Had to ask for malt vinegar twice.  Don't they ever look at the table to see if silverware is there?  Seems kinda basic.  Fish was ok, didn't give me the shits at least.  It wasn't that great though, I didn't finish it.    

An unenthusiastic 4 stars.  Wah wah.  I might be back.  Place is a little better than your average Chevy's.  The wannabee Gordon Biersch garlic fries were pretty yummy and might bring me back.  Perhaps next time I'll try something different.

On a positive note, servings are very big.  Also the owner contacted me regarding the service and said he would talk to the employees so I bumped up my review from 3 stars to 4 stars because I have faith that the owner cares about the customers and that the small problems (like silverware and malt vinegar) will get fixed.
author: Cynthia B.

description: Food was eh, the chips and salsa had burned bits os something on the plate. The fried combo had to have been frozen and the fries were limp.  My husband had a steak and shrimp bowl which ok but chock full of zucchini. My son had fish tacos which he liked but the rice and beans had no flavor!
author: Kim W.

description: The service was ok. The wait was not worth the food. The burgers were burned. I had tacos that didn't have cook tortillas. The calamari was the only decent thing we ate. Restaurants should have good food even when they are busy!!! Wipeout has wiped out on us choosing it again.
author: Tim W.

description: Fun, but way too busy...fantastically busy with people waiting, standing, stalking the maitre'd!!!
author: R J.

description:
I know, I know, it's a touristy place, blah blah blah... in my defense I don't live in SF. I went here for my last night in SF and I wish I had been here before...

I love the decor, it's bright and fun and the atmosphere is very friendly.

I am a sucker for clam chowder soup so I got the salad and soup combo. At first I thought it was going to be too small, because those combos tend to be, but not this one! You also get the bread bowl just in case you do need some more filling goodness! 

Overall this place was cheap, delicious and good quality food. I will definitely be back. I just wish it was warmer so I could have sat outside. =(
author: Sylvia M.

description: The fish for the fish and chips was great and crispy. The fries were not so good which is why they get 3 stars. Had the carnitas tacos and they were really good. The buffalo wings and burgers were good. Great service.
author: Ady B.

description: I live in walking distance to Pier 39 so I stroll over when we have out of town guests so they can check out the Sea Lions! This place has consistently good, fast service (and the wait staff seem to be mostly college kids) and a very wide choice of menu items. In the evening it's so pleasant to sit outside on the WipeOut's patio on Adirondack chairs arranged around small fireplaces.
author: Paula H.

description:
Food was great. Loved the atmosphere. Waitress very nice and the food came out super-quick. I had the clam chowder in a sourdough bowl which was good. My niece and sister-in-law had their BBQ sandwich. They both said it was the most delicious sandwich they've ever had. 
My other niece had a hot dog and who knows if that was good or not because my niece doesn't say much but the hot dog was huge. It looked more like a Polska kielbasa than your typical hot dog.
The location was ideal and the prices were right on. We went on a Saturday afternoon and were seated quickly. Thanks Wipeout!
author: Loretta J.

description:
Stopped by Wipout Bar and Grill after wandering throughout San Francisco and Fisherman's Warf. We were in the mood for seafood and their sign for fish tacos drew us in. 

The restaurant has a cute atmosphere and a nice outdoor patio to enjoy the warm San Fran weather and do some people watching. The tacos were great, and just what we were craving. They also came with some really great and flavorful black beans and rice. Besides the tacos, we also ordered a cup of clam chowder. The chowder was thick and creamy with nice big chunks of potato and clams.

Our waitress here was excellent and very helpful. She was glad to answer all of our questions about what places we needed to see as well as other great restaurants to try, including a great little dim sum shop in China Town.
author: Kim R.

description:
Went to Wipeout to grab some lunch.  David the manager greeted me at the door and was very nice and welcoming.
I had the Salmon BLT and it was delicious!  And my server Lex, was  delight, and even drew me a map on how to get to SOMA from there.
I will definitely be back!
author: Heather E.

description: This place is a lot of fun! We actually have more fun here than any place on the pier.  The wait can be painful at time but the beer is cold and the food is very well done.  Still one of our favorite places on the pier to hang out.
author: John C.

description:
Two words, tourist & trap.

Rude manager, he took a to go cup of coke right out of a guys hands and says he can't have it.  Hello?  Course he then tore into the poor waitress, in front of everyone, this guy is a jerk and is an embarrassment not only to the wipeout, but the entire pier 39.
author: Rolland L.

description:
Usually I can live with bad service if the food is great,but in this place everything was all the way around.The waiters are really friendly,checked on me couple of times during my meal,but the food was horrible.I ordered deep-fried seafood with fries and coleslaw and that was the most terrible meal I've ever had.Apparently they ran out of salt in the kitchen because my food was totally tasteless,shimp was chewy,french fries were barely warm,eating coleslaw was the same as eating paper,normally I would send the food back but I felt bad because my waiter was great and i didn't want to boss him around.
Would I recommend this place to my friends?Definetely not.
author: anastasia a.

description: Not a bad place, but the service could have been better. I came in with a group of four adults and two children and we were charged 14% gratuity, really? I thought that was outragous!. I will definitely will go somewhere else next time!
author: Alfredo G.

description: Burgers are not fresh and were over cooked. Missing the onion straws on my burger and the waitress tried to convince me it doesn't come with them even though the menu shows it. Shared servers, one nice, one not. Would not recommend.
author: Jason S.

description:
Strong TWO stars...lol

I have actually had better! We stopped here to grab a bite before our Alcatraz ferry and I didn't want to eat anything heavy. I ordered the Clam Chowder (in the bread bowl) with a salad and my son had the cheeseburger. Kids will eat anything, so he enjoyed his food. I was a little disappointed in the flavor of my chowder and the bread bowl was definitely kinda gross.

This place was just ok for me. Nothing to write home about...the service was good...and our server was really nice. I'm glad I didn't pay a ridiculous fee for mediocre food - because then I would've REALLY been pissed off!! 

Live and learn...this place WON'T be on my list of places to visit again.

********* UPDATE ***********

I just got a note from Bob the manager asking about my experience. I'm giving this place an extra star because of it. Now THIS is exactly the kind of customer service that more establishments should be giving!!!
author: Tam M.

description:
How have I not reviewed this Wipeout yet?

Yes, it is a tourist location so the prices are higher than other places.  It is still cheaper than many options on the pier and many options at home.  If you wanted a $4 burger, would you have been at Pier 39 in the first place?

Every time we are here, we have been seated right away.  Service has been good.  Last time our waiter was a little grumpy when he first came over, but he brightened up after bringing our drinks.

Burgers:  Huge and fantastic!
Ahi Tuna Sandwich: Great!  Possibly one of their best things.
Tacos: Shrimp, good, not skimpy on the shrimp.  Carnitas: Also good, their best taco combo.  Fish:  Great, very flavorful and meaty.  All three options I had had the same sauces and were very juicy.  

I love this place, it's a great place to eat while at the tourist center of San Francisco.  Service is fast and the place is clean.  They have TVs with surfing on everywhere and the flow of people in and out keeps a toddler occupied.  Be sure to get your parking validated.
author: David W.

description: The food was pretty good for its price. I thought it was a little weird my waiter was wearing a helmet but if you go there ask for Lisa she's the best. She told me what flavor the windows were, apparently they are delicious.
author: Zachary F.

description: Excellent, david gets 5 star for his humour and service. I have been here many times and each time the experience is better.
author: Sunny E.

description:
This review is based solely on the outdoor quick dining area, and not the larger indoor restaurant.

**

Just prior to boarding the ship to Alcatraz (awesome), we headed to Fisherman's Wharf @ Pier 39 to get some tasty treats since no food is allowed on the island.  

This restaurant is located near the street end of the pier, so easily accessible and not a far walk.  This location has two components; a dine in restaurant and a "fast food" style outside ordering window in the shape of a VW bus. 

We ate at the outside quick location.  The menu was simple and varied, containing interesting and random items.  We saw various items such as Gnarley Garlic Fries, Teriyaki Chicken Wings, and a Chicken Quesadilla.

Ordering was slightly awkward since one needs to lower themselves down to order.  Not a huge issue at all.  The concept is great and very "California".  The food is well priced, considering the nature of the area. 

The food we received was average, with a few notables.  I ordered the Gnarley Garlic Fries, which were fantastic.  I'm a huge garlic fan and enjoyed the kick that they had.  I also had ordered the Teriyaki Chicken Wings.  They had an unusual flavor, not so much teriyaki, but more plain than anything else.  My friend also ordered the chicken quesadilla.  Nothing to write home about.

Overall, a great place to pick up a quick bite while walking the pier or prior to jumping on a boat to Alcatraz.

**Note - after my original post, I received a message from a manager of this restaurant who was genuinely concerned about customer feedback.  His explanation and concern compelled me to rewrite my review to more accurately reflect my experience.  Thank you very much Bob.
author: Brian F.

description: The food was OK at best except for the onion rings which were really good. It seemed kinda dirty and sticky and service was eh. I wouldn't go back but in a pinch its OK.
author: David C.

description: Not great. Stop here if you want a quick meal on the cheapish side. Wouldn't come here again. The staff is very friendly, though.
author: Jack F.

description: Cold, hungry, and fed up with expensive food we decided on Wipout. We ordered Bailey's & Coffee to take the edge off of the crisp ocean air, then decided on bread bowls while people watching. The clam chowder bread bowl was worth the long wait, which the manager apologized for by discounting our food. The calamari was just okay, but I would recommend this place! Great prices too!
author: Sommer B.

description: In & out burgers are far better. Just not worth the 35$ for 2 burgers. The taste was nothing special.
author: Nejc T.

description: Food was good but if you ordered from the outside, good luck in finding a seat. We had to go search the pier for a seat and when youre hungry the last thing you want to do is look for a place to eat the food you have in your hand already thats getting cold.
author: Shanna R.

description: My husband ordered the Fried Calamari as the appetizer and expressed it was "heavily battered" but it wasn't greasy. It wasn't bad it was just a little odd. He ordered the fish and chips as his main entree and said it was good. I ate the Summer Love Burger along with the garlic fries and was very pleased. The fries were awesome! However the service was nonexistent. We were never offered a refill on our drinks and couldn't get anyone to retrieve payment for the meal after receiving the bill. 15 minutes of waiting, led us to the hostess stand and to pay. As long as you aren't concerned with customer service then it's an okay place but I would not recommend it to anyone.
author: Marquelle S.

description:
It was a busy Sunday afternoon, the place was packed. We were promptly greeted and was sat in a timely manner. It was refreshing to see the managers hustling and bustling around instead of just standing around. Our server's name was Lisa, she was very positive and suggested a few of her menu favorites, which I really do appreciate. I always ask servers what would they order so she off the top answered that question. The food came fairly quick. I ordered a mahi mahi bowl which damn near knocked my sox off. Even though it was busy, the drink refills kept coming. Again the floor managers were refilling and clearing plates which I think is totally awesome. We didn't feel rushed to leave. 
     All in all the atmosphere was great, food was great, but how they earned that fifth star was the high level of service during a very busy afternoon.
author: Sean F.

description: not bad of a place to go for lunch. had the salmon blt which is around 15 bones and comes with fries. little on the pricey side but so is every place around the pier. service was pretty good, waitress was attentive and often came by to refill my drink like three times.
author: Ethyl M.

description: Michael was great! My friend and I are visiting from Connecticut and he told us the sights to see. He work a black skull cap and pulled it off like a champ. He was extremely pleasant and genuine and we are drunk so good job Michael- it's cool we are not driving. Thanks for showing us a good time. Wings were Great. Calamari...eh .
author: Ronald D.

description:
I went with several friends of mine and I thought this place was pretty good! I had a clam chowder breadbowl and garlic fries for an appetizer. The bread bowl was pretty filling but I couldn't stop eating those garlic fries. I can safely say those were probably one of the best garlic fries that I had; it wasn't too garlic-ie but just the right amount of flavor. 

I think the bill was a bit too much to have for lunch, but I'm gonna say that I had a very good meal. I'd come back again or recommend this place
author: Greg H.

description: I took a group of 16 coworkers here for breakfast as part of a team building day.  We were seated at 9:00am on a Wednesday and we were the only ones in the restaurant.  Their breakfast is pretty much standard diner fair eggs, bacon, toast, waffles, pancakes...  I had the California breakfast.  Everything was cooked well and the portion size was perfect.  They had us in and out in good time and the wait staff was very accommodating for so many of us.  They do have outside seating but not for a group as large as ours.  I'd say if you're on the pier and need a quick breakfast that won't break the bank they fit the bill.
author: Kristina T.

description: I came here this last Sunday with my bf because we were so hungry and didn't want to keep walking so we just decided to eat here. I have always passed by here but have never tried it so we did. I ordered a cheeseburger with garlic fries and my bf the fish and chips. My burger was well done and I really liked the garlic fries they were really good. I didn't try my bf's fish and chips but he said they were good..or maybe we were just really hungry. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here though.
author: arlene d.

description:
Yum! This place averages about $10-$15 for an entree, but still relatively cheaper than other Pier 39 restaurants.

My boyfriend and I came here after one of those cruises around the bay, and this was a good pick. What caught my eye was the fire pit they have in their outdoor seating. What a nice way to kick back and relax around a fire with some friends in this laidback surfer restaurant. Ignore the bustling tourists.

We were both fairly hungry, but perhaps not enough to eat an entire meal. So, we got a bowl of clam chowder and their Wipeout Fried Combo (fried fish, calamari, and breaded shrimp skewers). It was all pretty good, the batter not being too thick and crisp to near perfection. The only thing is that the calamari rings are relatively small in ratio to the batter. Their fries were perfectly crispy I must say. This dish alone was pretty filling for the 2 of us.

Clam chowder was worth it as well. Flavorful with some of those octagonal crackers on the side. Helped wash down the seafood!
author: michelle f.

description: Excellent service by Wyatt. Food was great the Burgers were so yummy!!! Great atmosphere and cool location.
author: Shannon A.

description:
Service was great!

At first, my friend and I decided to sit outside where we were immediately helped by a very friendly waitress. She got our drinks and appetizer very quickly. It got pretty cold so we asked to sit inside. I was nervous about asking because I didn't want to be a pain, but I didn't have anything to worry about. The waitress was understanding and immediately asked the hostess about indoor seating. She told us it would be a 10 minute wait, but then came back a few minutes later to let us know that our table was ready. 

When we got inside, the manager, Edwin, greeted us and gave suggestions for food & drinks to order. Once we decided, our new waiter (Herbert) got our order in. We didn't have to wait long for our food to come out. 
Salmon BLT and fish tacos were great! 
Loved how friendly and accommodating the staff were. Everyone is really nice and it makes the whole experience very enjoyable.
author: Christina E.

description: The Wipeout is a great spot. Brandon D., our waiter, was awesome along with the chili. I don't know what made me happier, the beans or our waiter, but the service was great!
author: Andie M.

description: "Had a great anniversary week in SF and stumbled upon Wipeout. We were recommended the Wipeout Burger and Anchor IPA...what a great combo! We asked the really nice bartender Michael where we can have a romantic dinner. He suggested Fog Harbor upstairs. Really great dinner! I would try either one these places if your coming to SF!
author: John R.

description:
I chose this place because it was one of the more inexpensive places to eat at the Pier 39.  It loooked pretty cool with the whole surfer theme.  Perfect for my friend who was visiting from Arizona.  She had the fish tacos and I tried them, AMAZING.  I ordered the burger with blue cheese, cannot remember for the life of me what it was called, California something I think.  Anyways, it was delish, but the bread was a little too grilled.  
The beer was kind of pricey but they had a good selection.  The waitress was pretty awesome too.  I would go back here and order the fish tacos next time, I'm hooked now!  It's a cute little place in a great location & great service.
author: Ashley W.

description:
Went to this restaurant after not being able to get service somewhere else.  Turned out to be a great thing.

I had the 3 fish tacos.  Not the greatest, but good.  Service was fast and friendly.  Beer was cold.  Unlike many thing on the wharf, the prices seemed fair for what they were and the location.

Can you ask for anything else?  I will definitely come back here.
author: Ted H.

description: Great food, decent price, and Brandon was awesome! He made great recommendations for our lunch and was spot on - it was delicious. He was so cute and nice, will definitely come back if just to hang out with him!
author: Taylor G.

description: Yuck!  We ordered chocolate lava cake (chocolate cake topped with vanilla ice cream) and apparently they stored the ice cream with the fish! Fish flavored ice cream with chocolate?  GROSS!!!!
author: Kevin I.

description:
We had the fish tacos and the salmon bowl both were good. They had a good 
variety for the  kids menu. Most of all we had GREAT service from Alexa.  Try to sit on her area. Enjoy!!!!
author: Peg E.

description:
I usually don't dine in touristy areas mainly because the restaurant are usually over rated. But my bf and I wanted to grab some drinks, snacks and then walk it off. 
We decided to go to the wipeout mainly because every time we come the pier we always pass by and it is always crowded. 
The hostess took down our name and told us the wait would be about 10 mins. We were seated around 10-15 mins, our server approached our table and took our drink orders I don't remember his name but I love his entuseasiem. My bf and I both ordered the bowl of clam chowder and some fried calamaris. The food came out at a good pace but our waiter kept forgetting to bring us extra sauces but I don't really blame him since it was really busy and I've been in that position before. But the food was great the clam chowder wasn't too heavy and the calamaris were fresh and wasn't too dry or over-cooked. 
It was a good experience I would definitely come back when it's not too cold outside and dine on the patio.
author: J W.

description: I'm not a foodie, but I like food and I like restaurants that have something for my whole family, great atmosphere, and quality service.  I'm sure this is a tourist restaurant, but that's what we were in our first visit on 7/8/13.  We had looked at other restaurants but the menus did not satisfy.  We went for lunch and were seated promptly.  Our waitress was very pleasant and even took our picture without a problem.  I had the fish tacos, my wife had the carne asada tacos, and my kids got pizza or a corn dog meal.  The food was great!!  We all ate everything.  The manager even came by to check to see if everything was going well.  I like that.  The bill was expected, about $60 for the five of us with tip.  We were unable to get back there for another dinner but we would visit again and would recommend this to anyone visiting Pier 39!
author: Jeff V.

description:
Went here twice on our recent trip to San Francisco. The first time we went we sat outside and ordered beers and burgers. The burgers were delicious and the beers were nice and cold. Great service too!

On our second visit we started with the garlic fries which were nice and garlicky. Then we ordered 2 pizzas: Hawaii 5 Ohh and the Chorizo & Chicken. Being from the East Coast, we are a little particular about our pizza (being it's the best!) These pizzas were very large (we could have split one) and were quite good. 

Definitely would come here again on another trip. Good service and good prices.
author: Chrim K.

description: Great food and the service was awesome, we were in a large group and people kept changing their mind but they were happy to accommodate our requests..
author: Manu M.

description: Great place to chill and drink. Nice patio for sun and people watching!!
author: John V.

description: This place sucks, I came up to NoCal for work, so after I decided to visit fishermen's wharf. I walking down the pier and when I finished my sight seeing I seen this place and decide to give it a try. Bad idea order calamari first then changed my mind and order fish tacos instead. So when my food came out it was the calamari, let down but decided that I was hungry so I just kept it. They tasted like all batter and minimal amount of the flavorless calamari. So I order the turkey burger with BBQ sauce, this was also not good. The burger had a soapy taste like they had soap on the grill or something. There are so many other place to eat.
author: Anthony L.

description: I have had so many enjoyable meals at Wipeout Grill. The décor is California Surfer and the food is casual dining. The taquitos are my favorite, because they are different from what you might expect. They are crunchy, flavorful and the sauce is lightly spicy. Most other taquitos I have found to be kind of bland. It is fun to bring out of town guests here to get the California Surfer experience. I like to sit and relax after a meal and I have never felt rushed by the wait staff. I highly recommend this place.
author: SF Bay Area D.

description:
This place is on pier 39.  It has a cute surfer appeal.  It reminds me of an islands, where all the screens have surfing, wake-boarding, snowboarding, etc on them.  I our server was fantastic, except for one minor accounting error at the end which was immediately fixed.  The food is decent.  It is not 5 star cuisine, but definitely got the job done....filling me up!  My two friends got margaritas and the other a banana pudding drink and they all loved them, and said they were pretty strong.   

If you around pier 39 check this place out.  If I lived in the city I would fend off the crowds and go back.
author: Kimmy G.

description:
We chose Wipeout for a large group, 20 in total, 50% girls age 11-12 and 50% moms. It was perfect! The menu was extensive and affordable. The vibe in the place was a lot of fun and our server was GREAT. I want to say his name was Michael but I did have a very large margarita so it's possible I have that wrong.

We started with chips and salsa and great margaritas for the moms. The drinks were large, delicious, and a good strong pour! I felt my drink before I was even half way through. The food was tasty. My kid ate all of her chicken and fries and I devoured my meal too. I opted for the two taco combo which offers you a choice of a few different types of tacos. I chose one carnitas, one grilled fish. They were both sooo delicious. They came with rice and beans and although I usually don't each much of that part of my meal, the beans were really good too.

I was really pleasantly surprised and would definitely come back again!
author: Jen B.

description: If you want cheaper seafood, this is the place to go on Pier 39.  The service is decent, but not very flexible with various requests and not incredibly attentive.  The food is good, the drinks are big.
author: Marianna K.

description: The free garlic bread you get for checking was good.  I had the teriyaki burger, sauce was strange and for 100% fresh beef the burger tasted like it had been frozen.  My wife ordered the taco salad, no onions.  The waitress said the beans had onions in them and they could leave them off.   Our food was delivered by a runner.  Well her meal had beans and the dreaded onions.  It took 10 minutes or so before we got checked on again.  By this time I was finished eating.  So my wife left hungry and I left unsatisfied.
author: Matt C.

description: Food's good, but not worth the unisex bathroom. Seriously. Disgusting. Men were not made to share bathrooms with women.
author: Jess D.

description: My family and I were spending some time in San Fransisco and happened upon this place on Pier 39. My son suggested we should try it, but after a terrible meal the night before at Joe's Crab Shack, we were reluctant. Boy, am I ever glad we did, this place has the BEST service EVER! Manager John was our waiter, and he was fantastic!! Our drinks never hit empty, he was quick to offer food recommendations, and he was so pleasant. We had the best meal, our drinks were cold and yummy, and the service was outstanding- from the hostess, to the busboys, everyone was pleasant! We loved it so much, we decided to return the next night. Manager John saw us walking through the door and had our drinks ready when we hit our table! WOW! So happy we returned.
author: Karri W.
