description: Good burger and chilli cheese fries and great service. Enjoyed the atmosphere. Pier 39 can't complain
author: Positive S.

description: This place is pretty good. I like the variety on the menu which is great, especially when you are with a group of people who have different eating restrictions. It's not fantastic, but its good.
author: AnnMarie V.

description: Totally not worth the money for breakfast. Service and food was mediocre. Won't be back and won't recommend this place.
author: Jeri H.

description: Our visit to the city was made memorable by the food and service we received at Wipeout Bar and Grill. ASHLEY was an attentive and knowledgeable server, she even had the personality to have fun with my companion's off set humor. We had the best burgers, pineapple chicken and hand made veggie. Thanks again Ashley I never would have guessed there were plums in the veggie burger....delicious!!
author: Sherri R.

description: Stopped in because we could get a table fairly quickly. Big mistake as its a giant tourist restaurant trap! Food is sub par and the service was off. The girl had her head in the clouds the whole time and took forever with drinks and refills. Avoid this place if you can. Over priced and not worth your time in my opinion.
author: Dave Z.

description: This is always our go-to place for steak nachos. They are so yummy! My husband also likes their coconut shrimp & garlic fries.
author: A A.

description: Me, my husband, and another couple were hanging out at Pier 39 looking for a place to eat. Most places at the pier were pretty pricey so we chose Wipeout Bar and Grill. Their prices were suitable but the food was nothing to scream about. The clam chowder was ok. I also ordered a fish and grilled chicken taco. I was not impressed. My husband ordered the Teriyaki Chicken Bowl. It was a generous amount of food but really sweet. Overall, the atmosphere was family friendly but the food was just OK.
author: Pugsly W.

description: Wipeout is a great spot at Pier 39!! We had Brandon D. who was cool beans just like the chili bread bowl!! Seriously - great place and service!
author: Claire C.

description:
Went here last night and it was just OK. Probably won't ever want to come back unless I had no other choice. 

We thought it was a plus that they had a gazillion TV's as there were some NBA games on that we wanted to watch, but all their tv's were playing clips of people surfing-- which wasn't a huge deal I guess, just don't call yourself a bar and not have any games on...

Anyway, onto the food--- we ordered and shared the garlic fries, wings, sweet and sour calamari and the shrimp linguine.
The shrimp linguine was REALLY tasty. The shrimps were cooked perfectly and was nice and juicy. The sauce was good and we thought it was a good dish, it was just a pretty small portion for the price... The garlic fries were nice and crispy. Just average in my opinion. The wings were okay and the sweet n sour calamari wasn't so good. All in all, just an ok experience, but nothing worth going back for...
author: Chi T.

description:
CAN YOU SAY YUCK! cause I can when I come here. Their take out window is ok [hence why I gave it 2 stars] but when you sit inside it's a total let down. Being on pier 39 a huge tourist destination you would expect it to be somewhat good. 

Lets start with the fact that it took the server 15 mins to come say hi to us & another 10 to take our orders. When it came out the plates were dirty, the server was rude & the food burgers were ok, nothing special at all. Will probably be the last place I'll be eating when on pier 39. complete & total let down especially for the money.
author: Dessa S.

description: We returned to one of our favorite places to eat while visiting SF and once again delighted with Wipeout. Love the fish tacos and especially the jalapeño burger. Service was spot on and we were again surprised how fast our food was delivered to our table. Well done everyone.
author: Alan D.

description: Meh....I've had better. Service was okay, food was alright and a super long wait time. Not coming back.
author: Jozelle D.

description: Service was phenomenal got the Shrimp linguini it was okay I wanted to try something different but it did fill me up . My gf got the jalapeño burger and it the jalapeños was the best she ever had and it was great . We also got the calamari appetizer and that was awesome little pricey but all in all I enjoyed my food and service , waiter refilled my soda every time it was empty
author: Kamaka B.

description: Went here again this weekend and got the Buffalo Chicken Pizza again. So good. This time I remembered to take pictures before I ate it. Our server was nice and attentive. We decided to sit outside and they put us under a heat lamp. We were getting a little too warm so we asked if we could move to another table. They were really nice about it.
author: Dee P.

description: I give them nothing in all the past bars they have always changed the drink after two sips to a different one with no extra charge, but this is the first bar/ restaurant that did this to me. This is the first and the last time I drink here. Bar tenders are not even friendly if your not their race and they don't even care to ask if everything is ok or if you need something, defiantly the worst service in pier 39. Michael and some other guy around 651 pm are the worst. Ok so before I payed when I was complaining to my friend a different guys came up grabbed the ticket and changed it to the correct price l, but only because he knew what I was ya liking to him. So for that I give them 4 stars and not one
author: Juan D B.

description: Update from my last review.  As mentioned my family's experience with the Wipeout Bar and Grill at Pier 39 was absolutely horrible. After bringing our experience to the attention of the company, a promise to look into our experience was offered. A somewhat confusing and contradictory apology letter was sent (We do appreciate the effort but it was really lacking and presented as disingenuous).  I would suggest people take their custom elsewhere.
author: Kevin R.

description: French fries are inedible, overall meal bad.  Server was fine but not much to represent other than location.
author: Mark S.

description:
After going to the Aquarium we were tired of walking and hungry, so walked into Wipeout.  To be honest, we didn't have huge expectations for the food, it was just conveniently located.  We ended up ordering chips and salsa, 2 orders of tacos (including fish, chicken and carne asada), and fish and chips for the kids.   Everything we ate exceeded expectations.  The jalapeno sour cream on the tacos was awesome- in fact, we asked for extra to dip the chips in.  All of the tacos were good, but the carne asada was REALLY good.  They give you a lot of meat and it's seasoned very well.

In addition to the food being a pleasant surprise, the service was great as well.  Our server was named Lisa (with brown hair) and she made us feel immediately welcome.  She was also very attentive and didn't make us feel like a pain, even though we asked for additional sauce and one of the kids spilled their milk and made a mess.  

Net/net, if you are looking for a fun atmosphere, reasonable prices and good food, I highly recommend Wipeout.
author: Steph Y.

description: This review is for the take-out option as we did not go into the restaurant. First, this is one of the more affordable options for a quick meal at the Warf. As an affordable option, we had mixed feelings. The fish and chips was pretty good, and a decent deal. The coconut shrimp was not as good of a deal. There were only four, small shrimp with the meal alongside fish. If hungry, the fish and chips are better for the price, and better as far as quality.
author: L H.

description: A friend visiting San Francisco or the first time wanted to check out Pier 39.  We soon figured out that we needed a dinner place that provides parking validation.  At Wipeout, we got that, and a reasonably priced, tasty, casual meal.  Great atmosphere, great friendly service!
author: Roslyn R.

description:
Nothing special about this place, really. You just need to know that since it's located at Pier 39, it's meant for tourists, which means the prices are higher than they should be.

There is a pretty large selection of food: burgers, fried seafood, sandwiches, etc., along with various alcoholic concoctions.

I opted for the Jalapeño burger (topped with pickled jalapeños, jalapeño relish and melted jack cheese on a toasted bun). It wasn't bad at all. My fiancee ordered the Wipeout Fried Combo (combination of fried fish, calamari and coconut shrimp). They give you quite a lot of thickly breaded calamari, but not very much shrimp or fish. Also, the shrimp still had their crap-filled intestines in them. Both entrees came with fries as well (a bit too much salt added to them).

Overall, Wipeout was alright. Just nothing special, and a bit overpriced.
author: John C.

description:
I was hungry and Wipeout was the first restaurant I saw.  It didn't LOOK bad, so my friend and I decided to eat here.  We were seated in the sun outside and decided to move tables to a shadier area.  A server later asked us to move to a smaller table (we were seated at a table for four).  Having worked at a restaurant before I can understand why-- if there was a party of four waiting to be seated it would make sense to have them sit at our table so they wouldn't have to wait.  Good customer service for them, but kind of bad for us.  No biggie though. 

I ordered the Salmon BLT, I love fish!  The salmon was tender and the flavor was just right, but I really felt odd eating it with bread, lettuce, and tomatoes.  Yes, I know it's what I ordered but at the time I didn't think it would taste so weird all together.

My friend ordered the Teriyaki Chicken Sandwich, which was... average.  I had half of it and I can just say it was very forgettable.

Overall this place was just whatevers.  Not good, not bad.  It filled me up--which was basically what I wanted, haha
author: Nina Y.

description: Tacky tourist trap. Only came here because my friends and I were starving and thy weren't willing to look outside the box. Food was edible but not much can be said for it other wise. Servers were standing around talking to each other the whole time, but I guess it was pretty dead at the time, but still try to make an effort to look like you are doing something...
author: Bailey W.

description: Took a early day from work and came to the pier with my family. We walk by this place all the time and decided to stop for dinner. It was the middle of the week in winter so not very many people. The food was not tasty at all. My boyfriends food came out cold. The service was okay... I found it extremely rude that the bus boy was sweeping my daughters mess under her high chair while we were still eating. Mediocre food mediocre service. Probably won't come again unless coerced by tourist friends.
author: Penelope V.

description:
There are places that you eat at just because they look cool, there are places that you eat at because you get recommend .... and then there are places that you eat at because they say they have a big burrito (and look pretty cool.)  

So everyone has been saying that the service is good.  They are wrong, Molly was one of the best servers I've had.  She was attentive but not pushy, every question I asked (a lot because I was feeling pedantic)  she either knew the answer to of went to find out, the recommended drink (Shawna's Summer Splash) could have had paint thinner in it and I still would have drank the whole thing, it was GREAT!

The kids meal was not a big hit, for my son, but I thought the dog was really good.  The Gnarly Garlic fries were also SLAMMING, though the whole "fresh" garlic makes me want to slap someone, it isn't fresh if it was made a few days ago people ... I don't have any proof but the taste said "I am not fresh you lover of garlic above all things" (vampires would die if they touched me.)  The Shrimp Burrito ... not spicy, but very tasty.  It wasn't the size of a Hula Hut Tubular Taco, but it was big enough to make me feel like I was going to bust through my pants.  

FYI there is a nice photo op right close with half of a VW minibus, pretty funny, there is also a pretty good one with the surfer dude hanging out.  I really enjoyed this place, and would recommend it.  Very Tasty!

The only complaint I have is the music was drowned out by the tool at the front of Pier 39 trying to sell his CDs.  Dude, if I want to buy a CD I'll go to a store, or iTune it.
author: Brad S.

description: Fun place to sit and watch all the tourist!  Food is good and tropical drinks!
author: Kenneth G.

description: We came in to have some finger food and to get a lil tipsy. The bartender was very chill and made some nice drinks for us. The decor of the place was very beach like with surf boards and other lil things. It was pretty koo. We had great conversation and laughs.
author: Anji W.

description: We came here during Fleet Week so our toddler could eat some pizza.  The service was good, always came and asked if everything was ok.  I ordered the fish tacos, I liked them.  The sauce had a nice kick to it.  My wife like her salmon club.  Our son's pizza from the kids meal was worse than a $1 Totino's pizza they sell in the frozen food section for your grocery store.  We also ordered the kids sundae.  I was wondering why our toddler didn't eat it, he loves ice cream.  It was already melted.  I'd bypass this place and look for better food next time.
author: James D.

description: My burger was spot on! My friends burrito was a little dry, I fell like if the meat and sour cream sauce on top was inside, it would have been perfect.  Our server Lisa was outstanding, she was the only reason this place got 5*. Her service even outweighed the horrible music selection. the constant country music ruined the vibe of the restaurant. But overall I was pleased with the food, and the service was outstanding.
author: Trenton L.

description: We went here for dinner last night. I ordered the Grilled Chicken Burrito. The thing was gigantic, as it was stuffed with rice, beans and cheese. On  top of that, it came with a side of beans and rice. Carbolicious! Food was decent. It was tourist food at best ~ bland (poured on the Tapatio big time!), overpriced ($10.95), and bad for you (carbs, carbs, carbs).  The margaritas looked good, but I opted to spend the evening with Bud Light. The bathroom was interesting. The entrance is through a red and white tent. It's all unisex and each one has a different color. I would've snapped more pix but to avoid seeming like some crazy lady with a fetish for lavatories, I put the camera away. I did snap one pic inside the stall, though.
author: Allyson M.

description: Love this place everytime we go..Sometimes service is slow but its in a pretty busy area..Food pretty good and beer is great..Try the Kona
author: Martin B.

description:
This place is great for groups -- but don't come here for the food.  As a restaurant in one of San Francisco's major tourist attractions, you'd expect the food to be a little more specialized and San Francisco-esque.  We came with a big group and everyone got appetizers, burgers, fries, and burritos.  Nothing stood out as particularly delicious.  The food tasted more like chain-store food than anything else.  The calamari had way too much breading, the garlic fries didn't have enough flavor, and the burgers could have easily been from Chili's.  Even the clam chowder tasted like it was from a can.

Bottom line: I would only come back here if I wanted to feed a big group on a moderate budget.
author: Julie C.

description:
Breakfast was just average. Coffee not hot, tasted reheated. Sausage mushy. Home fries greasy.

Service friendly, but there are probably a thousand better places to go for breakfast.
author: Roger M.

description: I ate here daily while working on the Fog Harbor Fish House (located above). The breakfast burritos, burgers, and everything else were great. Staff was fun and had a good atmosphere.
author: Scott A.

description:
It's a little too pricey but they give you a good size serving. The price is probably affected by the rental space, being that it's Pier 39. 

I'd recommend that they give out wet naps or they clean their menus since it's a little greasy, not that it's dirty but it probably got oil splattered on it. 

The projector TV is laid out in a way where you can watch from back and front, disadvantage is the guys looking at it from the back will see everything backwards. 

I'd come back here again, just to try out new things on the menu and as most people do... people watch.
author: Edward I.

description:
Went here for Fleet Week this past weekend and I was not impressed!!!!

Since this was my first time in here, I ordered the fish and chips and the Shrimp Burrito.  Why not go all the way right.

The fish and chips seems a little bland and I was a little disappointed in that.  Since this place is on the pier I expected an explosion of taste from the fish but it was lacking that.

I can say the good thing about this place the servings were huge.  My fish and chips had 3 huge pieces of fish and I was like wooooo and the customer service was great.  The place was packed and I mean packed for Fleet Week and we went to tell them a party of 4 and they told us it would be about a 15-20 minute wait.  We said ok and literally 2 minutes later they sat us.  There is inside and outside seating.  We sat inside.

My burrito on the other hand was very good.  The shrimp was seasoned very well.  They were also very good in size. The burrito was huge.  I could only eat half of it.  My favorite part indeed was the rice and beans because guess what...they had CORN in it.  LOVED IT!!!!!!

I decided to give it a 3 star because where the flavor in the fish fell short, it made up for the serving size and the burrito!!!
author: Sandra S.

description: What a Sunday !!! took my family for brunch we checked in and had a wait for 15 minutes which were were told and precisely that was the exact wait time Service was quick we got our order quick with our drinks right on time. we did not have to wait long to be seated and served. A plus was the ambience which is kid friendly as we took our baby with us and our kid who enjoyed looking at the pigeons outside . Will definitely be back as food was also great......
author: Lety S.

description: Came in because they had mac n cheese for the kids it was kid friendly from other places. Food is a solid 2/5 ...Service is fine.
author: Ray M.

description: My two children and I ate here on January 30, around 7 pm. The restaurant was busy, but not packed. We came here because of some discount coupons I got from the CA Visitor's Center upstairs with my AAA card- 20% off or a free kid's meal. The food is excellent- I had the Teriyaki Pineapple Chicken sandwich and my kids had chicken fingers and pizza from the kid's menu. Large portions and tasted great. My only complaint was the service, after our food was dropped off our waiter never came back to check on us or refill drinks. Our cups were empty at least 25 minutes while we ate. I finally had to ask the hostess to bring my son some ranch. When we saw our waiter again he was bringing the check. As a former waitress I feel strongly that you need to check that your table at least has everything they need to eat their meal, especially considering it was not crazy busy. I would eat here again on another trip because the food was excellent and a great choice for families.
author: Maggie R.

description: Food is not good...everything is fried and it's all very bland. Server didn't write down our order and then predictably messed up 2/4 items we ordered.
author: Alexa S.

description: Not bad for a touristy spot. I had the taco salad which was very tasty! and we had the garlic fries as an appetizer which was also good.
author: Ashley N.

description: David was an awesome bartender.  So friendly and fun. Made the perfect drinks for me and my friend. Definitely  coming back to wipe out because of him !
author: S S.

description: Been here many times as it is not expensive and we don't typically have to wait long. We always have the calamari appetizer but today it was flavorless and we are not fans of cocktail sauce that was served with it. I had the turkey burger with  fries, neither gad any flavor.
author: Seth G.

description: Very friendly employees, with great customer service! I love the outside fire pit and their garlic fries are super good!
author: Jessie L.

description: Eating at a restaurant on pier 39 is a crime to me.  I live in SF so why the hell would I want to eat on pier 39.  The only answer is my friend is a skinny ass.  In grad school he was known to be "fine".  I am just jealous cuz I was always known as "fatty".  Surprisingly the burgers here are decent.  I didn't try anything else cuz the rest of the food looked beat.  I still can't believe I ate at this place.  I am disappointed with my fatty self.
author: Fatty A.

description: you have to actually wait for say 15-20 min..the food is on average side taste wise but its quite filling. we tried the teriyaki chicken burger and the teriyaki chicken bowl..the burger was good but the bowl was far too sweet than expected which was a big turn off. the food is on expensive side.
author: Nia A.

description:
The food here was great. 
I have a sister that is very picky with her options.
I of course had to have my seafood in the bay, my sister ordered some chili cheese fries.
The one thing that threw me off real bad was that the waiter gave me the wrong bill.
He gave me the bill from table that was next to us and vice versa.
On top of that when my sister noticed we switched bills and i told the waiter.
The waiter apologized and returned my original receipt.
Turns out i was charged three different times with the same card and all transactions were different amounts.
Please check your receipts and make sure you get yourself an extra copy..ESPECIALLY if you are a tourist like myself.
author: Flor F.

description: Upon leaving the 3 star review, I revised my rating to 4 stars because the Operations Manager Bob left me an e-mail, and wanted to find out the facts about my visit and sincerely apologized. He even invited me back to give them another chance and left me his number to give them a heads up. I will keep you all updated when I visit next time.
author: Robert R.

description:
Wish I could give 2.5 stars, but will give them the benefit of the doubt.
I like the atmosphere of the restaurant on the outside. But inside, meh, I don't know, maybe it's the way they set up their tables, it's not as cosy as it looks from the outside ....
The food is usually ok, nothing special going on. Service is good too.
author: Linda S.

description: Food is mediocre. The fish and chips were good--and that would be the only reason I would come again.
author: A R.

description:
Nice location, the nachos were GREAT and the garlic fries/onion rings okay (i.e., good not great). 

Always a big loser at any restaurant-the ranch dressing for the garlic fries had multiple hairs in it, but the replaced it quickly. 

Expect tourist prices (hint: most prices aren't on the menu) because its on Pier 39, it's a nice spot and decent appetizers.  Not the worst place to go while being a tourist on Pier 39.
author: Mark W.

description:
This place blows....BIGTIME!

We were doing the touristy thing for some cousins out of town and my sister's birthday and decided to eat here. BIG MISTAKE

They forgot my sister's food, and it was her birthday!  The sever also messed up on my cousins order, spilled my soup and my cousin's soup on our table and laughed about it. 

and the food was bland crap and not cheap bland crap either!
author: Marlene D.

description: A little overpriced, but what do you expect for a restaurant in Pier 39.  I had the fish tacos and it was pretty good.  They were training a new guy while I was there and it seemed like the trainer was always looking at the tip, in case the trainee was gonna jack her tips.  It was a cold, but sunny day, and the pigeons were very annoying, waiting for me to drop any food.  Nice place to people watch if you eat outside.  I guess it's a nice place to eat if you want pretty quick service because the food came out pretty quick considering the restaurant was busy.
author: James C.

description: Awesome food!! Best location...drinks and fire place a must!! 2nd visit
author: John D.

description: NO WAIT! Yay..the best thing that happened on our San Francisco trip. Cheeseburger and only a dollar to sub for garlic fries, of course, I say!! Garlic fries weren't as good as other places, but not bad. Servers were nice and everything was good. How can you go wrong with the most basic foods anyway. Came here cause we didn't want seafood.
author: Angelina L.

description: We visited San Francisco,s Pier 39 back in 2007 and stopped in to Wipeout  for lunch because it was a good atmosphere!! It looked fun and wild!! The decorations around the place was really cool looking, the whole surf theme set the mood. we were seated and the staff was very awesome. We really wanted to try their fish tacos and my wife ended up getting them i got an avocado bueger instead. very juicy and fresh. the fish tacos were very good as well. the price was reasonable as well.
author: Raul D.

description:
Went here this week with co-workers while on a trip to SF.  The area is nice, but the food and experience were very average.  Started with the Salmon Nuggets and they were very nice, but the surf/turf was par at best.

While waiting to order a second round of drinks we even saw our server sitting eating her meal and had to flag another person down.

Be warned, they will NOT do separate checks for any group over 4.

If you are looking for a meal at Pier 39, head to the Pier Market, much better.
author: Greg M.

description: A nice location to chill when at Pier 39. But not really good food. We got some fish tacos with dried-out fish that were pretty bland. Very disappointing considering you can get amazing fish tacos at some local places around SF for mad cheap and here we forked over like 15 bucks. Won't be back...even if I happen to be at Pier 39. I think I'll just settle for some clam chowder and sourdough bread at Boudin.
author: Saliha B.

description: Fast and easy service, after a long day on Alcatraz and shopping, they have outdoor and indoor seating, we have dined here before and it is always crowded we usually dine inside however this time we were able to sit outside an enjoy the atmosphere. we started with Calamari for an appetizer and had salads and fish and chips, the portions were large we ended up leaving with doggie bags. I had a great margarita it really hit the spot. The children's menu offered several choices. Next time we will probably opt for the appetizers and salads as the portions are generous.
author: Elizabeth Holly S.

description: We stopped here after a long day of biking along the bay. This was a great find, and our waiter, David, was awesome. The food wasn't exactly cheap, but it was good and gave us enough leftovers for lunch the next day. If you get the chips and salsa, you can always ask for more if you run out!
author: Kurt C.

description: Absolutely loved the vibe of this place...reminded me a lot of the Santa Cruz Boardwalk, which is a favorite. A little hokey, but hey, it's catering to tourists! Staff was super friendly and attentive, music fit the surf theme. Looking for a place to relax before heading home from a long day between Alcatraz & Pier 39, we stopped in and ordered some fried calamari. Was neither bland nor extraordinary, but seemed typical bar food. Tasted pretty good with some lemon. Wish I could write more about the menu, but after a long day of sightseeing and snacking, we just couldn't pack in more food. =P
author: Leanne A.

description: I ate here about 3 times and didnt care for it to much.  The portions are big compared to the other resturants on the pier but the taste is standard.  I would honestly have to say to tourists do not come to this resturant because they dont have a big selection of seafood.  More salads and american food.  Great place for vegans and cheap drinks though.
author: Keoni G.

description: Staff is most appreciative of loyal customers and do care about good public relations! We'll be back!
author: P G.

description:
Sometimes, ladies and gentleman, as much as you might not like to hear it, there may be a very good reason as to why your server isn't as bubbly as you'd like. You are probably a rude, disrespectful customer. 

That being said, I had a great time here. Just needed to kill some time before the ferry, and I sat outside in the sun. Had two Cuervo spiked Corona's which were great. And also had the California burger.

Service wise, I had servers who weren't even assigned to my section come up and talk to me with smile on. Everyone was real nice, and down to earth.

While a bit on the pricey side, it must be said that it being a tourist trap, that is kind of unavoidable.
author: Peter C.

description: Ordered a Hawaii 5 oh pizza to go....it was decent. Nothing special about the experience, but no complaints
author: Tracie B.

description: Good food, service could have been better. Server never checked up on us. We had to ask a manager for refills on our drinks.
author: Wayne P.

description: This place was cool.   For the location is was a great on value.  San Fran can be an expensive place to eat especially at the pier.  You can sit outside or inside.  If you sit inside I suggest you request a table by the window overlooking the bay.   Food was great and the service was on point.  If you sit outside,it is a great place to hang out with some brews and people watch.
author: Matthew R.

description: As a Pier 39 employee, I had to wait over 20 minutes for service. It took away half of my lunch hour. As a Pier 39 employee you will get 50% for dining in only. Exclude breakfast. I see the 2 host and 2 waiter/waiteress standing at the door and do nothing but talking.
author: Steven C.

description:
Excellent service, Good burgers.  Kid friendly.

We eat here whenever we play tourist at pier 39.
author: Ray W.

description: My husband and I thought this place was fun and a perfect tourist spot. The food was good, the service fantastic! Cassie, our server was the perfect mix of personality, and professionaliism and she worked so seamlessly. I was truly impressed by her.
author: Liv A.

description:
Friendly waitress who helped us with directions and helped take our picture!
YUMMY garlic fries kinda pricey though for a basket of Parmesan garlic and seasoned fries
REAL DELISH warm and thick clam chowda!! 

Bathrooms are coed freakin weird....but they're kinda cute with different pops of colors and the sink area is co-ed hahaha a dude walked in and was like..."is this MENS?!?!?!?!?" we just nodded weirded out as well

cute bar area...lil store with shirts similar to a Joes and fun atmosphere! i like!
author: Carolyn C.

description: The location is great at this place!!! The drinks look delcisious!! I ordered Fish and Chips at this place and barely finished them.  They didn't seem to have flavor to me at all!! Maybe next time I will sit outside by the fire pit with a drink!
author: Fè M.

description:
A lot of talk lately on Yelp reviews and responses from business owners. A few days after I posted my review, I received a PM from Bob Partrite: 

"Steve, 
Thanks for the review. What day were you in? Glad to see you enjoyed most of the food. You nailed the mac n cheese. As the menu says it's Kraft. We switched to that years ago due to guest feedback. Again thanks. 
Bob Partrite" 

It's nice to know that get responses from business owners or managers of the businesses I review because it does show that they do care about there customers, and the are looking for ways to improve. 

In regards to the Mac and Cheese, yes the owner did confirm it was Kraft, but also it this was stated on the menu, and this was changed in response to customer requests. 

Doh! Read the menu, Steve!  Well, I'm accountable for my reviews!

Also, I've frequented this place many times over the past few years, and will probably continue to do so when we doing another staycation at the Wharf.
author: Steve L.

description:
Came here with a hungry group of friends because it was the first restaurant we encountered on the pier and did I mention? We were hungry.  In the end, I left conflicted about our decision to eat here... 

I'll admit, they have a lot of delicious choices on their menu to choose from that will leave you at wit's end about which one to select. And the food is actually pretty good and they provide large portions. But I simply can't forgive the prices ($9-10 for most appetizers; $10-12 for most sandwiches,  burgers, tacos and burritos; $14-16 for most specialty entrees). The BBQ Burger I ordered was good but definitely not worth spending $11.  In my opinion, the prices for their items are too high for my tastes for what I'm getting, but to my understanding these prices are fair for Pier-39 prices. 

I did enjoy the surf-themed environment of the restaurant though.  We had a surfboard for a table which was cool, but rather unpractical since it was narrow making it hard to fit all of our entrees on the table and even harder for those of us sitting at the ends of the surfboards.  There are some televisions situated in parts of the room tuned to various sports channels and a full-service bar is available as well. 

I can find better places to eat for a lower or even decent price, so sorry Wipeout Bar and Grill... unless you have a change of heart in your prices, me and my wallet are not coming back.
author: Serena C.

description: Hey, this place was cool. They have the restaurant and the express restaurant. Great food and a cool location at Pier 39 if you want to sit outside, eat, and people watch. But lookout for all the pigeons if you eat outside...They are brave and hungry.
author: Jen S.

description:
Came here on Saturday for a nice day in the city (including a lil one, 8 yrs old).  We were in the mood for outdoor seating and a variety in menu choices, oh, and beer.  of course!  We had beautiful weather, got seated in about 10 minutes, and despite the annoyance of being at Pier 39, it was great.  The people watching was fabulous!  Although we did get a, "Dad, why do all these girls around have pink stripes in their hair?"  hmmmm, good question.  They think its fun?  Kids are awesome!

I first ordered a Guiness but it came flat.  YUCK!  Sent it back for a hefeweizen.... delish!  He had the same, the lil one... a fruit punch.

For food, I went with the fish tacos, the man had a pineapple teriyaki burger, and the lil one had fish and chips from the kids menu.  We all were happy, but we agreed, I won the prize for the best item!  

The price tag......$50 bucks... ouch.  Granted, we each had two beers, but for lunch at a so-so place.... eh.  What do I expect though when you eat at one of the  most touristy spots in SF?  The things you do to celebrate kids birthdays :) Makes it all worth it!

I definitely would come back again, service was great, food was good enough, and the people watching was of course, the best part!
author: Kirsten O.

description: Unfortunately I can't comment on the food here, because we only stopped in for drinks, but I'm giving it four stars for atmosphere! I know it's a touristy place, but when it's 80 degrees outside and you want to sit in the beautiful weather and enjoy a few beers, this is the perfect spot to do it.  We got a bucket of Coronitas, and my boyfriend also enjoyed a yummy Blood Orange soda.  Sitting there at 3pm, having our beers, i really FELT like I was on vacation.  Also, I couldn't stop staring at our neighbors' food because it really did look tasty.
author: Jessica G.

description:
Quick service for us and nice waiter. 

We ordered sandwhiches and Salads we shared and both were really tasty they came at the recommendation of the Waiter so thanks tons for it!! I love when people working there can recommend what you should eat and it is a total win!!!

Tourist pier 39 but hey its all good duck in for a quick good meal and duck back out in no time. 

I'd definitely stop by again when I am in the area.
author: Sheila C.

description: This is a good place to catch a game and have some drinks. Ordered some Fried Calamari along with some good drinks and enjoyed the Niner game yesterday. The atmosphere was good and the staff was very attentive.
author: Oscar H.

description:
WORST MEAL WE EVER HAD............ My family and I were here for the labor day  I have eaten in many restaurants in the wharf but this is the worst We ever have been.
We order   Fish and Chips,  Fry combo, Hamburger, Clam Chowder.  Fish was with no flavor shrimp and the rest of the seafood it is frosen no fresh.  You can tell because it is hard when you bit it.  hamburger it is tasteless soup it tast like out of a can.  I am really upset because of the money  I spend  I wish there is a refund .     
Do yourself a favor  avoid these  place and you will save money and a headache.
author: Victor H.

description:
Fast service and quick outside seating, even on a busy Sunday.  Decent menu, had a grilled salmon BLT and sweet potatoe fries.  Pretty tasty.  Reasonably priced.  Would probably come back again if I were in the area.

Food: 3/5
Service: 3/5
Ambiance: 3/5
author: M R.

description: Scored a great table by the window other than that there is nothing else I am going to be positive about, per say. If it is fried, tastes good with ranch, it is here as that is the entire menu. Wouldn't be my first or last choice next time we go to the pier.. Maybe my drunk choice.. I didn't try the drinks.. But I imagine they are sweet and generous pours. Staff could be a bit more professional, but weren't bad. It would appear they are consistently slammed so expect to wait, but they did a nice job getting us sat quickly. Go bus and host staff! Servers, step it up some. .
author: Dalton M.

description: Wipeout was fun!  It was raining the day we were touring fisherman's wharf so the fish street stands were kind of out of the question.  I was bummed out by that but eating at Wipeout totally made up for it.  They seated us right away and the staff was very friendly.  I ordered the shrimp taco (with jicama and mango) and it was delicious! Really a great blend of flavor and texture with a yummy sauce that made this dish a total homerun.  I also got a regular fish taco... it was good, not great - I wish I ordered two of the shrimp ones!  My boyfriend ordered the bbq chicken sandwich which he said was good, but the garlic fries it came with were amazing!
author: Hailee G.

description:
I went here a few months back with some friends. It was late. We were hungry and there wasn't any other place still open serving food. So it was kind of a last and only resort. I ordered the fish & chips. And they were alright. Of course, that's a greasy and stick to your gut type of meal. But really, I couldn't finish my meal and barely ate just to satisfy my hunger. I doubt I'd go there again.

They did have friendly service once we get served and was at our table. However, it did take a long time for someone to finally notice us standing at the host stand to be seated.
author: Christine R.

description:
This place was much better than expected... First, it appears to be a lot smaller on the outside than it really is on the inside. The decor and atmosphere in the restaurant was fun and playful. 

Our group tried the garlic fries and the chili cheese fries and they were fantastic! 

The burgers and sandwiches that were tried in our group all faired well. 2 of us got the wipeout burger and they were fantastic, the only criticism I have is that it could have had a little sauce of some sort on it like some A-1 would have tasted great with the blue cheese and fried onion straws, anything other than Ketchup. 

Service was top notch, our waiter was on top of everything and even the manager was making rounds to all the tables and making sure everything was great, as well as helping his staff out! 

We had a good time and enjoyed this restaurant!
author: Nicole C.

description: Shark bites are worth going alone, the dipping sause is amazing
author: Juan C.

description:
I live in the Bay area and knew that in the tourist area I should expect tourist prices and cuisine.  I took my sister and her family who were in town from MI.  

The decor is nice.  The layout good.

When we walked in the door with 3 adults and 3 kids (15 mos - 5 years) we were told that we could be seated immediately.  

Then they changed their minds and said it would be 10 to 15 minutes. This seemed a little shady, but, whatever (again.) Again, normal at lunch in a tourist area.  We had been waiting about 10 minutes when I overheard the man seating us say to the hostess that it was going to be a LONG time before he could find seats for us.  It was also indicated that larger group seatings were being broken up to seat smaller groups (in fairness, I'm sure that this is much more lucrative.)  So I asked how long and he looked surprised that I could actually hear him from 3 feet away and a little taken aback that I would be so rude as to listen in.  Yeah.  That's me, RUDE.  He assured me 15 to 20 minutes.  I told him if that was in addition to the 10 that we'd already waited we'd be happy to find food elsewhere.  He managehed to find us a table in the next 5 minutes.

Let me say, our server was fantastic!  She was cheerful and perky with the kids (who were tired from their great trip to Alcatraz.)  

We ordered and the food came up fast.  It was mediocre at best.  The kids enjoyed their corn dogs and fries.  My sister and I had the carnitas tacos.  Very little flavor BUT they weren't aggresively bad, just mediocre.  My brother-in-law said that same about his burger.

We went to Boudin the next day.  Much better taste.  Kids were happier and, no waiting...
author: Anne S.

description: Great Place to check out while visiting the Fishermans Wharf area and Pier 39. Hard to miss the place, look for the big surf board sign. Now I am sure that mostly tourists come here since its on Pier 39 but this place has a lot going on. They have some great craft beers, all were served really cold. I had fried food. Coconut shrimp and calamari...Both were really really good. They have a nice bar and some big TV's spread throughout with constant surfing videos streaming. The fire pit out front is great for those chilly San Fran nights. It doesn't have a great night life sense though since it is on the Pier and all the tourists are probably sleeping by then.
author: Chris R.

description: This place is alright, my Fiance and his brother and I visited this past Friday although we've visited this location prior. The food is alright. I got the tacos, shrimp and mango, carnitas and carne asada, drenched in butter, the beans were not to my liking, the rice was undercooked, very dry. My Fiance ordered the calamari as an appetizer, which was alright very panko and of course greasy. The fries I heard were not that great either. His brother ordered a beer and it came out last, after all our food and appetizer. Oh, and the appetizer came out after our food was already there. The waitress checked back many times which I really appreciated. He got the BBQ chicken pizza, which I thought was mediocre as well. Everything here is just basically an overpriced applebee's or claim jumper. Nothing special, just that it's a the pier. I wouldn't like to come back.
author: Evelyn N.

description:
the place wa s packed, we went on a Friday for lunch.

it was weird the TV was off a projector and it was back wards.

we introduced our son to Fish and chips here and since then he has eaten them every day on the trip to comapre them. 

our waitress was good. we had a coupon for a free appitizer and had the coconut shrip. the sauce was really sweet.

they liked the fish and chips and my daughter llked the burger,

it was expensive but it was right in the tourist trap on the pier.
author: jessi s.

description:
The Tale of Diarrhea.

Started off with the cable car, maneuvered down to Fisherman's Wharf, watched my buddy Bushman scare some vulnerable tourist, watched some robots hustle, spanked some butt, and then decided to go chow down at  the Wipeout Bar and Grill.

Very busy vicinity, from that we expected exceptional food. Great surf like environment on a sunny day. Surfer dude manikins with my hot bod flaunted my reflection, humorous signs, giggles and plenty of tables circled the joint. A friendly waitress appeared with a cheese on her face. I ordered the Grilled spiced Salmon meal and a vanilla milk shake. Surprisingly the prices weren't too damaging, I had worst. The meal was delish, slightly spiced Salmon, a tiny amount of rice mixed with a pint of coconut; brocolli, carrots and other spiced vegetables sided the dish as well. A very satisfying meal it was indeed, worth $14.99.

Within an hour since leaving the Wipeout, I felt the tingly sensation in my rump, I shivered, yet tried to control myself around my lady. This was very unusual, Sani never feels the tingly sensation too the point of  combustion. Once entering home, I rushed to my sanctuary and sat down on my throne. Whoo! I was like a bottle of Pepto Bismol unleashed. Wipeout Grill sat on the back of my mind while I wiped... out.

I'm not blaming anyone, but that dangerously delicious Salmon was the last meal I ate!

Be Aware.
author: Sani S.

description:
Oh man, this was one of the worst restaurants ever!!!  The service was absolutely horrible and it was completely dead!  My husband, being the weird guy he is, didn't want seafood so ordered chicken.. they brought out both our plates 20 minutes later to find that his chicken wasn't cooked thoroughly! I mean, it was pink in the middle!!!  We told our waitress and she said, "oops" like the chefs couldn't of killed him or anything.  They remade it for him without an apology! 

There must have been something going on in the restaurant that day, but 2 customers near our table wanted to talk to the manager.  One customer complained about the service, and the other about the food!  I felt sooo bad for that guy!

As we left, we talked to him about getting new cooks or waitresses or both...he was embarrassed I think for having to go though his whole routine again about offering us some more gross food to go or for him to take the chicken off the bill.

Do not waste your money or your time by going here....please!!!
author: Alicia C.

description:
Burgers are good, but this is too expensive !!!  22$ for 2 drinks...
Service was too slow, even if the staff was very kind...
author: Zackery B.

description: really good food. i had the california burger and not only was it decent size (1/2lbs) it was delicious. its not very expensive either it was about 13 for the burger and it came with a load of fries.
author: Steven N.

description:
WIPEOUT!!

Not as good as the tv show (what happened to that anyway?), but 3 stars is fitting. The food is decent, but usually the service is a little lacking. It's a little pricey, especially the drinks, but if I was a tourist visiting this place, I would probably love it. The theme is really fun, and there is a fire pit (though it's popular and is always in use when I'm there). They have a decent "to go" window, and I've ordered many a cheeseburger from there. The biggest complaint I have is the first time I went here (admittedly, about 18 months ago), the bathrooms were disgusting. Since, they've been better, but that was enough to make me a little weary. It keeps me coming back every now and then though, so I'd say the restaurant does its job. Besides, it's really meant for tourists anyway, and I know when I bring out-of-towners here, they love it!
author: Bridgette A.

description:
Had another great lunch at Wipeout today!  We were seated right away and greeted by the server within minutes.  Drinks were served quickly.  
I had the Ahi sandwich which was super good.  I don't think I'll ever try anything else.  DH had the tacos and our son the chicken tenders.  

The restroom confused me and others.  One little boy was doing the potty dance not knowing if he can come in since I was in there.  His dad told him it was okay that boys and girls share the restrooms here.
author: Michelle W.

description:
Cowabunga dude!

I was going down to the beach and go surfing the other day, but i thought ... "why not just go to pier 39!"  

This place is like totally stepping into hawaii, bra.  Surf movies are rollin on the big screens while overweight people from minnesota eat fried food!  Rad!  

And have to tip my beach hat to the special small authentic touches.  The waiters were totally acting disinterested and confused -- just like real stoned beach bums!  Killer!

And who needs to catch a big wave when you can get double-overhead size lite beers!  Hang Ten .. Dollars!

So grab your long-board, your short-board, and your entire bored and uncreative family and head to wipeout!!  Bring your camera because a shot with the wipeout surfer dude statue will show all your friends back home how you really lived the california surf life...


haha, im sorry wipeout ... i actually kinda liked this place - esp the shark bites  :)   point.  break.
author: Brad C.

description:
Oh, the irony of tourists coming to visit a world-class foodie town and then ending up at Pier 39! Wipeout is "the best of the worst" and I owe it a review because of all their Ahi tuna sandwiches I've eaten.

So here's to you, Wipeout; may you never take the Ahi tuna sandwich off your menu because that's the only thing you have that's worth a damn.
author: Ian G.

description:
Surf's up!   I love Wipeout, not because of the corny surfer theme, not because of the tourists on Pier 39... DEFINITELY because of the food.  San Franciscans love to knock any place that's touristy or too "mainstream", but honestly, everything I've eaten here has been soooo good, it compelled me and my roommate to travel across the city several times to eat here again.

I've had the salmon burger, the garlic fries (ugh!  amazing!), the fish and chips, hawaiin pizza, other things that I can't remember now...  it was all quite close to perfection.  Beer comes in super tall glasses (see my main yelp photo) and the cocktails are kind of expensive but SOOO FREAKIN delicious.  The decor is cute and even the bathrooms have connected sinks in the shape of the tide to make you feel like you're at the beach.

I have yet to sit at one of the bonfire tables to drink beer, but that is on my list of things to do!  I wouldn't even mind that it's on Pier 39.

I give it 4.5 stars.
author: Laura W.

description:
WhoHoo! Fun! Right on the Pier 39 boardwalk.  
Great for people watching when seated on the patio.  
Tuna salad was just awesome for a hot & sunny afternoon.   
 I was pleasantly surprised that this type of establishment (rowdy-type-looking beach bar) had such good service and food.
author: LINDA R.

description: The food is nothing special, the price is alright, and it's always crowded since it's right on the pier.
author: David C.

description: Pier 39 is so lucky to have this delightful place.  The beachy atmosphere, the high energy bar, the great sevice and yummy food and drinks make this place way, way, way better than anything one would expect in such a touristy area.  The margaritas and bloody marys are delicious!  The fish tacos are so tasty and pretty much everything I've tried on the menu has been fresh and scrumptious!  Meaghan, the bartender is my favorite and there is also a super attentive manager there named David who is always fluttering around making sure the customers are happy.  I'm also really impressed with how clean the place always is.  Whether they are super busy or not, the bathrooms are always tidy and tables are promptly bussed.  I just love Wipe Out!
author: L L.

description:
The name of this place is the same as the way I felt while eating here. It was a total wipe-out. I had out of town friends, who wanted to go to Alcatraz. We ended up at Pier 39 a bit early, so we thought we would grab a few drinks and a snack. The outdoor seating and fire pit looked like it would be cool, but the people who worked here are completely brain dead!! 
We ordered chips and salsa and a side of cheese sauce. The guy brought out a slice of cheese. Hello, what the hell am I going to do with a slice of cheese. Then he brought out out drinks and out of four, two were right. I guess 50% is not bad?? Needless to say, we got our check and left. I knew not to expect much, but this was crazy!
author: Lisa A.

description: Good spot to get some good food. They have a good selection and a nice window view of the bay and Alcatraz. Went with their wipeout burger. It was a good sandwich and the fries were great as well. Service was good and friendly. Pier 39 is a good spot to visit for food and shops.
author: Dominic C.

description: Amazing service. The food was great. Outside seating with fireplace.
author: Joel B.

description: The food was alright and the service could've been better. The decor reminded me of texas with a beach theme.
author: Ronnel C.

description:
*NOTE TO MANAGEMENT:  Servers were fantastic, food well-prepared but generic menu.

Duuude, it's brand new and replaces what was the "historic" Chevy's #2. Greeted in the entry area by a Sean Penn surfer statue/dummy lookalike...Funny, since he lives in the area. 

Rating: 3.5 overall...Fantastic service...but formula food. Great for sports bar type of dining or for grabbing apps and drinks. Feeding the kid really quickly, etc.

Food: Very well prepared and presented but just not anything fantastic...however a 4 for dessert. Even the fried foods are lighter than comparable places. Surprised by how light all of the meals were -- even the banana split was light vs. gooey. Very light, fresh salads with hearty portions. Easily share an app and a salad and call it a night. Chinese chicken salad more along the Thai peanut flavors lime flavors -- pleasant taste, but not what expected based upon the description (the ingredients were almost identical to a South Beach recipe we tried in the past). Kid's meals $5.99 inclusive of drink-- fish and chips (aka fish nuggets) were a hit with our stinky cheese eating bug. Fun wine selections and interesting drinks and "spritzers" to match personality of restaurant although the usual silly mark-ups.

Service: Fantastic service with on-the-nose recommendations and exceptionally fast response and food delivery. We were sitting by the server stations and eavesdropped on the fun, frustrations and interaction between the various servers and management running through the area. A favorite server from another restaurant was also working the dinner shift -- hopefully she's only there because the other place is closed for dinner on Sundays! For now, servers aren't spread thin around too many tables and there are many other folks ready to step in as necessary.

Reservations: They only take reservations for 6 or more, but when we walked in we were seated efficiently.

Decor: Surfer, beach walk everything; even the little corner "tourist" gear store. Huge digital screens throughout the restaurant. The bathrooms are covered by a cabana entrance with a common sink area for both sexes -- so a good idea to go with your kids to use the bathroom. Outdoor bonfire with beach chairs is a cute touch although our little one asked if we could come back and make smores. 

$60+ for 2 adult entrees, an app, drinks and a child dinner? Better off at Cafe Z for a cozier more refined dining experience, but a very fun and thoughtful staff.
author: Tanya P.

description: Came here for dinner since it was a very short wait and now I see why. the food was below par and so was the service. Definitely wouldn't come back here.
author: Lisa C.

description: Absolutely nothing great about this place. Bland blah food in a tourist area. Only reason I give it more than 1 star is we only had to wait 5 minutes. Nothing memorable about the food. Fries were even terrible. McDonald's had better food.
author: Rob D.

description:
The menu had remains of ketchup from previous customer, but judging from the atmosphere, I didn't expect a high class restaurant. 
I liked the relaxed feel of the restaurant. 
The fish tacos were delicious and plentiful. 
My wife had pesto pizza which was also really tasty. 
I'd go here again if I was in San Fran
author: Alan G.

description:
We were looking for a place to eat before we took our trip to Alcatraz. We walked down to the pier and by chance, walked into the Wipeour Bar and Grill.
The decor is really cute, I'm from a beach down so seeing even more of it always puts a smile on my face. The service was super good, we were seated right away and our drink orders were taken and given quickly, as well as our food order. We came here because it had something for everyone, and it sure did deliver. I ordered the personal cheese pizza, which was so good. We were seated outside, which was fabulous for what kind of day it was.
I gave them 4 stars, only because their heater outside (which I'm assuming they have on all year round - brrrr san fran weather!) was right above me so I had two different kind of heat on me.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Well, this is the first review I've bothered to write that isn't getting the highest possible rating, but only because of a couple of short-comings.

First, I loooove the ribs (you can order them as an appetizer or as a meal). They are succulent, juicy, sweet and barbeque-ey and I'm addicted to them! I've only tried one other menu item, a bbq burger I think it was? Well, I don't think 9 bucks is a whole lot for the portion sizes. You get a heap of fries with virtually every menu item, and the sandwiches are huge. 

I don't go very often because it's all the way at the Wharf. But the upside is that every time I go (with friends or family visiting) I ALWAYS pick Wipe-Out. The other options around are ridiculously overpriced. I mean, I know it's seafood but there's no way you can justify charging 50 bucks for crabmeat!

I always take people on the scenic route through the city so that, by the time we get to the Wharf, we're ready to throw down! Wipe Out is perfect for that.

I like the margaritas. They may be watered-down but they're huge and I like fruity mild drinks over hard liquor anyway. ;)

On the down side, the service is kind of iffy, mostly kids serving with very short attention spans...no one was rude, just flighty and air-headed. At least they were nice! And the decor is kind of like Joe's Crab Shack, it's themed and corny but the food's good so who really cares?
author: Manisha T.

description: got this booklet of coupon from 2nd floor in fisherman's wharf, as long as you are AAA member! their garlic fries is quite delicious and i was not expecting such a huge portion! the wait time was not long at all even it was during a busy sunday afternoon!
author: Louis O.

description: Classic tourist stop, have been here twice. The food is about what you'd expect from a joint like this, nothing to write home about. The house margaritas were big and very good. Extra point for fantastic service all around. Very on top of their game and quick with everything.
author: Kyle S.

description: Went here for Labor Day, yes it was busy and packed. But the food and cocktails was delish! Staff is super friendly! Coming back to try more.
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description:
Food was good.
My veggie pizza was delicious..and my hubs nachos were YUMMY!!

I usually don't like black beans..but the taste really made me consider...why I don't really like black beans???!!!  His meal was HUGE and delicious!!!

Prices were moderately priced.

Service was fairly quick.

Clean place.  Just a little loud.  Definately more of a summer place to eat....
author: Evangelina P.

description: Ok service, ok food. Burger was overcooked, fries and fried onions were obviously old and stale. Drinks are expensive as well for this type of place
author: Paulem V.

description:
We were seated, a waiter quickly handed us menus, and we told them we were in a hurry.  No one came back for 20 minutes, we hunted around but couldn't find anyone, so we just bounced.

Devastating.
author: Wayne K.

description:
I have eaten at this restaurant twice, and this review is based off of the terrible experience I had the second time I visited. 

My friends and I walked in and waited for about 5 mins to be seated, at which time we were asked if we would like to sit inside, or on the patio. It was a nice day, so we figured, patio, why not?

We sat down, and the waiting began.... 

About 15 min after we were initially seated, a young man came and took our drink order. Nothing special, 3 sodas and a beer. We then proceeded to wait patiently for another 10 min or so to actually have our drinks brought to us. After he dropped off our drinks, (without asking if we were ready to order) our waiter proceeded to the wall, where he skimmed the crowd of heads for what seemed to be FOREVER. At the time, I thought he was just catching up to see if anyone was trying to wave him down, or if there was a table he had missed. Well that was our table. .

I made eye contact with this guy at LEAST 4 times before he returned to rudely ask, "Did you guys want to order food too???"

I was shocked, it was quite obvious we wanted to order food, and I couldn't for the life of me understand what would have made him think we didn't. 

After he took our food order, he went to 2 or 3 other tables before going inside, and hopefully submitting our order. We got our food about 20 min after he put the order in. 

After we got the food and ate (it wasn't bad, not amazing) we stood up to leave, and the waiter asked if he could bring us any change, my boyfriend sarcastically chimed, "Keep the change."

We walked out and guess who followed, our waiter. He proceeded to tell us we forgot to leave a tip. We all laughed and I explained that we had received the WORST service ever, and that I had had better service from McDonald's. 

Here is the best part. He told us, "Oh, Ok well don't ever come back then."  

I decided the best thing to do would be to come here and share the experience rather than tell the Manager, if only I could remember that pricks name.
author: Jennifer K.

description: COWABUNGA!!!!! Surfer theme Bar and Grill with surfboards for tables, a Cabo Wabo patio area where you can order Coronas by the bucket and chill by the firepit. Also the bar area has flat screens with surfing movies playing on them.  I haven't tried the food yet but, hear it's pretty good. Very clean and relaxing place
author: Marco M.

description: I went here with my brother, sister-in-law and boyfriend for an early dinner. The server was really nice but the service was horrible. We all has ordered different dishes and three out of four came out together. I had originally ordered the bread sticks but 10-15 later the waiter told me they didn't have them. He said to get a pizza instead. So I ordered a pizza instead. My pizza came out 20-30 minutes after everyone else's food. By the time it came everyone was almost done eating. On top of that, the waiter also brought out the bread sticks that he told me they didn't have. When paying the check we were charge for the pizza instead of just the bread sticks (which cost more). I did not originally order the pizza but since they didn't have the item I wanted, they offered a pizza instead. So why was I paying for the item they offered. When we told the server, he talked to his management but they refused to listen to our issue. The server came back and said the bill was taken care of because he made a mistake. We assumed that he paid the whole bill - but he didn't. Before knowing that, my boyfriend tipped him a good amount of cash. Basically, we paid a lot for a late meal, bad management,  and lot's of confusion. Will not be eating here again & told many people about this experience. Worse experience ever in an SF restaurant.
author: Navdeep S.

description: This is a great casual place to grab some food on the Pier. We like to forgo the sit down service and the tip that goes along with it and buy from the quick take-out window to the side. There are less options, but they also tend to be $1 or $2 cheaper or so. The food isn't phenomenal but it's still pretty good. Plus it's nice to take it out and sit by the water.
author: Natalye R.

description: This is my second review of Wipeout Bar and Grill. I was impressed that after posting my last review stating that Wipeout was just mediocre I got a message from the manager asking for details, Obviously management is striving to be the best they can be. So, on our return visit (bar only) we had awesome Bloody Mary's made by our bartender Giovanni. Giovanni rates 5 stars for service and being very personable. He brought us two glasses of ice water without even asking if we wanted it - I think he overheard my husband saying he needed a glass of water. We went elsewhere for lunch because we wanted some crab, but returned to Wipeout for a final drink before getting on our Amtrak bus. Giovanni makes quiet a show with his awesome cocktail skills, and gave me some Italian lessons, to boot - he is a real asset to Wipeout!
author: P S.

description: I felt inclined to create an account just to express how impressed I am with this place. Lisa, our waitress was so down to earth and sincere about her job and made the perfect suggestions on both food and drinks. They had ran out of chili, however a young lady had come from the back with the same sincerity and assisted in making excellent food suggestions. It's not just the kind staff, nor the layed back ambiance, the food is top notch. Relatively cheap for the serving sizes you get and honestly some of the best food I've had. My friends and I ate family style for the most part so we tried everything: the clam chowder is to die for, same with the bread bowl. After being disappointed with chowder misadventures elsewhere on the pier it was nice to know someone knew how to do it right. Finally, we were suggested the chili cheese fries from two tourist from the UK who said it was some of the best food they've had but we ended up with steak nachos and rice instead of beans. It may seem a little over zealous of a review but it's honestly one of the best restaurants I've been to and has the nicest staff with the best food and prices.
author: Tao O.

description: We were weary of eating at Fisherman's wharf after seeing critic reviews and hearing from locals, but were too hungry and low on time to go elsewhere. We chose this place because of their wide variety of food on the menu and reasonable prices. We got a burrito and cheese burger. Both were of quality and taste that we expected from this place. The french fries were really good. What surprised us was how great and friendly the service was. That definitely moved this from a 3 star to a 4.
author: Aaron T.

description: Popped in for a quick drink and some pizza with a group of out of town friends. I never thought I would find myself on yelp leaving a review for a  restraunt like wipeout for food or drinks when the city has soo many other options, but I was left with a lasting impression all around for a place such as this.  First the food, 3.5 stars, drinks 4.5 stars. And service, 7 stars if I could actually leave that many, so I am giving 5 stars overall for wipeout bar and grill. Pizza was good, but beTTer options elsewhere in the city. Drinks were freaking awesome, but a little pricey. And lastly the service, Mr. Munn was our server, and he was outstanding. He was fun, energetic, and the best part was, his awesome socks. I found his service prompt as well as compassionate when he was serving us as well his other tables around the est. That's a great quality to have in your waiter when out to eat. That quality service is getting harder to find these days. Who woulda thought, wipeout bar and grill would be the place to find excellence. Thanks for the great experience, we will be back. Also, Mr. Munn we will be looking for you especially.  So don't go finding a new job or anything...  thanks, and you have won me over. This place will see me and any visiting friends I have in the future. Pier 39, you are not justfor the tourists. What can I say, Good service is addictive. I will be back for sure.
author: Chris R.

description: Great setting. Located on pier 39. Sitting outside is nice. Food is ok. Nothing to write home about. But overall not a bad place to eat.
author: John V.

description: It was very good food. Great portion size. Friendly service. Root beer floats :)
author: Michelle B.

description: It was nice. Slow as hell but; the drinks were just potent enough
author: Andre D.

description: First we arrived and were seated promptly and they took our drink orders. We then asked them if we could use a coupon for a free kids meal in combination with another 20% off coupon. They said no, but they would let us get an extra free kids meal with the purchase of the adult entree. So that sounded nice. When the food came, mine was the wrong dish, and my wife's didn't come right away. They sent my dish back to get me what I ordered, and then we waited while our friends were eating. When mine finally came it was good, but wife's didn't arrive until about when mine did(the second time)- it was soup and salad, so how long would that take to prepare!? We go to pay, and we notice that they only gave us 1 free kids meal, and when we brought their attention to it, they said that my wife's 12.95 soup and salad was not an "entree". I asked if they could make an exception, the server said she would ask a manager. She came back and said the manager couldn't do it but they were asking another manager. A little while later she came back and told us that this other manager said they can't do it, because the computer won't allow it. Lame excuse- really disappointed with their service.
author: Jason B.

description: So the food is good and the prices are decent for a pier 39 restaurant,  but the service was horrible! We were there mid week at around 3pm. They're was lack of communication with our server... not til we were about done did she check on us. Apparently I order an appetizer of a bread bowl and salad so I couldn't use my kid's eat free coupon. She could have told me that I ordered an appetizer since she knew I was trying to use that coupon before I even ordered! The management wouldn't honor the coupon after our served asked 2 managers. I would have totally ordered something else if I would have known! I think my order got forgotten cause I had to ask another server about it.  My food came out about 30 minutes after the rest of my party! So if I ordered an appetizer shouldn't my food have come out first? The only reason I gave 2 stars is because of the taste of my food. The clam chowder bread bowl was really good... but when your super hungry everything tastes better, right?
author: Melissa B.

description: Visiting San Francisco and came upon this place.  Looked fun and that's where it all stops.  Unimpressive inside.  Greasy chairs and table - yuck.  Not sure if they are cleaned between customers - seems not.  Ordered fish and chips - coming from New England it's one of our faves and seemed safe enough here being on the wharf and all.  Nope - loads of greasy batter on the fish...and hardly any fish!  Total disappointment.  Would not recommend or go back.
author: L K.

description: The very expensive way to have a beer on Pier 39.  Good place to people watch.
author: Darrell S.

description:
This place is the shits.  Honestly, I don't know why I was sucked in.  Oh yeah.  I was craving fried calamari and chips and this was the first place I reached with TO-GO! Yay for fast service.  

Ouchies, not that fast service and still expensive.  Shoulda-coulda-woulda head on to the fish market instead.  The calamari tasted like it was fried frozen and breading was awful.  The fries were stale.  Freaking $4.50 for a slice of pizza?  NA-UH!  Find another place!
author: Janina U.

description:
I had a tourist night tonight with my friend Tolu... It was very enjoyable and wipe out made it even more so. The staff at the bar was great, totally picked up our humor and ran with it. The food a solid 3, the staff gets the extra star. 

Also, If you are a European, don't be so fucking rude as to leave a tip consisting in pennies, nickles and dimes... Here in America we tip, on average, 15% of what the total bill is. If you are me, an awesome individual, you tip 20%. You know better, don't pull that Euro shit with us like you don't know. These waiters, servers rely on tips too, so don't short them on it. Be nice and tip well. What you do is just rude.
author: danny e.

description: i was here last week, i was looking for a place with a California feel to it and its like a surfer bar, its on fisherman's wharf. i did not eat there just had drinks.  i had the big wave Ale its a  Hawaiian beer and a taste wave a 23 ounce blending frozen drink. drink both Good. They have a Small bar with stools on the Inside and outside of the bar. i did not think the Drink prices were that bad 12 Dollars for a big frozen drink. if your in San Fransisco i would check it out
author: Adam M.

description: my food was on the colder side(fries, rice,beans). but the fish is good and fresh. and they have good drinks (bar)
author: Lisa S.

description:
My wife and I went to the Wipeout Bar and Grill on June 1, '08. It was one of those cold evenings at Pier 39, and we were super glad to be rushed to our seats at a warm table inside. 

There was some sort of police/security activity going on when we arrived... it seemed like a few teenage girls were angry about a discrepancy in their bill from an earlier event. Why they couldn't talk to the manager without bringing in the cavalry is beyond me. Either way... it made the experience more interesting, and didn't take away from our enjoyment.

The initial service wasn't super fast. I had a feeling that the commotion up front had something to do with that... but either way, it was about 10 minutes before our server had dropped by to ask us for our beverage selection. Once we had his attention though, he was on the ball. 

We started off with chips & salsa, but the "roasted tomato salsa" left much to be desired. It didn't have any kick whatsoever. We ended up dropping in a lot of Tapatio to spice things up.

For the main event, I ordered the California Burger that comes with a 1/2 lb burger, guacamole, bacon, and a gloriously toasted bun. It was super delicious. My wife ordered the Teriyaki & Pineapple sandwich, which she said was good, but she wasn't super excited about it.

Overall, it was nice to get out of the cold and have a juicy burger lathered in guacamole. Mmm...
author: Matt B.

description:
May be a bit pricey, but so is everything on Pier 39.  This place is a great little stop for food and beer.  With something like a dozen beers on tap, a special 23 oz glass, and great burgers and nachos, you can't go wrong.

The patio is a sweet place to chill, I was there yesterday and it was sunny and awesome.

It's also right next to the Aquarium, so check that out if you like marine animals!
author: Kurtis M.

description: Stopped by for dinner on a hot summer night - it was great to sit outdoors and the service was good.  We had garlic fries with the sampler platter. Popcorn shrimp, calamari and fish.  Food wasn't great, but we also weren't expecting anything spectacular.
author: Nicole D.

description: VERY VERY GOOD SERVICE!! we had a large party one rainy day and thank you so much for the patience to seat us and accommodate us!!
author: Faye F.

description: My first Yelp review!  I work near Wipeout, and I have gone a number of times to their little take-out window that is basically the side of an old VW bus built into the wall.  I have always gotten their fish tacos.  The tortillas are warm and just barely starting to get crisp, so they are still pliable.  There is a creamy sauce on them, along with cabbage and jicama.  The fish, thankfully, is not breaded.  And they have a real kick to them--your mouth has that warm feeling for a few minutes after you're done.  A really great, quick lunchtime item.
author: Kevin W.

description:
I went  with my cousin to the Pier 39, and she doesn't like seafood, and this place is the only decent place that served chicken. 
All the foods looked the same, and it was sort of bland tasting. I had the shrimp kabob plate, it was so sweet. It was really crowded and it was a little pricey. 

Our waiter was a little off, and overcharged us on our drinks. But the restaurant's theme was the only nice thing about it.
author: Zohra A.

description: Amazing food and large portions not to menchon refreshing margaritas! My mom and I sat up at the bar and were helped by Meghan and Anthony! Both of them were welcoming and friendly! I've never been here before but it was a great first experience and seems like a really fun place! I will definitely come back when I'm visiting SF again! Thanks for the fun on the 4th of July! Team Meghan and Anthony this ones for you "Baby you're a firework!"
author: Tiffani D.

description: Reading some of the reviews, I think a few people are being just a little picky. As for my review, I thought this place was pretty good. I ordered the BBQ chicken sandwich and decided to upgrade to the garlic fries (mistake). Don't get me wrong the food was pretty good but I think the fries has just a little bit too much of the garlic mix on them. The service is ok i guess, nothing out of the ordinary. With 2 entrees a beer and an Iced Tea, $32 isn't bad. This place is one of the first restaurants you see when getting to Pier 39. I think the experience would have been a little better if we had just gone for drinks and sat outside. Overall, I think it deserves 4 stars
author: Gabbie S.

description: Crowded, OK food, ok service. Soso restaurant
author: Jia H.

description:
I wouldn't recommend this place for breakfast. I had the chicken fajita omelet and it was so dry, I had to put ketchup on top. My toast was cold, as was the butter, so I couldn't eat that either. I ended up ditching my food and eating part of my daughter's sourdough french toast, which was good. I'll give it 2 1/2 stars, but I won't go back. Could just be that I ordered the wrong thing though. 

It's Pier 39 though, so I don't expect gourmet.

Update: I'm overdue in updating this review. I'm sticking with my rating, but kudos to the manager who wrote to me after reading my review and offered to have me come back out and get a better meal. That is impressive. If I lived nearby, I'd take him up on it. But given I only visit SF occasionally, I'm leaving it with my one visit for breakfast. Still, his approach was so much classier than the folks who post fake rave reviews about their own places of business in a sad attempt to boost their ratings.
author: Erin O.

description: Service at the bar great chuck is awesome but the food is shitty the burger sounded nice but everytime it was way over cooked and had what i asked to be held after the fourth time I wasn't even hungry anymore
author: Patrick F.

description:
