Came here for the first time with my boyfriend, i like the food we ordered the Hawaiian Teriyaki burger/Hawaiian Teriyaki Chicken sandwiches.

I liked the chicken sandwich, he wasnt too fond of the burger it needed more flavor according to him...

but good eats if your limited on time at the Pier.
author: Tiffani L.

description: Reminds me of Islands or something along those lines. Didn't eat only drank.  Not sure what the regular atmosphere is since it was Fleet Week when I went so it was PACKED.  But I like the beach like feeling.  I sat at the bar with my friends and the bartender was nice. It's a good place if you are a tourist on a summer day in SF.  Probably one of the more decent priced restaurants at the Pier.
author: chibi c.

description: really good food. I had the carne asada tacos and they were delicious. Place was a bit worn and the service was ok. The bathrooms were awkward and dirty.
author: Raymond R.

description: Man, the food looked good walking by (that;s why we went in). But it's a glorified Chili's with a beach motif. My Fish and Chips were decent and my son's Chicken Sandwich was decent, but, eh, it wasn't worth the money and the service, well, sucked.
author: Jeff K.

description: The taco salad and burrito was extraordinary!! Atmosphere is really chill! Our waiter, Iggy was really good!
author: Rebecca B.

description: Wait was long. Pizza was too salty. Taco meat tasted nothing like chicken and was way too bland. The Mexican rice if you can call it Mexican rice was nasty. Never again! :(
author: Foodie L.

description: While I was on vacation my group and I went to this place twice. The first time service was very slow and took forever to get our drinks (draft beers) and that's all that we ordered. So we decided to give it a second chance and the same thing happened we actually got our fries this time before our beer. I was highly disappointed in the service both times but,  my pregnant wife loved the fries. That's why gave them two stars.
author: Cory T.

description:
this place is just what it's name indicates, a wipe out.
it is great for tourists who want a greasy, not so good meal in an artificial environment.  the prices are ok, but the food is pretty bad.
they try to get more of your $ with their special drinks which cost about $9 each.  
find another place with better food!
author: Yummy E.

description: Good food.  Had the fish and  pork tacos!  Service was PHENOMENAL Lisa was our server and highly recommend sitting in her section!  I'm not usually a margarita fan but the bartender makes an amazing margarita!!!!  Manager really has this place running top notch!!  He has great staff and running smooth!! Definitely recommend visiting this spot on Pier 39!!!!!
author: Shane H.

description:
I have came here before with my boyfriend and it was fine.  That was over two years ago.

Yesterday we went there but I will never go back.  
No one greeted us at the door and so after about a minute or two of waiting we took our own seats. But no one came by to give us menu's despite the bartender noticing us sit down and look around for a waitress/waiter.

Finnaly, a bus boy  cleaning tables noticed us and took the initiative to grab us some menus.  
But....no one ever came to take our order.  So after 15 minutes we left for good.

I do not recomend this place at all.  I remember the food being good the first time we came which is why we chose this place - but I to me it doesnt matter- if im not even acknowledged when i come into your resturuant then I dont want to give you my money or service.
author: Melissa S.

description: This place is GREAT! Its located right on Fisherman's wharf so it can get a little crowded, but its worth it! They have a really neat fire pit outside where you can enjoy your perfectly cooked fish tacos with an ice cold corona, kick up your feat and relax! Its a great place to eat if your on a budget. The food is great and the prices are the cheapest on the wharf. Oh, and did i mention; TRY THE FISH TACOS!!
author: Kyle S.

description: The best part was the decor. The food was very average. What made it a one star was the service. I understand what casual dining service is like but this was awful. I think we actually saw our server once to take orders. The appetizer were dropped before the beer came out. For a bar and grill, limited beer selection, nothing exciting. I barely had reached for appetizer and the entrees were shoved in front of us. Food was only slightly better than Denny's. We were shocked by the awful dining. A server's responsibility is to read the guests and do his or her best to pace the food! This guy didn't care at all! I was picking at the food whilst talking and ten minutes later....."are you done with this and that?" I leaned back to look at the plates and within a blink they were gone! No...."would you like a box?" or anything! VERY POOR SERVICE. at least implement a training program! Then, the bill comes and I'm looking at the receipt, only to be surprised by the 18% gratuity that is already tacked on! Um....we were a party of TWO not six. Why the hell was there gratuity? Definitely undeserving and definitely not coming back.
author: Zara S.

description: Not the best, not the worst...not fancy at all, just meah.  Kind of like a step down from Chilis.  We ordered the calamari as an appetizer and it wasnt anything special at all, not really very good at all.  I got the shrimp mango tagos as my entree which were actually quite tasty but the rice and the beans that it came with were yucky.  my boyfriend got the club sammy with fries and he liked it a lot.  pretty decent price for SF too, like $14 each.
author: Libby B.

description: Food is great.... But the Bathroom is even better Really clean and tidey. Kudos to the staff and management for that.... Will be back again 4 sure
author: Prince J.

description: This place has hands down the best chowder and fish tacos on the pier... BUT the hottest guy that worked there is no more... therefore i will not visit ever again... Oh poor poor wipeout.. if only you had better management and did not spread dumb pier rumors.. Come to hard rock!
author: Samantha R.

description: This is one of my favourite places to eat in San Francisco. Every time I come here with my family we come here; I keep bringing new relatives with me. I think I've been here like 4 or 5 times and it's been great. I love the food and the service. My favourite are the burgers and the fish n chips. It's full almost all the time but it's awesome. I love the atmosphere, I like the sitting in the outside but I never had sat outside. The view on a clear day is awesome which i can see the Golden Gate and I think Alcatraz too but can't recall.
author: Nadav M.

description: I had to fast all day before a doctor's appointment. After which I was DYING for a big juicy hamburger.  I found the Wipeout Bar and Grill using the nearby search feature of the yelp mobile app (love that).  I'm super picky when it comes to burgers and this was seriously a delicious treat. The California burger was one of the best ever...perfectly cooked, fresh avocado, crispy bacon, and amazingly fresh fries.  I was in heaven.  All made better by the delightful company of the manager, Gerald who I chatted with easily as I sat at the bar (originally I ordering take out but the pleasant atmosphere made me switch to eat in).  He was extremely attentive to all customers and just topped off the overall dining experience.  Will definitely be back again.
author: Denise E.

description: Fun little burger joint, though broader menu than that. A lot like a Chili's or Island's. Was a pleasant break from all the cafes and more formal restaurants in the city. Easy on the budget too.
author: J B.

description:
My boyfriend and I took a "daycation" to San Francisco to walk around Fishermans Wharf and couldn't figure out where to eat. The boyfriend doesn't really like seafood so we were walking by this place and the prices looked okay and they had some seafood and pizza/burgers n such so we just decided to eat here. We ate outside and they had this cool little fire pit with a few chairs around it so people could grab a drink and sit down and relax. We didnt get any margaritas or alcohol but a lot of people around us did. They looked pretty good. We started with chips and salsa which were bleh. They were really plain and the salsa kind of sucked. I ordered the coconut shrimp and the BF got the california burger with garlic fries. The service was good and the drinks were always refilled and the food came fast. The french fries were great. I have an obsession with french fries and I thought these were pretty good. The coconut shrimp were large and very coconut-y haha and they give you a pretty good amount. They come with this chili/honey dip or something and it was pretty spicy. The boyfriends burger was delicious! It had bacon, guacamole and jack cheese on it and the garlic fries were good as well not too garlicky too where it was overwhelming. Meal came out to $41 and some change, pretty expensive but its Fishermans Wharf so I expected it.

Overall it was a cool place to grab a quick bite to eat. This wouldn't be my top choice and am definitely going to try some other places next time we come to the wharf.
author: Cheri M.

description: Good place, loved the food and service. I got the shrim and steak with coconut rice, it was reaally good! Wish I had more. Great place to chill, only bad thing is that we were sitting were they have the screen backwards..:/..
author: ed v.

description: Food is ok the servers are fun hell who can go wrong drink beer watching the tourist great palce to peoeple watch have fun.....
author: Frederick S.

description: Cool, clam chowder was on point and my server Lisa was amazing. She had a giants beanie and red sweater on.
author: Sarah E.

description: I had the clam chowder here. It wasn't very good but I did like our waitress. She was very nice and helpful
author: C. W.

description: We were just walking all the way down Pier 39, and just figured, what the heck, we're hungry, let's enter.  Got a window seat, very nice view, you can see Alcatraz from where we were seating.  We had crispy fried calamari for appetizers, and it was great, but there was a long wait between the appetizer and the main course itself. As hungry as we were, we ordered another crispy fried calamari and soon right after we got our main course.  The main theme of this restaurant is seafood but good thing they have a Teriyaki Chicken Bowl, the serving was really huge, but maybe it's because we ate two appetizers and it literally just filled us up.  As I said, SF can be a bit pricey, the Teriyaki Chicken Bowl was $13.95, but it was okay because it was tasty!  The calamari was $8.95 so times two that's $17.  It was worth it, but once this restaurant gets busy, which is all the time I think, there may be a quite a long wait for seats.
author: Rheine T.

description: Food and service here was great.  Ordered fried calamari and the portion size was great. Turkey burger was one of the best I've had. Lots of flavor.
author: Lonny R.

description: My husband and I were walking around pier 39 and were looking for somewhere to have a good dinner. Wipeout  Bar and Grill got our attention because it's the first restaurant on the right side of the pier... also it has a small fire outside! Once we entered the restaurant, the atmosphere and decor reminded us both of Hawaii! There were surf boards and a shark as decor... it was so laid back! We ordered the nachos as an appetizer and were not disappointed! For being an appetizer, it was a big plate! They were so good.. very generous with the cheese! I had the chicken teriyaki bowl and my husband had the ribs. We were both very pleased with the taste of our food! I also had a California Dreamin' drink and LOVED it!! We'll definitely be going there when we're by pier 39!
author: esmeralda b.

description:
a good spot, for lunch, on a sunny day in SF. this place is located right near the entrance of Pier 39, to the left. they have plenty of indoor AND outdoor seating. the food was pretty good. i had the chicken terriyaki sandwich w/fries, and it definitely hit the spot. prices are about what you would expect from a sit-down bar & grill. 

they have a cool fire-spot, outside, with a bunch of seats around it. it would be great for those cold days/nights in SF. on this particular day, a guy managed to spill his alcoholic drink on top of the fire, thus, nearly blowing up the joint. funnier, was seeing him looking around to see if anyone noticed...
author: Andrew T.

description: Good location on the Wharf.  Shared restroom so that was a bit odd.  Good food but expensive, especially for holidays like New Years Eve.  Cute design though
author: Michelle T.

description:
Up until today I have never had the need to comment on a restaurant on a website such as Yelp, however my experience at Wipeout was soo bad that I felt it necessary to get the word out. 

Before I come off as too negative, the restaurant has a great atmosphere for hanging out and watching sports, there are plenty of TV's and the background noise is right where you want it to be. 

The problems begin when you order your food. The waiter at our table, Andrew, seemed as if he couldn't care less that we were his customers. I'm not expecting a five star dining experience, but the guy didn't come to our table once after dropping off our food. We had to ask another waiter to find him to bring us our check as the guy was basically a ghost. 

Then there is the worst part of the restaurant... THE FOOD.  I could barely eat the calamari and chips dish that I had ordered. The calamari were rubbery, fried for too long, and obviously had once been frozen. The other people in my party ordered the grilled shrimp plate and pork sandwich and they were also unable to finish their meals. I wasn't expecting perfection, but I considered walking out of the restaurant, as I was unable to find our waiter to complain. 

It's too bad that the food and service at this restaurant are soo horrible, as it has the perfect atmosphere for watching sports with your friends. I MIGHT come back to Wipeout, however I will never order anything to eat there ever again, as I am currently fighting off an upset stomach that I can't help but blame on the food.
author: Cole M.

description:
I've only been here once.

I had a great experience. I had the fish and chips. It's always worth the trip for me to go to Pier 39, sight-see and have a nice lunch. They are a little pricey but it's worth it because the portions are quite large. 

Always crowded though but try to get a seat outside if the weather is nice. You may have to wait 15 minutes or so for a table.
author: Charlage W.

description: Great place. Good food, very friendly servers. They totally got us a great seat outside because I brought my dog even though it was super crowded. The server even brought a bowl of water for my pooch. Defo coming back here since there is no Island burgers in no cal.
author: J A M.

description:
I was starving when I stopped here. I had some family in town so we were at Pier 39, but Joe's Crab Shack would have been a better choice. I was expecting it to be touristy, and I was expecting it to be chain food. But this was still disappointing. My fish and chips were greasy (even for being fish and chips), and the food/drinks were overpriced. 

The one thing that was good was our server, Natasha. She remembered our orders, even after we changed our minds--and was always outgoing and cheerful. Besides Natasha, eh!
author: Teresa B. H.

description: I smiled when the waiter set the clam chowder bread bowl down in front of me - it was HUGE - and it tasted just as good as it looked.  It was a warm sunny day on the pier, perfect for sitting outside and throwing french fries at birds like the signs say not to.  Our waiter was very laid back and comfortable with us, giving us honest recommendations on what to get for lunch. He recommended the clam chowder and the breaded fish, and that's just what we got. He seemed to be the type who had perfect timing.  Right when you needed it, slurping the last sip of your lemonade, he'd pop over with another full glass.  The prices were maybe a buck or two more per meal than they'd be elsewhere, but it's Pier 39, what do you expect?
author: Abby O.

description: after hours of walking around the wharf it was nice to finally rest our tired feet in a nice air conditioned restaurant. my bestfriend jason ordered the salmon and fries and i ordered the shrimp and mango tacos. the portions were great and the prices were usual. my boyfriend ordered a house margarita which was pretty tasty as well. the service was fast and the atmosphere was relaxing. definitely a nice place to stop by for lunch or a quick drink at the bar!
author: Erin N.

description: I had an excellent experience today at the Wipeout. I met a friend of mine here for a couple of beer's and a nacho. The bartender was friendly and the beer was cold, not to mention the huge plate of tasty nachos. I will definitely  be coming back.
author: K B.

description: Touristy. However, the redeeming quality is the tequila shots.
author: Morgan W.

description: When I came to this restaurant I came in with a open mind and got a BBQ Burger with those small onion crisps and fries and this was really good actually i would visit this place again I usually do not go to Fisherman's Wharf to actually eat but this place was pretty good they have TVs and projectors for those Sport games. But this is surely a tourist area and a tourist restaurant but its expected.
author: Scott R.

description:
I love this place! The food is really good. Our waiter recommended a chili bowl. Mmmmm 
It's a laid back, fun and friendly place. Ryan (Waiter) was a Rock Star! Super sweet and fun.
author: Samantha C.

description: The food was OK.  I ordered their burrito and it lacked some flavor but it was alright.  The sample platter is real good. You get a little bit of everything and it's big as hell; forget the entrees.  Employees are always real nice there and treat you well.
author: Chai S.

description: I will never be stepping foot inside this establishment again. The prices are ridiculous and the food is definitely not worth it. We ordered one of the appetizer platters and everything came out dry as hell. Our waiter was very scarce, though when he did come around he was okay. We did complain about our appetizer and the manager gave it to us for free, but that still doesn't make it worth anything. My recommendation is to not go here... EVER.
author: Danielle S.

description:
the pier 39 is good place to chill. it is beautiful, nice, and clean.
i was going to go to get shirmp at buba gump, but i ended up eating at wipe out. it was crowed and restaruent looked good.
the food was medicore and nothing special. price was   reasonable either.
however, i didn't like the service. the waiter didn't take look at my table.
maybe we didn't get the service because i was wearing dodger jersey.
go dodgers!!!
author: min p.

description: A three star rating is being sort of generous. The food is ok. Nothing to write home about. But it is like every other sports bar/grill. Nothing exciting about this place and nothing terrible either. It sort of just... Is.
author: Christopher D.

description: Solid. Very happy to have Fat Tire draft (which isn't served on my beloved east coast). Tacos (both the fish and shrimp) were good. Fast, friendly, efficient service.
author: liz s.

description:
For serving food with hair in it and not immediately offering to make a new sandwich when alerted I would give this restaurant 0 stars if that were an option!

We chose Wipeout because it had something on the menu for everyone in the family.  

We were seated immediately, at a table by the windows which we loved. We thought it was a good sign of a good meal to come.

The table next to us sent their food back and ordered something completely different which should have been our first clue. 

When our meal came my husband's sandwich was wrong. He had ordered a BBQ chicken sandwhich but got just a plain chicken sandwich. He thought they may have just forgotten the BBQ sauce but after looking at the menu on our way out he realized they didn't even bring him the BBQ chicken (which should have been shredded chicken) they just brought him the Grilled chicken sandwich.

When my plate arrived there was a big black hair on my plate. It was not touching my burger but was on my plate nonetheless.  I showed it to my husband who showed it to the waiter. He took his pointer finger and middle finger, slid the hair off the plate, dropped it on the floor and then just stood there. I sat speechless.  He looked at me and asked "Did you want a new one?"  I told him that yes, I would like a new burger since I was a little bothered about this hair.

He returned about 5 minutes later with the same food on a different plate.  GROSS!  I couldn't eat.

Never again!
author: Michelle C.

description: The service and drinks were wonderful. The location is very centeral and fun! The Margaritas are amazing! The food though, not so good.   =( We started with Guac and Chips, the Chips were stale, and the Guac was warm and had an eyelash or hair of some sort in it. The Chinese Chicken Salad my mom ordered had no flavor at all, and the bean and cheese burrito I ordered was OK, but I would not say nearly the best I have ever had. Maybe the Fish and Chips would have been a better choice, but if you care more about a HOT spot to go socolize with friends, and get some good drinks, this is it. =)
author: Nikki S.

description: YESSSSSSSSS! i like fried foods! i like my calamari and assortment platters and clam chowder! all that good stuff! this restaurant is pretty big, do not have to wait too long. it's right at the front of pier 39, so you most likely wouldnt miss seeing it. you get what you pay for! try the drinks!!
author: Veranna N.

description:
I love this place-sure its mostly for tourists but the wait staff are kinda cool. Shannon-love your colorfull hair, your happy attitude and quick drink refill.
I had the shrimp and steak stir fry and it was great, marinaded just right. Brother had the mahi mahi fish and chips and couldn't finish the large plate. I think for seafood the prices are semi resonable.
author: Shelly T.

description:
Ok, sometimes it's your duty as a good friend to suck it up and brave the wharf. I met up with my dear out of towners here after they were done shopping it up at the Hard Rock Cafe. Pier 39 has a serious lack of bike parking for locals, but the Wipeout has a metal fence that works great as a bike rack. There's a little patio outside and a fire pit, inside it's Chevy's on the Beach.  Kinda scary and very bland, but they're trying and the tourists probably love it. The bathrooms are like going into a cabana on the beach and then there's a bunch of flip flops stuck on the wall.
What I really have against this place is the gall they have to charge $8 for a beer. Are you kidding me?! Granted, I think it comes in a liter glass instead of a pint, but still, that's beyond ridiculous. I watched them savor every cent of their $8 brews and then we skedaddled right quick away from the loop that is "whaa haaa wiiiiiiiiiipe out".
author: Colleen B.

description:
yay, i am a fan!  I drank two big ole margaritas on the rocks with salt and a sierra, the margaritas hit the spot!  we had fun taking goofy pictures of ourselves double fisting drinks.  we also ordered the nachos which were huge and extremely bubbly with cheese and all the other works that come with those types of platters.  also ordered fish tacos, which were cool, but they were not batter dipped and fried, the way i like.  
but not to worry, there are plenty of fried items there if i wanted.  
i spied on other tables, and they have the jammin sourdough chowder bowls, if you want.  
in summary, i had a great time.  However, i am realizing that i am pretty easy.  i mostly judge on if i feel like i had a good time with my companion.  
the service was fine,  i am not expecting a sommelier in training from this type of joint,  nor do i approach it with the tastebuds of an epicure.
I had a great time tourist watching, and being an anonymous person amongst all the visitors to our fine city.
author: yayoi s.

description:
I wasn't expecting much from this place but I was surprised by how good the food tasted. We got the shrimp kabobs and the mango shrimp tacos (we were in a shrimp mood). I particularly liked the jalapeno cream sauce in the tacos. The shrimp kabobs were good too. Nothing exceptional, but nothing bad either. The beans and rice that came with the tacos were ordinary but my shrimp kabobs came with a side of coconut flavored rice. I hadn't had this before and I enjoyed it more than expected. We almost got the shrimp and steak stir fry but my astute wife noticed other people who had ordered the same dish and it looked pretty bland like something you'd get for lunch in high school. 

Maybe we lucked out and picked the right dishes but really I have nothing to complain about this place except that it might be a little pricey. $31.62 for our two dishes excluding tip. I wouldn't care if I spent this much on two dishes at a restaurant but I place wipeout in the good fast food category and our total should really be 10 bucks cheaper.
author: Umair A.

description: I ate here twice during a four day trip to San Francisco. The first time had the fish and chips. Good, but nothing special. The fries however were amazing. The second night I had the grilled spiced salmon which won an extra star for its deliciousness. Also subbed the rice to satisfy my fry craving again. The prices are excellent compared to all the other restaurants on the Wharf. A great place to relax and have a beer and some food after exploring the city all day.
author: Mike M.

description: Go there for the breakfast. The food is awesome! I got the California Breakfast and it totally blew my mind. the coffee is strong and intense. It has also a surf shop and the music they play is surf-related. The food and ambiance make this place the quintessential restaurant for tourists. Even tho it's hard to find surfing spots in the city, besides Fort Point, it makes you want to go to San Diego and do some surfin' and dinner by the end of the day.
author: CacaoRock J.

description: THis place was pretty decent. I came here and ordered the calamari and the carne asada burrito. I like the environment here, it's nice. It's crowded, loud, full of energy, and overall not too bad. But the food here is okay. I came here with a couple of friends after a baseball game.
author: stephen n.

description: Argh, I hate the outside seating where pigeons are everywhere! The food was average. I got the beer battered fish and chips the batter was really good. A lot of people come here too, mostly tourist though. My waiter did not really understand english that well! WTH! I asked them if I can sit inside in the beginning but they were being such an ass.
author: Janet Z.

description: This place is alright. I think it's better to go here in the summer because of the beachy vibe and along with the fire pitt, even more reason for the summer aura. The sandwiches are okay except the crust is usually burnt. But the fish and chips are my fav. here.
author: Charisse G.

description: Good to sit outside and people watch, bar food, good place in the Wharf
author: Bob F.

description:
I have always walked by this place when I have gone to Pier 39 and seen people having good food and beer.  So we thought sure lets go.  I ordered fish and chips because I love it so much and my husband ordered a burger.  The drinks came and my husbands Long Island was okay... had better but okay.  Then the food came.  Well the fish and chips was really wimpy and were not good portions for the price.  My husbands burger looked great at first glance but once bitten into his medium cooked burger was RAW.  we asked for a new burger and cooked the way he wanted and the waitress said this is what medium looks like here.... Ummm??? what does rare look like???  Needless to say she took it back and brought a new burger a few minutes later that looked more on the medium rare side.  

I will not be going here again, instead I will find one of the many other places near the pier to have better food.
author: Sarah K.

description: My friend and I went to Pier 39 for the afternoon.  We had a great lunch and cocktail.  Service was fast and friendly.  The food was good.  I recommend the Ahi Tuna sandwich! They were extrememly busy but  we were impressed how management took the time to  come to our table to see how we were doing.
author: carolyn g.

description: do not go here if you're hungover.  the music's too loud, the lights are too bright and there are screaming kids EVERYWHERE.  I ended up here on new year's day because everything else was closed and it took me a bloody mary and one of their 90 oz beers to start to be able to tune it all out...didn't completely work tho.
author: lily z.

description: Pretty decent food, decent prices (for a tourist spot), lots of indoor and outdoor seating, good music, good place to people watch....enough said.
author: Christina D.

description:
4 for the delicious raspberry martini, 3 for the food. not a long wait and the hostess had an amazing peacock feather tattoo. 

appetizer: chips and salsa (warm tortilla chips and awesome salsa). took a bit longer than "immediately" as the waiter claimed. $4

try: hawaiian burger (sub beef for turkey burger):  lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle, grilled pineapple, teriyaki glaze and melted jack cheese on sesame seed bun with fries. $10

warning: watch out for moulting pigeons with missing toes! oh, they also serve shark...?
author: terra d.

description: I went here on the eve of my 21st birthday!  I enjoyed the laid back atmosphere and the entertaining service but  the food was just ok I had chicken fingers and fries.  We sat outside and were nearly killed by birds when the meal came out. haha.  Overall, it was okay I would make a point to visit it because it's a fun little spot but don't expect too much.
author: Lindsay S.

description: I give three stars for the shrimp and chicken tacos. i ordered at their take out window, it is made fresh and really worth the wait.
author: m e.

description: food was great. the only problem being that some of the wait staff dont use a pad to write down their order instead they memorize it. our waiter got my order wrong because he chose not to write it down
author: Mike B.

description: I was not impressed with this place. The prices were okay, but I didn't enjoy the shrimp and chips I ordered. I won't go back here in another visit.
author: Kristina W.

description: Good food, friendly staff.  Ask for server Jenna...she was excellent!  Our food was good and very timely.  They never let us sit too long.  We also sat outside....people watched.  Enjoyable but the food was not something that left me with wanting to come back for it.
author: Mark H.

description: Guys, don't make my mistake...I was unaware of the span of the wharf so I took my girlfriend there for  her birthday lunch this year. Bad idea. Its basically a cafeteria with a surf theme. Now to give me a little credit, it was within our first few weeks living in San Francisco. I've learned my whereabouts since then but trust me, my girlfriend hasn't let me forget  this is where I took her.
author: Rob J.

description:
The food was pretty much what you would expect for a place like that, meaning chain type restaurants on fisherman wharf.

But the service was really good.  The waiter was super friendly.  The chef went out of his way to make me a pepper-free, gluten free meal.  (I am allergic to pepper, wheat and many other things that makes it very hard to go out to eat).

They even dug some meat out of the back freezer so they could make me something that wasn't pre marinated.

So 5 for service! :)
author: Khloe M.

description: My co-workers and I often cross the street to eat at Pier 39 for lunch.  When we're sick of La Salsa, we usually come here to Wipeout.  The burgers are big and the meals can definitely fill you up.  There seems to be a large turn-over as far as waiter service goes because there's always someone being trained.  I give it one extra start because they give us a huge discount for working in the office across the street...
author: Nate V.

description: I had the fried combo plate (fish, shrimp and calamari) with a side salad.  The salad was huge, but I loved the vinagarette dressing.  The entree was pretty good for it being all fried.  The best part was the calamari.  our server was a ditz though - we had to wave another server down for more drinks, and our server didn't split our bill even though we asked her to do so twice.
author: AC A.

description:
So I heard about this restaurant from some friends, and then saw these amazing coupons via facebook.  You can get buy one get one free pizzas, 50% off pizzas (and trust me their pizzas are INCREDIBLE!) and there's a coupon for $10 beer and burgers too.  Especially good for anyone that likes Monday Night Football.  I have been going to the Wipeout in Marin County (not as touristy, really fun atmosphere great place to go after a day on the beach, before/after/during a big game, etc!).  Here is the link to the coupons I found (to use at the Marin County Wipeout)..

http://www.wipeoutbarandgrill.com/coupons/coupons.php

HIGHLY recommended!  Go check it out
author: Christina D.

description: If your looking for a place with a great margarita the is the place. I had the Rippin Skirt Steak (this was the best steak I have ever had) so tender and creamy with the light serving of blue cheese butter they put on it. My wife loved it (and she hates blue cheese) and my wife had the mango shrimp tacos, also very good. You can't go wrong if you find your self hungery or thirsty and on the pier. We went back a second time, and it was even BETTER than the first!
author: Brandon P.

description: Guy at alcatraz tour suggested this place. Great atmosphere and the my Margarita was  great. The bartender took great care of us and the manager made sure our water was full also. Music was a little to loud. But we will come here for drinks whenever we our at the wharf.
author: Greg B.

description:
addendum:  Bob P. wrote me an email, asking what happend to my experience.... I hope people learn from it...



months ago, we came, got seated by the outside seating...then my kid was acting out, carousel so tempting, over stimulated  with environment,  so me and my kid, got kicked out of this restaurant because my 4 yr old son was having a tantrum. he's got aspergers and gets really into tantrum when he wont get his way. he has delayed speech issues and when he cant use his "words" well, he gets frustrated, well....what can i say, they could have offered us a table far from everybody, but no, the server told us to leave.  this is a casual dining place, but not family friendly. I hope that the table with family who probably complained and told our server to do so....well i hope somebody in their family will have an autism or disability that cant be seen so easily, so they will be judged badly....so they feel what it is, when you are dealing with something that cant be identified so easily, such as aspergers, as people may think they are just brats....and i hope that the servers will be more sensitive towards families who are not perfect....this place is not welcoming at all....in my personal experience.  people may not look like rich, but have jobs, and can pay your overpriced menus as well.
author: Bing.kay B.

description:
This place is definitely family friendly. It is the usual sit down restaurant, with friendly servers. I have been here a couple of times. The calamari is a nice size portion for four adults, and the clam chowder bowls are ok. A little bland, but the price for the food was reasonable. You can probably find a better spot for clam chowder elsewhere.

one nice thing is they validate your parking ticket.
author: Simply L.

description:
Walking around pier 39 on a sunny afternoon in the city I was getting really hungry. I've never seen this place before (shows the last time I was down at pier 39) so my friend and I stopped by and got some lunch. The service was good and the whole surfing theme was working well. I got one of their 23 ounce drinks and it was ok, a whole lot of juice and not too much alcohol, but what do you expect. 
I was going to get the fish and chips, which I've been eating on a regular basis lately but I was looking around at other people's tables to check out their food and saw a burger that looked very appetizing. So I changed my mind and ordered a California burger. The bacon was cooked along with the burger but instead of avocado slices they had a lump a guacamole. They also cooked it how I wanted it, medium. I can't tell you how many times I go into places to eat burgers and they can't cook a medium burger. My friend got two tacos and she liked them. They had plenty of meat but she said they were a little to spicy for her taste. Overall, for what it is, Wipeout isn't a bad place and I was pleaseantly suprised.
author: D J.

description: I will not deny my affection for the Ahi Tuna Sandwich even if it is stuck in a touristy crap hole.
author: Shawn P.

description: Spent a sunny day with the bf sitting at the outdoor bar and did some people watching (more like tourist watching) over mixed drinks and chips & salsa.  I had the Malibu Mai Tai and he had a Classic Margarita.  The salsa could have been spicier - it wasn't spicy at all.  All in all, we made a good choice by sitting in the outdoor bar - I wouldn't have it any other way.  There's even a fire pit you can sit around as the day gets cooler.  Maybe next time we'll try the food.
author: Melissa P.

description: I loved the food here! I tried the shrimp and steak stir fry and it was fabulous!  I love seafood!  I also tried the shark bite and that was really good too! Everyone that I went here with loved the food and the environment.  It is a very fun setting and the bathroom is very interesting. My friend and I split the stir fry and wipe out combo?? I don't know what it was called but it was the plate that had fried fish, calamari, and coconut shrimp.  It was so good.  It is a bit more pricier but definitely worth it.  We had so much food that we bought it back and we had left overs in the morning and the left overs was fabulous too!
author: Patricia T.

description: I love this place! The staff is very friendly and upbeat  the food came out fast even when it was busy.  Great variety of food and drinks!
author: andrea h.

description: I was at pier 39 with my family and it seemed like this was the perfect place to eat that had stuff we would all like. The appetizers kind of filled me up which was garlic bread and I had no space for my pizza which was bigger than I thought but I'm not blaming it on the restaurant what I kind of didn't like was that my moms California burger was a bit undercooked on the inside but everything else was ok...
author: Harumi C.

description:
tourist trap!!

but the food was ok.. not pricey in comparison to other places on the wharf.. i ordered something battered and deepfried and garlicky (i looove garlic).. 
it was nothing to scream about.. you could most likely get it somewhere else for cheaper.. but its allll about being near the stinky sea lions and massive numbers of tourists with their cameras trying to take pictures of everything in their path..

OH MY GOSH!! a rock!! can u take my picture as i pose with it!??!?
author: monica c.

description: Good food--a little greasy depending on what you order, but always decent.
author: J K.

description: stay away from the fried food.  calamari was tough, shrimp and cod were heavily battered, and the french fries were even old and chewy.  could have earned two stars if we were in Kansas, but NOT in SF .  Next time, . . . there won't be a next time
author: TJ T.

description: I think the price is right at this place. Some say its a bit pricey, but what do you expect from a Restaurant thats at the Pier. Anyhoo, I ordered some Fish and Chips. Super good. My Fiancee always like the plate I get. He ordered a Burger with Pineapple and some garlic fries. Very good! Its a great place to hang out on a sunny day... Come and eat here when your hungry because the serving is BIG. I'm a fan here.
author: Pamela ..

description: Great carne asada fries, usually pretty quick to go service, hamburger is e okay. but the tacos are really good. Very accomodating to employees of Pier 39 employees which is important. I constantly reccomend this place to hungry tourists
author: Vincent P. G.

description: AWFUL! Everything about this place was terrible and we couldn't get out faster. My burrito looked like it was died orange my rice was ketchup rice and the waiter did not give a shit. And our bill was like $40! I wish I could forget this experience...
author: Stayshuhh G.

description: Despite my friend's proceeding diarrhea after Wipeout's Salmon dish, I absolutely LOVED my dish. A beautiful summer day at the wharf, so we decided to sit outside.  The hostess decided it would be funny to sit us on the table where the sun would shine directly into our eyes.  After my adamant demands to sit on a decent table with some shade, she directs us to a dirty table, picks up the dirty cups, tosses the two menus on the table....not even wiping the table, mind you, or even moving the silverware from the skin cancer table to the decent dirty table.  Not that I minded the beast of a waitress too much.  They were like picnic tables anyway. Greeted by a nice lady in shades.  Asked her what drinks were good.  She recommended this one drink called a Sunset something....DELISH and dangerous. Had I had a couple more of those, I would've been buzzed enough to start surfing on our table.  Ordered a shrimp and steak stir fry with coconut rice and fresh veggies, and my taste buds thoroughly enjoyed their take on Asian cuisine.  Now I would have given this place 5 stars, but the bill came out and my tiny drink came out to $9!!! $9?!?! What the heck?? I should've worn my "Buy me a drink, it's my birthday" shirt at that rate! Service was decent except towards the end, I had to send out a search team to track down the waitress with our check and another worker for a box. Good to go at least once for the experience. Fun.
author: Chow Mein Ninj A.

description: Among my limited choices for lunch, this is one of the best. It's really not a bad place comparing to other restaurants in Pier 39. Clam chowder 5 star. Salad, two.  Ambiance, 4.5. It really takes me out of  my crazy daily routine and allow me to have a 10-minute-vacation in the wave while I am waiting for my clam chowder to go.
author: T L.

description: ive experienced better. popcorn shrimp was good but they give you a little, and the calamari was mediocre. nothing special. there are better places around the pier.
author: Maria P.

description: Went there with 2 of my friends on a Thursday night and the restaurant was full of people. The waiter was really good. Its a bar with surf theme. We ordered burrito, nachos and salmon. Then Four drinks. The items were really really good and I would definitely go back. They charged us 100$. Damn.
author: HD S.

description: Last Saturday night, after a long day we were winding down and just wanted something quick, uncomplicated, but decent. We stopped in to the Wipeout, not expecting culinary perfection, but at least on the level of perhaps a national chain such as Fridays, Chili's, etc. The mexican portion of the menu looked promising, so we ordered, beginning with a couple of margaritas. Big mistake. We would have sworn they were virgin drinks, absolutely no taste of alcohol whatever, and totally bland. After mentioning it to the server, he said he would ask the bartender. He returned and said the bar puts "4-1/2 oz of tequila and triple sec" in each drink. I've made plenty of margaritas in my day, and can promise you that was not the case. Rather than make the drinks decently, he offered to bring us something else instead. We ordered a couple of french martinis. They brought those out, and they were good, except for the fact the glasses were only half full. Just glad to get something drinkable, we didn't complain. Anyway, our food came-a burrito plate and a taco plate. Both were stone cold. In order for a burrito to get that cold clear on the inside, it would have had to have sat for at least 10 minutes or so. Anyway, after we complained, they took the food away, and in a few minutes brought out some warm food. The food was average at best, but once again we were just happy to have something edible. Anyway, at the end of the meal the manager stopped out and apologized for the cold food, and reinforced their claim that the margaritas have 4-1/2 oz. of alcohol. He said he took the margaritas off the bill, like that was doing us a big favor. When we got the bill, we were charged $16 apiece for the french martinis! Granted, we had ordered them with Grey Goose vodka, but still, I've never paid that much for a drink in my life, let alone a half full one! Ridiculous! After another complaint, he reduced it to $13 each, still not exactly cheap. Anyway, I suggest you avoid this place at all costs!!!!!!
author: John L.

description: Food was average. But service was slow. Took some time for us to be noticed to get our orders. Took even longer for the cheque to come.
author: Joe T.

description: A good (pricey) restaurant for the pier - seared tuna with wasabi mayo was wonderful! I stop by either Wipeout or Players when I'm in the area.
author: Lance C.

description: So I came back up to the city for my bday with some friends.. and we were down at the pier for lunch and we saw the fires going and were like alright lets go. I have been here before and was not happy.. THIS TIME.. well lets just say NOT AN IMPROVEMENT. My bloody mary was made for a toddler, so not spicy like I had asked for it. As I'm eating my breadbowl a pigeon comes up and lands on it. I'm like great now i have nothing to eat. So i through the rest of the bread bowl and the pigeon (yaya your not supposed to but it wouldnt go away from me!) So this chick runs out and starts yelling at me to not feed the birds and I was like well seeing as it landed in my food, and was not  moving away from me it seemed like the safest thing for me to do. So then she sends out her manager who takes it off the tab. But the woman was so rude and offensive I had to write a review. Just a note to restaurant owners/managers you shouldn't hire people who make customers hate your restaurant because of this one persons actions. Proper training in customer service is a plus.
author: Katie M.

description: if i didnt get a discount i wouldnt eat here but i do and its awesome! deff a tourist spot over priced but pretty good, burgers , fish, nachos surfboards on the walls, the on ly wierd thing is the unisex bathrooms i dont want want to see some hot chick after she took a dump washing her hands next to me
author: lord v.

description: We were hear over busy Thanksgiving weekend.  Knew that most restaurants in touristy Fisherman's Wharf would be mediocre food which we were okay with.  Had out of town visitors so taking them around SF.  There was a short line to get seated, but because we had a slightly larger group, I asked how long.  Was quoted 10 minutes.  I asked the hostess if she was sure it would only be 10 minutes given our larger party, and told her we had young hungry kids to please be upfront about wait.  She reaffirmed it.  After 15 minutes, I asked a different hostess, and she said anytime now.  After another 10 minute wait, they told me it would probably be another 15 minutes.  I was not happy about it.  Totally understand that it's hard to tell how long, but they were confident in being able to seat us, and even after the much delayed seating, didn't even apologize.  Well, I suppose they cater to tourists and don't really care about being friendly.
author: Pete T.

description: this is probably the worst place to eat on pier 39! i have been here 4 or 5 times and i woulda thought that the food would be slightly better the next time i went... but PSSSH that! today i had the burger with the blue cheese and bacon....BAD IDEA...the blue cheese ruined the burger, the patty was extremely dry and fries were terribly greasy! $12.00 and 9 hours later and  my face is sweating oil! (no but really...) our server was o-k, but there seemed to be more workers than necessary....there is no reason to have 30 FOH on staff.....and if you want to get a drink here, forget it.... not worth the $7 a beer!
author: Kelly K.

description: Seriously, the nachos here were the best I've ever had.  Everything on the menu looks super delicious so I had a hard time choosing what I wanted.  The food's great, the atmosphere is relaxed and fun.  I will definitely be back, and so glad to know there is one in Marin County too!
author: Liana S.

description: 2.5 stars, not as bad as a two but not really "A-OK."  It's one of those zany bar places I would  not have ventured into on my own but at the decision of someone else in the group.  Mostly hamburgers, sandwiches, burritos, starters, maybe one steak on the menu and drinks.  The place was themed as a Hawaiian/Surf bar, but obviously a Pier 39 stage.   I went into the restroom and on the way out, I looked at what the others were ordering. Their customers mostly ordered burgers which I did not order after noticing how dry and home made they looked, nothing handpatted.  I decided to order a carne asada burrito but it was decent at best and gringo-ish.  Only the starters were a litlle better, their garlic fries was fair and their calamari.   The drinks were a bit pricey mostly more than half of the entrees.  My glass of flat tire was $8.46.  All in all it was your basic Pier 39, theme park food, decent but not worth the bill.
author: Foodie B.

description: the pizza was delicious. full of vegetables and chicken. got it togo so wasnt sure what the service was like. but 4 stars for the pizza. nice location on the pier.
author: Dennis C.
